L’entrée de l’hôtel est surprenante, il n’est pas clairement indiqué qu’il y a un hôtel à cette adresse, vous entrez dans le hall de l’immeuble et là vous trouvez la réception. Certaines chambres offrent une vue sur l’empire state building. L’hôtel dispose d’une salle de sport. L’hôtel ne propose pas de petit déjeuner. Le gros point noir de cette hôtel est que la consigne est PAYANTE !!! Après avoir pris nos bagages on nous a demandé 2$/BAGAGE. Du jamais vu jusqu’ici à New York ou ailleurs.

title: Jose, the concierge was awesome!
text:
I must say I was a bit concerned, as not all the reviews have been good. We found the hotel with no difficulty, and I was a bit alarmed by the basic, and seemingly temporary lobby. However, the reception ladies were very pleasant and helpful, and we were soon in our room, on the 7th floor. The room was clean, and a decent size for New York. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the bathroom clean with extra toilet rolls, a hairdryer, and plenty of towels. It looks as though the room has been refitted fairly recently, but not to a very high standard..the cupboard doors, and the desk were all a bit wonky, but this gave us a laugh, rather than irritated us. There was no PowerPoint that we could find for the coffee maker, so we had to set it up in the bathroom. The room was fairly quiet, although New York sirens would cut through any soundproofing…so loud!
We had a great three night stay, capped off by Jose, a wonderful concierge, who convinced us to take the subway to the air train instead of a taxi..and thanks to his help, with written instructions,we made it, even with three suitcases..easy when you know where the elevators are. Thanks Jose!
Would stay here again, as price was awesome and location perfect.

title: Excellent emplacement
text:
Chambre très correcte, ménage tous les jours avec changement des serviettes et des produits de beauté.
Très très bien situé !!
Seul bémol, pas de petit déjeuner proposé ni de bar mis à part le roof top qui donne un excellente vue sur l'Empire

title: Ignore the bad reviews.  It’s fine.
text:
It’s great for a reasonably budget stay.   We paid around $1600 for 10 nights in a ‘suite’.  I am still not clear what the difference between a suite and a basic room is.  In room 1211 we had a coffee machine, a microwave and a fridge - we also had a cracking view of the Empire State Building.   The room was a decent size and had a wardrobe and seating area.   

Rooms were cleaned everyday.  Reception staff friendly enough.  Subway station 5 steps away from the front door and takeaways, restaurants, a ‘park’ seating area and  target and pharmacy within 2 min walk.  
The room was dated but clean. Towels etc replaced daily. 
Quiet enough overnight barring sirens - which you will get anywhere in Manhattan.  
I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again if I caught a similar deal.

title: Good value
text: This was a great wee hotel. Don’t be put off by the dark, small reception area. The bedrooms are absolutely fine. They are big enough, very clean. There is a little fridge in the room which is great but no tea or coffee facilities. The room has no wardrobes to hang clothes in which was a nuisance but there are plenty of little drawers and cupboards. Plenty of toiletries and towels etc. we had a room with a balcony which was great but railing around was so high we could not see anything and felt like a prisoner so don’t waste the extra money on the balcony. The gym is great and there is a room with microwave and vending machines. Hotel has a rooftop bar open to the public but we never heard any noise or anything so don’t let that put you off. Staff are helpful and friendly. You can leave luggage on the last day for 6 dollars which is great facility. The hotel is well positioned for Broadway, Times Square etc.

title: Do Better, Respond to People
text:
Unfortunately, the bad reviews are true.
The only redeeming factor of the whole experience I had, was that after having to resort to complaining about how they are non-responsive, through our correspondence, or otherwise, they finally responded to me telling me that they apologize and will today process my refund, after over 30 days of having the timeframe, and all of my information, to do so.
It is sad, that we have to hound businesses, to find the truth, the bad reviews, and only, only because I read the reviews, I found an email address that someone of the property left in their response.
This is how I finally got someone to respond to me, and tell me, I will get my refund.

Thank you for finally responding to me, but next time, don't make people chase you, hound you, and look at reviews to find a way for you to finally respond to them.

title: Poor quality
text: Poor hotel, quick to take money and do not provide refund straight away. Would not book with this hotel.customer service agent was not helpful when requesting refund, avoid booking this accommodation on booking.com, different prepayment rules apply from when booking and when they charge.

title: Scam, absolutely avoid this
text: Do not book at this hotel !!! This hotel is a scam. This hotel doesn't exist and once you realize it and cancel the reservation, they never answer. I've been waiting for an answer for 3 months, they've never refunded me and even proceed to lie by email regarding the refund. This is undoutbly a scam.

title: No Refund
text: I booked through Booking.com, in November 2022 for a visit for November 2023. I have since cancelled on February 25, 2023. I still have not received my refund. it has been well over the 30-day period.  Please be aware of this hotel, as I went against my better judgment after reading the reviews. I was thinking of rescheduling for another time, but I am thinking I will be finding another hotel to book.

title: Mala gestión
text: La habitacion bien, pero llevamos más de un mes esperando la devolución de una habitación que estaba dentro del plazo de cancelación. En el hotel nos dieron un mail para reclamarlo pero no hemos obtenido respuesta, si las condiciones de cancelación te dicen que se puede cancelar deben devolver el dinero. Una pena, seguiremos reclamando y haciendo lo que esté en nuestras manos.

title: Perfecto
text: La Ubicación era perfecta con parada de metro delante y a 10 min andando de Times Square y el servicio de limpieza correcto. Días antes me puse en contacto con ellos preguntando por secador de pelo y me contestaron amablemente que según dispobilidad lo pidiera en recepción, el día de llegada ya lo tenía en la habitación. Con vistas al empire state.

title: Extremely Pleasantly Surprised
text: I have to admit that I was a little nervous going into this because of some of the reviews, but the room was clean, updated, and had a wonderful view, the staff was pleasant and helpful, and the price was extremely reasonable. If I ever go back to New York City, I will definitely stay here again.

title: Vorsicht: kein Geld zurück bei Storno!
text:
Wir haben uns kurz nach der Buchung aufgrund der zahlreichen schlechten Bewertungen entschieden, die Buchung zu stornieren. Booking.com bestätigte uns die kostenlose Stornierung. Das Hotel hatte den vollen Reisepreis bereits wenige Stunden nach der Buchung abgebucht. 

Auf die Rückzahlung warten wir nun seit 6.1. - Nachfragen per Mail werden schnell beantwortet. Man soll einfach abwarten und nichts tun. Da andere Personen von ähnlichen Erfahrungen berichten, warne ich ausdrücklich davor, dieses Hotel zu buchen. Wir werden nun versuchen, unser Geld über den Kreditkartenanbieter zurück zu erhalten.

title: Don't read the reviews!
text: Absolutely perfect stay here. Nick on the desk was lovely and helpful. Managed to get a hairdryer no problem despite reviews saying opposite. I was really worried about my stay but was very pleasantly surprised. No problems at all, great location, housekeeping every day, hot water (perfect shower pressure!) and beds were so comfortable. Only challenge was finding it at first but look for the NYC cookies building (blue mural on the side). Great price and would definitely stay again!

title: Checked in, checked out
text:
We booked 3 rooms for 4 nights with Booking.com, when we arrived the rooms we were given on the 4th floor looked nothing like the rooms depicted on any website. They were in a very poor state of repair.
We checked in at 4pm and checked out at 5pm.
On a plus side we got a full refund as promised within 7 days

title: Daylight robbery - 2 months and counting for my refund!!!
text: NEVER AGAIN WILL I CONSDIER BOOKING WITH THESE !!! I booked with them in November and paid in full - over 2000 dollars upfront for a stay in July. Then I found out my daughter was having a baby at the same time and we had to cancel our trip. I cancelled it in December and now it's been nearly 2 months and I have not had a refund even though I'm entitled to a full refund. I am struggling to pay bills and they have my money. This is not fair and others need to know !!! I chase them every day and I get a standard answer back - ZERO customer service. It takes seconds to press a button a refund but NOT These!! They have my money and it's daylight robbery right now! AVOID!!

title: Horrible and unprofessional customer service
text:
Horrible experience! Very poor management and unprofessional, non-existent customer service.
I book for my sister & I to spend 4 nights but we were put in a unclean room by the lifts with no wardrobe and nowhere we could hang our clothes.
When I raised my concerns, the receptionist's attitude was very poor and when asked to speak to the manager, she told me to go back after an hour. When I went back, there was no sign of a manager. He waa happy for me to cancel the booking and leave. The entrance waa dirty and the receptionist spoke in Spanish to her colleagues, making insulting remarks, assuming that I didn't speak Spanish. The whole experience was handled badly and the place was really awful.

title: Malhonnête
text: 'j' ai annulé ma réservation et L'hôtel Herald 8 a encaissé la totalité de mon séjour (prévu en mars 2023) malgré l'annulation gratuite et bien que cela ne soit pas dans le contrat. Aujourd'hui, plus d'un mois après les faits, je ne suis toujours pas remboursée comme l'hôtel me l'avait dit et je suis obligée de relancer Booking qui n'est pas si facile à joindre... L'hotel me doit 700 euros environ.

title: DO NOT BOOK - poor service
text:
It has been more than 30 business day's and we have still not received our refund. We have received generic emails on when to expect payment and when you call the hotel they are unable to help. 

We fulfilled our obligation by cancelling our booking on time so I EXPECT THE HERALD 8 BY LUXURBAN TO FULFILL THEIR OBLIGATION BY REFUNDING US ON TIME!!

title: NEW YORKTAKİ EVİNİZ....
text: Otelin konumu, fiyatı,  temizliği, personelin yardımseverliği  kısaca bir otelde ne ararsınız herşey fazlasıyla mevcut.. Odaların bir tarafta Empire State , diğer tarafta Herald Square manzarası var. Times Meydanına yürüyerek 5 dk, Hep canlı ve güvenli....

title: No reservar. Mala gestión. Aún no me han devuelto mi dinero
text: El sábado 14 de este mes llegamos al hotel, después de tener la reserva 2 meses pagada con antelación, nos dan una habitación ocupada. Bajamos a la recepción comentamos este tema, después de 40 min esperando, nos dicen que no tienen habitación para nosotros. Aún no me han devuelto el dinero, además de perder el dinero del Taxi, tener que reservar otro hotel, al hacerlo con mínima antelación nos sale más caro. Aún me dice que me van a devolver el precio del hotel con el valor del dólar actual, en este caso pierdo dinero. También pierdo la comisión del banco. Si yo hubiera cancelado con menos de 72 horas se quedarían todo el dinero. Ellos me dejan en la calle y yo pierdo, pierdo y pierdo. Gracias que no era temporada alta y había más hoteles. Por cierto Booking te dice que pueden tardar hasta 40 días en devolverte el dinero. Es fliplante, decepcionadas con este hotel y con Booking.

title: Hidden Gem
text: I recently stayed at this hotel. My friends and I were on the 16th floor and we had great views of 6th Ave. Truly a hidden gem of a location. Minutes walk to major attractions like Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Grand Central and Madison Square Garden. Our check in process was easy and quick. Our bags were delivered to our room for us. Housekeeping was prompt every morning. Elevators worked the entire visit and we had no issues with hot water shortages. I would absolutely recommend staying here. We had a blast and the location couldn’t have been more convenient. There’s also a subway stop directly out front. The front desk person ordered us a cab to the airport when we checked out which was very nice of them.

title: Non remboursement de l'annulation gratuite
text:
Une réservation en Novembre, annulée début décembre et à ce jour, soit plus de 40 jours plus tard, toujours pas de remboursement !!!
Malgré plusieurs retours par mail, pas d'évolution sur mon remboursement. L'établissement est apparemment coutumié des faits.
L'établissement n'est pas recommandable. Je vous le déconseille car un manque important de sérieux et de professionnalisme.

title: Refund - cancelled during free cancellation period and was charged full amount
text: We haven’t stayed here, booked two rooms via Booking.com and one hour later cancelled during the free cancellation period (which was until September 2023). Received email notifications from the hotel and Booking.com to say booking cancelled for free and yet $5,000 AUD has still been charged to my credit card? I have had to contact hotel and credit card company to dispute this charge. Awaiting a refund. I saw this has happened to others also, the hotel needs to address this, no funds should be charged with a free cancellation period, and definitely not the full amount! I understand from others that it takes the hotel months to refund. BE WARNED!

title: Pas professionnel
text: Si vous réservez, soyez sûr d’y aller ! Annulation « gratuite » faites en novembre 2022, toujours pas remboursée ! Je les ai contactés à plusieurs reprises, les délais de 30 jours ouvrés sont largement dépassés et  à part me dire qu’ils remontent l’info à leur service comptabilité, il ne se passe rien. Inadmissible !!

title: Vergogna non restituiscono i soldi.
text: Vergogna! 3 mesi per la restituzione di una cancellazione gratuita, ottenuta solo con l'intervento di Booking. Innumerevoli solleciti, per poi ottenere la restituzione con il cambio sfavorevole e perderci dei bei soldi. Non ho parole per descriverli...

title: Do not use this hotel
text:
Avoid at all costs. This hotel does not refund when they’re supposed to. I booked via booking.com and picked the free cancellation option. They took £600 out of my bank account straight away. I cancelled
Within 2 years of the cancellation window. Booking.com got confirmation from the hotel that the refund would be processed in 5 days, they still haven’t done anything. 

This was 4 days before Christmas and they’re still stalling and delaying. I would never book this hotel ever again. Looking at other reviews I am unfortunately not alone.

title: Problemas no Aquecimento do Hotel - Grave
text: Durante minha estadia de 7 noites o hotel respondeu que estava com um problema de aquecimento central por 4 das 7 noites. Apesar de saber sobre o tempo ruim, revisões anteriores já mostraram que o hotel tem este problema. Durante minha estadia tive que ter o quarto com cerca de 11 a 13 graus de temperatura (53-56 F), mesmo pedindo para me mudar de quarto. Após a mudança, o outro quarto era ainda mais frio. Colocava o aquecedor para os 76 F, mas não passava dos 55. Os atendentes da recepção davam uma resposta padrão, mas que não atendeu  a necessidade. Eu fiz a solicitação de reembolso destas 4 noites, não sei se pagarão (pela experiencia destacada aqui no Tripadvisor, infelimente não). Vamos ver. Eu realmente não recomendo este hotel, apesar da localização que é muito boa. Fiquei bastante desapontado. Espero que eles sejam justos e façam o reembolso, mas realmente eu não o recomendaria a viajantes.

title: This hotel avoids and delays processing refunds
text: This hotel has been a nightmare to deal with. I made a reservation back in October (through booking.com) for a long stay in upcoming January 2023, which cost a few thousand dollars. A few days later I needed to cancel my reservation- which was well within the cancellation window. The hotel confirmed my cancellation and that my refund would take up to 30 business days to process. After 30 business days I still had not received my refund. I have tried contacting the hotel whose response is that they will update me when it’s being processed…and no other detail. They do not answer their phone and have no customer service email, so I asked booking.com to intervene and they also cannot get timely responses from this hotel. It’s been over 2 months and I am once again being told to wait ANOTHER 30 DAYS from now (December) for the refund to be processed. Avoid this hotel - they are unresponsive, unreliable, and are frankly committing fraud by withholding my funds through the end of the calendar year.

title: Great Potential
text: A stange place! Problems with the hot water. The staff (all very polite) made an effort to be surprised when we complained. Obviously they knew about the problem (also from Tripadvisor). However it became betterat the second half of our week long stay. Room was spacy (for Manhattan standards) and the view of Macy's from the room did certainly make my wife very happy! The plkace has a great potential....

title: Refund
text: I've never been to this property. I booked my stay for October 2022, cancelled my booking begining of September within free cancellation policy. I still didnt recieve my refund and it is December.. Booking.com helped but thankfuly paid by credit card and now my bank is trying to get my money back... They kept pasting and copying the same replies without giving me an explanation about why the refund took so long. Don't recommend this hotel! Don't stay there!

title: Oltre ogni aspettativa
text:
Abbiamo prenotato presso questa struttura non avendo tantissime aspettative e invece ci siamo dovuti positivamente ricredere. 
La posizione è ottimale, tra la 35thStreet e la 6thAve, con tantissimi negozi e ristoranti nei dintorni e a 2 passi dall’Empire State Building. La prima uscita della metropolitana, inoltre, si trova fuori la porta di ingresso dell’hotel stesso (fermata: 34th Herald Square).
Noi abbiamo alloggiato in una matrimoniale al 13esimo piano con vista su entrambe le strade ed è stato semplicemente favoloso.
Le camere sono pulite e ben tenute, inoltre, la ragazza delle pulizie è molto gentile.
Tutto semplicemente perfetto.
Unica pecca: alcune volte l’acqua calda fa fatica ad uscire ed è capitato che ci docciassimo con acqua tiepida tendente al freddo.

title: Refund
text:
I've never been to this property.
I booked for March 2023 two months ago and then cancelled with free cancellation policy. It took them more than a month to give my money back. 
They kept pasting and copying the same replies without giving me an explanation about why the refund took so long. 
Honestly, I feel lucky I haven't been there.

title: Fantastic!
text:
We had a wonderful stay here. The room was great with everything new and clean.  Very comfortable bed with crisp sheets and warm comforter . The location is superb with a great view of the Empire State Building
Shout out to the staff, especially Samantha, who were very helpful!

title: Super Stay
text: Great hotel!! Staff were helpful and very pleasant to deal with.  Rooms were spacious and beds very comfortable. Location was brilliant right next to subway and Macys and only a few minutes walk from Times Square and Empire State.  We will definitely be returning to this hotel and would highly recommend it. Thanks a a great stay

title: Highly recommend first time visitors to New York
text: Hotel was great, location was perfect, room was big and cleaned daily. No issue at all with this hotel and will stay again. Reception staff were really friendly and helpful. Bed was big and comfortable. We had an amazing view from our room. TV worked perfect. Overall a really nice stay and we’ll be recommending this hotel to anyone going to New York.

title: NO RESERVAR EN ESTE HOTEL
text:
No aconsejo reservar. Reservé a traves de Booking.com.La reserva era sin pago por adelantado y me cobraron. Han pasado 13 días y no me han devuelto el dinero todavia.
Booking tampoco me lo esta resolviendo.
NO RECOMIENDO RESERVAR EN ESTE HOTEL

title: Begging for toilet paper
text:
ONE toilet paper roll. That's what they give for a two-week stay. We had to constantly ask (or beg, in my opinion) for toilet paper. And after asking several times each time, we always got only one roll. There was a problem with the "shipment" they said. They couldn't order toilet paper for the whole two weeks that we were there? I don't buy it. That was the most annoying detail in our stay.
Plus, hot water was seldom in the morning hours, only if you took a shower really early.

Other than that, location was good (but I recommend booking another hotel in the same location)

title: Perfect Stay
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights at the start of November. After reading previous reviews I was a little bit worried but we didn’t need to be! The reception is small but the staff are very friendly and check in was quick. Unlike other hotels in New York there are no extra fees to pay when you arrive or deposits. We were on the 14th floor with a great view of the city. The rooms were spacious and came equipped with a hair dryer, iron and ironing board, coffee maker, and plenty of storage. There is no daily cleaning service for the room but you are able to ask reception the day before if you wish for your room to be cleaned, or for fresh towels. The hotel also has a roof bar that does not require a reservation.

The location was great, it is opposite Macy’s, and only a short walk of about ten minutes to Times Square, Empire State etc. There is a subway station outside the hotel which is handy and the larger penn station for airport travel is only a ten minute walk.

title: DON’T STAY HERE
text: DON’T STAY HERE. No one came to clean the room, the shower was like warm instead of hot, and the manager was unresponsive about the cable being out. The location is ok if you want to be in a touristy area, but there are much better, affordable options.

title: Magnifico!
text: Abbiamo pernottato nella struttura per 5 notti, posizione eccezionale, a pochi passi dall’empire state building, 5 minuti da Time Square, diverse fermate della metropolitana vicine. Personale gentilissimo e super disponibile, camere abbastanza spaziose e bagno pulito, rapporto qualità prezzo ottrino! Consigliamo assolutamente questa struttura per chi desidera fare un viaggio a New York e dormire in pieno centro!

title: Geld kwijt, geen enkele service
text: Geboekt augustus 8 met gratis annuleren. Zelfde datum geannuleerd omdat dagen anders werden. Bedrag is afgeschreven en nooit een refund gehad. Hotel onbereikbaar voor zowel mij als booking.com. Gaat om ruim €1100 dat ik nog steeds niet terug heb. Steeds zelfde auto reply op alles wat ik doe. 30 werkdagen staat daarin maar doen zijn na twee maanden ruim voorbij. Waardeloos

title: Very good experience in my first time in NY
text: It is well worth the money.  Right at the 34th and herald station.  Very well located, clean and organized.  Excellent decision if you are looking for a room just to sleep. A really good deal. First time in NY and love the experience. Recommended

title: SCAM Hotel
text: I booked with this hotel months in advance. When I was about to board my plane to New York, I was emailed informing me the booking was cancelled. It has been over a month now, and I cannot get in touch with anyone, and I have not received a refund.  Save yourself the stress, the headache, and the money. This hotel is a scam

title: Perfect position for visiting ny
text:
I traveled alone and stayed at this hotel for safety and great location. The metro is right under the hotel. The room on the 14th floor with a magnificent view is priceless, the staff with Samantha and the guys is always available.
The rooms with tv and coffee maker and iron are very large, the bed is fabulous and everything is clean! On the 4th floor there is the gym and a terrace to relax and work.
I will definitely be back on my next trip!

title: 100 % recomendado
text:
Me hospede con mi hermana y sobrina en este hotel que superó nuestras expectativas teniendo en cuenta precio calidad
Muy bien ubicado, habitación amplia y muy limpia. Tiene las 3 B 😃, bueno, bonito y barato

title: 9-day Stay at The Herald
text:
My family and I stayed here for 9 days. Throughout our stay, the feature of the hotel that really stood out to me the most was its location. We were able to walk to several attractions such as the Empire State Building (-5 minutes away), Times Square (~10 minutes away) and Macy's (~3 minutes away). There were also lots of restaurants (American, Mexican, Korean) and many shoping outlets (H&M, Foot Locker, Target, Forever 21) nearby so you can always do last minute shopping if you still have space in your luggage. The nearest subway exit is also right outside the entrance, so the hotel is very accessible. 

The hotel lifts are sometimes shared for the customers for Monarch Garden Rooftop, but despite that the lifts service really quickly.

Although the hotel itself was relatively new and did not have much services and facilities for now (e.g. complimentary breakfast, in-hotel laundry, service telephone), the staff did an amazing job with their service to make up for it. They were very accomodating and answered our queries well. 

Overall, I thought that the cost of our stay here was a little on the pricey side, but it is still New York city and it is still one of the cheapest accomodations you can purchase for your stay. Thank you for accomodating us!

title: Excelente
text:
La ubicación privilegiada. 
Habitaciones amplias.  Camas super cómodas. 
La amabilidad del personal   Jake, Corina y todo el resto del equipo   Samanta una genia, me presto su celular para un reclamo en la aerolínea durante 50 minutos. 
Además tienen hay un rooftop en la entrada con vistas al Empire únicas. 
Volvería sin dudas

title: 10 days in NEW YORK CITY!
text: The location was great nearby subway, restaurants, macy’s and stores. Very convenient to walk around. Room were clean and daily housekeeping is provided. Staff were nice accommodating. Thank you. Checking in was quite fast and we are given a room with balcony so we can have some view.

title: So great!
text:
Perfect location!
With a rooftop bar next door (from the lobby) with gorgeous view at night of the Empire State building, excellent restaurant 100 yards away (Mew) and so much more. This hotel was perfect.
Staff was welcoming and 24/7 reception and security was also a plus :)

Thanks for having us!

title: Great location. Nice room in Manhattan
text: We stayed 9 nights at The Herald powered by LuxUrban in Sept’22 (travelling from Europe). Its a great located hotel. We found this plance really good. Room was large for the money, comparing to other hotels at this price in Manhattan. Bathroom really nice with hot water all day long. WiFi also good and free of charge. We stayed on 14th floor with super good view of the Macy’s store and 7th avenue. The staff is always helpfull. Desk open 24h. Room was equipped  with fridge, microwave and iron. Cable TV not wirking but was an issue for us. Bed was comfortable. Any time we asked at the desk the staff was always helpfull. Highy recommended place.

title: Awesome place to stay during NYC trip
text: I highly recommend the hotel. I stayed for a week in a room on the 14th floor with a great view. Room is large, well equipped (safe, microwave, iron, ironing board). Bed large, very comfortable. Bathroom clean, hot water available at all times. Hotel clean and well maintained. Housekeeping staff courteous, and Jose, Jon and rest of front desk staff always willing to help. Location super, very close to the subway station. The biggest attractions within easy reach.

title: Thieves!!
text: Absolute sham of a company. I’m only giving 1 star because I can’t give zero. Booked a fully refundable room & 3 months before I was due to stay, the hotel emailed to say they could no longer honour the booking & said they’d refund. Numerous emails later & 8 times being told it’d been passed to their refund Dept, I had to get my bank to do a chargeback. AVOID

title: Excelente ubicación
text: The hotel is very well located, 1 minute away is access to the subway and 2 blocks from the penn station that connects with the airport, so it is easy to get there, the people of reception is very good and they take care of the bags before check in. The room was clean and the room is quiet despite being in a central location. Keep in mind that breakfast is not included

title: Great experience and localitation
text: Excellent location very close to midtown manhattan. The Subway is next to the hotel, it's a great advantage if you visit the city overnight. Clean room, hot water, air-conditioning and friendly service at reception.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Nick siempre estuvo dispuesto a ayudarnos con las dudas y consultas, el hotel tiene una buena ubicación si quieres movilizarse en transporte público, hay una estación en la esquina y está a 2 cuadras del Penn Station

title: Beware
text: Corphousing group has many brands that eventually scam customers by overbooking properties, cancelling reservations, and then not offering refunds.  Research the company and the brand that was used before Luxurban, SOBENY.  Stay clear. I did not stay because of a cancellation and was ripped off for $1300 so I think I've paid for my review dearly.

title: Unsatisfied
text: I stayed here with my partner for 2 days and we booked on booking.com. When we arrived at 2:30/45 we were told check in was after 3. That was absolutely fine. 1 hour later we were told our room wasn’t ready and that it would be another half hour max. Another hour passed and it was still not ready. 3 hours we waited to check in to find that the room that we were given was unfurnished (e.g no pillows, no tv etc). As a matter of fact the whole floor we where on was not finished, tools laying everywhere, room a mess yet we where made to stay here. We paid about $300 dollars for 2 nights to have to wait to 6pm to check in and have no towels, no tv, no pillows ect. We were told we would be refunded 50% of the balance as we had a very poor experience here and yet 2 months later we are still waiting … I would not stay here.

title: Great Hotel
text: Overall, we had a great experience with The Herald Powered By LuxUrban. The staff was incredibly helpful, and the location is unbeatable. The room was wonderful, clean, and perfect to spend time in New York.

title: Great Place to Stay
text:
Really recommend The Herald. Overall experience was great. The location was amazing, the employees were very friendly and the room was neat and tidy! 
This was definitely not the last time we have been here.

title: I recommend !
text:
I loved this hotel, Perfect localization (the Empire State, the  macy’s are near and also the station of metro), the staff was helpful and the room was clean. Such an amazing experience at New York City 
I recommend !

title: Easy and comfortable
text:
Hotel is top located - one step to the train station.
Reception is always nice and helpful as we had multiple questions.
Room is only cleaned up on request - but that was never a problem and worked fine (so if you want this daily this can be done).
Plus big and comfy bed

title: Top located Hotel!
text:
Top located Hotel for our stay in New York :)
Herald square, where 6th Avenue and Broadway are crossing.
Very nice people at the front desk, big and comfy bed!
Empire State Building view from the room included!
Also all New York attractions are near by and the next subway station just in front of the building.

title: Valido
text:
Un hotel molto carino a herald square.
Tante note positive come: posizione, cortesia del personale, stupendo Rooftop in cima all hotel e ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo.
Consigliato per coppie o famiglie.

title: Sabina
text: Great location, walking distance anywhere. Nice view from the room at Macys and Empire. Room was very pleasure, clear, spacious. Gym available. We was very satisfied and we are looking forward to come next time!

title: Amazing accommodation in downtown NYC - LuxUrban Herald Square
text:
Thank you very much for the very friendly approach and wonderful accommodation with a view on the 16th floor.This place is really amazing! We stayed at the Lux Urban Hotel in Herald Square for 7 days and everything was perfect. There was always someone very nice at the reception who always helped and advised us with everything. If you are going to visit New York City as a tourist, you must stay here as it has an amazing location. Only a 10 minute walk to Time Square, food and coffee shops all around and the subway right next to the hotel to take you everywhere. Highly recommended and thank you very much!

We hope to see you again!

Sarah, Czech Republic

title: Localização sensacional
text:
Pontos positivos: localização excelente, quarto amplo, cama grande e confortável, banheiro privativo e limpeza. A recepcionista também foi bem atenciosa.
A localização é o ponto forte, bem centralizado, do lado de uma estação de metrô e a alguns minutos do Bryant Park e da Times Square. Excelente.
O hotel parece ter sido reformado e está bem novo (tão novo que nem a TV tinha sido pendurada na parede e instalada ainda).... pelo menos era o que acontecia no nosso quarto.

Pontos negativos: não tem café da manhã como a maior parte dos hotéis em NY e poucas comodidades, mas ok pelo preço cobrado.

title: 1 Woche Manhattan
text: Sauberes, nettes Hotel. Zimmer sind überraschend gross. Von der Lobby aus kann man direkt in eine sehr gute Rooftop Bar fahren. Bester Blick auf Empire State Building hat insgesamt viel Spass gemacht und kommen gerne wieder

title: Excellent hotel
text: I stayed here in September 2022 and i loved it. The staff was helpful, the rooms clean, the location great! Finding halal food was easy. You have everything in the area. Cheap and service 24/7 i recommend everyone this hotel. Ps. I had a view on the imperial state Building.

title: Great value, good vibe
text: My friend and I stayed here on Labor Day Weekend 2022 and we loved it. The staff was helpful, the rooms clean, the location great! (The entrance is a little hard to find but look for the sign for the Monarch Rooftop restaurant—a great place for a view of the Empire State Building.)

title: Honteux !!
text: we are two friends who came to new york to visit we found this hotel, given the reviews we thought it was the best value for money given its position, but we did not get the room we had reserved on the internet, the air conditioning does not work it is 27 degrees (82F) in our room (we went to see the reception but nothing was done) and when we wanted to take a shower the water was brown.

title: Pésima gestión.
text:
Lamentable...
El hotel nos canceló una reserva a menos de 24h de nuestra llegada a NY y sin previo aviso.
No te dan ninguna solución, solo el reembolso, pero debes buscar por ti mismo una alternativa de última hora y con el sobre coste que conlleva.
Por lo visto, hay más reseñas con este mismo problema, así que debe ser un proceso rutinario en el hotel... Trato pésimo.

title: Año nuevo en Manhattan!
text: Nos alojamos en el Courtyard Herald Square desde el 28 de Diciembre del 2019 al 8 de Enero de 2020, matrimonio con 2 hijos adolescentes, en 1 habitación con 2 camas queen. Llegamos bastante antes del horario del check-in (3:00pm), pero pudimos dejar las valijas en guarda e ir a caminar hasta nuestro horario. La tarifa que contratamos (Atrapalo.com) incluía desayuno y 2 Metrocard x 7 días ilimitadas. Nos tocó una habitación en el piso 11 cuya vista daba a la calle 36th, si bien la habitación era pequeña nos resultó confortable, teníamos 2 valijas grandes, 2 medianas y 3 carry-on, contaba con frigobar, pequeño placard para guardar la ropa, LED TV, cafetera. Incluiso varias noches cenamos dentro de la habitación, ya que compramos la comida en un Target que se encuentra a 2 cuadras. La habítación muy limpia y silenciosa, todos los días reponían café, te para la infusión y jabones, shampoo. El desayuno (lo teníamos incluido en nuestra tarifa) es servido en una cafetería de Starbucks en el 1er entrepiso, incluía una bebida fría/yoghurt, una bebida caliente y algo de pastelería, el café especial de Starbucks y/o otra cosa fuera de lo incluído se abonaba a parte. La cafetería es muy amplia y limpia, tiene vistas a Herlad Square y Macys, cuenta con espacio para fumadores, como así también con terminales para hacer el web-check in de los vuelos, tambien cuenta con un sector con microondas para calentar comidas y posee expendedoras automáticas de snacks y otras cosas. Muy cordiales todo el personal del Hotel, incluso con un problema que tuvimos con la tarifa de Internet el cual lo resolvieron. Tener en cuenta y leer bien las condiciones de internet gratis en el Hotel, depende de la red que se seleccione es gratis. Nos facilitaron la contratación de un transfer para ir al JFK. El hotel posee un rooftop/bar en el piso 15 llamado Monarch, no pudimos acceder porque estabamos con menores y en el horario permitido no estabamos nunca en el hotel, tenerlo en cuenta para las habitaciones en el piso 14 que suelen ser muy ruidosas en la noche por la actividad nocturna del bar. Hotel estratégicamente ubicado en el centro de Manhattan, fácil acceso a cualquier parte, en la puerta del hotel se encuentra la 34 Street-Herald Square Station Subway, a 1 cuadra del Empire State Building, 2 cuadras del Mahattan Mall. ¡Definitivamente volvería a ir a este Hotel!

title: Dec 2015 Stay
text: Long long overdue  from Dec 2015 but I believe I should review this great hotel.  Location is perfect (just opposite Macy's, decent and very clean rooms. It has everything required for a short family stay over Christmas period.

title: Noisy, and rude staff (John). Had to leave at midnight for another hotel
text: If you value actually getting sleep, do not stay here. There is a nightclub on the top floor, which can be heard all throughout the hotel. And not just the bass, I was basically playing “name that lyric” at 11 PM while I was trying to get to sleep. The hotel was absolutely useless in helping us out. A guy (I won’t use the term gentleman because he was anything but) named John would not give us a lower room, despite originally saying he would, because the street noise would be just as loud. Which, shouldn’t we at least see if that is the case instead of dismissing us? He then, on our third trip down to complain, asked us immediately “so would you like to check out”, with a smirk on his face. I don’t think John has received the memo that he works in the hospitality industry. John also said he would refund our money, and he has not. Thank goodness we found a fabulous hotel across the street who actually takes care of their clients.

title: Excellent location for short holiday in NYC
text: We were in town for 2 and half days with our kids and needed to have a good location in Manhattan to optimize our travel across the city. This Hotel by Marriott is perfectly located literally just above the tube station Herald Sq and allows you to go pretty much everywhere in Manhattan and is walking distance to various classic tourists places such as 5th At or Times Sq. The hotel offer minimal service (one lobby with a breakfast bistro, food average and pricy though) and rooms are ok for are short stay

title: Perfect Location
text: It was our first time in New York city and this hotel is perfect! Close to Macy's, times square, Madison Square Garden, Empire state building and subway. This hotel has a rooftop lounge/bar and has a coffee bar that serves starbucks. However, for 2 nights in a row the entire floor including our room smelled like pot. I informed the front desk and the manager who immediately attended my complaint. I guess It could've been the neighbor or we don't know. The issue was resolved by a spray! Other than that, It was all good!

title: So glad I picked this place!
text:
First off, the staff at the front desk including Sheen and others (I lost my note with their all their names) were incredibly nice and fun to interact with. Bend over backwards helpful and really enjoyed interacting with their customers. Then there was Jose, who handled luggage storage! He really knows the city. We didn’t want to do the tourist locations and just wanted to walk around parts of the city. He recommended a walk down the West Side and across 14th that took us thru many neighborhoods and parks. It was awesome. This guy is worth asking about things to do! 

Our room was excellent (NYC SMALL but worked great for us!) Bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed the view of the Empire State Building. Very happy with the accommodations! Great location in the city to walk to many places and  a subway station right there also. Perfect for an event at MSG. 

We took the train down to the city so we stored our luggage prior to our room being ready and again after checkout as we had time before our train. Very convenient!

We did venture to the rooftop bar but didn’t stay. Nice views but this was a “club” for younger people and wasn’t for us (we are in our 50’s). But was jammed and appeared to be very popular. 

We highly recommend this hotel and if we overnight in the city this will be our place!

title: Good price, well-worn hotel
text: I stayed for 4 days on a business trip. The location was super convenient to my midtown meetings and the staff was excellent. The hotel was definitely worn around the edges from my room to the elevators to the corridors. If you're looking for an affordable, clean, central hotel with no frills and nothing fancy--go for it. The best part about this property is that it's 2 blocks from Korea town (32nd St) so I ate spectacularly well the whole trip.

title: Plus for Location; Minus for Room Size
text:
The hotel was right smack in Herald Square. The subway station was literally at the door step. The area surrounding the hotel is always busy with lots of people but was also well patrolled by the police.

We had views of the Empire State Building on the left and Macy's on the right. Though we were on the 16th floor, we could still hear some noise from the roof top bar.

Getting Halal food was not a problem as there were plenty in the hotel vicinity.

The only minus is the size of the room; the room was very small. And the toilet was minute. Human Factors were not taken into consideration when they have designed the toilet. This can be improved.

title: Una pena el Ruido estropea la Experiencia
text: Estamos 5 noches y todo parecía súper bien, la chicas de recepción súper atentas de 10. La habitación amplia.... pero llego la noche y encima del hotel hay una discoteca que filtra la música y los graves por las paredes del hotel. Son como golpes graves continuos, encima abren hasta las 4 de la madrugada tanto viernes como sábado. UN DESASTRE INSOPORTABLE. Por ganar MÁS DINERO , destrozan el descanso de sus clientes. Mañana pediremos un cambio de habitación ya que hoy es ya tarde. Les escribo desde el wifi del hotel que por cierto va muy bien a pesar de estar en planta alta. Si no fuera por la discoteca de arriba y el ruido de graves que se filtra por las paredes insoportable. Sería un hotel magnífico.

title: Gute Lage, leider Zimmer nicht heizbar, Erkältungsgefahr
text: Die Fenster zur Strassenseite sind undicht, der kalte Wind strömt ins Zimmer. Die Heizklimaanlage schleudert mehr Keime in den Raum als es heizt. Das Zimmer ist auch dann noch kalt, wenn man 32° einstellt. Wir wurden beide krank.

title: Beware of the rooftop bar noise- though excellent customer service
text: We stayed 3 nights at this courtyard during the NYC Christmas season. All throughout our stay I was continually impressed with the professionalism of the employees. They were always excellent inspite of what must be ongoing problems. Our first night we arrived and we told that the double room we reserved and required for 4 people had been given to someone else. We were put in a smaller room, that only slept 3, with the promise that the next day we would be moved to a bigger room. Despite discomfort of squeezing into the small space we agreed, but when we arrived back at the hotel that night to sleep, the real issue became obvious. We were on the 17th floor, right below the rooftop bar that stays open until 4am on weekends! Our beds and room were literally vibrating to the music. The base continued until almost 3. Ear plugs provided blocked out the sound, but not the base. The front desk was fielding all manner of complaints from every room on the upper floors. The remainder of our stay was uneventful and comfortable after we were moved to a new room on a lower floor after the first night.

title: Very disappointed
text:
My wife and I were travelling with our baby of 12 months and my mother-in-law. When we arrived at 9.30 p.m after a long journey from Europe (2 flights and more than 12h), the room was still not ready and the pack and play for our baby not dispatched! 30 minutes later, I had to come back at the reception to complaint because our baby still can not sleep while it was 4 a.m for him! (And what is incredible is that I faced a similar situation a few weeks ago with Marriott Vienna during a business trip where a room was not ready at 5 p.m!)
Moreover we have made this reservation on June 2019 for a stay in December 2019 and made a special request for an upper floor and nice view because this travel was a present for the 60th birthday of my mother-in-law who visits NYC for the first time and we wanted something special to please her. Finally, we have been provided with a room at the 5th floor (super noisy) despite the special request made a long time ahead of our visit. We have been told that no other room was available which is a non sense since the reservation has been made months ago.
And finally, only 2 breakfast have been included in the reservation while we are 3 adults.
We stayed at the Hilton a few years ago which is literally next door and had been granted a room with nice view on the Empire. We should have booked there to avoid such disappointing and frustrating situation. 
Thus, make the correct choice. On my side, I will never stay within Marriott anymore!

title: Wonderful visit
text: Our room had a great view of Macy's and the Empire State Building. Perfect location. Jose, our valet, was super friendly and helpful.  Our room had a full size sofa bed so we had to rearrange it but that was minor.  We drove to NYC so they held our luggage after we checked out until we were ready to leave. You have to call an hour before you need your car since it was parked off the premises. Great trip!

title: Pleasant
text: We enjoyed our stay here. The staff member, Michael, went above and beyond and was extremely helpful. He made our trip easy! The hotel was a perfect location for seeing a show, shopping, and finding good eats. We would stay again.

title: Excellent Staff, Wonderful City Views, Super Convenient Location
text: An excellent choice for those visiting Midtown Manhattan.  The hotel facilities are clean and convenient and the hotel staff is top notch when it comes to enhancing the guest experience.  Ms. Yeilly Pimentel is a true professional at check in, and her bubbly demeanor will brighten the mood of even the most tired of travelers.  Michael is the hotel's all-around "go to" person who cannot do enough for the guests.  We are looking forward to our return visit!

title: Staff and Hotel Exceptional
text: The hotel is located in a very convenient location to shopping, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and is also located to public transportation. The staff was friendly and very helpful.  The hotel was clean and well maintained.

title: Do not recommened this hotel
text:
This hotel is one of the worse I have ever been.
No possibility for breakfast there front desk service is bad. I left a present for a freind to pick up and they lost it. The front desk people are not nice and not helpfull

המלון הזה הוא אחד הגרועים שהייתי בהם. צוות המלון אנטיפטי לא נחמד ולא עוזר. אין ארוחת בוקר ואין במלון בר או מסעדה.
השארתי מתנה קטנה לחברה שתבוא לקחת והם איבדו את זה.
למרות המיקום הנהדר- לא להגיע לשם.
יקר ולא מומלץ

title: Thumping music all night from roof-top bar
text:
Stayed for 2 nights after Thanksgiving (Friday-Sunday) on the 17th floor just below the roof-top bar/lounge, which had very loud, thumping music well past 1am each night. We heard and felt the music in our room and had a terrible time falling asleep each night. The hotel is sacrificing the comfort of its room guests for the sake of what I assume is a profitable business on the roof. I would not stay here again. I complained about the noise at check out and the clerk gave me some extra Marriott points, but the hotel really needs to rethink the business model for the roof-top property.

Our hotel room was updated and clean, and large enough for NYC standards to fit our family of 4. Limited and expensive breakfast options -- better to go out. Nice and helpful staff. Excellent location near multiple subway lines.

title: Another amazing Review
text: Another great stay for us at this property! It was so convenient to the subway, and was walking distance to Times Square. The Macy's in Herald Square was right across the street, so it was pretty to see the windows decorated for the holidays. We go to enjoy a drink at the Monarch, the rooftop bar with a view of the Empire State building.... beautiful space. Everyone from the managers to the outstanding bell staff (Michael and Jose) are so wonderful. I look forward to our next stay there!

title: Noisy, elevator down, poor service
text:
Elevator down without any notification (at least post a letter up).  Other two very slow so most people ended having to take the stairs a bunch of times. I had to cancel my car-share pick-ups even though there should have been ample time and was charged fees. 

Hotel is very noisy (picks up all the street noise), but in additional the housekeeping staff has loud conversations outside your door and in the hallways.  

Staff was not helpful when I was trying to leave my leave my luggage in store. I was redirected from lobby to ground floor and then back up to lobby for the service.

title: Solides Hotel an zentraler Lage
text:
Super gelegen in Midtown; in Gehdistanz zu vielen Sehenswürdigkeiten. Nüchterne und zweckmāssige Ausstattung, das Frühstück wird an der Theke in Einzelabfertigung angeboten, Kaffee/Espresso mit Aufpreis. 
Der Fitnessraum bietet alles, was man sich wünscht. 
Die Rooftopbar, gehört nicht zum Hotel.

title: Convenient location but disappointing overall
text: Location was ideal for easy access to the subway, yummy eats in Koreatown and walkable to Hudson Yards. Rooms were shoebox sized but clean. But our visit was tainted by an unpleasant experience with the staff. When we waited after checkout to check our bags for the afternoon, the staff person who came to pick up bags didn't bother to ask who was waiting longest. He immediately checked the bags for a white couple and told me to wait even though we had been waiting longer...not very professional.

title: Worse check in experience
text: Great location, room updated with higher ceiling.  Very difficult to communicate with front desk staff at check in, I think his name is Sheen (not sure about the spelling).  No recognition for Titanium Elite Member.

title: Great Rooms / Friendly Staff!
text: A great location in Midtown Manhattan.  The subway is just outside the door, Macy's is across the street, and everything you need is right there. The rooms are spacious for Manhattan. The staff is all so friendly,  and the Bellman, Michael R. is truely a great guy and so full of energy! The breakfast could be improved offering just 3 sandwiches and muffins. It appears to be an independent operator and shuts down about 1130, so there's no hotel restaurant available for lunch or dinner, although there's Korean down the street. This is our new NYC hotel!

title: Good for business room
text: I liked the room I had.  Room was clean and updated. It’s conveniently located a few blocks from the Empire State Building and lots of nice restaurants in the area. I ate at keens which was expensive but the steaks are ginormous.

title: Good if you’re not a light sleeper
text:
Well located, in the centre of Manhattan, with entrance 10m away from the subway. Room adequate and clean. Breakfast comes from a small Starbucks outlet in the lobby. Platinum members get $10 daily credit - enough for a coffee or yoghurt, but not both.
Notable downside is the bar/nightclub on the 18th floor. Very popular (no idea why!) and DJ plays until 5am at weekends. Unless you like heavy bass, avoid the high floors. Even down in our 12th floor room it was noticeable and annoying.

title: Great Location
text: I stayed two nights at the courtyard on Harold Square the location is excellent close to many great restaurants and sites within the city. The staff was friendly, very attentive, and sought to help in anyway possible. The check In process was great as was cafe.  The housekeeping staff was super friendly and did a great job. My only complaint was the street noise which was noticeable the first night and I did not notice the second.   I’d stay again at this location.

title: Great location; great value for money
text: The location is awesome! Very convenient for everything. The staff was extremely and helpful. The rooms had a good size, and we were not bother by the street noise. I felt the cleanliness of the room could have been a little better.

title: Mixed
text:
The good:
Personable staff
Great location
Surprisingly quiet room, even with a loud family across the hall
Secure entrance
Rooftop bar if you’re into that

Needs improvement:
Dim lighting in room
Need more outlets near desk and bed 
Full length mirror is 8” wide, inside the wardrobe. Opening the wardrobe door blocks the light. Please put a mirror somewhere more accessible, near the front door.
Housekeeping should make it a practice to check the safe can be locked - mine just flashed e-code and wouldn’t lock
Bad art

@Marriott: time for a refresh on the room decor.

Gym: Went twice. Machines are older but still functioning well. Cleaning wipes were not available the first day, and never refilled, so I was unable to clean the machine before or after the workout. I

title: Excelente hotel e localização
text:
Hotel excelente, otima localização. tamanho bom, a se considerar os tamanhos de quarto em nyc. Custo-beneficio otimo. Pegamos 1 quarto para 4 e era bem espaçoso.
Possui wi-fi.
Quarto limpo e cama confortavel.
Esta bem localizado e alem de poder fazer muita coisa a pé tem o metro ao lado. super recomendo.

title: Great location but street noise
text:
The proximity to Penn Station is fantastic.  The room was clean and comfortable, similar to others in the chain in NYC.
This is a bit of a double edged sword as I found the street noise from the Herald Square loud.  I also found a bit of the noise from the rooftop bar seeped down to my room - likely bc my room was directly beside dedicated elevator & on a high floor.
Rooftop - forgot about getting up there, the line goes around the corner.
Lastly, asked about points rewards at front desk and was directed to call head office which resulted in a $20 room charge for outgoing calls as I don't have a US cellular.
Would stay at another location next time.

title: "Great Hotel & Great customer serivce by the staff"
text:
First time in New York and was greeted by Michael as soon as we were getting out of the taxi and he took our luggage and got in the elevator to the lobby .  Michael was so kind and helped us with restaurants and direction. Great staff at the desk while checking in. Rooms we clean, updated and the best mattress I've ever slept on out of all the hotels I've stayed at.  

Excellent location, everything close by.  I will be staying at this hotel again.

title: GET WELL LOOKED AFTER IN HERE
text: Our second visit, because our first was great too. We had five nights in room 1612. A corner room. A great view up 6th. Avenue to be had and you can easily pass an hour looking out of the window. New York City has got so very busy so I doubt we'll be back. This is a good central place to stay with a subway station right outside. Corey on the front desk was great, some first class service from this nice guy.

title: Nice place
text: Nice hotel, the rooms were fine. The location was excellent, close to the center and subway. The rooftop bar was also very nice with a great view over Manhattan. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpfull.

title: Scarso
text: Ho letto alcune recensioni e mi sono deciso a prenotare questo hotel. In effetti la posizione è ottima. Ma qui finiscono le cose positive. Le stanze sono minuscole, il bagno piccolissimo. Nel complesso è una specie di motel di città. A New York anche in zona c'è tanto altro di meglio.

title: GREAT HOTEL
text: I stayed here , and Sheen made my stay memorable!!! He checked us in and after that he was so personable and was a great genuine employee!!! Sheen made us feel welcomed and not like any other guest! Not only was he great but so was the rest of te staff. Being from NJ I come to NY all time, and I typically like to switch up my hotels each time, but because of sheen and the staff this is now mine and my friends regular spot!!!

title: Thank you Ted!
text: I would like to thank the hotel and especially to their Operations Manager named Ted, because we forgot and left quite a large sum of money in the safe, while we already left NY and flew to Boston. Fortunately, Ted kept our money safe during the 2 weeks we were gone! We really appreciate the honesty that Ted showed, and it definitely leaves a good impression of Courtyard & Marriott.

title: Excellent location & honest staff
text:
We checked into the room without any wait at all, the receptionist acknowledged our elite status was reasonably friendly. 

The room itself was quite average, but it was on par with other Courtyards. It was clean, but the whole room felt quite dated. The room had a small window with a pretty nice view of the surroundings. While nothing was wrong with the room, there was also nothing noteworthy.

However, the whole highlight of the place is the location. The Macy's store was just steps away from the hotel, and there are a plethora of other shops in the area which are worth visiting. 

I gave this hotel 5 stars because unfortunately, I forgot to empty out the safe during check-out and left a sum of money inside the safe. When we called, they were able to confirm the items left behind which we retrieved later on. We were very relieved and satisfied that the Courtyard staff are honest displayed integrity.

title: Good location, clean and comfortable
text:
Stayed for a night before heading west. Hotel is centrally located about 10 minutes to Penn station, Times Square, Broadway theaters....

Rooms were comfortable and well appointed.   There is a rooftop bar that is accessed from the ground floor.  

Would stay here again for the location

title: Admin kinda sucks but actual hotel and location are great
text:
We stayed for a week and the location is incredibly convenient. Literally in front is the entry to the subway. Restaurants around. K-town is just around the corner, Penn Station and Empire State Building are just 5 mins away. Macy's is literally in front of you. There's also a great rooftop bar on top called Monarch (this is also sometimes a problem as on weekend nights, so many people are lined up in the entrance - hotel and club have same entrance to elevators). One night they commandeered as well one elevator for the hotel to use for the club as there were way too many people coming in and out.
Also loved that there are free water bottles that can be taken anytime at the ground floor, there's a starbucks inside the hotel. Not a complaint but there wasn't any tea provided, only coffee.
For the rest:
Guys at the ground floor were way nicer than the receptionists at well, reception.
A bunch of admin issues that people didn't seem to want to help with - given the wrong room and we had to change on next night. When I went the next day to change I had to kinda explain the whole thing again. I asked same guy if we could still change the credit card which we originally gave for check in. He said yes and cards aren't charged but on day of check out we woke up to a charged credit card. We could still pay it but upon paying it, we somehow  paid for the room of another person (!!) and only discovered upon inspecting the invoice closely. Tried to use the computer to print stuff and it wasn't printing - came to reception and they were like ok... and eventually said if i wanted help. don't bother. 
Ice machine on our floor was just forever broken.
anyway my point is, there's like 5 hotels in the same street (next street) which has same price point, view, location - would recommend to go there than here. (Hilton Garden Inn is literally beside courtyard - with the added bonus of having an actual patio.

title: The hotel in itself is fine but the reception services are not that good.
text:
Location of this hotel is number one for me if you want to be able to explore NYC. It is right beside a subway terminal and even the Penn station is a few minutes walk. 
The hotel is clean and rooms are comfortable.
They give service water for free which is very convenient for travelers like us who always like to bring a bottle of water especially at the time we were there which was very hot and humid.
We did not try doing breakfast but they have a Starbucks at the lobby area which is open in the morning.

Top on the list on what I didn't like with Courtyard is that they were not not able to reserve a room that we booked with booking.com. I booked April 2019 with booking and when we called last June to confirm this booking (they were not replying to my messages via booking which is why we called) they said there said there was no such reservation under my name. If we did not call then we would not have a room to stay in after 20 hrs of travel. 
The consequence of this non-reservation was that on the first day of our stay we had to stay at a room without the city view (which is what we paid for) and was transferred only on the second day. 
Also, I don't understand why we always have to ask for toiletries every time we arrive at the end of the day. I was paying for the 3 of us but the toiletries they give is always for one person only. 
At the end of our stay another issue cropped up. We gave the room keycards with the room number to the front desk and I gave my card for processing of payment then we left and went to our New Jersey hotel. While in the New Jersey hotel, I checked the receipt given by Courtyard and saw that I paid for the wrong room since the receipt indicated a wrong name and a different room number. We called the hotel again and that was the only time they settled the issue accordingly, It was good that the person in the room number I paid for did not check out yet when I called. 
Some people may get bothered every evening with the long line of people going to Monarch rooftop bar since they share the same entrance door though they have a different service elevator.

title: PERFECT SPOT TO STAY IN MIDTOWN!
text: I travel to NYC on a very regular basis and always stay at the Courtyard/Herald Square.  The location is perfect - walking distance to Empire State Bldg, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and the Flatiron District.  As a bonus, the subway stop right outside of the hotel services most lines since it's a main transfer station.  Cannot get much better than that!  Not only is the location great, but the Team at hotel is the best.  Everyone is very accommodating, and goes above and beyond!  They treat everyone as a VIP regardless of status.  Plus, the hotel is always clean and very well maintained.  I highly recommend staying when in NYC for business or other.

title: GIRLS 50TH BIRTHDAY ADVENTURE
text: AWESOME !!!! This hotel is perfect for all activities you need to do in  beautiful New York City. My girlfriends and I came to New York for our 50th Birthday Celebration,and it was just that. Michael was a sweetheart. He had all the answers to all the questions we had about New York City. Very HELPFUL! Thank you Michael, and friendly staff , you made our adventure one we will not forget.

title: Hotel superbe
text:
Hôtel super bien situé 
Propreté des chambre optimale 
Belle vue. Facilite d’accès au rooftop pour les clients qui sont présents dans l’hôtel 
Le personnel correcte. 
Dans l’ensemble je recommande vivement.

title: Sink Issue!
text: Only needed the room to stay overnight so checked in and went to dinner!  Upon my return at 11PM, I found an issue with the sink clogging up.  No water was going down and pipes were leaking.  Called front desk, they eventually sent maintenance.  He tried to fix it without opening up the pipes, but no go!  He left at least twice and came back.  Mind you this is 12AM by now and I have to be up by 6AM.  I asked multiple times if he could fix it and he said he could but would take a little longer.  I asked if I should move rooms and he said no he would fix it.  This late at night the hotel should have moved me so I could get a good nights sleep.  The maintenance staff did end up fixing it that night.  Not blaming them at all but the entire pipe had to be taken out cleaned, etc...  That room should have been put out of commission that night and I should have been moved.  Barely got any sleep and had to leave first thing in morning.  Not the best customer service on handling these situations.

title: ANOTHER AMAZING STAY!
text: This is our go to hotel in nyc for a variety of reasons! We love the subway entrance right outside the hotel and the proximity to our favorite bar the ginger man but the best part about this hotel is we always get upgraded to a corner room on the 17th floor and the bellman is so friendly and polite! The hotel isn’t fancy but clean, spacious and the customer service is amazing! They always take care of their Marriott members!

title: Old, cramped, 2-star and never again.
text:
I'll get it straight right from the start. The people are great, (in that special, brash, New York way). They gave everyone the rundown and made me laugh a lot. 

But even they could not make up for the serious dereliction of any service management. So let's start: I check in: Kind of okay, but when finished with formalities I get handed two plastic bottles of water..... (suitcase, carry-on, briefcase, now 2 bottles of water. Why? Not a porter in sight, so let's go with this!).  
Apparently the hotel cannot place the water in the room for you, you have to carry it yourself, because if they give it to staff then it gets stolen?? Really?
Minibar - joke! It's empty and you have to beg to get anything.

I checked into my cupboard, (smaller than the walk-in wardrobe at the last Courtyard I stayed at) to find it was very old. Everything is "chipped and cracked", and I tip-toe'd around on the carpet because I was not sure what made it so shiny. 
The bathroom is barely big enough for one. 

I wish I could say that the mattress and quality of sleep made the stay, but it also didn't meet the 'corporate standard' Marriott bed - in fact it felt stuffed, grubby and damp. 
I'll not go on, except to say that I spent as little time as possible at the hotel. 

My final BIG beef: I stay in a lot of Marriott Hotels - too many and I'll be working on that!
Over the past year I have noticed something a bit alarming about them - they all have the "WE DO GOOD" environmental stuff in the rooms, (hang up towels to re-use; place card on bed to save sheets, etc.) 
But in the last 6 Marriott's I stayed in everybody ignores then completely, except 1. In this one it was expressly ignored 3 nights out of 3. I even put the 're-use' sign on the towel, and it still got changed and the card put back on the counter - this is like the 'evil empire'!
They say: 
1. We "respect our customers" and we give our customers an environmental choice;  
2. At Marriott we care for the environment;
3. We provide the means to help you, the customer, to help the environment.
What they do is: 
1. We do not respect you or your choices, as we ignore your instructions completely. 
2. They do not care at all and have the worst dose of 'green-wash' in the hotel industry.
3. The have a management regime and do not care at all about you or the environment.

I love New York for all kinds of reasons, I'll go back, but never to this hotel. 
Sorry Staff - you were great and you did your best - but management don't get it at all, and Marriott do not get it at all.

title: A really nice Courtyard in a prime location!
text: Just a couple of blocks away from Macy's, The Empire State Building and Broadway you will find this very nice and convenient Courtyard Marriott. The staff was so friendly and so good at their job. The lobby has breakfast, Starbucks Coffee, computers and tv's. The rooms were spacious for a NYC Hotel and comfy beds. I can't say enough about how good the staff was here and I highly recommend this hotel for those staying in The Big Apple.

title: Decent member of its chain in good location
text:
The hotel is centrally located near Herald Square and Macy’s iconic store. It is less than 50 feet from a major subway entrance and various buses are located within a block or two. The rooms are compact but there was enough space to unpack 5 days worth of clothing and store suitcases out of the way. Bathroom is also small and has a shower but no tub.
The lobby is one floor up from the entrance which is manned by security and security for the rooftop bar/club (which we did not visit but which seemed very popular to judge from the crowds waiting for admission). Check in was efficient. “Breakfast” is available adjacent to the lobby but consists of limited choices of prepackaged items warmed up by the staff in microwaves. About equal to other fast food outlets but more expensive. Not worth the effort.
Would return if we wanted to be in the area. Rates were in line with other hotels on the street.

title: Callously cancelled reservation Memorial Day weekend
text: Went to check in Friday night after a long day and 10+ miles of walking. Used Bonvoy points to book, but when I arrived they had given my room away. According to Marriott/Bonvoy I had a reservation, but they insisted I did not. Got on the phone with Marriott/Bon Voy who confirmed my non-cancelled reservation, but the front desk was insistent and totally callous to the situation they put me in on a busy Memorial Day weekend. I asked them to call a neighboring hotel to see if there was a vacancy, and they would not. Not only was I left stranded due to a several errors by both Marriott/Bon Voy and Courtyard Herald Square, they were completely indifferent to helping me. I was in tears and the Bon Voy  rep on the phone was incredulous. Ended up in a teeny room sandwiched between two clubs in Time Square and paying out of pocket to do so. Being a member of the hospitality sector myself, their behavior was shocking.

title: Outstanding hotel
text: I have lived in NYC and get back occasionally.  I can definitely say that for the money this is the best hotel I have ever stayed at in Manhattan.  The location is perfect.  The staff is extremely friendly.  The rates are actually reasonable. Our room was decent sized and very clean.  We were on the 11th floor which reduced the street noise and avoided the rooftop bar noise.  I would definitely stay again.

title: Great Location, Great service and Great rooms
text:
Stayed here for our NYC road trip. First thing is how convenient the location was. Steps to the Subway, 10 min walk to Times Square and Broadway. Lots of food choices around the hotel.

Service was excellent. My room was ready at noon cause we came in early. Our family of 4 was able to move around the room with ease. Obviously since it's in NYC the space will be tight but it was ok since it was just our home base for shopping and sightseeing. 

Use the valet parking and the bell hop was awesome. Super friendly and greeted us every time we came in and out of the hotel. He also had my car ready before the time we arranged cause they were starting construction on the street so he saved us the walk. Huge shout out to him.

I had read the reviews about the noise coming from the club but I didn't hear anything and we were there over the weekend.

title: Birthday trip
text: Janeal checked us in and was so lovely! She was very patient with us and answered any question we had. She advised us of some pretty good food spots. Was also very helpful in taking the time to give us a quick lesson in taking the subway and giving directions to other popular places around the area. We squeezed as much as we could in the three days we were there. The room was cozy, and when it was time to checkout we had janeal again! It was a very stress less easy checkout. Definitely keeping this location in our back pocket for our next trip to New York. We still have so much more to do & so much more to see.

title: Great location, good service, comfortable rooms
text:
I searched for on a budget, good family oriented hotels in the Herald Square/Timed Square area and found this jem. It was great for us for several reasons:
Location: we chose this hotel for it's location. It is right next to the subway and walking distance from the places we planned to visit (Times Square, Union Square, Rockefeller Center). 
Family oriented: we stayed in their basic room (I think it is called "King Room"). We were surprised how specious it was. It had a king sized bed (very comfortable) and a little sofa that openned up into another bed. 
Firendly and helpful staff: from the moment we arrived until the end of your stay, we were treated great by the staff of the hotel. Mike and the guards on the street level were extremly friendly and helpful in giving advice what to do with a two year old. 
The hotel was very clean.

title: Great location
text:
We stayed here for one night, our last night before flying back home. We were upgraded to a corner room which was large and had a great view of Macy's. The room was very clean and staff was helpful and friendly. Subway station entrance located right in front of the hotel which made it easy for us to get to the airport the next morning.

Plenty of restaurant choices within walking distance. They have a rooftop bar which we didn't get a chance to visit, but it has a view of the Empire State building. 

We would stay here again if we ever get to visit NYC again.

title: Splendid spot with super rooftop lounge
text: Stayed here with our family for the Easter weekend. Right opposite Macy’s and Broadway and Times Square are just around the corner. The hotel has a super rooftop lounge with a great view on the Empire State Building!

title: Jewel of Midtown
text: When we travel (and we travel frequently) to Manhattan,  we look for a hotel with great location, kind people, excellent rooms, and competitive rates. This hotel has all of these qualities and more. I cannot thank the managers Alpha and Michelle enough - they were so helpful and kind. They are tremendous assets to this property.  Every person there, from Jose helping us with luggage, to the aforementioned managers,  to the housekeeping staff were super friendly. The rooms were large by NYC standards. The location was amazing. We went to a Yankees game,  and the subway was literally 20 steps from the hotel entrance. Going to Times Square? We walked there in 10 minutes.  Macy's? Across the street. Want wine or food or anything? It is literally steps away. We also visited their rooftop bar, Monarch. It is beautiful, and has stunning views of the Empire State Building. This hotel is wonderful in every way! I cannot recommend it highly enough!!

title: Goed hotel met goede locatie, jammer dat bar niet echt bij hotel hoort
text:
Prima hotel, met 3 op 1 kamer wel wat krap. Vond amenities beetje mager, geen theekoker bijv. Wel iets voor koffie. Bedden lekker, wel zacht. En bedden zijn dus smal.
Wat ik wel een domper vond is dat de bar, waarvan werd gesuggereerd dat dit bij het hotel hoort, volledig los van hotel staat. Niet echt iets waar je dus aan einde van dag even zo gaat zitten. En wijntje anders 14 dollar.

title: Fantastic location, small room
text:
Being an experienced NYC traveler, I know not to expect large room - I look for location, safety and cleanliness.  With regard to those qualities this was a good hotel.  

Location: The hotel, right across from the iconic Macys and near the Empire State Building, was an easy walk to almost anywhere you want.  We loved the central location with Central Park a little to the North and Soho a little to the south.  The room was small, to be expected.  My criticism is that they didn't utilize the space well.  There were two beds and little floor space but it would have been adequate for a small dresser or even a fold-out suitcase stand. Instead, there was a small armoire with room to hang a few items and 2 small drawers. The TV was large and there was a refrigerator and safe - both helpful.  We're savvy travelers and didn't overpack, but with three of us in the room, we had to place our luggage on the floor and found ourselves tripping over our stuff.  The hotel could learn a lot from the cruise industry that has small space organization really well thought out.  

Safety: The hotel was in a safe neighborhood with a security guard always at the door.  When you enter the hotel you enter a very small lobby where you have to pass by security to enter the elevators which take you up to the rooms.  People can't just walk up off the street and access the hotel.  

Cleanliness: The hotel lobby and amenities were clean and well maintained.  Our room appeared clean except that I could see signs of old mold in some parts of the bathroom.  And I could tell that our shower wasn't cleaned the entire week we were there.   

Ambiance: We were on the 7th floor so we weren't bothered by rooftop noise and we did hear the occasional siren/alarm out the window but that's to be expected.  Our view from the room was of an ugly rooftop next-door but we didn't really choose the hotel for the views. The hotel has a cafe with some breakfast items and starbucks coffee but the first day we went down to order breakfast they were out of all items except the breakfast burrito.  Needless to say we didn't even bother going again.  There are too many great choices in NYC to waste our time there. The hotel staff was really nice and the elevators worked well and without delay.

Overall, this hotel is a good choice for families looking to stay in a clean, well-located, safe hotel with cost in mind.  We stayed on Marriott points but when I searched hotels I did look for budget-friendly ones when I chose this one.
