It's not a fancy place...not a boutique hotel...but if you can get a larger room (they weren't available when we were there) it's worth staying here.

title: Noise from the Rooftop Bar
text:
The good: the check-in process was smooth and they were able to hold our bags until the room was ready so that we could go explore the city.
The room was clean.
Good location for what we needed.

The bad, really bad: We were put on the 17th floor/top floor which seemed fine at first.
We were in town to run the NYC half marathon and expected to get a good night's sleep. 
We got back to our hotel around 11 to turn in for the night and realized that the rooftop bar is more of a night club. All night, until 4 am, all we could hear wass music from the rooftop bar.
I came prepared for regular city noise and had earplugs, those only muffled the bass slightly. 
Around midnight, I called the front desk to find out two things;
1. If they had any other rooms available. They did not have any doubles available, only king rooms, so they could not switch us. 
2. What time would the bar close/the DJ stop playing?  We were told 4AM.
This was the worst night's sleep that I've ever experienced in a hotel and I will not return. 
Had we been informed that there was a nightclub that would be blasting music until 4am at check-in so we could have waiting for a lower level floor our experience and this review could have been entirely different. But to only get 3 hours of sleep for the price we paid was absolutely absurd.

title: Spacious corner room
text: We stayed at this hotel due it's proximity to Penn Station. (3 blocks). We went to the Barclays Center in Brooklyn which was a short subway ride on the D train, whose station was right outside the hotel entrance. The front desk allowed us an early check in, housekeeping gave us the extra towels we requested, and the entire staff was friendly and helpful. The corner room was clean, and came with a microwave and fridge; the bed comfortable.

title: Great little gem in Manhattan
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  Good sized family room in an excellent location directly opposite Macys and a whole load of other shops and places to eat.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Great internet connection.  Herald Square subway station is directly outside the hotel.  Would definitely recommend this hotel as a base for a great New York holiday.

title: Hidden Gem
text: This was my fourth visit to NYC and my fourth different hotel. But it will be my go to hotel from now on. Location is perfect! Walk to everywhere, subway stop outside door, and shopping all around. Everyone was extremely nice and welcoming. The first night we were on the 17th floor and because of the noise (there is a nightclub/bar on 18th floor- not associated with hotel) they moved us immediately and it was a smooth process. You truly feel everyone is there to make sure you have a great visit. Will be going back to NYC and will be going back to this hidden gem!

title: Great location, nice rooms!
text: We stayed at this hotel for a quick weekend getaway. The location is perfect- only a few blocks from the train station, theaters, restaurants, shopping, etc. We walked from the hotel to Central Park and back again. The room was very clean and the staff was extremely friendly. We had a corner room facing Herald Sq and 6th Ave. Our room was a king "suite" with a small couch and chair. The room itself isn't huge, but is perfect for two people. The only thing I would caution, if you are  a light sleeper and not used to the city, there are sirens all night long. Clearly, this is not the fault of the hotel, but something you should know prior to booking a room facing Herald Square.

title: Great location and helpful staff
text: Adequate room for three in a great central NY location with very helpful staff. Thank you Michael for having our car waiting and luggage packed for the quickest exit out of the city.  Your advice on driving straight on W 35th until Dryer Street was spot on and put us right at Lincoln tunnel to exit the city.

title: Basic accommodation and staff
text:
we stayed in the hotel which was out dated and drab. All i can say is that the location is great and wished that i booked the hilton garden inn which is next door.  

Our flight was delayed and we asked for a late checkout they offered us a 1 ocloak an hour from the original checkout and said thats the best they can do as they are fully booked, but if we pay for a room rate then thats fine. I said so your not full then. 

i found the staff to be fake friendly and the sheets were yellow and the toliet smelled like poo in the mornings and the furniture was peeling off.

title: Very Pleased
text:
Not only the hotel is in a perfect location (very central and only a short walk away from Times Square) but the service provided was excellent!

 All the staff was very friendly, asking about our days out and making sure everything is okay with the room. The room is provided with amenities such as shower gels etc as well as a coffee machine which gets stocked up every morning. 

It also has a gym which is a small size but has everything you need if you want to fit in a quick workout during your travels and has cardio machines as well as dumbbells and a bench. 

I would highly recommend that you visit the rooftop of the hotel even if you don't want to use the bar as you get a very beautiful view of New York and the Empire state building. We went during the evening and the view was absolutely breath taking!

title: Quarto espaçoso e limpo
text: Tudo em Manhattan é caro, e esse hotel não foge à regra. Porém, o quarto era bem confortável, maior que os minúsculos que se vê em NY. Estava tudo limpo e o chuveiro também era bom. Atendimento muito gentil. Café da manhã não incluso, há uma lanchonete no térreo.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Very pleased with the hotel.  Our first time staying in a Marriott Courtyard.  I had requested an early arrival, (which we usually do and rarely have ever been granted) and was so happy that they were able to get us in our room early.  The staff was friendly, attentive and helpful.  Our room was a good size, clean and had a little refrigerator.  Would definitely return to this hotel.

title: Loved it !
text:
מלון מצוין,מיקום טוב מאוד. נוח וקרוב לSubway 
צוות אדיב ושירותי מאוד.
חדרים מרווחים,נקיים ונעימים. שירות חדרים טוב מאוד.
חדר כביסה שירות front desk מלא גם בתחום הזה. דואגים לעודף למכונה. ונותנים גם אבקת כביסה חינם. 
איחסון מזוודות מהיר, בל בוי מקסים ואדיב
ממליצה להישאר ולהמתין בנחת בלובי עד הנסיעה לשדה. 
תודה ! 
בהחלט חוזרת.

title: Not up to standard of previous stay
text: I returned to this Courtyard because of great location and positive previous experience staying there. Big differences this time: I had a room facing 35th st, as opposed to the back of the building; and the toilet was not cleaned after the previous guest. The first issue meant it was noisier in the room—if you are a light sleeper, make sure you don’t get a room on that side. The toilet was I’m sure an oversight by housekeeper (on duty Sunday), as rest of room was very clean. It was gross to say the least and unacceptable. I should not have to clean after a previous guest on the toilet seat. Will make me think twice about staying here again.

title: super Hotel in bester Lage
text:
Das Courtyard New York Manhattan/Herald Square ist ein super Hotel in absolut bester Lage. Direkt gegenüber von Macys mit einer Subway-Haltestelle an der gefühlt fast jede Linie hält.
Wir waren eine Woche im Hotel im Zimmer 1707 im 17 Stock mit einem genialen Ausblick aufs Empire State Building.
Das Zimmer ist sehr groß und wurde immer ordentlich gereinigt.
Das Badezimmer ist nicht hübsch, aber zweckmäßig und sauber.

Zum Frühstück können wir nichts sagen, da wir keins hatten.
Das Personal war sehr nett, vor allem die Luggage-Boys.

Punktabzug gibt es von mir allerdings für die Bettdecke, diese war sehr dünn (im Dezember eher die falsche Wahl) da es nur ein Lacken war und man hat nur ein großes Lacken für zwei. Auch die Kissen empfand ich nicht sehr bequem.
Was außerdem etwas lästig waren, dass man beim Verlassen des Zimmers nicht zentral das ganze Licht ausschalten konnte. Man musste wirklich jede einzelne Lampe separat ausknipsen.
Aber das ist meckern auf hohem Niveau. Wir würden wohl wiederkommen!

title: Solid hotel
text:
This is a typical Courtyard hotel you'd find in any city (average amenities, courteous staff, basic room, working TV and shower, lacking character, etc). I don't have any major complaint and I don't have anything to write home about. 

I found elevator to be pretty slow and given that the lobby is on the 2nd floor, slow elevator made it a bit more inconvenient. 

The view from my room was pretty good and it's certainly better than the other adjacent two hotels nearby. Location is fairly convenient. rooftop bar while I haven't gone seemed to be not completely deserted given the flow of people.

In all honesty, given the plethora of affordable hotel options thesedays, I am not sure if I'd come back again but it is also not a bad choice (could say it is a safe choice), I wouldn't recommend people from not staying either. there's some value in that I think.

title: Waited over 2 1/2 hours for our car from valet and we finally had to get it ourselves
text:
Do NOT use their valet service.  I repeat, do NOT use their valet service.  For $65/day you would think you can get your car back w/o much hassle.  But I was proven wrong.  At check-in the bell guy told us if we needed our car to call 30 mins ahead since the valet service is offsite at a parking garage.  Sure no problem, I understand, parking is limited, NYC traffic and we’re staying in one of the busiest cities in the world.

The day we checked out I called the front desk 1 HOUR ahead to get our car ready.  Here is a timeline of events

9am - called front desk letting them we want our car around 10am

10am - went by front desk to let them know we are ready for our car.  Was told “just a few more minutes”

10:30am - still standing in the lobby waiting for our car.  Overheard a couple of other groups waiting for their cars for over 30 mins.

11am - still standing in the lobby waiting for our car. Complained to bell guy and front desk.  Was told they were backed up today, system glitch, and blah blah blah.

11:30am - A couple of groups ahead of us finally got their cars after over an hour of waiting.  I noticed it is the same valet guy dropping off cars.  WTF … so I asked the guy where our car is after waiting 2 1/2 hours at this point.   He pulls out a paper list with 15+ cars.  I see my ticket # as the top of the list but it was a digit off.  Good thing I noticed, god knows how long it would of taken to fix that mistake.  At this point I was beyond pissed off.  I went upstairs to complain some more and my sister followed the valet guy back to the parking garage to RETRIEVE OUR OWN CAR from valet.  When my sister got our car, the valet guy had to nerve to ask for a tip.

I spoked to the hotel manager and complaining that retrieving our own car from valet after 2 1/2 hours of waiting is not acceptable and what are they going to do to improve the valet situation in the future.  The manager gave some BS rehearsed answer that they are always working with the valet company to make things more efficient.  Oh yea? then why is my complaint similar to another reviewer’s complaint 2 years ago?  I guess since this hotel is central to all the major attractions this hotel is always booked so there’s no need to improve the valet service.

11:45am - Sister pulls up with our car.

The hotel is nice and staff members in the lobby did everything they could to help us and it is not their fault.  But I blame this bad experience on Marriott management for not working with the valet company to ensure customers don’t spend over an hour waiting for their cars after giving them a heads up and in our case getting our down damn car from valet.  I would given this place 4 or 5 stars but it is getting a 1 star for the horrendous valet experience.  If you stay here and are driving in, try to park else where.  Or you might risk waiting hours for your car and potentially missing your flight!

title: Ubicacion excelente
text: Hotel muy bien ubicado , a 10 metros de la estación del metro , a una cuadra del edificio Empire State, entre la quinta y la sexta avenida , caminando se llega a todas partes . Lo malo no incluye desayuno y la cafetería para comprar algo es muy pequeña.

title: “Expected More”
text:
Very disappointed with check-in...didn’t get in the room till 4 o’clock for one room and 4:15 for the other.  They kept giving me false hope, I understand 4 o’clock is check in but don’t give me false hope of an early check-in.
 They told me to call 30 to 45 minutes ahead to retrieve my vehicle from valet upon check out, well it took one hour and a half. 
 The bathroom shower tub drain backed up, by the time that my shower was done I had 4 inches of water in the shower tub.
Room could have been cleaner,  A lot of dust.

title: Great Staff and Location
text:
First ever trip to NYC and stayed at Courtyard/Herald Square. We were on the 17th floor and the first thing I saw out my window were the Empire State Building and Macey's. 
The bell hop's were very friendly and helpful giving directions that even a newcomer could understand. I would definitely give a 5 but they have a rooftop bar and the music was very loud until after midnight. Maybe should have asked for a lower floor, but the views were too good.

title: Clean and Comfortable!
text: We stayed here for two night during the New York Marathon and were completely satisfied with the location and the accommodations! We were within easy walking distance of Bryant Park and the Empire State Building. Many good restaurants and street vendors are nearby as well as a small grocery store.

title: Excelente Hotel
text:
Marriot no falla. Cerca de todo, habitaciones limpias, todo muy comodo. La ubicacion es perfecta. A la salida tenes una boca de subte, muy practico todo! 

Reciben paquetes sin costo!

El checkout es sencillo y rápido.

title: Family Comfortable
text:
Family of 4 very comfortable in a twin double standard room. Bigger than many European rooms which was a surprise for NYC.

Location is great for us first timers in NYC ie Hearld square subway right out side Penn station down the street as well as easy walking to broadway and many sights.

Staff very friendly, a bonus was monarch rooftop bar located in the same hotel, excellent view of Empire State Building.

Recommend this well priced hotel, don’t expect 5 star but excellent value for $

title: 50th B'day Celebration
text:
Celebrated my daughters 50th birthday for 5 days. Our stay was perfect on the 6th floor of the hotel. Loved entering on the Ground level, Jose, Raphael were so very helpful in suggesting places to local eat. Restaurants with great food for a good value. Not just tourist spots. Directions, subway, transportation. 
Housekeeping was wonderful. Loved taking the opportunity to visit the Club Monarch on the roof to see the Empire State Building up close. 
Location so convenient to shopping. 
Averaged walking about 9,000 steps a day by choice.

title: A Magical Stay
text: Had an opportunity to stay at this property for four nights the week after Thanksgivivg, and totally pleased.  The location is ideal in Midtown Manhatten, walking distance to all the midtown attractions, in a decent, busy area of the city.  The building is clean, safe and with a second floor lobby secure.  Only bell stand and security officer on the ground level.  The staff is remarkable from check in to check out, Michael, the Bellman is very helpful, knowledgeable a can make anything within reason happen.  Front desk folks, Djiwo and Corine, bent over backwards to insure our needs were met or exceeded.  Housekeeping staff were professional and kept the rooms and public areas tidy.  Everyone we met were seemingly caring and professional.

title: Fantastic Location
text: We stayed here while visiting NYC to see the Macy's Day Parade.  We could not have picked a better location.The hotel is very nice and clean. Michael with guest services is incredible and will help with any questions you may have about anything to do with NYC.  There is a subway station just outside the hotel which is very helpful. The Empire State building is very close.  We would absolutely stay here again when we visit NYC.

title: A gem of a hotel with outstanding customer service in Herald Square!
text: I am going to preface this review by saying that I'm a hotel snob, and I don't apologize for that :). My family travels a lot, and when we do, I like to have an experience at a hotel that makes us feel like we are valued as guests, not customers. I also consider hotel location, the look/decor of the hotel room, and the kindness of the workers when I write a review. The Courtyard Herald Square was an absolute winner in all aspects! From the front desk people, to Jose, the incredibly kind bellman, to Alpha, the manager, we could not have had a better experience at this property. The people at this hotel went above and beyond to make our experience an unforgettable one. The location is 1 block away from Macy's in Herald Square, a quick walk to Penn Station, and an easy walk to Times Square/Rockefeller Center/Madison Square Garden/Subway/LIRR trains/Amtrak trains.... it was perfect. The hotel also has a BEAUTIFUL rooftop bar called Monarch, with views of the Empire State Building. The room we had (2 beds) was large by NYC standards (don't expect monster sized rooms in NYC), and the hotel elevators, which can be a pain (slow/not many of them) in many NYC hotels were super fast, and we never waited more than a minute to catch one. If you are looking for a perfectly located, reasonably priced hotel in the middle of everything, this is your place. I look forward to returning here!!

title: Perfect location for perfect stay
text: Hotel is a 20-25 minute ride from LaGuardia. We were greeted warmly by front desk who gladly helped us find a room on floor desired. The room was on corner with view of Macy’s. There is a great rooftop bar. Staying here gets you free access. We also went to ND game at yankee stadium. The D line is right out front door and goes direct. Broadway is one block away and Times Square is an easy walk. Fast elevators! If you have stayed in NYC before you know about waiting on elevators. Again, great staff!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: We just returned home after spending three nights on the 9th floor. I had called prior to our arrival to ask about an earlier check in and the person at the front ask was incredibly helpful. When we arrived Ocean was wonderful. We were able to get the early check in and we were in our room in a matter of minutes. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The bellman, Jose, was awesome. He was so kind and helpful, providing us with places to eat for breakfast with directions. Everyone working at the hotel could not have been kinder or more professional. The location is perfect as it is in the middle of everything without all of the hustle and bustle of Times Square. There is a lot of shopping nearby with Macy’s being the next street over. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Comfortable and Great Location
text: First staying at the hotel. The customer service was outstanding. A big shout out to front desk associate Ocean for helping us check in and get us a room right away. The room was very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The location was great for walking to all the sights. The bellman go the extra mile in providing friendly top notch service. My only suggestion would be to have better and softer lighting in the bathroom. Would definitely stay again.

title: Point fort : la situation sur Herald Square
text:
Les moins :
- Chambre pour 4 : 2 700 $
- Petit déjeuner : peu de choix
- Service petit déjeuner : peu souriant, insatisfaisant
- Nuisance sonore si vous êtes dans les étages les plus bas avec vue panoramique

Les plus :
- la situation centrale avec la station de métro au pied de l’immeuble
- la chambre est suffisamment grande pour 4 avec deux lits
- Service accueil au top

Conseils :
* payer votre chambre en cash pour éviter vos frais bancaires le cas échéant
* ne pas prendre le p’tit déj pour cet hôtel
* la vue panoramique ok mais en étage élevé seulement

title: Wonderful place to stay in NYC
text: This Courtyard has wonderful guest service, and excellent, full breakfast and happy hour, and has a great location for sight-seeing and getting around NYC. Clean, very, very comfortable rooms, and located close to some great restaurants.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff & Clean Rooms.
text: We stayed for 5 nights on the 16th floor. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The hotel is in a great location. The rooftop bar had lovely views of the Empire State building. We look forward to staying here the next time we are in New York.

title: Brilliant location
text: This was a lovely hotel and within easy walking distance of the Empire State and Times Square.  The hotel was clean and the beds were very comfy. It had a roof top bar which had a fantastic view of New York skyline. The best part was the staff very friendly and professional. Special thanks to the porters who stored our luggage twice and looked after us superbly.  Would recommend this hotel and would stay again when in New York

title: 便利な立地で最低限の設備はある
text: タイムズスクエアまで徒歩で数分なので、非常に便利な立地で価格もリーズナブルなのではないでしょうか。マリオットの名は冠していますが、コートヤードなので最低限の設備がある感じです。私の宿泊した部屋はバスタブは無しでした。部屋は清潔感はあり、寝るだけとわりきれば満足度は高いので、ニューヨーク観光の拠点としてはおすすめ、滞在型でホテルを楽しむ方には不向きですね。

title: Excellent location, comfortable stay
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 1 night and were very pleased with the central location. Easily walkable to Times Square and the theatre. 

The room was adequate and the bed very comfortable. 

Have to give a special shoutout to Michael and Jose, the 2 bellman that helped us during our stay. The service provided by these 2 gentleman and with a smile and positive attitude was fantastic. They made us feel like we were at home!

title: Great Location in Mid-town NYC
text: This Courtyard is centrally located in mid-town NYC by Herald Square.  It’s walking distance to Macy’s, Empire State Building and Times Square.  The subway entrance is just a few steps away.  The location was perfect for our 9 day/8 night stay in New York City.  We had a room on the 15th floor of a 17-story building.  The room was a typical Courtyard room with a king-size bed, very small sofa, safe, refrigerator, microwave, and desk.  What was missing was enough drawer space to hold our clothes for 9 days.  There were only 2 very small drawers in our room.  My husband is a Platinum Elite member and we got an “upgraded” room.  But the upgrade was not to a suite; instead we got a room in the corner with windows on two sides.  So we had great views of the Empire State Building, Macy’s, and Herald Square. But I wouldn’t say that this was really an “upgrade”. The bathroom was really small and it only had one sink.  Also, the lighting in the room was terrible with low wattage light bulbs. Michael and Amin, the bellboys, were very friendly and helpful.  Finally, there’s a rooftop bar called the Montrose on the 17th floor.  It is not affiliated with the Courtyard and has a separate elevator.

title: Great location and service
text: The hotel has wonderful staff: friendly and kind. It is located central not even a minute away from broadway. Lots of great stores and restaurants around. For a little time I had I was able to see at least a little bit and felt well hosted. Rooms are very clean

title: Awesome location...
text: This hotel was located in a great area...less than a block from Macy's, 5th Avenue, close walking distance to Times Square. I walked over to Penn Station to take a train to Met Life Stadium. Lots of shops nearby and restaurants. My king size bed/room was roomy, comfortable and clean. I returned around midnight on Saturday and you have to use your room key in order to enter the building. There is a club within the hotel and lots of people waiting to get in, separate entrance. So having this security feature in place made me feel very safe. The staff is also helpful and friendly.

title: Did Not Honor Reservation
text: Arrived at 10 p.m. and they gave away the reservation.  Did not honor reservation even as a preferred platinum member.  Had to go to another hotel across town at own expense because I was tired of waiting more than 30 minutes for a car they arranged.   Also had to agree to come back for the remaining nights of my reservation.

title: Great central location
text: Hotel is in very convenient just off 5th Ave. Staff was very helpful and offered local knowledge of must do things. Rooftop bar (no kids after 5) had great views. Rooms were a little bigger than many NYC hotels. Only negative, coffee shop closes pretty early (before 11) on Saturday and Sunday.

title: Great spot in the city
text:
Our room, with a king bed, was a really nice size by NYC standards. You enter on the ground floor, and, if you're arriving in the evening, you'll see a line of partygoers for the rooftop bar that's separate from the hotel. Getting past that is a little chaotic, but once you're in the bank of elevators for the hotel it's quiet and smooth sailing. Check-in was fast and the service here was just fine. We called for more towels and, being a big hotel I figured it would take a while to get them but someone was at our door in less than 5 minutes. 

The location at Herald Square is pretty good if you want to be in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. It's NYC, there are going to be piles of trash, scaffolding, honking horns and homeless folks on the streets, so just expect that. That's not the hotel's fault. Being in midtown means you're near a lot of attractions and cool places to eat and hang out. 

However, the gem here is the rooftop bar, not affiliated with the hotel itself (and has a separate entrance you must go to like everyone else). The view is amazing, you're right next to the Empire State Building, and the crowd is a good mix of people.

title: Decent 3 star but I think it is overrated here
text:
This hotel has a very high rating on TA and I'm not exactly sure why. I've stayed in 3 stars that feel high end and are very highly rated but this is not one of those.

It's a boring run of the mill 3 star hotel in a good location.  It's a perfectly acceptable as a 3 star (seems up to date), but for the same money in NYC I think you could do better.  I think the pictures online are accurate so if you like those you will like the place.

I don't like how there is no complementary water or coffee in the lobby. Also bags are stored on another level, so each time I needed to drop off and pick up (4 times for my stay) I had to wait about 5 minutes.

title: Fim do ano
text:
Óptimo hotel, boa localização , livre trânsito. Acolhedor, simpáticos ,pequeno almoço americano e europeu,à escolha , ficou nos mais acessível tomar o pequeno-almoço no hotel do que numa pastelaria! Uma passagem de ano diferente mas muito boa !
Aconselho a quem nunca o fez .
Tenciono voltar ao mesmo hotel ...

title: Super location with a really good hotel
text: The best thing about this hotel is the location, walking distance to everything you need. the rooms are small but I didn't have a problem with that because we were out of the rooms for most of the time. Rooms and bathrooms are clean, the reception is great. One thing that can be a negative is the rooftop bar but we did not have a problem because of the noise. Great location and great people, will be there again soon

title: muy buen hotel
text: hotel recomendable,con muy buena ubicacion , el personal muy atento y servicial,la instalaciones muy limpias y recientes,agua caliente  todo muy bien,solo el desayuno no esta incluido es costo aparte y la verdad  no vale la pena,pero en los alrededores hay bastantes alternativas de alimentos a no mas de una cuadra.... y todo esta muy cerca, a una cuadra macys ,enfrente herald square muy bonito parquecito a una cuadra de la 5ta avenida ,a dos cuadras del iconico Empire State Building,buena relacion costo-beneficio....

title: Deecent hotel in a central location
text:
My purpose was essentially theatreland, so in that respect the location was decent -- 10min-15min walk to Times Square at busy times.
The check in process was slick and efficient, and the hotel has multiple elevators, so you're not waiting too long for them
The room was a little smaller than Marriott hotel rooms are generally. Not miniature, and its still comfortable, but not a huge amount of room to lounge-around in - unless to lie on the bed. Again, for my purposes, this wasn't a problem. 
Bathroom was fine
There is some noise from the street; but its not awful - and I've stayed in a hell of a lot worse in NYC (looking at you Hotel Paramount) ; and again some from the elevator (if you're room is next to the shaft) - but again, not bad

In summary, its fine. It might not be my first choice, but I wouldn't have an issue staying there again at the right price

title: Don't stay if you want to sleep
text: The location is great.  Until friday night, not too much street noise. Unfortunately it was impossible to get any sleep at this hotel.  The upsetting thing is that it's the hotel's fault. I was on the 17th floor.  The hotel operates a dance club on the roof.  It would have been nice to be made aware of this and given the option to be down a few floors.  Rooms are tiny.  They made great use of wide angle lens on website. Tiny armoire to hang clothes and only drawers are in the narrowest nightstands I've ever seen.  It was me and 2 children and we basically had to live out of suitcases....although there was no place to put those either.  On the upside, the staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Super Location at Medium Price
text:
The doorman, Michael, is a treasure.  From the minute he spots you until the last goodbye - he knows your name, gives excellent advice on restaurants and how to get somewhere, takes great care of your luggage, etc., etc.  

There is a subway entrance at the hotel or you can catch other subway lines at 34th Street (very nearby). So convenient and cheap.  Or you can take a $16 cab and sit in traffic forever.  You can walk to "the World's Largest Department Store - Macy's, Herald Square plaza, or several restaurants. Or walk straight down 45th to the 911 Memorial.

Room 1506 now has a new shower curtain (all you have to do is ask). Negatives: small, double/double with lamp between beds which only had candelabra style bulbs (dim!!!), no towel bars in the bathroom, no closet or bureau (just an armoire with space for maybe 8 shirts to hang), and the full length mirror is hidden in the armoire.

Positives: no road noise!  (We used "fan only" on the A/C unit to further insure this.) Safe, refrigerator, and Starbucks coffee maker in room. Lots of hot water and good water pressure, rain head in shower.  Ample work space with ergonomic chair, multiple outlets, and desk lamp.  Fast elevators.  Pre-prepared food in lobby cafe, ex. packaged egg 
sandwich. 

Summary: ok room in great location with moderate prices  (New York real estate means condos, hotel rooms, etc. are TINY.)

title: Wonderful Hotel!!
text: The staff is what really makes this property so awesome!  Our maid anticipated our needs such as an extra blanket and towels before we even asked for it.  Michael the Bellman was so helpful and friendly with recommendations and suggestions.  It was a great location for us because we could easily get uptown or downtown trains throughout the city!

title: Super location, but not a typical Courtyard...
text: The rooms are quite small without places to put your suitcases. The bathroom doesn't even have a towel rack on the wall so you are forced to get new towels every day. There is no hot breakfast- just some sandwiches which are microwaved and not very appealing.

title: Great hotel, perfect location!
text: This hotel has everything you need and is very affordable for New York standards.  Walking distance to Times Square, Subway stops in all directions and Herald Square has the best shopping.  Rooms were extremely comfortable, great showers.  Monarch Rooftop was incredible as well! We were there for a wedding, GREAT choice!

title: Great location and hotel
text: The location is situated in a great location to get that makes walking to numerous destinations very easy.  The rooms were clean and quiet for the most part.  The concierge Micheal was a very informative nice guy.  Cafe's on the same corner offered good breakfast and lunches for a very affordable rate.

title: Great location
text: Great location is the main selling point right by Empire State Building and Maceys the rooms were small and basic but staff were friendly and helpful. We would stay here again as I say the location is great with not to much noise of the hustle and bustle of NYC.

title: Goed hotel op top locatie
text:
Hartje Manhattan. Direct naast metrostation Herald Square. Daarop ook uitgekozen. Sowieso slim om naast een metrostation te verblijven.  Kies er vooral 1 met veel verschillende lijnen. 

Ontvangst was uitstekend. Eerste etage met de lift voor receptie. Wijst zich vanzelf. 

Kamers ruim genoeg badkamer wat aan de kleine kant. Bedden liggen goed. Weinig overlast van drukke stad. 

Ontbijten kun je op steenworp afstand op verschillende plaatsen. Ideaal zo’n grote stad!

Macy’s om de hoek, empire state vlakbij en 5th avenue ook. Ideale uitvalsbasis.

title: Great Location - Basic Hotel
text:
Perfect location - walk out the door and down the street your at Macy's. Yummy pizza place on the same street as well - Cafe Rustico ii
Roof top bar has great views!
Price per night isn't bad considering location and the hotel is pretty clean.
We had a sofa bed in our room and when we opened it up to make the bed, the old bed linen was still crumbled up inside.

title: Good hotel
text: Good hotel , nothing really  to write about. Room clean small ,quite a lot of noise from the street we stayed on the 16 floor everything you need but somehow really average I was very excited about this hotel but not anymore.

title: Location, Front Desk and Concierge Service Outstanding
text: Having stayed here many times in years past, remains my go to hotel for business travel. Proximity to Penn Station 2 blocks away and extensive subway network access next to the front door wonderful. Roof top bar/club reaching new heights in popularity on weekends.

title: Nice Place
text: Enjoyed my visit. Nice size rooms. Very clean. Great rooftop bar and views of the city. Fitness center could be improved.  Starbucks on 4th floor.  Lots of dinner choices nearby.  Very friendly service.  Good for business travelers.

title: Training for large employee group
text:
Very misleading. did not apply my Marriott Rewards points, though they certainly took my Visa Card! Upon follow up, was told by multiple staff that they could not go back and apply or credit my points. found this hotel to be disingenuous. Will not be staying there for the next training in NY.    
A little customer service is not too much to ask.

title: Decent
text:
I stayed at this Courtyard a few times this last year. 
It's slightly old compared to many options close by. But, it's decent. My only qualm is that the rooms don't have a microwave oven.That was the only reason why I didn't stay more frequently. 
But, great New York views.

title: Great Service, Clean Hotel, Awesome location
text:
We stayed here as a family of 5 for one night.  We had a WONDERFUL stay.  We got there late, as in 1230am, the doorman greeted us with a smile and got the elevator for us and sent us right up to the lobby.  The lobby is spacious and clean with friendly staff.  We finally made it to our room after traveling all day from Europe.   The rooms were spacious and clean.  We asked for some extra towels and they were delivered within 6 minutes (we timed it for fun).  Had a wonderful sleep.  The next morning we woke up and went down to the lobby to ask what was the best way to get to Yankee Stadium--we were then directed to the bellhop (??) Michael who told us exactly what we needed to do and where we needed to go.  He got us really excited for the Yankee game. 

After returning from the Yankee game, Michael was still there and remembered us and asked us how the game was.  He gave superb service and was wonderful.  This hotel also has luggage storage and made it super easy for us to explore NYC without hauling our luggage every where when we had to check out.  The subway station is literally 10 steps out the front door of the hotel which made it SUPER convenient to get anywhere in the city.  We were on a higher floor and didn't hear any street noise below.  When we return to NYC, we will definitely be staying HERE.  HIGHLY recommend it.  The only complaint I have is no FREE breakfast---but welcome to NYC :).

title: it is ok
text:
Ok room probably small for 3 pax , great location!
loved the rooftop bar and the views, however I requested an envelope to be sent by mail which I left upon my departure with the bellboy and it was never received on destination, neither the hotel knew anything about it, It was a gift and they never accepted any responsability.

title: Good midtown location, no frills, thin scratchy bath towels, foam rubber pillows.
text: Average size, clean, room with King bed. View of 35th Street, Macy's and Herald Sq. Convenient walk to Penn Station and the 1 train; next to B.D.F.M trains. Good view of Empire State Building from busy bar at top of hotel. Helpful front desk. Really low bathroom lighting, very thin, scratchy bath towels, not the most comfortable pillows. Internet a bit slow. Noisy air system. Very difficult to warm the room up in cold, rainy weather, even with air turned up to 73-75 or shut off. Small work out room, no towels, very small cone shaped water cups.

title: Efficient, Friendly and comfotable
text: Checked into the Marriott @ Herald Sq,  Manhattan today.  After a long flight from Australia it was great to have a seamless check in with friendly staff to great you at the desk.  Great Location. Would recommend for all groups of people.  Close to all attractions and public transport. Will post more in the coming weeks.

title: This hotel made the trip perfect!
text: This hotel is where you need to stay! It is in in the perfect location with access to so much. Our room was on the 15th floor and we looked right outside our window to see The Empire State Building. Service was great, room was clean, and we could be anywhere within a quick walk. What really made this hotel the best was the bellhop/concierge Michael. He took care of us! Places to eat, tips on things to do, setting up the car. He was just amazing and I am thankful.

title: Kurz und bündig ideal für ein kurzen oder längeren Aufenthalt
text:
Wir waren 3 Tage in dieser Hotel.
Die Lage des Hotels im Herzen Manhattans, ausserdem  Macy`s ist schräg gegenüber, alles in der Nähe. Kurz und bündig ideal für ein kurzen oder längeren Aufenthalt.
Die Zimmer sind gross für Newyork, dazu noch sauber, ruhig und sehr gut ausgestattet, aber der Bodenbelag ist  leider Teppich.
Hotel-Roofbar ist  zwar schön aber teuer.
Das Personal war freundlich

title: Convenient location, good sized rooms
text:
I visited with family recently and we had a positive experience here. The location was excellent for exploring and a short was from Penn Station which was convenient. Our rooms were on the 15th floor overlooking 6th Avenue but street noise wasn’t an issue. The rooms were pretty spacious for NYC. 

I’d definitely stay there again on future trips.

title: Great stay
text: We recently stayed for one night. The hotel is in a great location. The rooms are fairly small but clean and updated. We were on a higher floor with a good city view. It can be a bit noisy but not enough to disrupt our sleep. Overall, we’d definitely consider it again.

title: Best location and nicest Marriott in the area
text: I have stayed at every Marriott in this area. This is the cleanest, friendliest, and best location, hands down. Centrally located, near mass transit and MACYS, you can't beat it. Easy to find, pretty quiet and near enough to Times Square. Pretty nice rooftop bar to boot!

title: Great central location with superb subway access
text: As everyone else said, the rooms are a bit on the small side, but adequate, and as is usual for mid-town, susceptible to street noise. The main draw is the location. From here, we could walk to virtually everything-- penn station (10 min walk), grand central station (12 min walk), subway entrance (10 seconds), Rockefeller Center (20 min walk for ice skating!) and oodles of shopping, restaurants and bars. The hotel lobby is on the second floor and has a small bistro and "marketplace" to purchase snacks & drinks, although I'd recommend visiting one of the many nearby stores for water & snacks for a better deal.

title: Great shopping location
text:
We stayed here for 10 nights and would definitely stay here again. 

The location was fantastic, the hotel is literally 15m from the subway entrance and the subway has access to quite a few lines. Also it’s a shoppers paradise (why we chose to stay here). There are all majors store within a couple blocks. Also only a 10 minute slow walk to Times Square and the Orr authority bus terminal. 

The room itself was good, it was a decent size for New York standards. The room was clean, newly renovated with comfy beds. We used the coin laundry which was convenient.

title: Méga bien situé et juste ce qu'il faut
text: Je rejoins de nombreux avis. L'hôtel est très bien situé, à 2 pas de l'Empire State Building, le métro au pied. Et Times Square à 5 minutes à pieds. Chambres propres mais un peu petites et petit-déjeuner décevant. Par contre, accueil excellent et personnel à l'écoute.

title: Fantastic location, super convenient
text:
If you want to enjoy the core touristic area of Manhattan, this is the spot. Small rooms, very pricy at times but you are in the centre of the world. 

You can walk anywhere from there and the subway stop is on the corner.

title: É mto bom
text: Possui Wi-Fi grátis e funcionando bem. Quarto mais ou menos de tamanho e banheiro pequeno. Limpeza foi boa. Tem uma cafeteria no andar do lobby, mas só funciona de manhã. A localização é perfeita, mas achei muito estranho a recepção ficar em outro andar... tanto que quando cheguei não tinha ninguém para ajudar com as malas... parece até um prédio comercial. Só uma mulher avisando que ficava em outro andar. Não a vi mais por lá. Durante a minha estada, o pessoal qua ficava na segurança era bem simpático. Já o pessoal da recepção não tive quase contato.

title: Excellent Hotel - make sure you greet the doorman, Jose!
text: Great location!  Clean hotel!  Rooms are small but adequate!  What made the hotel fabulous for us was the help of Jose Ortiz - the doorman / bellhop/ concierge! He helped us with every step of our planning, including Broadway tickets, subway tickets, car service, event planning, etc.  He made our trip run smoothly;  we would not have been able to see all that we did in New York with Jose.  We were so thankful for his help and friendly demeanor.

title: Weekend or short trip to NYC ?  This is your spot
text: We were in town for a long weekend.  The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms (for NYC) are a good size).  The entrance is a little different as the hotel is located in a high rise so you enter downstairs then go upstairs to the lobby but not a big deal.  What makes this hotel is the location.  You literally exit the front door and walk down to the subway, maybe 12 steps from the front door !!!!!!  Macys (from Miracle of 34th St) is across the street, Times Square is a short walk, and we had a view of The Empire State Building from our room (which is also only a short distance away). The hotel is perfectly located for a tourist in NYC

title: Great location, super helpful
text: Had two reservations for 3 nights. The front desk was very gracious and helpful getting it all straight. Bell hops and guards were wonderful. Very convenient location to get north or south. Rooms were clean. Small for a Courtyard but not that unusual for NYC. Rooftop bar not managed by hotel, huge disappointment. Terrible service, high prices.

title: Aardig hotel op een top locatie
text: Met de taxi zo’n drie kwartier vanaf JFK kom je Midtown Manhattan aan  bij het hotel. Vanuit het hotel kijk je op Herald Square waar het beroemde Macy’s warenhuis zich bevindt. Ontvangst beneden is prima. Je moet met de lift naar de lobby om in te checken, wijst zich allemaal vanzelf. Bij de lobby is een ruimte waar iMacs staan waarop je eventueel kan internetten e.d. Onze kamer voldeed. We hadden een kleine bij ons en kregen op verzoek keurig een babybedje. Bedden liggen prima en het slapen moet lukken als je tegen het lawaai van ‘the City that never sleeps’ kunt. Het hotel is een hele goede basis om de stad te verkennen. Op loopafstand het je Times Square, Fifth avenue en de Empire State Building staat op nog geen 300m afstand. Het hotel is vrij prijzig, maar dat kun je verwachten zo midden in de stad. Er zijn voldoende gelegenheden in de buurt waar kan worden ontbeten, want dat is in het hotel eigenlijk niet mogelijk. Als je wilt kun je je door de taxiservice van het hotel laten ophalen of wegbrengen. Hier zijn uiteraard kosten mee gemoeid, maar wordt perfect geregeld.

title: Nice spot
text: Hotel room was spacious, quite and overall in a great location. My visit was work related, but this really is a great place to stay if you want to visit the tour spots. Very close to Time Square, Macy's and Empire State building. Will definitely consider this hotel when returning to NY.

title: Excelente
text:
Primeiramente sua localização é perfeita. Perto de tudo. Perto de cafés, restaurantes, lojas, etc
O hotel é super limpo, quarto ótimo e espaçoso. A vista para o Empire States foi demais. Possui cafeteira no quarto e frigobar. Mas não possui microondas.
Possui wifi aberto
As areas comuns sao otimas, incluindo a academia super bem montada e conservada.
Recomendadissimo.

title: Great Location, Mediocre Hotel
text:
I’ll always begin with a positive. The location of this hotel could not be any more perfect. It’s walkable to basically anywhere in Manhattan. The bellman / concierge, José, is amazing. He’s very personable and can assist with anything. 

The negative: we had a problem with our room. One of the bed frames was definitely broken. When we addressed the issue, the front desk staff was basically apathetic to our concerns. Problems happen. How they’re handled is what separates one hotel from another. 

I am Marriott Rewards “Gold” status. That means I stay at least 50 nights per year. I will stay loyal to Marriott, just avoid this hotel in the future. There’s too much competition to settle.

title: Surely surprised me here
text:
The Courtyard Marriott Herald Square (aka name in this hotel listing) was not as bad as I thought it would be, initially. I got it as a last-minute thing, not a deal at the time I did it, but this location turned out to work in my favor. It’s not in Times Square, but it’s in Herald Square, where you have all the shopping you can stand, on 34th street, and a very good assortment of ethnic (especially lots of Korean food as it's near little Korea) and American restaurants in the immediate vicinity. So, I made sure to indulge in both. You are also located a stone’s throw away from the Empire State building, for viewing that landmark. So, while it’s not Times Square, 1 train ride north and you’re at Times Square, which is on the same corner as the hotel 10 feet away. You can likely save some money.
The facility is clean, the staff is friendly and attentive, and they have a little mini store, or the Market, as they call it. That is very key for me, because I hate when I get thirsty (late night) and don’t have anything to drink until the next morning (there are no bottled waters in the room). Alternatively, there are drug stores nearby, so you can buy a bunch of things when you’re out and about.
The rooms we had were small but not bad though. Smelled good, everything white was actually white and not eggshell colored, so that was a good sign, including the bathroom sink and tub. There isn’t much of a view there, but if you just need a quick room, in a jam, it’s a good place for that. It doesn’t have any USB charging stations, but there are available AC adapters everywhere, and unlike many hotels, you don’t need to unplug anything to have access to them. That’s a good thing. 
The included Internet speed is 33 mpbs, so that is far greater than you’re going to get from many hotels in the area, and trust me, I know this to be true. Take advantage of this if you have a day with bad weather- STREAM STREAM STREAM! It’s wide-open internet though, no password, so be safe out there.
Was really quiet there, I have to admit, and I know the place was booked to capacity because I just beat out a few people for the last few rooms. I didn’t hear anyone, nor anything, the whole time I was there, including street traffic. That was perfect, because I forgot my ear plugs. 
The bed, however, I didn’t care for. They are really soft and can be firm if you remain dead-center in the bed. If you happen to land on the side of the bed, you’ll sink in or launch off of the bed in comedic fashion. The springs are really responsive on the sides of the bed. If you like a firm bed, like I do, avoid the edges of the bed. I felt my side hurting a bit in the morning.
There is nothing really fancy about the place, quaint look, some dings on the furniture here or there, but nothing to impress or depress you. If you are depressed, hit the room for some drinks. It’s a 3-star hotel, but it holds its weight very well, in my opinion.

title: Good location
text: Great location in Herald Square right outside the subway entrance. Close to Penn Station. Staff is nice. Room was a little worn, with a broken chair in room 1308. Worst part was the very noisy and rude neighbors who were yelling in the halls and partying with the door open. This isn't the hotel's faulty, but I was very angry to have been awoken several times a night. For the price, I don't know that I would stay here again.

title: Look no further... excellent experience
text: Great location, subway stop right by entrance, excellent staff. Empire State photo taken from 18th Floor lounge. Room  photo taken from  1704. Refrigerator in room. Elevators slow at times. Overall great experience.

title: Great customer service
text:
I have stayed at this courtyard before and am a platinum Marriott member. Great location as you can quickly walk to many restaurants and stores and sightseeing. Great customer service. The front desk staff was very friendly and even allowed me to check out a day early with the news of an impending snow storm. Michael, the bellhop, went above and beyond. He arranged a car for me to JFK and checked my luggage while I went to grab a bite to eat. Once I arrived back, he made sure I used the restroom
 Before my long ride and had my suitcases waiting in the car for me. He even had the driver open up the trunk so that I can see they were all there. I remember Michael from previous visits. His customer service truly goes above and beyond any I have encountered in NYC!

title: Best location!
text:
Can’t beat the location!!  Right in the middle of it all, sightseeing, restaurants, shopping, etc.

Was in town for two nights for a girls weekend.  Comfy beds, clean room and friendly staff.

Will come back again!!!

title: New York to the Bahamas
text: Nice courtyard. Excellent location! Very close to major attractions. Very reasonable price during off season. Only a breakfast bar at the hotel, but is surrounded by eateries. Highly recommend for cost, location and service.

title: No frills offering in a great location
text: The main advantage of this hotel is its central location in Manhattan, close to the Empire State bldg and Macy's, Reasonably priced for New York, the rooms are adequate and clean with comfortable beds and the customary coffee pot, ironing board and safe provided. There is no restaurant and one can get snacks and beverages at the In-house coffee shop at the lounge. The fitness centre was alright with a few weights and a couple of treadmills, bikes and elliptical trainers. In summary an average hotel in a great location.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Ho trascorso solo una notte in questo hotel.
Ottima posizione molto vicino a Empire State Building ed a Times Square.
Hotel pulito, personale gentile ed efficiente.
Ho soggiornato in una bellissima camera all'ultimo piano con vista sulla 6a avenue e vista parziale dell'Empire State Building.
Prezzo alto, ma non eccessivo per NYC

title: Clean, Nice Staff, Great location
text:
My flight out of JFK got cancelled and I found myself needing a hotel room near Penn Station. Booked easily on Marriott's website and was so glad I chose this place. 

Hotel room was incredibly clean, smelled good, and at no point did I get the "hrmm do I really want to put my suitcase on the floor?" vibe. Had a King-sized bedroom, and while it was compact, it was more than enough for me. Wireless internet was consistent and fast enough to watch Netflix. Please remember that it's New York City. Translation: unless you're willing to pay a LOT more, you're going to have to accept the fact that hotel rooms are going to be a bit more compact than in other cities. That's just the way it is. Deal with it or pay up. 

Also: light sleepers, you've been warned! It's New York City in Herald Square - there's going to be lots of noise! Cars honking, people shouting, sirens blaring, etc. It didn't bother me at all, but I could see where it might disturb others, or if you have young children. Otherwise bed was extremely comfortable, ample blankets and pillows. Also was very happy that I was able to control the temperature in the room, as I was fighting off a cold. 

Staff was very friendly and attentive with me but also with every guest that I saw while I was there. Business center isn't exactly private, but it's actually quite comfortable and clean, and staff seems to take pride in keeping everything looking nice.

title: Empire State of mind!
text: Me and my mum had a fabulous stay at the courtyard for our birthdays. Fantastic location beside macy’s And a street away from the Empire State Building. Within walking distance to lots of other tourist attractions and access to a roof top bar with amazing views of the Empire State Building. The hotel staff are amazing especially the concierge Michael, very helpful with places to go eat and how to get around. Easy to check in and out and as we had a late evening flight home, they happily kept our luggage so we could do more site seeeing and arranged transfer to airport as we couldn’t be bothered to drag our luggage to the bus or subway. We took the subway to most places and with a stop right outside the hotel couldn’t have asked for better! The room was large and spacious for Manhattan, comfortable bed, tv with good channels if need of time to relax, hot shower with plenty of space and room cleaned daily with fresh towels. The only thing I would say and it’s not a negative would be when you enter the hotel you don’t come to the lobby it is located on another floor but you are met by the concierge and taken to the check in desk. Oh and it’s quite noisy, horns blaring at all hours of the night so take ear plugs but we were that tired after site seeing all day it didn’t bother us. I suppose that’s what you have to deal with for the location. Would highly recommend this hotel for everyone.

title: Loved our corner room
text: Our ample corner room on the 12th floor was perfect for three adults. King size bed and a sofa bed made for a comfortable stay for two ladies and my 18-year-old. And the view was great looking onto Herald Square and 6th Avenue. On the freezing New Year week of 2018, having 8 subway lines at our door was a necessary plus. Very clean, and good service. No street noise except for the ocasional faraway police siren. Undoubtedly, I would recommend this Courtyard both for location, and for comfort, too.

title: Decent but could use improvement
text: The Courtyard Herald Square is pleasant enough and a good price.  It is centrally located and right by a major subway stop to boot.  It’s clean and in good repair, and the staff are friendly and well-meaning.  There is (just barely) enough storage for a short trip.  The beds are comfy.  The Kleenex is of good quality.  However...small issues reveal a lack of attention to detail and detract from the overall experience.  There are no soap dishes.  The shower, although it appears newly renovated, smells musty.  The narrow glass shelf cannot safely hold much, and the sink also has no space to speak of.  Similarly, the bureau between the beds is only a few inches deep, and mostly taken up by a phone and a large clock, so there is no place to keep stuff beside the bed.  Both the bureau and the bathroom shelf could have easily been a few inches deeper, and that would have made all the difference.  There are no outlets on or near the bureau, so devices can only be charged on the floor or far from the beds.  A suggestion for the chain at large:  please make the shampoo and conditioner bottles different in some way - color or size.  Those of us who need glasses to see well cannot distinguish between them in the shower!

title: Close to the action
text: A nice hotel but the entrance is a bit obscure and unimpressive.  The rooms are quite small as is the bathroom.  It is a comfortable hotel but has not many amenities. It is a good base for explosing the city but no somewhere you would choose to spend time in other than to sleep.  The rooms are quiet and the beds are comfortable too.

title: Great Location - Great Service
text: Location is great for shopping, food and transportation.  Room was very clean, bed was super comfortable.  It was really nice to have a mini fridge in the room.  The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. Great view of Macy's.

title: Excellent location, friendly staff
text:
My family of 4 stayed here for 5 nights in January. This hotel is all about location. It is perfect. It is just minutes away from everything; Macy’s, Times Square, Penn station, Madison Square Garden, Flatiron ... you name it. Room was good for 4 people, containing 2 double beds with really good mattresses, desk, tv, and coffee. The cleaning was unfortunately not good. Not that the room was dirty, but it was for sure not clean either. 

Hotel staff was really friendly and helpful, but failed to refill coffee in the room (every day). In the lobby, they have a mini Starbucks with coffee and light meals good for breakfast. Too bad it close at noon, so no coffee or refreshments in the afternoon. You could use their mini-market, but you’ll probably pop outside instead.

We had a good stay, despite the cleaning and coffee issues. Good sleep!

title: Fine for a couple of days’ trip, and basic
text:
As you would expect, is a middle-range price hotel, very well located.

The pluses: excellent WiFi, location, the gym (small and well equipped).
The normal: small rooms (mine was one of the biggest), small bathroom with very basic amenities, clean, small closet with just a couple of drawers (for me an important feature but not for many other people).
The negative: since I wake up very early, I expect to have breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast place is a low version of Starbucks. All plastic, poor selection, few healthy choices.

title: Ótima localizacao
text: Ótima escolha de hotel. Localização excepcional, em frente à Macy’s. Com varias lojas próximas, varias opções para lanche e café da manhã próximas. Quarto de tamanho razoável, não são grandes, banheiro bem pequeno, atendimento ótimo, Wi-Fi funciona bem. Ficaria novamente com certeza! A localização é maravilhosa! Tem metro bem em frente.

title: Location, Location, Location
text:
The Courtyard NY Mahattan at Herald Square proved to be an excellent choice as it is just about 50 feet from the subway, a short walk (2-3 blocks) from Penn Station, and has lots of restaurants in the area. The Empire State Bldg is just down the street. The hotel has a great deck/bar on the top, the Monarch Room, with excellent views of the Empire State Bldg. It is quite popular, particularly on a Friday night. Those who stay in the hotel have priority over those waiting in line to take the one elevator to the top.
There is a coffee machine in the room but they only left one packet of coffee so we had to call down for additional. However, the manager didn't know where the packets were kept so he brought us a cup of coffee from the Starbucks in the hotel.
The room was on the small side but we didn't spend much time there anyway. Would stay there again due to the convenience of getting around. It is directly across the street from the large Macy's department store. Lots of barricades around Herald Square that has sitting areas for enjoyment.

title: Handy Location
text:
Great location, excellent staff and clean rooms.
Had very serviceable facilities also such as gym, laundry on site and cafe on the lobby (keep in mind cafe closes at 11 each day)
Plenty of restaurants, cafes, pubs all within walking distance and subway out the front for easy access to the whole of NYC.
Ample shopping within 200 meters in any direction.
Walking distance to Maddison Square Gardens a huge bonus.

title: Not bad
text: Stayed here on business, it is a good location in midtown, the shades block out the lights, but the windows are not very good on noise reduction. I was on the 5th floor and the trucks and sirens were fairly loud compared to other hotels in the city I have stayed at.  You do have a view of the Empire State Building and Macy’s on 34th Street.

title: Great location near Macy's Herald Square!
text:
The location of this hotel is the exact reason to book it! We were in NYC for a quick, 2 night visit, to take in the Christmas sites and attend the NY Giants game at Metlife stadium. We took an Amtrak into Penn station and were able to walk right to the hotel. We were light on luggage, so it was easy to zip through the crowds and we were in the hotel lobby within minutes.

It was also a short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Saks Fifth Avenue. Macy's and Duane Reade available across the street to grab anything you need while you are traveling!

The hotel itself was a standard Courtyard - no free breakfast, but there was coffee available in the room. The room was small, but we are in downtown NYC, so it was perfectly fine for 2 people for 2 nights. Someone there for a longer visit might have some trouble unpacking and finding a spot for all of their things! Overall, the room was clean, comfortable and felt safe! Street noise was a bit of a factor, but you are in Manhattan, of course there is noise!

We would definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent stay
text: First time at this Courtyard property and had an excellent stay. Super thankful for early check-in opportunity (pro-tip: book directly via Marriott and access early mobile check-in via Marriott app). Room was comfortable, front desk accommodated request to change to room with two doubles (from single bed room), and overall quiet in room. Would stay again!

title: Quite nice
text: This was our first stay at the hotel. The hotel welcomed our very early arrival after a long haul flight. The rooms are small but clean and the streets may sometimes get a little noisy at night. The staff was friendly and helped us with all our queries. The hotel didn't offer much to eat during breakfast and didn't have a proper restaurant. The hotel is located very close to a subway train station and makes it very convenient to travel around.

title: Recomendo
text: Tudo muito bom: atendimento, localização, acústica, banheiro. Quarto limpo. Máquinas de gelo nos andares ímpares. Possui uma mini loja de conveniência no lobby. Permitiram early check-in sem custo para 2 de 3 quartos reservados.

title: Vacaciones navidad
text: Sobre todo, no en la planta 17, ta que hay una discoteca en la planta 18 y es bastante incomodo por el ruido que hace. El hotel es justo en los servicios que ofrece, el desayuno dice que em pieza a las 06:00, pero a esa hora nos dijeron que esperaramos quince minutos, cuando en realidad teniamos prisa, por lo que no pudimos desayunar nada

title: Location and service... at Herald Square
text:
This was our second stay at the Courtyard at Herald Square.  It was just right for both occasions.  The location is very good (35th and 6th)... easy access from Penn Station for those taking the train.  We had a corner room that overlooked the iconic Macy's store on one side and had a great view of the Empire State Building on the other.  The room was small but comfortable... typical for NYC.  Service was friendly and attentive,,, especially Michael, our doorman, bellman and concierge (his description).  A couple of tips... street noise is an issue.  We were on the 14th floor and the reality is that if you are at 35th and 6th, there is a lot going on down below ... there will be noise.  Getting around on foot is easy, but if you want to get a cab or uber, leave yourself enough time... especially around the holidays.  Bonus tip... because the address is on 35th, your ride will usually approach the area via 35th... which is always slow/backed-up.  If you catch your ride on the corner of 35th and 6th (about 100  feet from the hotel entrance), your ride can come up 6th, which tends to move more quickly than 35th.  

Overall... price + location + service = good value

title: rumoroso
text: splendido hotel, con maestose stanze,  in posizione magnifica con un unico accorgimento, ossia riuscire a ottenere stanze in piani alti in quanto nei piani bassi il sonno diviene una vera chimera. , stante il traffico costante di tutta la notte

title: Bring earplugs
text:
9 floors up you can appreciate what it’s like to live on the streets of New York. You even get to pay for the pleasure. Sirens, trash collection, the works. You don’t need to sleep, right?

Aside from no sound insulation or (ear plugs) the rooms are decently sized, the location central and the Wi-Fi pretty fast. 

Just really, really noisy. I stay in New York once or twice monthly, all in Marriott properties. This is by far and away the noisiest. Truly disappointing.

title: Nice stay
text: Only stayed one night but I can't complain. The room was typically small but not claustrophobic with a huge tv (and lots of channels) and a couch. Comfortable bed and was high up enough that I wasn't bothered by street noise. Hidden away in a little cabinet was a nice sized mini fridge and a microwave. Nice touch. Used the gym and it was sufficient. Bring your own headsets if you want to listen to the tvs as there aren't any free ones.

title: It could have been designed better
text:
In many ways, we can't complain.  After all, we used Marriott Rewards points for this stay, so  the price was right :)  That said, we're glad that we didn't pay for our room as there were some things we disliked.

First, I will talk about what we did like about the place.  The staff here is great!   Everyone we dealt with was very friendly and helpful.  Housekeeping did a great job keeping our room clean.  Everyone we talked to on the housekeeping staff, was very nice to us.

The location is great if you are using Amtrak to get to NYC.  It's a really easy walk to and from Penn Station.

Literally, right outside the door is an entrance to the 34th Street Herald Square subway station where you can pick up the B, D, F, and M trains.

It's a very doable walk to Times Square and Broadway theaters.

There is a rooftop bar that has both indoor and outdoor seating.  I wish that we had the time and better weather, we would have checked it out.

Now, here are the things we didn't like --- Professional photos the hotel posted online had us thinking that the rooms are very spacious for NYC.  Well...yes, they are more spacious than the average NYC hotel room but...the layout is very inefficient.  For example, the bathroom was really small.  If you have claustrophobia, you definitely won't like it.  The bathroom sink was tiny and the faucet was awkwardly placed.    Every time we used the sink, water ended up all over the tiny counter.  There was hardly any room for towels.  They were placed in a very small shelf under the sink which they had to share with the hairdryer, a roll of extra TP and the box of tissues.  Thankfully, there is a ledge above the sink which has room to place your toiletries.  

There is a desk in the room but it has no light on it which made it difficult to use properly.  The desk chair is covered in red cloth which shows stains made by previous guests.  There is a fridge which is a standard size hotel room one.  One beef I have with Marriott---they no longer put a freezer compartment in the fridges.  We travel with meds that need refrigeration so we need the freezer to keep our freezer pack cold.

The closet was literally the smallest closet I've ever seen in a hotel.  A full-sized ironing board and an iron take up a good chunk of space.  Also, there is a small 2 drawer dresser which has a bag with an extra blanket on top.  There is no way that your suitcases can fit in there.  If you do any shopping while staying here, keep in mind that you may not have enough space to store your items.  We travel light and we could barely fit anything in that closet.

There are no luggage racks, which seems to be an issue in other NYC hotels.  Fortunately, there is a small coffee table plus a small cushioned bench, both that we used as luggage racks.  A couch is in the room which we believe was a sleeper couch.  It's not the most comfortable place to sit.

Our room had a king-sized bed.  The mattress was on the soft side.  We would have preferred it to be a bit firmer but it wasn't bad.  The nightstands were tiny.  They had 2 drawers.  One draw held the Gideon Bible and the Book of Mormon and they barely fit in there.

To summarize, so much wasted square footage was in this room.  The room could have been designed better.

Our room faced 6th Avenue and we were on the 9th floor.  If you are a light sleeper, be sure to use earplugs!

title: Vacaciones Navideñas
text: Excelente ubicación, cerca de todo y sobre todo del Macy’s, Time Square, 5a Avenida. La atención muy buena, la habitación muy cómoda. Quizás el personal debería hablar un poco más español, pero todo perfecto. Les recomiendo de todas maneras

title: Great Room and Location
text: We stayed here for 1 night to view the NYC Holiday lights and attend a Broadway show. We got in a little after noon and our room wasn't ready (this was expected and fine) and were able to easily store our luggage. Since I used mobile check-in I received a notification about 2:20 that our room was now ready. The room was large for NYC and was a corner room so we had views of both Macy's and up 6th Avenue. The bed was comfortable and the small love seat size sofa was actually a small sofa bed, so this worked out great. The bathroom is a little small but adequate. The shower had good pressure and got hot quickly. There is a small heater in the bathroom which was good to take the chill out. There is a safe and refrigerator in the room. The fan/blower for the HVAC was very loud when running. The elevators were slow to come, but fast moving once you were able to get one. The lobby is on the second floor, but you don't have to switch elevators to go from the ground to your room like in some NYC hotels.  I would stay here again and would recommend.

title: Great location. But wrong billing
text:
Despite of no making any consumptions in this hotel . The hotel is charging us the 500us deposit. 
Clean. Great location. Kind staff specially bell boy. And the best view of Empire state from rooftop bar. 
Otherwise great stay. We hope they can fix and reimburse asap.

title: ミッドタウン観光に便利
text:
エンパイアステートビルやメイシーズに近く、ニューヨークを間近に感じます。
チェックインは午後4時からで、早く到着しても部屋には入れず、ベルボーイに荷物を預けて出かけるか、ロビーで待つしかありません。ロビーは広く、インターネットやカフェもあるので、ゆっくりできます。
14階の部屋でしたが、ルーフトップのラウンジからの重低音が少し聞こえる感じでした。
朝食はロビーのスタバで有料です。外に出なくて良いので便利。
総じて、観光やビジネスに便利なホテルです。

title: Heroic service, excellent location
text: My husband and I were flying home from NYC when he realized he had left his wedding ring in the hotel room. The wonderful staff found the ring and Fedexed it to us within 24 hours. We only stayed one night, but the staff was also great at check-in and with boarding pass printing. Good security on the ground floor, too. The central location saved us a lot of time and stress: walking distance to most of my meetings, with multiple subway lines available literally outside the front door of the hotel. For two people, go for the executive king (it's not a huge room, but you'll get a some additional space with sofa, which makes it more comfortable for two). Bathroom is compact but well designed, with shelf for toiletries. Bring earplugs or run the fan if room faces Sixth Ave (street noise is the trade-off for any centrally located hotel in NYC). I stay at Marriotts in New York often but had not stayed at this one before. It delivers on the standard Courtyard expectations: clean, comfortable, nice hot shower, good treadmills. But the location is a big plus, and the beautiful, peaceful lobby that is high above street level makes for a good landing spot at the end of the day. And Herald Square Courtyard is very well managed! Thanks again for going above and beyond to help us out.

title: Great location for Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade
text: Originally was going to stay, with the family through Wednesday before Thanksgiving but decided to extend the stay through Friday for the parade.  Moved to this hotel from the Renaissance (because they were booked) and it worked out great.  This hotel is right across the street from Macy's and is near the end of the parade route.  Had we chosen too, we could have watched the parade from our room, but we went down to the street and had a great time.  I recommend getting out to the road around 6 a.m. for the parade.  It gets crowded quickly.  The hotel was was great and the staff was excellent especially the bellman, Jose, who was a big help.  One thing to keep in mind, if you have a car, I recommend the valet parking even though it is $65 per day.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Macy’s Day Parade!
text: Great hotel! One of the cleanest places I have ever stayed. The parade was awesome to view right from the hotel. You can see it from every floor coming down the street. A couple notes if your planing on staying during the parade. The streets get blocked off so navigating back to the hotel can be a little tricky, also the night before the parade all the bands practice right outside the hotel so don’t plan on sleeping much. We are a younger couple so it didn’t bother us but if you were traveling with children you might want to reconsider. Altogether we had an amazing experience THANK YOU!

title: The Perfect Location
text:
We travelled from Londom Heathrow to JFK. The journey to the hotel may show as 30 mins but trust me it's nearer an hour unless you are travelling between 12-6am. It's like rush hour all day and night in Newyork. There is a fixed rate into the centre of Manhattan which with tips and taxes should set you back around 70 dollars. The hotel is located right opposite Macys which is a shoppers heaven. The subway is also right outside. As you enter the hotel, take the lift up to the Lobby for check in. Check in was smooth and despite being early our room was ready (705). Our room was on the 7th floor, would have liked to have been higher as there was quite a lot of noise outside. I was delighted with the size, very spacious and clean and the bed was huge. Sadly it was too soft for us so we had to turn the mattress upside down. We had a great big flat screen tv which opens out as well as coffee making facilities. I would just highlight being from the UK we love our tea, so I would have preferred a kettle. If I am honest the storage space was a little limited, fine for 2/3 days but we stayed 5 nights and so was a little tricky. The drawers by the bed were very small and there were only 2 drawers in the cupboard. I also had to ask for more hangers as there were only a few provided. The difficulty being on the 7th was that the room was a little dark, this only mattered when getting ready in the morning. 2 lights by the bed and one by the door meant the centre of the room was still dark. This is a minor detail though and by no means was a big issue. The shower was great, very spacious and clean and plenty space to put your toiletries. I loved the little heater for your feet too, that was a nice touch. The room also had aircon which was perfect as it was too noisy at night to open the windows. On a couple of mornings we went down to the Lobby to order tea and a muffin, this would set you back around 10 dollars. Please note that coffee in Newyork is considerably more expensive.

The location of the hotel was absolutely perfect, right opposite Macys which is a shoppers paradise! Subway is right outside and Shake Shake is a 2 minute walk away and do great burgers and hot dogs. 2 burgers fries and drinks will cost around 31 dollars. You will be spoilt for choice for places to eat but note that food is not cheap in restaraunts. We found a couple of Gems which worked well for our budget- 5 Borough Burger is a 2 minute walk (80 W 36th street ). 2 main meals and 2 soft drinks will set you back around 40 dollars including tip. If you want a good breakfast in a traditional American diner then Andrew Coffee Shop is the place to go on the corner of 7th and 35th. Waffles, pancakes, eggs benedict, the lot and at a reasonable price. Remember to tip, the service is second to none out here and average tip is around 20%.  

We walked everywhere, one day we managed 18k! It's very easy to get around on foot so bring some good walking shoes. Before we flew out we booked a multi use attraction  pass through City View. We selected the 911 memorial, rockafella, empire state and The Ride tour bus and am so glad we did. It meant we saved around 40 dollars in admission fees. The tickets will be emailed to you and you can either print them out or use your phone. The Rockafella was very impressive, the tour lasted around 90 mins, the tour guide Aaron was fun and informative. It was nice that we were given headsets so could hear him through the crowds inside and out. I have to insist you try The Ride bus tour, this is not like a normal bus tour which can become dull. I absolutely loved this interactive ride through midtown. One side of the bus is glass and so you face out to the streets waving at shocked passers by. There are also actors amongst the crowd to entertain you when sitting at traffic lights or in traffic. I didn't stop laughing the whole way through. Make sure you collect your tickets first from the bus ticket office using your phone so they can scan your code and print them off (I know, I thought the email would act as a ticket too and it did for the empire state only).
