Empire state was again really good, we visited at dusk which was the perfect time as all the lights were coming on. Really quick to get up to the top and absolutely stunning 360 views. It's windy so take a hat and scalf if you want to avoid hypothermia! There are toilets there too which you will need after 10 mins outside. 

The 911 memorial was interesting and ofcourse sombre. Again you have to print your tickets off at the desk there and then queue up in their security line which meant 1 hour waiting in line, fine if you have warm clothes. You could easily spend a few hours here so plan it for either the whole morning or afternoon. We decided to get the subway to here which cost 3 dollars for one journey (W route)

I have to insist you go to the BB King Blues Bar and Grill. It was one of the best nights I have had! An evening of Motown along with a sit down meal and drinks. People were up dancing and singing along, absolutely fantastic evening. We arrived for the 8pm show, just to note that they say doors open at 6 but we were queuing until 7.50pm so no point in getting there before 7.15pm. I booked via their website where you can see the calendar of events and pick what you fancy. The show went on until about half 9 and we were right by the stage which was perfect. Try the Mud Pie from the dessert list, this was really delicious!

As mentioned Macys is right opposite the hotel, Lord and Taylor dept store is also close by on 5th, we also visited Bloomingdale and Century 21 up by Central Park which has great discounts on designer brands. It reminded me alot of a TK Max store. 

I would also recommend a walk to Greenwich, it's beautiful and a totally different feel to midtown. It had a camden feel about it. This is where we picked up the High Line (an old train line converted into a long walkway) and walked along to Chelsea. The views of the city are wonderful, again being high up it was bloomin cold but totally worth it. 

If you are leaving during the day to return home give yourself plenty of time to get to the airport, our flight was at half 6 in the evening and we got a taxi at 2.45pm which worked out just right. 

I would definitely stay here again, perhaps on a slightly higher floor so its a little brighter and quieter. Overall a wonderful time and 5 nights was just about perfect to get everything in that we planned. Make sure you have a good amount of spending money, the only cheap thing here was the subway!

title: Anniversary
text: My wife and I stayed at the courtyard Marriott herald square for our first anniversary. Staff are nice, especially the bellman names Jose. Cons: very limited choices for breakfast and waited too long to get our foods ready.

title: Beware of Airport Transportation Service
text:
I found the hotel itself to be fine, room was clean, nice bathroom, good location. I am giving it a "poor" rating because of the following. The day before my check out I spoke to Michael, the guest service rep, about transportation to the airport. He told me that the Marriott has a car service for a FLAT FEE of $65  The day I was to leave I spoke to him again to ask if the driver would take a credit card for payment. He stated "of course, this is a Marriott service, and was again assured me of the $65 FLAT FEE and that would include toll fees if any.
My driver picked my up at the appointed time and upon arriving at the airport I first gave the driver a $15 tip in cash and then gave him my credit card for the $65 FlAT FEE. He then stated that the fee was $70. I told me that I was assured that the fee was $65 not $70. He told me he wanted the $70 and I told him I would not pay anything other the the $65, (again this was after I had given him the $15 cash tip). After several minutes of arguing he accepted the $65. Since Michael ASSURED ME that I would only pay a $65 FLAT FEE and since he also stated that the car service was a Marriott service then as far as I am concerned it was Marriott that was trying to rip me off for an extra $5. And by the way the drive to the airport did not entail any toll road so there could not be any confusion about any additional cost for a toll, which of course would not have been additional anyway according to "Michael"

title: Disappointing experience
text: Hotel is centrally located near a busy street. Room amenities are minimal. Not even a tea bag. Did not see any employee smile or great us except for the bellman in the street. Was not awarded even a bottle of water as a gold member. This is not the practice by other Marriot system hotels. Shower head is too high to reach and adjust.  There was only a single person on the front desk at any time (except on check out in the morning) which caused long waiting time. Had to wait 10 minutes to retrieve our luggage from storage. Requested a quiet room and was given one facing the street which was very noisy. A very disappointing experience.

title: Great hotel, great location, great staff, highly recommend
text: We spent 4 nights here recently and had a fantastic corner room. Looking up six avenue from one window the across to Maceys from another. There is a subway entrance right beside the hotel entrance, it is a short walk from Penn station, about a 10 min walk to Times Square, and a 5 minute walk to Bryant Park. We went up to the roof top one one evening and had an amazing view of the city but the highlight was the Empire State Building all light up at night. Staff were really friendly and helpful and we were able to store our bags on our last day as our flight was in the evening, giving us an extra day in NY. You couldn't be any more central, and the views from our room, especially at night will live stay with us for a long time. No restaurant but an excellent cafe for a fresh breakfast each morning. So glad we choose this hotel, wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

title: Manhattan Man Michael
text:
Upon entering the hotel, we were greeted by Michael who treated us as if we were the only guests in that lobby. He took our bags to luggage storage and took down our number in case our room was ready prior to the check in time. Given that we had an early flight coming into Manhattan, we expected a lengthy wait knowing the hotel’s check in time is 4pm. I was pleasantly surprised to get a check in just after 1pm, with no charge whatsoever. 

The room itself was very cozy, warm, and tidy. The location is mint – everything is literally steps away. In addition to the famous spots such as Times Square, Central Park and MSG, there are liquor stores, coffee shops, fast food joints, convenience stores, etc. on every block. It was amazing to explore the city to its fullest and returning to a comfortable room and lounge in a soft bed to some US cable TV. 

I’ve travelled all over the world and I can honestly say that Michael’s hospitality was excellent and has provided one of my best experiences while travelling. He genuinely cares about each and every customer that walks through that door and treats them like royalty. He greets you throughout the day as if you have been friends for quite some time. He ensures your stay is at its finest from the second you walk through that door to  the moment your taxi driver pulls up downstairs upon checkout. 
It has been an absolute pleasure staying at the Marriott and Michael deserves tremendous recognition and appreciation for all of his hard work and dedication. I will definitely stay here again upon my next visit to Manhattan!

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text: I was in NYC for a convention and decided to try this hotel.  The price was reasonable by New York standards.  As soon as I approached the hotel the doorman Michael greeted me warmly.  Michael and/or a security guard were always at the entrance every time I entered/exited which made me feel very secure.  The front desk staff and bellman were all very nice.  I was upgraded to a room with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building and Herald Square which was great.  The room was a good size, well maintained, and appeared to have been renovated recently.  There was street noise, but it is NYC.  I didn't have any trouble sleeping, however.  The location is great for sightseeing, business, etc. and is walking distance to Penn Station.  I will definitely consider this hotel again the next time I am in NYC.

title: Dinner and drinks
text: Amazing views of the Empire State at night! The rooftop bar was great, relaxed atmosphere, great food and drinks. The staff were friendly, very accommodating. Would highly recommend for a chill out after shopping!

title: Attended the inaugural CEO Action For Diversity & Inclusion closed door session on Friday, Nov 10th
text: Attended the inaugural CEO Action For Diversity & Inclusion closed door session on Friday, November 10th at Gotham Hall in New York City. Hotel located one block from event - great hotel, outstanding front desk staff and excellent room - close to everything downtown

title: Great Stay at the Courtyard - Clean and Great Location!
text:
I took my daughter to NYC to visit some museums we hadn't been to yet.  We wanted to a choose a location that was away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, but yet was in a good location with access to the subway system.  I always stay at Marriott properties and found this hotel to fit the bill.

We flew into Newark and took a train from Newark to Penn Station.  The Courtyard was a quick Uber/Taxi ride from Penn Station (3-4 blocks) and about a 10 minute walk.  So, it was very accessible by train.  One of the great things about this location is that the subway entrance is literally about 20 ft. from the hotel entrance.  It was so easy to jump on the subway and get around and then come back to be dropped off right at the entrance to your hotel.  It was great!

Regarding the hotel accommodations...It is very clean and the rooms are nice, but very small.  However, this is what we expected and weren't surprised one way or another in that regard.  There is a cool bar on top of the hotel that has a great view of the city and a great picture opportunity looking up at the Empire State Building.

One of the primary reasons for reviewing this property is that I really want to say that our stay was fantastic due to the help of Jose, the Concierge at the Courtyard.  When we got there, Jose greeted us and took us up to the lobby.  He immediately helped us check our bags (got there too early for check in) and then started giving us recommendations on places to go and, more importantly, places to eat.  He gave us some coupons for food and a metro card for the subway.  We were meeting some friends that were also in NYC and he suggested an Italian Restaurant around Times Square.  He asked how many people would be going and asked for my cell number.  He said that he would make the reservation for us and would call to give me the details.  I was like, "Yeah, right." and assumed I would still need to end up making them myself as he wasn't going to do that.  About an hour later, I received a text from Jose with the details for the reservation he made for us!  

Throughout our stay, Jose was there to greet us just about every time we went in and out and gave the hotel a very welcoming sense.  It kind of felt like a home away from home while we were there and we always looked forward to a warm welcome back.  

I will strongly consider returning back to this hotel due to the location and because of Jose.  Courtyard management team...please realize what value Jose brings and make sure you take care of him.  He is likely one of the most valuable assets you have at your hotel and you will want to retain him!  Keep up the great work, Jose!

title: Location, location, and location
text: My company was charged a fortune for what was a very typical chain hotel room.  Big selling point is that it's literally steps from the subway and close to Penn Station.  So once you schlepp your luggage over here no need for cabs.   Took the new Q train to the Upper East side and got there fast.  Shout out to the security guard who stored my suitcase since Jose never seemed to be at the bell desk.

title: Go elsewhere
text:
I probably stay in hotels 100 nights a year… I pretty much pick any hotel I would like… I picked Marriott Herald Square because it was very convenient to everywhere where I need to go on this particular business trip…

That being said, they put me in the smallest room I have ever been in in New York City and could not have been less accommodating.  I hate to call out an employee, because most of the employees including the security guards were super friendly and smiley but on this particular day Mike at the reception desk was just not in a good mood… and I was the recipient of his grumpiness when I inquired about receiving a free coffee for being gold elite status with Marriott… I’m not going to going to the interaction, however I would just recommend going to a different hotel…

title: Exceptional staff makes for a great stay
text: I have never stayed in a hotel where the staff have been so attentive, welcoming and helpful. I would especially like to mention Jose who went above and beyond what was expected. He arranged our broadway tickets on his own lunch break which was fantastic and always had a pleasant and approachable demeanour. I'd also like to mention Michael who always gave us great suggestions for dinner and was very helpful in many ways. Mani looked after our room so well, kept it spotlessly clean and always dealt with any requests promptly and without any hassle. The hotel is basic but adequate and very clean with a fantastic location near Macy's, Broadway and Times Square. My only negative was the size of the bed in the family room, they really were very small doubles. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay such a great experience - I hope that the Marriott hotel group appreciate their amazing workers!

title: Good hotel in a great location!
text: My family of 4 adults stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I am a Marriott Gold Elite Member and was very surprised at check-in that we were not offered any breakfast amenities or a complementary room upgrade. I was told that Elite members are only entitled to a late checkout and a few bottles of water at check-in (we were denied more water during the stay). In addition, the front desk staff was not very friendly or understandable. We were given a double room on the 4th floor. The room itself was fine, not large, but a seemingly good size for NYC. The room also has a small balcony, though the fencing was solid and there was absolutely no view. The bathroom is OK, however the sink is so small and it's difficult to wash one's face without getting water all over the floor. We had 2 specific issues with our room during the stay (the toilet was running when we arrived and the shower was very slow draining). We notified housekeeping of both of these incidents as they were in the hallway at the time, and they took care of these issues as well as providing additional towels and coffee at our request. Other than the housekeeping, the best thing about this hotel is definitely the location - right in the heart of Herald Square, across from Macy's and near to a lot of shopping. It's also near the new Target and there's a Whole Foods a few blocks north across from Bryant Park. The subway is next to the hotel. All-in-all a good experience, though I really did not feel like being Gold Elite at this hotel is worth anything at all.

title: Great location to explore New York
text: Very centrally located in Midtown next to Macy's and  the Empire State Building. The subway is also next to hotel.  The rooms are not that spacious but modern and clean with a very nice shower room. The beds were comfortable.  We were on a high floor but still heard the rumble of New York, as it is right in the middle of town.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was very much packaged in the lobby of the hotel, but the coffee and croissants were nice which we took to our room. Functional hotel, fairly priced.

title: Location, location, location
text: This is a great choice for a mid-priced Midtown Manhattan hotel. As mentioned in many other reviews, the location is ideal for accessing all Manhattan attractions. We had a spacious (by Manhattan standards) corner room with plenty of windows and lots of light. The room was good: comfortable bed, high quality linens, strong wifi, small sitting area and a mini-fridge and small safe. Very friendly and competent staff, too. With Starbucks coffee available in the lobby and a fun rooftop bar with amazing views of the Empire State Building, what else do you need? No negatives at all.

title: Great Convenient Location for sight seeing
text: The best thing about this Hotel is it's location. Walking distance to Empire State, 5th & 6th Avenues, Times Square, Broadway & Subway Stations. Even Central park is not very far away. Staff very friendly & helpful. Complementary Breakfast if included is a set menu, but adequate and tasty. Good View from the hotel room. Room Spacious for a NYC  hotel room but the toilet is a bit small. Free WiFi is good. Coin washing machine & drier available. Detergent supplied free. Easy access to a lot of good dining places.

title: Muito bom, ótima localização!
text: Hotel novo, com ótima localização, times square, restaurantes, mercados e lojas tudo muito perto, metro na porta. O quarto era limpo, tamanho era pequeno, mas nada que atrapalhe. Atendimento muito bom, a recepção fica no segundo andar, então fica tudo mais seguro e calmo! Recomendo com toda certeza!

title: Courtyard Marriott Herald Square
text: The best thing about this property is its location. Its a 5 min walk to 2 nearby subway stations and across from Macy's. Many choices for restaurants and shopping nearby. About 25 min walk to Times Square or Rockefeller Center.   However, the rooms are old and badly need updating and bathroom is very small.  No breakfast included for Marriott Gold Members. The restaurant is mainly pre-made sandwiches, muffins, etc.   Service at reception desk was efficient but not very friendly.  However, housekeeping and bellboy staff were very friendly and helpful.  Would probably look for other options on my next visit to NYC.

title: Great location, excellent people, good size property
text: We had a great stay at the Courtyard New York Manhattan/Herald Square. The location is very walkable to Times Square, Broadway theaters, the Empire State Building, several restaurants, and THE Macy's. The lobby has a large number of tables and chairs and was a great gathering place for our group of 12 - and the perfect place to eat pizza from the little shop around the corner or drink Starbucks in the morning. The staff was very helpful from my first to my last interaction with them. I called before making the reservation because I had a question about the types of bedding in various rooms and was given info that helped me make the best choice for three adults. When we needed additional towels, bedding, etc, it was brought to the room quickly and with a smile. We have to give a special shout-out to Mike (the bellman/concierge/rockstar). From restaurant and tour recommendations to making sure we had a car reserved for the drive to the airport on our last day (and his day off), he made our stay there expecially nice.

title: Good NYC Hotel
text:
Stayed here for a week recently while commuting to my company. The hotel is in a great location. The people who work here are all friendly and helpful. I had a corner room with a great view of Herald Square and Macy's. 
The room itself was clean and quiet. Which is how I like it. It was the perfect size for a NYC hotel. Not small and not too big, or can a NYC hotel room be too big?
There is a rooftop restaurant/bar, but they don't operate it. It always seemed to be packed either private party or just packed with people.
I am looking forward to staying here again.

title: Great location
text: Stayed for three nights with husband and two children in a double bed room. View heading up 6th ave from 13th floor was incredible.  Concierge team had lots of good food destinations including a cheap family-friendly diner at 35th/7th.

title: Decent mid-range hotel in a good location
text:
Central location on Manhattan, close to Times Square and walking distance to all mid-town attractions, this is a decent choice for sightseeing without blowing up your budget.
The hotel is relatively simple but the rooms are spacious, clean, and air conditioned.
Check-in process was very smooth and fast, the staff was very nice and efficient.
I was staying on 17th floor, the view is not particularly nice but I like to stay in high floors to get some daylight. As it is midtown, do expect some street noise, it might be disturbing if you are light sleeper.

Pro:
Location
Complimentary wifi in the hotel
Laundry facilities ($3 for washing machine, $3 for the dryer)

Cons:
Can be noisy even on high floor, the soundproof of rooms could be improved
Limited equipment in fitness center

title: Great Location
text: My family and I had a very pleasant stay at this Marriott. The rooms were comfortable and the service was responsive. The location is fantastic! It is central and literally only steps away from the subway.

title: what a pleasant surprise
text: I checked in late after a long drive and opted to save time and park my own car rather than using a valet.  That saved me money right there and the parking is only a block down 35th.  The best part was that I forgot a few toiletries and they had everything for me at the front desk around 11 PM prior to offering me a late checkout the following day.  The room was clean and quiet and the coffee good.  It wasn't cheap but it was definitely worth it.  I didn't have time for the gym this time but it looked very nice and up to date. I would definitely go back.

title: Great location to explore NYC
text:
Just returned from a three night stay at the courtyard by Marriott herald square.  Hotel is conveniently located next to yellow and orange line at 34th street.  This was great midtown location making everything in a stop or two on the subway.

Room was bigger than expected and very clean and comfy.  Great blinds that allow the bright lights of NYC stay out.  Our view out our window was the Empire State Building.

Highly recommend those looking to explore this great city.

title: Genial
text:
El hotel se encuentra en una ubicación perfecta: está cerca de la estación de Penn (menos de 10 min a pie), por lo cual es muy conveniente para los que vienen del aeropuerto de Newark en tren. Cerca de Macy's y del Empire State, y muy accesible en metro desde toda la ciudad. 

La habitación que nos tocó era bastante espaciosa, sobre todo teniendo en cuenta el tamaño normal de habitaciones en NY. A la hora de hacer la reserva, indicamos ciertas preferencias que los recepcionistas tuvieron en cuenta muy amablemente. A destacar el trato de Ben, que en la planta baja nos ayudó en todo lo posible - incluso a intentar parar un taxi en la avenida, que en hora punta puede resultar una tarea imposible. ¡Volveremos!

title: Best view!
text: Upon checking in, my family and I were upgraded to a suite that overlooked the largest Macy's! What a spectacular view we had! We could've also seen the top of the Empire State Building! The only downside was that the room was small (3 people) and the pull out sofa was very uncomfortable. I honestly can't focus too much on that because we were hardly in the room!

title: Great location for shopping & sight seeing!
text: Hotel has very basic necessities. You would need to get your own water as hotel doesnt provide complimentary water. The location is amazing! Near subway, Empire state building. Walking distance to flatiron. Minutes away from times square via subway. Drugstores opened 24 hours. Walking distance to New York Public Library. Bell service, Jose was very helpful.

title: Great location
text:
We loved staying there, the location is amazing , the bedrooms are spacious, clean and the staff was nice.
The rooftop lounge is a great spot to the empire state building pictures :) By the lobby there is a small convenience shop and a breakfast restaurant.
Nearby we had many options for breakfast as well, by the 6th ave.

title: Fabulous Hitel
text:
Stayed in many Marriott hotels before and this didn't let us down. We had a high City view room and could see down to the streets below. Only few minutes walk from Times Square, Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, Maddison Square Gardens, across the road from Macy's, ten minute walk from Union Station. 
Lobby is on the first floor, accessed by lift. 
Top floor is s roof top bar/restaurant which we didn't use. 
Rooms very spacious and well appointed. 
No complaints at all. 
Porter (Mikey?) very helpful giving us directions on how to get to various places, made easy by the subway station right outside the hotel. 
Would certainly recommend and use again. 
Thank you.

title: Stadthotel in perfekter Lage
text:
Wir waren vier Nächte mit vier Personen im Hotel. Es liegt perfekt und nachts sogar recht ruhig. Die U-Bahn ist direkt vor der Tür und auf dem Dach befindet sich eine angesagte Rooftop-Bar. In der Umgebung gibt es rund um den Herald Square etliche Restaurants und Macy's liegt direkt gegenüber. Die Zimmer sind für vier Personen recht eng, das Bad ebenso. Wer einen tollen Blick haben möchte, bucht bitte Skyline View. Frühstück gibt es im Coffee-Shop in der Lobby, lecker!
Fazit: Preis-Leistung stimmt und wer mit Kindern reist, ist um das inklusive Frühstück im Hotel dankbar.

title: Business and pleasure
text:
First time that I been to this hotel, is clean, organized, friendly staff and a great location.
I been to work and mine wife went shopping.
The area is surrounded by pubs and restaurants.
The hotel has a gym, roof bar and a area to do your laundry, also meeting rooms.
The room was good,honestly the acoustic isolation should be better since you can hear everything that happens on the streets.
This is a negative point from this hotel.

title: First Visit to NYC!
text: This is where we stayed on our first visit to NYC.  Nice place.  Lobby was smaller than I thought it would be, but everything in New York is built to save space.  The 'free breakfast' was an item from the Starbucks at the hotel.  With a coffee or water, a fruit and a breakfast sandwich.  Not a bad deal.  Really good location.  The subway was right outside our hotel door.  Close to a lot of attractions, walking distance to a lot as well.  I'd stay here again.  Good room for the price (in NYC, that is).

title: Great Location
text: This hotel is a great location for visiting Manhattan, right opposite Macy's. It has a roof top bar with views of the Empire State Building. The breakfast options are ok as they have an onsite small cafe, although we went out for breakfast every day. The staff are very knowledgeable of the area and very helpful. This hotel is within walking distance of many of the New York attractions. You can hear the rooftop bar music from the upper floors

title: Amazing location
text: We had a great stay. It's close to the empire state building and directly across from Macy's. It's a 5-10 minute walk to Time's Square and just another 5 minute walk to Rockefeller Center. It's walking distance to Central Park or you could just take the subway which is right next to the hotel. Rooms were really nice and spacious. We checked out but wanted to grab lunch before we left so they checked our baggage and grabbed our car from valet. So when we got back from lunch we just had to go up to the lobby and grab our stuff and go to our car which was already waiting for us. Highly recommend for a nice couple days.

title: Localização excelente, a poucos passos de tudo. Confortável e seguro.
text:
Pontos Positivos:
Localização excelente. A dez passos do metrô, vinte minutos a pé da Times Square, duas quadras para o Empire Sate, Macys, bares, restaurantes e comércio na vizinhança. A recepção do hotel é no segundo andar, não no térreo, o que dá mais segurança, pois há um porteiro no primeiro andar. No hall do segundo andar, loja de conveniências, amplo espaço bem decorado para café da manhã, computadores e impressora disponíveis. Bom número de elevadores. Quarto não é muito espaçoso, mas confortável, bom isolamento acústico e ar condicionado. Boas camas, tudo em bom estado, bom guarda-roupas, cofre, banheiro pequeno mas corretamente equipado. Conexão WiFi grátis de boa qualidade.

Pontos Negativos:
Café da manhã padrão americano, sanduíches prontos que esquentam na hora. Café do Starbucks, padrão americano, bem diferente do brasileiro, fraco. Recepção não é muito gentil ou atenciosa, respondem curto e grosso. O preço é alto, mas parece ser assim em todos de Manhattan, mas amigos locais que fizeram reserva direto (nós fizemos pelo Booking) conseguiram preços mais interessantes. O rooftop tem um bar que é bastante frequentado para happy-hour, então há bastante movimento todo dia no final do dia, o que incomoda um pouco para entrar no hotel neste horário.

title: Great location in Manhattan
text: Very well located, close to Empire State Building and walking distance to Times Square. Check in and check out is simple. Its lobby is on the first floor, the ground floor provides space for a top floor bar, for which there was always a queue.The rooms are decent size and provide good quality sleep. Its mostly basic stuff, not luxurious. Macy's is just opposite and its easy to get to from anywhere in NYC. Recommended for a short stay!

title: Ok hotel med dejligt personale
text: Hotellet lå perfekt i middle, så der var fin adgang til alt. Det var rent og pænt, men ingen overdreven luksus. Vi havde valgt et værelse med udsigt. Lad være med at betale for det, det ses bedre fra rooftop- baren klods op af Empire og det er MEGA meget larm om natten på grund af udrykninger og det er gamle vinduer i værelserne. Lad være med at bestille morgenmad - køb det i byen. Man får slet ikke det, som man betaler for. Man kan tage et stykke frugt og vælge juice ELLER kaffe. Og så en valgfri sandwich. Personalet i morgenmadsbaren var ikke specielt venlige, men ellers oplevede vi en helt utrolig service, især fra servicemedarbejderen i receptionen, som hjalp med kufferterne og vidste alt om udflugter og bus til outlet og sightseeing.  Han er skyld i det meste af den 4. Stjerne😄😄

title: Everything was perfect
text:
We arrived early and our room was not yet available. Our bags were checked into storage as we began our tour of the city. The location is perfect for sightseeing around the city and requires only short metro rides to most of the top sights/locations.

Comfy beds, clean facilities, friendly service make this our top NYC hotel. Being Marriott Rewards collector makes great to come back here again and again.

title: disappointed
text:
the list of disappointments with the Marriott hotels gets longer and longer. This hotel is another entry in this list. Inattentive staff at the front desk (forgot the usual procedure for reward members at check in, had to claim that separately), again no upgrade for a platinum member, slow wifi, loud air conditioning, rooms are spacious but with little room to put your things in (not recommended for a stay longer than two nights), and again the staff - not reliable: needed a call from management in an urgent matter, was promised a call from manager or deputy, but that never happened. Upon check out they had the nerve to ask me about my stay and when I told her, what disturbed me (from the loud AC to the management call) she just said "Oh..." and that's it. 
Water in the shower has little to no pressure and can't keep constant temperature. Walls and doors are thin, which is especially annoying when you're close to the elevator (which is explicitly mentioned in my Marriott rewards profile); so, again a hotel where customers or guests are basically an annoyance where you better not expect the service that should be connected to the Marriott name.

title: Zentrale Lage
text: Sehr gut gelegenes Hotel im Herzen Manhattans. Subway-Station direkt am Gebäude. Besonders hilfreich bei Regenschauern. Mit den Linien B und D kommt man schon ganz gut zurecht bei der Erkundung der Stadt. Dank der Lage ist man schnell am Central Park aber auch im Village bzw. Soho. Zimmer waren gut, allerdings für eine vierköpfige Familie etwas eng. Zu zweit genau die richtige Größe. Auf dem Dach gibt es eine schöne Bar, wo man tolle Aufnahmen vom Empire State Building machen kann. Ach ja, und Macy's ist direkt gegenüber. Bei Pret a Manger kann man super Frühstücken. Einfach die 6th Avenue ein paar Blocks nach oben laufen. WLAN ist im Hotel frei. Eine schönes Lobby gibt es noch dazu.

title: Conventient site and comfortable
text:
We fund the hotel to be conveniently located right outside of the MTA Herald Square subway entry. We bought 7 day passes and took MTA all over town and rode the crosstown busses at 34th street and 42nd street. 
The hotel doesn't come with breakfast, so we bought pastries and milk at Whole Foods down 4 blocks away and ate in the room. It was pretty quiet in the room except for the weekends, the noise of partying on street level at all hours required a pillow over my head. Not the hotels fault

title: Good location
text: We had a good stay here.  The hotel is in a great location with subway access to pretty much anywhere just outside.  It's a short walk to Penn Station, Times Square, Bryant Park and some other spots.  There is a rooftop lounge with a great view of the Empire State Building.  The staff is very nice, with Michael and Jose (Bellmen) being particularly nice.  The security guard during the day was also very friendly.  I really didn't care for the fact that I had to buy my coffee downstairs every morning, but there was an in-room maker available.

title: Una estadía de lo mas increible
text:
La ubicacion del hotel es realmente excelente! esta al alcance de todo! además, la atencion es genial.
A destacar: La excelente calidad de servicio de Yeilly! siempre nos atendio con la mejor predisposicion y nos ayudó en todo lo que necesitamos!
El hotel y los servicios excelentes y la limpieza genial.
Realmente volveria a hospedarme en este hotel ya que superó mis expectativas.

title: Excellent location.
text:
The hotel is located in a very convenient location on the corner of 6th Ave and West 35th Street right next to the subway exit. Penn station is only a five minute walk away. Macy's is less than a minute walk. The hotel entrance is shared with the Monarch Rooftop Bar. The main reception is not on the ground floor but a floor above. The staff were very welcoming and efficient. 

My room, on the 15th floor, was large compared to other hotels in NYC. The room was clean with a view of the empire state building from the window. The bed was comfortable. The hotel does not have a restaurant or its own bar but in NYC that's not an issue as there is a bar on almost every street. The bathroom is equipped with all the necessities including a hair dryer. In summary, a great base to explore NYC and the rooms are larger than other NYC hotels.

title: Great stay for New York trip!
text: We truly loved our time at this hotel! We were looking for a reasonably-priced, great location, simple luxury stay and that is exactly what we got. Our room was the perfect size for our 4-night stay, as we spent most of our time out of it enjoying the city. The room itself was clean, updated and had awesome amenities (the fridge came in handy for our leftovers!) We didn't hear the usual hustle, bustle and sirens because we were on the 16th floor, which was a gift from the hotel after they learned we were celebrating our first anniversary! The staff is great. The location is awesome if you are looking to be in the heart of Manhattan. Right when you walk outside you can head up to Times Square in ten minutes, or have access to everywhere with the subway station just a few feet from the doors. And our bed was perfect for relaxing after long days of walking all over town. I would absolutely visit this hotel again, it made for a wonderful trip to NYC!

title: Wonderful staff, great location
text: We were only in NY for a few nights, but the location of this hotel made it easy to get around. The staff is wonderful - super friendly and extremely helpful with advice and tips to get around. Our room had a great view of the city.

title: Great hotel in an excellent location
text: The hotel is right opposite Macy's so fantastic if you like shopping.  Also, the subway station is right outside the hotel front door, which is extremely convenient.  I really enjoyed the hotel - service was excellent and everyone was very helpful.  The rooms are a good size for Manhattan - we had 4 ladies in our room and managed fine.  Hotel is clean and the price was reasonable for the location.  There is also a rooftop bar in the hotel (Monarch) which is lovely and gives great views of the Empire State Building.

title: Grubby, Loud, Few Amenities
text: Do yourself a favor: Manhattan has a lot of choice, you really don't need to stay here. For the price ($1,400 for three late-booked nights, mid June 2017), the rooms and common spaces are grubby and cramped, the noise from outside is unreal (I'm on the 10th floor), there's no restaurant except for breakfast, you get one cup of coffee in your room, few amenities in the hotel. Really not up to par in such a competitive market as NYC. I'm a Marriott member, so naturally am drawn to their hotels for the points, but won't be back to this property. PS: One corner of my room smells of cat pee.

title: First trip to New York
text: This hotel was such a gem! I was pleasantly surprised at how great the location was! There is a subway station right outside the hotel and on our first day here, Jose, the bell hop, walked us downstairs to help us get set up with our first subway ride. Throughout the week, he was there to recommend which routes to take whereever we were heading. He even suggested places to eat for us that were really great. . The hotel is very clean and everyone working there was so pleasant! The location can't be beat as it is close to Times Square and the Empire State Building. And anything else is accessible from the subway station just steps away. We will definitely stay here again on future New York trips.

title: Great Location! Great Staff!
text:
Happy with our stay! Comfortable rooms; although a little small. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Convenient location.
Definitely would stay again. Actually we have stayed two years in a row so far!

title: Very helpful staff. Reasonable room size. Steps to subway
text:
I really enjoyed by stay at this midtown Courtyard. The staff was very helpful, particularly Jose (shout out to Brooklyn) and Michael on the bell staff. 

The room was big enough for my wife and I and our just-graduated-from-high-school daughter and 15-year-old niece. There wasn't extra room around the beds, but it didn't feel like a cramped NYC experience. 

The location was great - in mid-town, with lots of shops and restaurants in walking distance, and steps from the Herald Square subway station. 

We stayed on the 13th floor, and either the street noise was not a problem, or we were so tired that it didn't matter.

title: Top Hotel in super Lage
text:
Wir waren leide rnur eine Nacht auf unserer Rückreise von Hawaii hier. 
Was sollen wir sagen, es war super! Die Lage ist perfekt als Ausgangspunkt um die Stadt zu erobern. Man ist zu Fuß an den wichtigsten Dingen sehr schnell. Genügend Restaurants, Einkaufsmöglichkeiten und Sehenswürdigkeiten sind alle gut zu Fuß zu erreichen. 
Die U-bahnstation ist direkt vor dem Eingang, so dass mann überall schnell hinkommt.
Die Zimmer sind für New York Verhältnisse rießig, und sehr sauber. Das Personal war super freundlich und die Roof Top Bar "The Monarch" war auch mega. Ein toller Ausblick und coole Leute.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the staff could not do enough for you. Fantastic location, right across the street from Macy's. The beds, oh my God the beds. It was like sleeping on on a cloud. The pillows and duvet were feather and down. So squishy and comfy. Our room was huge (2 double beds), a rarity it NYC. Bathroom was spotless, powerful shower. Room cleaned daily. Fantastic wifi which was free. Fridge, safe, ironing board, massive tv plus tea/coffee making facilities. Rooftop bar in Monarch, elevator at the lobby. Very quiet hotel. On site restaurants, wifi stations, snack corners. Such a friendly hotel, especially Michael who did everything he could for us. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough and will definitely be back.

title: Nice location!
text:
Stayed at this hotel for the first time last year and I must say that what I liked the most was its location. Its located in a good shopping area,  some good places to eat and very close to the Empire State building . Also there is a subway station right outside so you can pretty much go anywhere (1 stop to time square, 3 stops to central park, if you get the express train going downtown you're 1 stop ahead of union square). 
The rooms were good and clean. They also have a laundry room at the hotel which was very helpful too.
The staff was nice also. It was a very nice stay.

title: Would Def. stay here again!
text:
We loved this hotel. We live in NYC but decided to spend a birthday Friday/Sat night oernight in Manhattan. We chose this hotel originally based on the combination of reviews, price, and location to what we had planned.
Location: Awesome. Subway right there, it's walking distance to Penn, and to the restaurant we had reservations and SO much to do and see in the area.
Staff: Amazing. We were there for a single night and the staff greeted us in and out and remembered my husbands birthday. They held our bags when we got there because we arrived early and when we came back and the room was ready it took only 2 minutes to get the bags back and brought to our room.
Room: PERFECT. We loved the room. Clean & comfortable (really most important), enough room , free wifi.
Dining options: Breakfast was lacking. But we enjoyed a nice lunch on the Monarch rooftop lounge before checking in. It gets crowded there later but we only went for lunch. Beautiful views, great food, but drinks were expensive and very small
Overall, we loved this place and will stay again!

title: Great location, Good value for money
text: We are a couple with a 2 year old son. Spacious enough room and good bed. We stayed in a king size room which also had a sofa bed, quiet, on a raised floor and overlooking herald square. We saw Macy's and the Empire state building from our bedroom window, which was fantastic. Small but functional bathroom. Room has an empty fridge which is ideal for buying drinks and for example yogurts and fruit to have in the room. It has a coffee machine, iron and ironing board, safe, TV and radio. In my opinion it is only necessary to have an electric kettle. All floors have ice maker. There is also a self service laundry with coins which was very useful for washing laundry. In the lobby there is also a mini market and microwave to buy something ready or drinks or simply warm up whatever we want. There is also a cafe operated by Starbucks who serves breakfast. It was included in our rate. It is not the typical small hotel lunch but it includes a hot drink and two pieces (croissants, bagels, muffins, yogurt, fruit, juice, etc). On the street we would pay 15usd per person for something equivalent. Very central site with subway station the door, with connection to several lines. Penn Station to 2 quarters. Hop on hop off also for 2 blocks. Shop convenience and pharmacy across the street and several deli's. Many shops all around. Ideal for traveling with small children because everything is close and is well served by transport.

title: Wonderful haven in a busy city
text: I was very pleasantly surprised when I arrived at the hotel.  From the bellman, to the desk clerk, to the cleaning staff, to the amazing corner room this is by far the best hotel I have stayed at in Manhattan.  The spacious 9th floor corner room afforded a view of Herald Square and Macy's on one side and up 6th Ave on the other.  The room was large with a wonderfully comfortable bed and large bathroom made my stay so much better than I anticipated.

title: Surprise birthday trip
text:
Fantastic hotel in a fantastic position 2blocks from Empire State Building and central to the whole of New York. Great staff great service great value. In particular Michael Rolleri who couldn't do enough for us and made our trip so special. 1st  picture view from our room

Would return tomorrow

title: Great Find!
text:
We searched and searched for hotel for a friend's birthday weekend in NYC right before Christmas. We wanted something convenient, comfortable and reasonable. We were all really happy with our choice! I could see the amazing Macy's windows from my room. It was so special to be able to view the windows at night upon our return from dinner each night.

I upgraded for a slightly larger room and it was 100% worth it. I had a corner room with significantly more space than my friends. It was a really nice size for a NYC hotel room. The room was comfortable and served its purpose for the weekend.

The staff was really friendly. No complaints! And they had a fun rooftop bar with a great view of the Empire State Building.

title: A great surprise
text: After recently staying in a couple of five star hotels in New York City, I wasn't really looking forward to this stay except for the fact that I knew it would have a convenient location. Boy was I wrong. From the minute I checked in and let me just mention check-in literally took less than one minute, until checkout I was blown away by the kindness of the staff as well as the quality of the hotel. First I was notified as I hoped I would be that I would get an early check-in even though the hotel was sold out. We did get the early check-in.  We were greeted on the ground floor by the doorman concierge Etc Michael who was very kind and helpful. He took us up to the second floor where we checked in almost instantaneously. Our room was clean and comfortable.  Let me at this hotel is right at The Herald Square subway stop which meds from LaGuardia I took a free 20-minute bus ride to Jamaica Heights Station easily got on a train which stopped right across the street from the hotel. The entire Transit from the airport to the hotel was less than one hour and less than $5.  I'll spare you how great the location is but know it is perfect. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Location to Herald Square Macy's
text:
Spent 5 days here for work and couldn't complain about anything. Everyone was so friendly and "Michael" the concierge was absolutely wonderful!!!

My room was on the 14th floor near the elevator, which usually would bother me but didn't this time. Size of the room was great with a king bed

Lobby level there is a place to grab coffee and snacks/sandwiches and the personnel are very friendly and attentive here, one of the employees remembered my order after one day. Great customer service!!!

Would definitely stay here again on my personal time and I'm even looking into booking a mini vacation here in the summer with my family. Great place.

title: in viaggio di nozze un'ottima soluzione
text:
Ho soggionato in questo hotel durante il viaggio di nozze.
Comoda la posizione: times square raggiungibile in 15 minuti a piedi, metro praticamente accanto all'hotel, oasi di Bryant park a meno di 10 minuti. Servizio concierge valido: al prezzo di una semplice corsa taxi per raggiungere il JFK ci hanno dato una limousine. Quando torno a NYC terrò in considerazione questa struttura

title: First Time in NYC... Rooftop Lounge at the amazing Hotel
text: I highly recommend the Courtyard Marriott/ Herald Square... Location was amazing. The subway was literally just a few steps from the front entrance. The hotel was a bit small but very clean. Housekeeping did an amazing job with cleaning our room daily and leaving plenty of towels for us to use. The staff was helpful and kind. I will be staying here again...

title: Spectaculous location!
text: Nothing we would have changed. The location was perfect for everything we did. The room was on the small size but had all we needed with great views. The beds were just right! The staff was top notch and took care of us like friends. Jose was especially awesome. He gave us great recommendations! Would stay here again!

title: A great experience in a great location
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard New York Manhattan/Herald Square. The location was perfect. Having a subway stop right out the front door made getting around so simple. 

We have to give a shout out to the awesome bellman Jose! He grabbed a map and helped us enjoy our short trip. He was so welcoming and gracious with his time. 

The only downside was the rooftop bar. We were expecting the same warmth and service, it was not. We didn't feel welcomed and we're basically told that we weren't. Luckily they are not truly a part of the property.

The room was quite a nice size considering the city location. It was the perfection you come to know while staying Marriott. 

We will for sure come back to this property when we travel to NYC.

title: Great location, clean room
text:
We just spent 4 nights at this hotel for our 10th anniversary.  We booked it using Chase reward points, so I can't comment on the value.  The location could not be more convenient to the subway - 7 different lines literally just steps outside the door.  There are also a decent selection of restaurants within a few blocks - a Shake Shack, delicious Korean bakery, and plenty of others. And lots of shopping nearby - Macy's, H&M, etc.

The room itself was fairly spacious by NYC standards - a queen bed plus a sofa that folded out to a bed.  With 4 it might be a little crowded, but it was plenty of room for two.  The bathroom was quite nice, although the shower nozzle and door combo made it inevitable to getting sprayed with cold water.  We had a nice view of the Empire State building from our room on the 13th floor.  It was a bit noisy to the outside - lots of honking and sirens, but very little noise from neighboring rooms.

Overall, I'd recommend this a clean, convenient location.

title: Au cœur de Manhattan
text:
L'hôtel bénéficie d'un excellent emplacement au cœur de Manhattan a deux pas de Times Square.
Nous avons séjourné 4 nuits dans cet hôtel avec nos deux enfants.
La chambre convient pour 4 personnes dont 2 enfants mais pas pour 4 adultes.
L'hôtel est très propre et l'accueil satisfaisant.
La salle de bain est trop juste en taille. 
Le 17ème étage est à éviter notamment le samedi soir car le bar sur Le roof top au 18ème est bruyant.
Le petit déjeuner n'est pas satisfaisant car le choix est trop restreint et limite en quantité.

title: Fräscha rum och häftig takterassbar.
text:
Bodde en natt och gillar det fräscha rummet och att det gick att åka upp till en häftig takterass med bar och utsikt. Väldigt nära bla annat Empire state och Madison Square garden. 
Affär öppen 24/7 runt hörnet.

title: Great view of the city
text:
Very Friendly staff, convenient location. Awesome rooftop bar :) 
My only complaint is that it should have a pool. There is a Starbucks inside. Many good restaurants are also nearby. The lobby isn't on the ground floor you have to go through security and go up a level. Make sure you check out Monarch Lounge.

title: Navidad 2016 y Año nuevo 2017
text: Muy buen hotel. La habitación para tres personas tenia una cama matrimonial y un sofa cama (no muy comodo). Era agradable y justa en el tamaño para las personas que eramos. Todo muy limpio y ordenado. La habitación daba a la 6ta Av. y la vista era hacia Herald square y el frente de Macys. En el lobby había un desayunador operado por Starbucks, solo hasta el mediodía. Si el desayuno no esta incluido en la reserva, adquirirlo en el hotel es muy caro, resultando conveniente tomarlo afuera. Piso por medio había maquina de hielo. La atención de todo el personal fue cordial y atenta.  A la salida del hotel estaba la entrada al metro de la estación 34 Street - Herald Sq Station.  En la terraza hay un bar "Monarch Rooftop & Indoor Lounge" para tomar algo y bailar, con vista al Empire State.

title: Great Room! Great Location!
text:
Two of us spent 4 nights at this hotel and loved it! The location is perfect for using the subway (just outside the hotel entrance), for walking, for eating, and for shopping. We had a view of the Empire State Building and Herald Square from our 14th floor window. The room has a great layout, uses the space very well, and has a very comfortable bed. There was plenty of room to unpack and store our suitcases. We loved that the bathroom has a shower (with no tub) and that there is a large opaque window in the bathroom allowing lots of natural light. The lobby area is very nice and has computers that we used to print a ticket and do some research. 

We arrived at 8:00am and had our luggage held until checkin time and when we left we had our luggage held again until it was time to leave for the airport. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

title: Great location- updated decor
text: Two recent stays for 5 nights total. Great location, 1/2 block to Macy's Herald Square, restaurants and shopping. Rooms are spacious for NYC, very clean. Starbucks, workstations, comfy seating areas in bright lobby and awesome rooftop bar at adjacent Monarch.

title: Great Location, Surly Front Desk
text:
Great spot in Herald Square. Easy walk to Times Square. Empire State Building literally around the corner.

Jose the bellman was the best. He helped us unload our car and hand it off to the valet, and had the car retrieved for us promptly. He always chatted with our kids and made us feel very welcome.

Different story from Occean at the front desk. Did not welcome me as a Marriott elite level customer. Room was unavailable (we arrived 90 minutes prior to 4 pm checkin time). She asked if we wanted to wait for a room or check our bags, so naturally I asked for an estimate for how long the room would take. "Families in rooms take a long time to clean," she said. She wouldn't answer, not even to give a range of like 1 hour or 3 hours. She had another oom type available but wouldn't give it to me because "you have a family." She was as unfriendly and unhelpful a front desk employee as I've ever had at any Marriott property (I've been a gold for several years). Me she doesn't like families staying at the hotel? Thanks for the warm welcome!

Teeny, tiny room. No drawers whatsoever. Typical of NYC, but even more cramped when you have suitcases piled up with no drawers for your clothes.

"City view" room looked north up 6th Avenue.

title: Average hotel - great service
text: The hotel was average - small room that was clean. Noise from the street made it difficult to sleep.  Jose the bellman was exceptional - very friendly upon check in. He took the time to walk us down to the subway to make sure we knew exactly what to do and where to go.  He really went above and beyond - always with a smile.  We would stay there again just because of the personal attention and service he provided.

title: Fantastic
text:
We stayed here in April for 4 days, we flew into Newark and used the shuttle bus service which was $21 per person. It takes about 1 hr to get to the hotel. Check-in was easy and our room was located on the 8th floor.  We booked a 2 x bed room which was a good size considering you were right in the heart of Manhattan. You were supplied with toiletries and also coffee for the machine. Wifi was also free. The hotel has a vending machine where you can purchase drinks and snacks. We had breakfast on two of the mornings, The staff were lovely and nothing was too much bother.

The hotel is located across the road from Macy's and Victoria's Secrets, round the corner from the Empire State Building. The location is fantastic. You can walk to Times Square, it takes about 15 minutes. We used the hop on bus and it was great to go updown and downtown. 

When I return to New York I would definitely consider staying here again. We got a taxi arranged through the hotel to Newark on the return and it was a flat rate of $85 and took about an hour.

title: Not happy...
text:
I am wondering why this hotel would offer Marriott Rewards Member Exclusive Offers that include breakfast and extra reward points and then make it so difficult to redeem it. 

First, when I went for breakfast, the receptionist told me that my rate does not include breakfast. I had to call my elite Marriott number to claim my breakfast. Eventually, after Marriott spoke with the receptionist my breakfast was found.

Second, when my regular reward points were added, the bonus of 2,500 point that the rate offered was not added. Again, I had to call Marriott to claim the extra points. And again, Marriott had to call the hotel to claim the point on my behalf...

title: Location Fantastic
text:
We stayed for 9 days 8 nights in March 2017. Requested an early check in because we were arriving early morning. Unfortunately our room was not available until check in time of 3:00 pm. We were lucky enough that Michael (one of the concierge) was able to store our luggage while we tried to get an early check in. 
We finally got our room and it was a corner ending in 13. Fair size. Had a m/w oven, fridge and coffee maker. Bathroom had a decent shower but no tub. The toilet/sink area was a little cramped and the fan was a bit noisy. Beds were ok. 
The location can't be beat. Macy's Herald Square was right across the street. A subway station within a few steps that is a transfer station to take other subway lines. So convenient to go anywhere. Not sure if it's because of the location, but it was loud from street noise. 
Korea town was less than a 5 minute walk so restaurants were there. Lots of fast food restaurants, drug stores, and shopping all within a few steps of the hotel. Times Square was about a 15 minute walk or one subway stop. Empire State Building about a 5 minute walk too. 
Elevators were quick (there were 3). 
The staff were super friendly and attentive. Nice to see people take a minute to look you in the eye and smile :) Josè the other concierge that we saw on a daily basis had many ideas on where to go for dinner or shopping.  He even helped us arrange for a car to take us to the airport. The blond young lady at check in (I apologize I didn't get her name) was fantastic. She got us the room a bit higher floor and gave us the late check out.  One thing I will mention is the cab fare isn't much less (maybe $5-10) than if you were to get a private car. That cost $65.00 plus tip and you ride in a nicer, cleaner, and comfortable car. I would stay here again.

title: INIGUALABLE UBICACIÓN
text:
Como ya es mi costumbre, trataré de ser o mas objetivo posible.

Manhattan Courtyard Heral Square by Marriott

El hotel está ubicado en pleno centro de Manhattan (Midtown) contra esquina de la primera y más grande "Macy's" del mundo. A sólo una cuadra de edificio "Empire State", a 3 cuadras de “Penn Station”, a 5 cuadras de la terminal de autobuses, a 3 cuadras de la biblioteca pública y a 6 cuadras de terminal "Grand Central"... A solo 10 minutos caminando a "Times Square", a el edificio de las Naciones Unidas, a los teatros de Broadway, al edificio "Flat" a "Central Park"...  En fin... Se puede pedir una mejor ubicación??

Caminando a los alrededores del hotel hay muchos edificios emblemáticos de Nueva York, y no hay que tomar metro, cabe señalar que prácticamente en la puerta del mismo hotel hay una estación de metro que en pocos minutos les hará llegar a cualquier lugar alejado turístico de Manhattan.

Aunque el hotel ofrece desayuno (con costo) en esta ocasión decidimos salir a desayunar en los diferentes restaurantes muy cercanos al hotel.

Hablemos de las instalaciones del hotel:

PROS: 

*** Vigilancia por personal de seguridad las 24 horas de los elevadores. 

*** Llegamos al Lobby Recepción ubicado en el 4 piso, fuimos recibidos muy muy amablemente por la señorita Jelly (Ella y casi todo el personal del hotel habla español), quién nos explicó con mucho detalle todas las amenidades con que cuenta el hotel. Hasta nos describió el posible clima de la ciudad y a donde podíamos ir y disfrutar los 6 días de nuestra estancia en la ciudad.

*** A diferencia de los anteriores hoteles que he llegado en Nueva York en que han sido muy estrechas las habitaciones... éste hotel nos asignó unas habitaciones estupendas, (eran 2 habitaciones) ambas con vista a la plaza Herald y a Macy's, la mía era más amplia que la de mis familiares, contaba con una cama "Queen Size" una cómoda / escritorio, Armario con espejo completo, plancha y mesa para planchado, caja de seguridad, mini refrigerador, cafetera eléctrica y sobres de café y Sofá de 2 plazas. La habitación de mis familiares era solo un poco más pequeña y no contaba con el sofá.

***Pantalla de televisión LG plana de 42 pulgadas. (Menciono la marca porque prefiero Samsung a la cual puedo enviar mis vídeos o mi Netflix desde mi teléfono Samsung)

***La habitación alfombrada y muy muy limpia. La ropa de cama de estupenda calidad por lo que resalto la suavidad de las sábanas.

*** El baño con ducha bastante limpio y muy nuevo en sus materiales, bastantes toallas y muy suaves, cuenta también con secadora de cabello. Y dotación de Shampoo y jabón de manos.

*** El hotel cuenta con 3 elevadores muy rápidos, por lo que nunca sufrimos una espera.

*** En el lobby del hotel hay bastantes sofás muy cómodos, el centro de negocios cuenta con varias computadoras.

*** El hotel cuenta con internet inalámbrico gratuito (WiFi) en todas las habitaciones de súper mega velocidad.

*** Y Como siempre la cadena de hoteles Marriott te ofrece el servicio de "Check Out" automático, pues te deja por la noche previa a tu salida y bajo la puerta de tu habitación, tu cuenta ya cerrada, y si no consumiste algo extra a lo descrito en tu factura, puedes abandonar el hotel sin pasar por recepción.

CONTRAS:
*** En las habitaciones no hay botellas de agua de cortesía para beber, pero si va uno a recepción las proporcionan sin costo alguno.

*** La televisión no cuenta con ningún canal en español.

*** La jarra de cristal de la cafetera no estaba por ningún lado, por lo que no pudimos preparar café alguno.

title: Lovely little hotel in an awesome location
text:
Centrally located (like smack in the middle of Manhattan, 20 minutes walk to Time Square, 2 minutes to Macy's and a subway station seconds away), this hotel offers what an active modern traveller is looking for. Stylishly appointed and makes great use of the cozy spaces, this Courtyard does not disappoint. 

A nice selection of restaurants and eateries close by (less than 2 -3 minutes walk), and ahem, a 24hours MacD. 

Being New York, 24 hours of hocking and ambulance/ police sirens comes at no extra charge. Annoying and inescapable. 

For guests driving in, I recommend the valet service. They seem to magically find parking, and the valet requires an hour of notice as I recon they probably need to bring the car back from a different dimension. 

The staff are friendly, attentive and accommodating, which is a welcoming after a 9 hours drive from Toronto. Thank you for a great NY experience.

title: too many problems
text: First, the staff was uniformly friendly. the location was great, and the price was very reasonable for Manhattan.  In fact, I rebooked twice, each time lowering the rates by $25/day.  Unfortunately, the building has problems.  The biggest problem was climate control.  I had a corner room (low floor but still quite interesting view) with big windows that were not insulated at all, and the heater just couldn't regulate the heat on cold nights.  To get what felt barely 70 degrees required setting the heat on 80, and still the heating was variable and not well distributed in the room.  The thermostat worked ok when it was 50-60 outside.  The elevator buttons intermittently just didn't work (or took 30 seconds of pushing until they finally registered your request and sent an elevator).  There were no usable electrical outlets near the bed the lamps and clock were plugged in, but there were ugly pieces of wood nailed to the wall to prevent access to these outlets.  There was an outlet on the lamp, but positioned so you couldn't plug in anything on a transformer.  The staff was apologetic about everything, but couldn't seem to fix anything.  Other Courtyards are really better.

title: Winner all the way around
text: From moment of check in this hotel was a winner all the way around. Location is perfect. Empire, Madison Square, Times Square, Rockefeller, broadway, - alll are within close blocks away. Subway is at doorstep. Macy's is across street. Rooms and bathrooms are large for NYC - especially kings. 2 dbls are large too just a bit more crowded. Upper story rooms were super quiet. Rooms/baths were very clean and strong water pressure. Bellman/Concierges were fantastic! One even walked us all the way into subway - thru the ticket buying, map explaining, and to our train. Simply awesome. They always had the answers no matter what we asked. Check in was simple friendly and efficient. Price - for NYC - can't be beat. We will be back.

title: Great stay and Location
text: I don't think I have anything bad to say about This hotel.  The location is absolutely perfect!  Most subway lines we used were either right outside the hotel, or just a few blocks away near Macy's.  Made getting around super easy!  We easily walked to Times Square.  There is a great breakfast diner a fee blocks away called Andrew's Place which has great food and prices.  Room was always clean, and ready when we arrived Christmas Day.  We have stayed here 2 years in a row.

title: location, location, location
text:
Fantastic place to stay while in NYC. Just around the corner from the Empire State, Flat Iron and Macys across the street! Lovely place to stay if you have come to shop or sightsee.  Its quiet around this area at night which I liked as around Times Square can be loud and noisy. It only a walk to everything from here, Times Square 20mins. Loads of shopping and subways just on the doorstep.
Hotel spacious, we ate out all the time as loads of nice diners for breakfast and lunch. We staying in a family room and had loads of room despite 4 large suitcases.

title: Hotel pequeño limpio, muy bien ubicado
text: Linda experiencia. hotel limpio buena cama y baño, ideal para quien quiere recorrer nueva york. Muy bien ubicado estacion de metro en la misma esquina del hotel. Cerca de todo, con un maicys al frente y muchos lugares donde comer. Lo recomiendo y volvere

title: Great Stay
text: Perfect location. Room was great with a great view. For those who love to shop you have Macy's across the street. Everything is in walking distance especially Broadway. There is a great bar on the roof.

title: Fun trip with friends
text: This is a great hotel located in the heart of herald square. Very clean. Very helpful and friendly staff. Jose was so good to us!!! I will definitely stay here again! And recommend this hotel to my friends.

title: Night in NYC
text:
We were attending Billy Joel concert at MSQ which was amazing!! 
Our over night stay was perfect.. the hotel is clean, staff very helpful, beds really comfortable.. love the rooftop lounge ... it made our night at the city just perfect!!

title: Very good hotel in midtown
text:
We stayed there for 7 nights (two King Skyline View rooms during two stays). 

This Courtyard is at great location in Midtown. It is located on W 35th & 6th Ave.  The subway is at the entrance (on winter is a great thing).  It is at few blocks from Penn Station, Bryant Park, Empire State, Times Square and the theater district and Fifth Ave shops.

The rooms were not big (just for two) but nice, clean and new. The bed was very comfortable. We changed our rooms during the second stay; they accepted our comments and accepted to change the rooms but the entire situation required time, discussions, explanations, etc. all things that you do not want on vacations.  Our complaints were about the size and layout.  Be aware all rooms are NOT identical (see Room tips).

No complimentary breakfast but there is a Starbucks (only selected products) in the Lobby.  There is also a 24 hour snack vendor machine. The Lobby is not at ground level.

As you can read in other reviews this Hotel has a particular combination regarding noises.  The street noise is significant at this location (the 35th st and principally 6th Ave). We stayed at 6th floor and it was as you were at the street level. And the building has a nightclub on top (on weekend is particularly noisy).  We stayed at 16th floor and there were quite (the upper floor is 17).

Staff was always helpful and friendly (with the only exception was the Desk person during the second stay check in). Housekeeping was very well.

title: Nice Lobby, Cafe With Starbucks, Friendly & Professional Staff
text: We greatly enjoyed our stay, and since the lobby is on the second floor, found it to be spacious and bright with ample seating. The staff was friendly and professional, and during our prompt check in, we were given a large corner room with couch and chair.  The cafe serves Starbucks coffee and on the lobby level. Internet speed was very good, sufficient for web conferencing. The Herald Square subway is right on the corner. We would be happy to return.

title: Business Trip to Empire State Bldg
text: This Marriott property is located just around the block from the Empire State building. I had business at the ESB each day and this was a perfect location. The staff here was very attentive especially Michael who is a bellman, he was great. The rooms are a bit larger than what you expect in Manhattan which is good. The lobby is adequate for business meetings. There is a bar on the roof called the Monarch and it has an outdoor area which allows smoking. I love to relax with a cigar in the evening and this was the perfect place however be prepared to pay NYC prices for any drinks you have, e.g. had a 12 oz bottle of local beer and it was $12 ($1 per oz). I'll stay here again when I come back on business.

title: OUTSTANDING!!
text: Loved it!! loved it so much I had a reservation for June for the Renaissance in Times Square and I canceled it and changed it to here. Michael R., the bellman on the ground floor IS AMAZING!! He is so friendly, always opening the door and ready to serve he made the stay!! Being a platinum member, was upgraded to the top floor, floor 17 and got a corner room looking straight up 6th avenue and we could see Central Park. The GM Susan was soooooo helpful too! There is a subway serving the orange and blue lines directly outside the hotel too!!!

title: Een heerlijk verblijf
text:
Wij hebben met 3 personen 7 nachten in het hotel verbleven en hebben er van genoten!
De kamer was schoon en ruim genoeg. Kluis en koelkast aanwezig en genoeg bergruimte in de kast. Badkamer wat krap, maar niet hinderlijk.
het personeel was erg vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Maakten elke dag een praatje met ons en stonden klaar om te helpen.
Ligging ideaal. Metro letterlijk de deur uit bij het hotel en genoeg op loopafstand.
WIFI gratis en goed qua sterkte/snelheid
Erg prettig verblijf gehad en dit hotel zal ik bij een volgend bezoek aan NY zeker in gedachten houden!

title: Back Again
text: Back in NYC after traveling amtrak to penn station from WAS. Very convenient walk from penn station and arrived about noon on a Saturday. They didn't have any rooms available so we went to lunch. Came back  around 2:30 and they were trying to put us in a higher floor room but it wasn't ready and we said it was OK, just give us what was available and they did. Room was fine. Staff friendly and attentive. Plenty of taxis outside and numerous subway options just outside the front door. Great location. Michael was great with our luggage and with numerous suggestions to visit/eat, etc.

title: Große Zimmer!
text: Tolles Hotel auch für einen längeren Aufenthalt! Zentral, aber trotzdem sehr ruhig. Saubere Zimmer. Metro direkt vor der Tür. Sehr nette Concierge, die immer mit Rat und Tat zur Seite standen. Wir kommen definitiv wieder!

title: Good location - in it, but not too much
text:
Good location - lots of shopping nearby, close to subway stations, action if you want it or you can turn in and somewhat block the noise.  (There was a post election protest in the street leading to the tower where our elected official resides, but it was easily avoided by pulling the shades, or if (as I was) you were curious the windows actually opened a bit so you could allow in fresh air or hear what was being chanted.)

My biggest challenge here was they were out of water (WATER) in the little food area.  It was easy enough to go purchase at Duane Reade across the street, except it was raining cats and dogs, so this one night I would have preferred to have it on site, but one can not live overnight in a hotel without H2O.

The bathroom was pretty small but they made the best out of a very awkward layout.  I had a big room for NYC standards.  Would most definitely stay here again - probably soon!

title: Nice location
text: Nice location; convenient to both business and tourist destinations. Room was surprisingly quiet. Guest service staff was extremely helpful with suggestions on nearby restaurants. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Great location, comfortable bed, nice shower
text:
My wife and I stayed during off season and snagged a room with a king size mattress for about $150 a night!  It's centrally located - easy walking distance to Empire State Building and Macy's flagship store.  Times Square/The Rock/Central Park are pretty close too.

Room was clean.  We were on the 8th floor next to elevator and didn't notice too much city noise.  We left the fan running on the AC unit and that provided some nice white noise.  It's a small room but normal for the city.  Shower was actually nice sized with good water pressure.

I imagine this hotel could cost a fortune during peak demand but I was super pleased at the rate we got!

title: Bello bello bello!!!!!
text:
Porteremo sempre nel cuore questo Hotel, prima tappa del nostro fantastico viaggio di nozze...abbiamo soggiornato dal 26.01 al 31.01.17... il personale molto attento, educato, disponibile e professionale, la pulizia delle camere, veramente accurata, senza considerare la posizione centrale e a due passi da Time Square.
Torneremo sicuramente!!!

title: Exceptional
text:
Exceptional location, very professional staff and the rooms are very clean and big enough for a family of 4 without any problems. My next visit i'll stay with them for sure without any doubts!
Recommended for everyone

title: Great First Stay in NYC
text: Had a wonderful time on our first trip to NYC!    Everyone at the Courtyard/Herald Square location was excellent.    Check in was fast and easy, very helpful with directions and dining tips.   The rooms are very nice for NYC not large but perfect for 2 people.   Have to say thank you to Jose at the front door, he was extremely helpful.  Walked us to the subway station and walked us through using the subway.   Won't forget downtown vs uptown!   Thanks for making my first trip to the Big Apple an excellent time!

title: Perfect location
text: This hotel is the perfect location! Right outside of the entrance is a subway station and the hotel is a short walk from the Empire State Building and Times Square. I had a few packages shipped to the hotel prior to my arrival and the staff was extremely accommodating.

title: Great place to stay!
text:
Really convenient location, especially if you are arriving/leaving from Penn Station. Subway right outside hotel. Rooms are attractive, clean, very comfortable beds. Prices in January and February are super reasonable for NYC. Lighting in the rooms is subdued so not great for reading, but not a big drawback. Staff is very accommodating and helpful- good security and amazingly fast elevators (3 of them). 
Breakfast is not included, but there are many choices of restaurants within a block orr2 of the hotel. Highly recommend!

title: Fantastic location, great staff (that one small item is still there)
text: My friend and I were in NYC for just one night, and the price and location were right for the Courtyard.  The staff was fantastic --- very friendly.  I need to give a "shout out" to Yeilly, Jose, and Michael (he may have been the manager on duty on Saturday).  They made us feel very welcome.  The rooms were in good shape --- large by New York standards and clean.  I believe we were on the 7th floor.  The hotel's location was prime!  A few blocks from Penn Station and Times Square.  The Herald Square subway stop is just a few feet away from the hotel's entrance.  Check-in and check-out went very smoothly, and we were able to store our bags all day after checking out on Sunday.  Okay, so just one small item, which was also cited in a previous review.  There was an incessant and almost constant sound of water flow above and around the room.  At first, we thought it was someone next door flushing the toilet, but it was pretty much non-stop.  It continued overnight.  I have no problem sleeping through noise and sound distractions, but it could be challenging for some.  The hotel really needs to focus on addressing this.  Aside from this one small item, I would highly recommend this hotel for those coming to enjoy the city.

title: Mother daughter weekend
text: Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Loved this location walking distance to Times Square, Macy's and other sites, restaurants and shopping. Super easy subway access right out the front door. Staff was readily available, friendly and helpful. Jose' the doorman made our trip so much more enjoyable with helping us with subway lines, buying tickets and tips. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Could be excellent - one small item to solve
text:
Spent two nights here in January. 
- The staff were great, friendly, helpful, pleasure to chat to. 
- There's a place to grab breakfast, Starbucks -  it seemed to close around midday. 
- The gym was fine. A tad warm for cardio, but the cardio was ok (treadmill on far right has AV issues). 
- The location is superb - close to multiple subways, Penn Station, etc. 
- the issue is that on the 16th floor, where I stayed, there seemed to be a constant trickle of water. Not from my room, possibly the room above or the heating system. It was incessant. I could sleep, but I was aware of it. If that's fixed, this place is 5*  

I will return.

title: Központi elhelyezkedés,
text:
Pár perc sétára helyezkedik el a Times Square-tól vagy a Rockefeller Center-től. 
A Penn Station és közvetlenül az Empire State Building mellett. 

Közlekedés kiváló. A bejárattól kb 10 méterre van a metró bejárata, ahonnan bárhová el lehet jutni.

Összegezve: Elhelyezkedés kiváló! Tiszta rendezett szobák! Kedves személyzet.

title: muy buena estadia!!
