text: En lineas generales muy bien, se nota que fue renovado hace poco las habitaciones son muy buenas , nosotros ocupamos dos y ambas tenian vista al Empire state.Para mi gusto tienen una pequeña deficiencia en la atencion, si bien el horario de entrada es claro que es a las 16hs, hasta esa hora no te registran cuando las habitaciones se dejan a las 10hs, creo que no es una manera de cuidar al cliente sobretodo cuando hay niños pequeños. creo que no cuesta nada y sumaria mucho, igual dejamos las valijas y nos fimos a pasear, cerca de todo y volveria a este hotel!

title: Great location and terrific staff
text:
We stay over in Manhattan fairly often, with our choices based on budget and location to whatever we plan for the weekend. We do favor the Marriott chain for consistency (and Points!) I am always glad to stay at this Courtyard in Herald Square, because the location to shops, subways and restaurants is so convenient. Last weekend was no exception. We arrived before check in, and were helped by Yeilly, who offered us an early check in on one of the lower floors, or it would be a wait for the high floor corner room we requested. We decided to go out for lunch, whereupon Yeilly called a bellhop to secure our luggage. He was the same friendly guy who had greeted us on the ground floor, Michael, I believe. As he took our bags both he and Yeilly asked what we were in the mood to eat, and offered suggestions on where to go. Michael even gave us a couple of coupons for local restaurants! After some great Korean food, we returned to the hotel and checked in to our room. 
The rooms here are clean, coffee maker, safe, refrigerator and large comfy Marriott bed.
The bathroom was small but clean and the water was hot with good pressure. The is a hair dryer supplied along with soap, shampoo and body lotion. 
NYC has plenty of competitively priced hotels, but what sets this one apart, and makes it feel special to us, is the staff, who are just generally friendlier and more accommodating than others.

title: Great Location!!
text: This is a great hotel in a great location but what makes it even more special is the staff. We had a few bumps in the road upon check-in, and I have to say, the front desk person and his subsequent replacement were not very accommodating.  It wasn't until we met Alaina that we got everything straightened out.  She helped us without hesitation or excuses.  Jose and Michael the Bellhop/Concierge/Doormen are also great!  Jose found us a wonderful Korean BBQ restaurant with exactly what I asked for.  Michael is just hilarious.  He makes you feel right at home.  Housekeeping also was top notch, leaving exactly what was requested (extra towels and coffee).  Will stay here again.

title: Good location
text: The location is great, just a couple of steps from the Empire State building. No problem with finding places to have breakfast/brunch etc. The room was fine, a bit small for this type of hotel. Staff super polite and helpful. Fast internet. However, toiletries were replaced only after the phone calls. Other than that - perfect.

title: Ho Hum Boring in Herald Square
text:
Nothing great. Nothing horrible. We couldn't check in our room at check in time so that was bad. Lobby is on the 2nd floor with no complimentary anything. Newer modern decor. 
Night club/restaurant on the top floor so when you come in and out there was always some event going in.
Staff not particularly helpful.
Room was clean and efficient. Pretty nice nice as well. 
No complimentary coffee or breakfast but pricey items in the lobby. 
Subway entrance is right there. Super convenient to get around. Great location!

title: Awesome hotel with strategic location
text:
Great place to stay if you want to be near down-town and shopping mall.
This hotel offers nice ambience, friendly staffs, restaurants and subway only a walking distance.
Don't forget......if you love Broadway but don't want to stay at crowded street, pick this  hotel:)

title: Another great stay
text: 2nd stay in 12 months . Great location and could be any nearer to subway. We were able to check in early on both visits . The check in was quick and friendly. Lobby very relaxing and well equipped . We didn't require much assistance from staff but they are helpful and courteous. Rooms are nice and clean . Beds comfortable after long days trekking in the snow . Rates were good and we will stay here again on next visit .

title: Great location and service
text: Excellent location central to lots of things. Close to good restaurants and service is always excellent. Room is always ready upon check in and check in is always fast and courteous. Easy to get a cab out front and doorman is extremely helpful and kind.

title: Just OK
text:
Stayed here for an overnight getaway with my 20 year old daughter.  The hotel was great for shopping (many shops in Herald Square) and for an amazing sushi place right next door (Izakaya Mew).  But the hotel was a bit of a walk for a show at night.  
The hotel and room were clean (but not spotless).  Our room was a good size (by NYC standards) and quiet but quite drab. But we were actually expecting more for the price since we have stayed at the Central Park Courtyard for less and found that property to be much better.  The view was only ok (see picture).  The one bright spot of this property is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff.  Would probably not stay here again.

title: Sehr gutes Hotel
text:
Die Lage des Hotels am Herald Square, im Herzen Manhattans, ist herausragend. Eine Subway Station ist direkt am Hotelausgang. Macy`s ist schräg gegenüber. 
Die Zimmer sind sauber und sehr gut ausgestattet. 
Trotz der Lage ist es auf dem Zimmer sehr ruhig. Eine tolle Hotelbar befindet sich auf dem Dach des Hotels. Standorttypisch sind die Preise recht hoch. 
Das Personal war stets freundlich und hilft auch mal gerne ein Taxis zu bekommen.

title: Excelente ubicacion y servicio
text: El hotel esta EXCELENTEMENTE ubicado, a pocas cuadras del Empire State, La 5ta Avenida, Time Square, con un subte en la puerta y los negocios mas importantes a menos de 2 cuadras de distancia, aparte de estar enfrente de Macy's. El servicio es impecable, las piezas no son grandes pero si muy cómodas y modernas.

title: Clean room in a great location
text: If you want a clean room in a central location in Manhattan without paying a fortune, look no further.  The hotel is literally steps away from a subway station that serves almost every line.  This was a huge benefit and also within walking distance of Penn Station. The rooms were clean and the bed super comfortable.  Andrew's Coffee Shop is one block away and the perfect place to eat anytime of the day. (see my review).  Staff was super friendly, from the check in desk to the maintenance people we saw in the elevators. Our room was cleaned with fresh towels and beds made daily. Highly recommend!

title: Muy buen hotel en la puerta de macys
text: El hotel no es de gran lujo pero tiene todo lo que se necesita, está literalmente en la puerta de la estación del metro y a pasos de la entrada principal de macys, a pocas cuadras de time square pero a su vez en un lugar tranquilo sin tantísima gente, la habitación tiene un tamaño aceptable , el baño es pequeño pero cómodo, cama muy cómoda y un buen TV de 46 pulgadas, lo mejor es que desde la estación de metro que está en la puerta del hotel puedes ir casi a cualquier sitio de Manhattan ya que pasan como 4 líneas del metro por allí.

title: Great location in NY
text: Although a Courtyard, the hotel is a high rise, we had our rooms on the 12th floor, a queen with a city view across from Macy's. The hotel could not be more centric, right next to the metro station, near the Empire State Building (can see it from rooms and the top floor) and within walking distance to Times Square. Personnel were nice and helpful and you know what you get with the Marriott brand, the rooms and service were very good quality, it has a Starbucks in the lobby which is always handy. I'd stay there next time I visit, highly recommend it.

title: Great location
text: Stayed here for the central location. The room was clean and the staff were really friendly. Right across from Macy's so shopping was great and didn't have to carry our bags very far!!  Walking distance from the Empire State Building and Rockefeller.  Price wise was great value.

title: Central to Most Everything
text: This hotel is clean, safe, and the staff are friendly. It is very close to the Empire State Building and about 10 blocks from Rockefeller Center. Our bed was very comfortable. The rooms are smaller than rooms at other Courtyard by Marriott's, probably because it is NYC and every "living space" is quite a bit smaller than other cities, but it was still very comfortable and clean.

title: Great hotel Great Staff
text:
Great location. Room was great. All the staff were very helpful. Bellman helped with directions and even offered to walk to subway station to help purchase a pass. 
Not sure about value since I didn't pay for the room.

title: Great stay
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights over thanksgiving. The hotel is spotless! The lifts are at the entrance and you go to level 5 for the lobby. 
I was on level 7 and we heard a few siren noises but nothing that bothered us badly. 

Michael is so helpful and answered any questions we had about the room and city. He was always eager to help. 

We had a room with 2 doubles. The beds were small but as we were a family it was ok for us.
TV and free wifi were fantastic! 

Coffee machine in room and also a hairdryer. 

We had breakfast included in our booking and it worked out perfect for us. 

There is a subway right outside. Mc Donald's around the corner and a few Irish bars on the same street. 
Macy's is across the road! 
5 mins walk from ESB and Bryant park and all other attractions. 
It is extremely safe there. 
We were also allowed to stay in our room for an extra 2 hours on day of check out which was fantastic as it was lashing. 

We were able to go shopping, come back to our room and dry off. 

I would have non problem recommending this hotel and would definitely stay here again

title: Perfect hotel in the heart of the city
text: Great room, service and location.  Quiet inside the hotel.  Staff was especially accommodating.   5 star review from us.    Hotel is impeccably clean.  Marriott's online checkin app is fantastic.  Could not have been easier.  Thanks all!  Makes me happy to be a Marriott Rewards member.

title: Nice Hotel in the Heart of the City
text:
We were there for Thanksgiving weekend.  The hotel let our son check in early for us.   The corner room was spacious for an NYC room and comfortable, though the bathroom was a little cramped.  The room gave us a nice view of the parade and six people were able to watch it from the room without feeling cramped.

The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The maid staff was wonderful. The decor was about what you would expect from a hotel of this level.  The location is fantastic and it gives you great access to a number of sites within a reasonable walk, and there's a subway station with feet of the entrance.  The entire area is a little noisy, but that's the trade off for being in the heart of NYC.  

I did not experience the security referenced by other reviewers.  Not once when I or my guests entered were we asked for any ID or room key and we were always able to access the 16th floor without using a key for the elevator.  Maybe I don't look like a threat, but I didn't see anyone getting stopped at any point.

Initially, months ago, we had some problem with the nature of the room we had reserved that I now believe was caused by a misunderstanding between the national reservation people and the hotel, but this was eventually resolved to our satisfaction.

All in all, a good experience in a conveniently located nice hotel.

title: Great Hotel for Thanksgiving Day Parade
text:
Our family stayed in this hotel to see the Thanksgiving Day parade. We had an upper floor and a great view of 6th Ave and saw the balloons and floats come down 6th Ave. We watched the parade from the comfort of our room. The room was adequate. Not too small for a family of 4 in NYC. The bathroom was clean and stocked with enough towels. Biggest drawback is that there was not a lot of drawers to unpack your clothes. 

Do not bother paying the higher room rate which includes breakfast. There are so many rules associated with breakfast. You can have one hot item and nothing else or 2 cold items. We had to pay for $5 for a cup of coffee. It's a Starbucks like stand and there are so many rules to what you can have, it's not worth it. My daughter wanted cereal, strawberries and a bottle of apple juice. We had to pay for the strawberries. 

The location was incredible. Being just steps across the street from Macy's Herald Square is amazing. Walk up 6th Ave and go to Bryant Park. You can walk to Times Square. Great location! It's a no frill hotel, though. Don't expect a LOT.

title: Great location, great staff, clean hotel
text: I stayed here with my daughter and husband the week of Thanksgiving. The staff was super friendly and efficient, always quick to answer questions. There was always security stationed at the entrance, and they were friendly and helpful. Located just across from Macy's, it was perfect for parade viewing and Black Friday shopping. Many restaurants and stores very close by, and the rooms and lobby were clean. Room was very small, but not unexpected in NYC! Reasonably priced. Walking distance to Times Square, and Subway stop just outside the door. Would stay here again.

title: Good Location, Average Hotel, Great Front Desk Associate
text:
My husband and I recently stayed here for 3 nights, Thursday through Sunday.  We were in room 1313 which is a king corner room facing Macy's.  The room was spacious and clean.  The bed was soft and comfortable.  I would have liked the mirror in the bathroom to be larger.  There is not room for more than one person to get ready in front of the mirror at the same time. I do not recommend this hotel for a girl's getaway.  Although there is one more mirror on the back of the closet door, it is poorly lit, no outlet close enough for your curling iron, and a bad place to put on your makeup, for this particular room anyways.
We had some checking out issues (our fault, not the hotel), and J-Lee was awesome.  She was also the one who checked us in.  She was always very friendly and professional and gave us eye contact with a smile.  
All in all, this is an OK hotel as far as the rooms go. But the employees we encountered made it better than average. Oh, the rooftop bar is nice too but you have to go early if you want $12-$15 drinks.  Later in the night it gets insanely expensive.

title: Nice Hotel, Great Location, And nice staff/rooms
text: Nice stay! In a great location not noisy like some other hotels in the city, room had a nice view very clean. Checked in on a Friday there was a noise coming from the AC unit in the ceiling. Went to the front desk to have someone come look at it, someone came right up to fix it, but the noise came back so i called the front desk and they changed my room no questions asked. Will be staying again when i am back in NYC.

title: Friendly, hotel personnel and great room
text: I needed to buy hand rolled cigars for my sons, the doorman Kenny gave great info and I got what I needed.  When I wanted info on Cuban food, he was there.  The maid service was there with extra towels and a friendly good morning every day.  The day we left are driver got stuck on the Lincoln Tunnel, so we spoke with Kenny and he got us a car service right away.  Thank you for a great vacation.

title: A Gem of a Hotel! Look no further!
text:
I stayed here with my sister in Nov 2016 for 5 nights. 
The lobby is on the 3rd floor so at the entrance you are met by courteous security staff who direct you to the hotel lifts, I liked the fact that the hotel had security. Once in the lobby - which is bright and cheerful, a perfect spot to rest after a busy day or meet up with friends - you are met by the happiest reception staff I have ever seen. Any time I had course to interact with the reception staff I found them extremely helpful and polite. Check-in was a breeze - just what you need after a long flight, and we were in our room on the 17th floor in no time. I had booked a double with two beds and a city view and that is what I got - with a perfect view looking up 6th Ave. The room and bathroom were both spotless with all the amenities we could ever need, including a fridge and a safe - vital in my book! 
Breakfast is served on the lobby level at a Starbucks counter - some may find the breakfast limited - but we found it more that enough to start our day. Having paid for breakfast inclusive we were had to avail of the guest deal - otherwise you can order anything off the menu. The guest deal was a beverage (tea / herbal tea/ coffee) and then either one hot item (BLT / Bagel / Ham & Cheese Croissant) or two items from the cold counter (fruit / yogurt / juice / water / muffin / croissants). I chose herbal tea, blueberry muffin and a bottle of water for my bag, my sister chose tea and a Ham & Cheese Croissant. We were both very satisfied with our choices, and once again the staff were very helpful and polite.
There is a subway stop right outside the door, but as the location of this hotel is one of it's best features we found that we walked everywhere - 10 mins to Time square. A cab from the top of 5th Ave to our hotel cost us $10.
The hotel also has a small gym and a private laundry room for guests - use your room key to enter.
Yes there is a bar on the 18th floor "The Monarch". The Monarch is a separate business and not connected to the hotel. The bar and hotel share the same entrance hall - it has 3 lifts, 2 for the hotel and 1 for the bar. The Monarch has it's own doorman waiting to guide you to the appropriate lift. The Monarch is fantastic - the best views of Empire State you will find - and the cocktails are just too good to miss.
So after check-in we put down our bags and headed off to explore the city happy in the knowledge that we had a secure, spotless and comfortable hotel waiting for us upon our return.
I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to my fellow traveler. The staff are the excellent, the location is beyond compare, the breakfast is perfect, and the added extra of the rooftop bar makes the 'Courtyard by Marriott @ Herald square' the only place to stay when in NYC.

title: Hidden Gem
text:
I have been wanting to write this review for a year and keep forgetting!! But we are heading to NYC again and staying again at this hotel. We stayed last January and were newbies to the city. 

We were greeted very warmly by a nice young man who was very professional and friendly.  Our room was extremely clean and our view of the Empire State building was awesome.  I had read some reviews about the loud noise from club upstairs. We never heard the club noise ever and we were up close. This time around we actually want to try out the club upstairs. 

This hotel is close to every thing.  Its is a hidden gem I believe. It made our first experience in  the city very easy.  Everyone at this hotel was very nice and seemed like they like their jobs. Always smiles on their face. 

We are coming to stay here again next week after Thanksgiving and actually talked our friends into staying here too. I hope its everything we remember.

title: Fab New York Girlie Trip
text:
My Self & two friends stayed here for my best friends 40th Birthday! 
The hotel was fabulous with a roof top bar which we never really got round to using! 
The staff were so lovely & helpful, I had a package delivered & they called the room right away as soon as it arrived!
The location was so very Central 5/10min walk from time square, over the road from Macy's which was fab especially being able to run over there to grab last minute presents before leaving! 
Only thing is you can hear all the traffic all the time, an it has a high traffic leave even in the night!

title: Can't beat the location!!!
text:
I was so torn on weather this would be a good location because we usually stay in Times Square.....this will be our new Hotel!!!

Location!!!! Location!!! Location!!!  The hotel sits on the corner of 5th ave and 34th street...literally next door to the train station and directly across the street from Macy's.

Customer service was great! Definitely a 10 in my book.

title: In The Thick of It
text: The Courtyard New York Manhattan/Herald Square is very close to the Macy's and Times Square. That being said, I was able to get a good night's sleep (albeit on a top floor). I thought the room was spacious and the bathroom very modern.

title: Mother/daughter trip
text: We just returned from this hotel in New York. There were four of us and we really enjoyed the stay, close to everything! The bathroom was a little small for four women trying to get ready, but we made it. Clean and everyone was really nice and helpful.

title: Perfect location when visiting NYC
text: This hotel is the perfect location when visiting NYC. It is right near all the major entertainment, without being in the middle of the chaos of Time Square.  Room was smaller than I expected, but reality is I wasn't in NYC to hang out in my room.  It was clean with a great bed. Staff is welcoming and very friendly.

title: Ruined Our Wekend in New York
text: Recently we stayed at this Herald Square hotel for 2 weekend nights.  We were traveling to NYC to help our daughter find a wedding gown and to enjoy the city.  Prior to arrival the front desk manager had promised  that we would be upgraded to an executive king room with city views in view of our status as Marriott platinum guests.  When we arrived the promised room was not offered to us so we were given an ordinary king room with no view to speak of.   That night when we came back to the hotel around 10 pm we encountered a party at the end of our hall.  We noticed that there were a number of people hanging out in the hall smoking cigarettes and otherwise being rowdy.  We immediately brought this situation to the attention of the hotel but the partying continued until at least 1 am.  Our room smelled of cigarette smoke as a result of the people in the hall.  Another minor problem in comparison was that our television kept going on and off which management could not fix.  The next morning we asked if the problem guests were going to be staying another night and were told they were. We questioned why  the hotel did not evict them and did not get a responsive answer. We were told the hotel was "looking" into the matter.  We then told the manager that we needed to change rooms and management accommodated by moving us to the same executive king we were suppose to have been assigned the first night.  Unfortunately, I had to pack up our old room that morning and could not go with my wife and daughter to search for a wedding dress.  This was a huge disappointment to all of us.  Someone left the executive room we moved to with the window open.  We did not notice the open window until we went to bed but by that time the room was filled with mosquitoes buzzing around our heads while we tried to sleep.  Another annoyance was that there were hairs in the bathroom sink and toilet from the prior guest which housekeeping missed.  As to the hotel, it is nothing to write home about.  It is located on 35th St. near 6th Avenue.  The street it is on is filled with very unattractive  Korean restaurants and the sidewalk while we were there was cluttered with rubbish from those restaurants.  The lobby to the hotel is on the second floor  with the  unattractive entrance on street level.   People line up in front of the hotel at night to get into the club on the top floor making for a struggle to get into the hotel.  So in conclusion, this is an unattractive party hotel, on a busy dirty street, with management not in control of the unruly guests staying there.  Definitely a place to avoid.

title: Amazing Staff!!
text: One of the best Marriott experiences my family and I have ever had. We typically stay at Marriott's when ever we travel but this Marriott had the best customer service we have ever experienced at a hotel.  Michael Rolleri the Bellman made our trip! Helped us to our room, booked us a car to the airport within 5 min of checking in. Michael helped us look for Broadway tickets and helped us navigate the subway system.  We will never stay anywhere else in New York City from now on!!

title: Fine, but not as polished as other Courtyard properties
text: Even though I am a gold member of the Marriott, my room was dark and small and on a low floor - and it was a Monday, not a big theatre night.  No upgrade. I was there on business and appreciated the good quality breakfast and the ease of getting snacks etc there - and of course the location can't be beat for theatre - but I was disappointed in my room although the bed was comfortable as almost all Courtyards are.

title: Amazing Location!!!!!!
text:
Stayed here In 18th till 25th May for my best friends 40th Birthday with her & another friend! 
The hotel & the staff were amazing so lovely, kind & ever so helpful, the room was gorgeous & had an amazing views towards down town & The empire state building too!!
And the Location well WOW that was amazing so central close to rail links and time square also not too much of a walk to central park too, 
we walked most of the time though out the city & my bestie & friend took the train from Penn station to Washington DC, the station was about a 5 min walk away & bonus Starbucks in the hotel & another over the road from the hotel so could enjoy a coffee first thing & also at end of the night too, 
You do get a coffee machine in the room but only 2 coffee pods left in room even tho there was 3 of us staying in there plus the coffee pods weren't the best not a lot of flavor or strength to them!! 
The Only Two things that let this hotel down was the fact we could hear ALL the traffic outside, I suffer with insomnia so doesn't take much to keep me awake but it also affect the other too! And the other was The Fold out sofa bed not only did it squeak like mad but you could feel every so called springs & the main legs of the sofa not comfy at all!! 
But hay I still thought the hotel was very nice & very clean!!

title: New york Tatili
text: Otel gerek fiyat ve gereksede merkezi konum itibarıyla ilk defa bizim gibi ilk defa newyorka gelecekler için ideal bir otel.Ayrıca temizlik konusunda da çok hassaslar. Odalardaki buzdolapları kahvaltilik gibi alimlari yapabileceğiniz nitelikte.Ama yakınlarda simit sarayini da kahvalti icin kullanabilirsiniz.Otelin 16. Katindaki barın manzarasi ise mükemmel.

title: Halloween weekend!
text:
We've stayed in a few Marriotts but this location by far has the nicest staff ever! 😉

The hotel is at 35th St and 6th Ave.
Close to subway trains (N,R,B,D,F,M)

It's at Herald Square so it's surrounded by huge stores (a block away - 34th St has more stores for shoppers out there)

UrbanSpace Broadway bites offers different kinds of food with outdoor seating.

Penn Station (Amtrak, NJ Transit, LIRR) is also a few blocks away.

When you go in you have to take the elevator to the Lobby to check in.

Rooms are spacious and beds are comfortable.

I suggest to request a High Floor room since it tends to get loud in the busy streets.

K-town is a few blocks away (32nd St) for people in the mood for Ramen and Korean BBQ.

title: Courtyard Marriott Herald Square - great location
text: The room size and prices are about average for NYC -- not bad, but not a bargain, either. What sets this property apart is the outstanding location (across the street from Macy's with subway access right outside the door). Michael, our bellman, knows NYC like the back of his hand and gave us great suggestions and directions. Overall, we're pleased with the property.

title: Excellent!!!
text: I brought my daughter to NYC for the weekend and Courtyard made it so extra special.  Our room had been upgraded when we arrived.  We had room 412. The balcony is as large as the over sized king room.  The concierge was a sweetheart.  Took the time to show us the views from our room even though he was extremely busy. The location is perfect for touring NYC.  Definitely will return to this hotel next time.

title: Solid Midtown Courtyard- conveniently located
text:
I have stayed at this mid-town property about ten times the last year for business (Empire State Building office nearby) and have had a good overall experience. Friendly front desk staff- efficient check in check out and quick elevators (not the long wait you get for both at some large NY properties). Basic but clean, small standard NYC room. Good wifi.

Good location to Penn Station - quick walk and right next to Path and subway. Request high room away from street noise. Close to Times Sq. and could be could be good base for weekend tourism.

title: Run of the mill Marriott
text:
Pros-close to Macy's, a stones throw. 5th Ave shopping the other side. V central. All the other reviewers were right, the two concierges were fantastic. Helped with bags, bookings and even got us a great deal on an airport cab. Full range of eateries and sights nearby.
Cons-small, expensive for what it, is really a bed in a box with no atmosphere or real views. But, I guess NYC space is at a premium.

title: Ideal Location Just Below Times Square
text: The Coutyard Herald Square is located at the junction of 35th St and 6th Avenue and so ideally situated for access to Lower Manhattan from 34th St Station or Upper Manhattan.  Macy's is across the road, The Empire State one block up, Times Square is a 10 minute walk and for those travelling in/out of NYC by train, the hotel is ideally placed for Penn Station and 33rd St PATH Station.  Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable and servced as a perfect base for our 3 days in NYC

title: All around superb.
text:
Location: just a short walk from Macy's and many other stores, and from the Empire State building. An easy10-minute walk to the Times Square area.
Entrance: doesn't look like an entrance to an hotel, because the lobby is on the 4th floor.
Lobby: modern - almost European design. Very inviting, with a very nice view of Herald Square below.
Staff: Like a 5-star hotel with the warmth of a family run boutique hotel.
Room - spacousl, modern clean, inviting.

title: NYC & cruise
text: Excellent location. Rates are fair and worth the cost. Excellent service, rooms are standard but comfortable. Highly recommend for a tourist stay I NYC. Within walking distance to many sites as well as tour buses.

title: Excellent Stay for a party of 10.
text: Rooms are very comfortable and serviced well.Location is excellent with easy access to the Subway and many bars and restaurants. All the staff were polite and helpful and special praise for Michael the concierge who provided much advice and arranged the taxi for trip back to JFK.

title: Basic hotel - lots of plus points
text:
The location of the hotel (as with many others in mid-town Manhattan) is great. It sits virtually on the junction of Broadway, 6th Avenue and 35th Street. The main entrance and exit is directly beside a subway station and opposite the end of Macy's.

The hotel itself has no grand entrance or lobby to speak of on ground floor level, just a small door with access to 4 lifts, one of which is used to access the rooftop bar (Monarch).

On the floor above is the actual lobby with checkin desks and breakfast cafe. Its all OK - modern but nothing fancy at all.

The rooms are on the small side and the beds also smaller than we have experienced in other New York hotels. Clean and well maintained. Wifi in the room was excellent - Free and with a strong signal and good speed.

Overall - the hotel didn't have any glaring faults as such. The staff were all helpful and friendly when we interacted with them.

Its just a basic mid-town hotel of which there are dozens. Nothing to write home about, but a perfect location for touring the island.

The rooftop bar is very popular at weekends and should be reserved if you intend visiting it at that time. Midweek its a lot quieter and you are effectively right next to the Empire State building drinking cocktails - nice.

title: TREMENDOUS
text: Very, very nice stay in a great room (1612). We changed hotels to this one using the Marriott app. We immediately had more space and light. Nice bathroom and hotel staff. Special mentions to Yailly and Corey on reception. So nice and helpful. This could be our first choice in New York for the future. We opted for a larger room on booking.

title: Friendly,warm, knowledgeable & kind personnel/staff
text: Ben (of Morocco) helped us w/our luggages,airport transfers + assisted us on the sights & the attractions of Manhattan. Last time we were in Manhattan was in 2008 & much had changed. Took us down to the subway/Metro station & helped us with our Metro card & destinations. Knowledgeable & friendly to all!

title: Séjour agréable en plein Manhattan !
text: La location de l'hôtel est sûrement le plus gros point positif ! Situé juste à côté de Koreatown dans Manhattan, proche de tout avec le métro juste en face de l'hôtel. L'hôtel est moderne, les équipements étaient pratiques, la salle de sport était un gros plus. Les lits étaient un peu petits, nous étions 4 dans une chambre de deux lits doubles, c'était légèrement petit mais on s'y fait rapidement. Le personnel très agréable et serviable. Il y a -20% au bar rooftop de l'hôtel qui devient également une boîte de nuit le soir.  La vue de la chambre sur la ville est juste top !

title: Toller Hotel in einer "tollen" City
text: War alles ok! Sehr freundliches Personal, hilfsbereit und gut gelegen zu allen Sehenswürdigkeiten von Manhatten. Gut auch die fussläufige Lage zur Penn-Station. Aber Vorsicht beim Buchen! Je nachdem von welchem Portal und zu welcher Zeit ist der Preisunterschied erheblich! Wir hätten bei einer vor Ort Buchung bei 3 Nächten ca. 600 Euro sparen können.

title: Repeat Visitors
text: This is our favorite hotel now.  We've stayed three times and will continue to return here.  It's easy to drive to from Lincoln Tunnel.  Easy to valet.  Easy checkin.  Wonderful rooms.  Most excellent security and door staff!!!  Roof top bar is super cool.  Great staff and close to everything you want on a NYC vacation.  I really like it here.  Special shout out to Nidia, Allecia and Chacoya!  Thank you for treating us like special visitors.  We know you do this all day, every day, but we just feel special every time we come.

title: Great location
text: I had a great stay. Staff on check in were efficient and helpful.  My room was good size and not just for NYC with modern fit and finish. Internal room noise was fine and external was good until 5 AM.  WiFi is included as part of room rate which is nice.  The hotel has pretty central location close to several subway stops and walkable to restaurants, etc.  Rate ead readonable by nyc standards.  Definitely worth another visit next time I'm in NYC.

title: Muy buen hotel con una única observación
text: Sinceramente el hotel cuenta con muy buenas instalaciones, atención y, como muchos han mencionado, excelente ubicación. De hecho, tanto por motivos de negocios como con fines turísticos, está perfectamente localizado, a 10 metros de un subte. El único punto a considerar es la calidad de descanso, mucho barullo que impide -por momentos- dormir. Conversando con algunos colegas, todos han tenido este inconveniente, sin importar el piso donde se hospedaban.

title: Simply amazing
text: While the room itself is nothing special (it is nice though), what makes this hotel amazing are the people working here, in particular one of the bellboys Michael. He gave us many tips and helped us out so much. He should be paid much more than he is and he made our trip to New York special. I would definitely recommend this hotel over any others I'm NYC because of him.

title: Posizione ottima
text:
Ci sono stata con le mie sorelle tra maggio e giugno 2016. La posizione è ottima, viicino al centro e ad una fermata della metro. La nostra camera non era grandissimas, ma confortevole, pulita e molto silenziosa; anche il bagno era abbastanza grande e sempre pulito.
Se dovessi tornare a New York, sicuramente sceglierei ancora questo albergo.

title: Convenient location
text: We stayed four nights and were very pleased with the location - we arrived by train from Newark airport and the hotel is a quick and easy walk from Penn station (even with luggage). There is another subway station right outside the hotel and you can easily walk to Times Square, shops, restaurants and the Empire State Building is literally round the corner. Our room wasn't enormous but was certainly big enough for the 4 of us and to be honest we didn't spend much time in the room. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, especially Michael.

title: Short Stay in Manhattan
text: Great location, a few minutes walk to all the great attractions of NY. The rooms are of a decent size for Manhattan. Macy's is across the road for people who wanna shop. Plenty of restaurants in and around. I wishes I had stayed longer, will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfectly situated hotel with very quiet rooms
text: Stayed here, 2 adults 2 teenagers, for three nights end August. 9th floor family room. Very quiet room. No outside traffic or hotel guest noise. Perfect central location for everything. Very clean and top hotel facilities too. Will definitely recommend to all our friends and family thinking of visiting NYC. Well worth the money.  Beds and pillows very comfy, air con perfect temperature, clean bathroom with spacious shower and enough wardrobe space for a few days clothing for a family of four and space in room for four large suitcases too! After ten days in Florida we had a fantastic end to our holiday in New York with our two teenagers - could have done with more time though by school beckons!! Oh well, will have to return back again with them another time to fit it all in! Can really recommend hiring bikes for an hour or two in Central Park. Very good fun - even if you haven't managed to ride a bike for at least 20 years!!! ;) now we need another holiday to recharge our batteries!

title: Hotel funcional, limpio, bien ubicado y  con excelente personal
text: Un hotel limpio, cómodo y funcional, con habitaciones amplias para NYC, con un excelente trato y profesionalidad por parte su personal, especialmente  Rosemary, muy bien ubicado en el centro de Manhattan, y con una boca de metro a la salida del hotel,  que te permite acceder cómodamente a qualquier zona de NYC

title: Buen Hotel
text: En verdad es un muy buen hotel las instalaciones son fantásticas y la ubicación inmejorable.El personal es amable y agradable.Está muy bien ubicado a pasos de la  gran tienda Macy's y de una plaza muy linda.Todas las grandes tiendas como Zara,H&M,Uniqlo,Gap se encuentran a solo metros.El sector es muy bueno y hace que el barrio se entretenido.Fuera de Macy's hemos visto desde protestas políticas a clases de Zumba gratuitas.El hotel cuenta con un Starbucks dentro del Hotel para tomar desayuno (no incluido) y un agradable y bien equipado gimnasio.También cuenta con una lavandería que funciona con monedas y te regalan el detergente en recepción.Abajo en el primer piso se encuentra la entrada para un Bar/Restaurant con ascensor propio ,que se llama "Monarch" y promete lindas vistas y buen ambiente.El código de vestimenta es formal .

title: Close but not too close to Times Square
text:
This hotel is well situated in mid-town, close enough to walk wherever you need to go, but blissfully far enough away from the madding crowds of Times Square.

Rooms are good-sized and very clean.  Staff greeted me each morning with a cheerful smile.  Get a higher floor for less city noise.

title: Ottima posizione, peccato per il resto
text:
La fortuna di questo hotel è quella di trovarsi a due passi da Times Square e adiacente ad una stazione della metropolitana. Per quanto riguarda le camere e la lobby assolutamente mediocri, nulla di entusiasmante pur trattandosi di un quattro stelle. Nota dolente il servizio, il personale della lobby non cortese, idem per le addette alla prima colazione, in bagno non c'erano cuffie per doccia nè alcun tipo di confort al di fuori del sapone e ciliegina sulla torta un giorno non mi è stata rifatta la camera (pur essendo rientrati alle 4 di pomeriggio) e quando ho chiesto spiegazioni mi è stato detto che ormai la cameriera era andata via e che potevano darmi le cose che mi servivano per il bagno.Senza contare il fatto che pagando veramente abbastanza siamo stati ad un piano relativamente basso e non c'è stata possibilità di cambiarla ( andrebbero forse applicate delle differenziazioni per le camere dei piani piu alti?). 
Altra nota negativa: il CAR SERVICE..avevo prenotato il trasferimento per l'aereoporto  alle ore 11:15, alle ore 10:50 rientro in albergo per prendere i bagagli e noto sotto il palazzo una limousine bianca, dal concierge ho la conferma che si tratta della nostra auto, peccato che quando soli dieci minuti dopo scendiamo con i bagagli per partire, la limousine non ci sia più..inutile dire che oltre alla delusione si è aggiunto uno stato stress non indifferente per la ricerca di un taxi che ci portasse in tempo in aereoporto.
Solo un giorno ho provato la colazione dell'hotel e non era assolutamente nulla di che. 
Non ritornerò.

title: Location right outside Metro Station
text: The best thing about this place is the location, right outside the Metro, which runs 24 hours in New York. Was there when construction was going on so not much of a view anyhow. Rooms are basic but clean and comfy enough for a hotel in the heart of Manhattan.

title: 위치 최고!
text: 방은 깨끗했지만  맨하튼 시내 호텔이 다 그렇딧 너무너무 좁았어요. 그래도 로비가 넓어서 로비에서 많은 시간을 보냈어요. 건너편이 메이시스 백화점이고, 한인타운 엠파이어 스테이트 빌딩이 도보로 5분이니 위치는 환상적이지요.

title: Good but not great!
text:
My boyfriend and I are still in 2 minds about this hotel. The location is good, opposite Macy's, a block from the Empire State and 5 mins wall from Times Square. The downside about the location is that there were quite a few homeless people about and the subway stank! We had to hold our breath walking on the street outside. 

We visited NYC with my boyfriends brother, he booked a deluxe king and we booked the standard king. The price difference was around £300. The rooms were EXACTLY the same! Same view, room space, same everything. Don't waste the additional money. Also don't pay extra for a city view, the hotel is on the corner of the block so every room has a city view. 

The room itself was very very small, even by NYC standards. We've stayed in a couple of hotels in New York, all other rooms have been double the size of this one. We had 2 large cases as we'd been travelling for a month and it was a nightmare trying to find space. Although tiny, it was spotless! Couldn't fault the cleaning! 

The staff were all superb and very friendly, minus one young blonde girl on reception who was rude when we checked out and who didn't seem to care that we needed to collect our bags. The hotel organised a car to the airport for a flat rate, would definitely recommend this! 

All in all its an average hotel which is overpriced because of its location. We wouldn't recommend it purely because the room was uncomfortably small and the smell outside was disgusting!

title: DISSAPOINTED
text: well im a marriot member as this was ny 1st marriott in ny so this trip as last trip was dissapointed! once again this july trip was nt respectful as i reserved on January with my specific requests as my room ciew prefference with 6 MONTHS in ADVANCE so what happened? the room was nt locked for my arrival even i wrote to manager by email on january too but been given wrong room view as also no extra towel and worse no toiletries!! my patience ran out!! but i was so tired as i came long international trip with 2 family members so i said clearly 6 months before my arrival..extra toilettries towels as room view prefference...gee!! i really wish Mr lewis the original director(he was transferred to other location) should return cuz Mr Lewis truly listen respectfuly as also lock room so with Mr Lewis in charge,my trips were pleassant!!...not sure if ill return again but some employers since my 1st time as Jose still work there as Jose cheer me and my family (mom speaks spanish as my hubby speaks english) in their languages so i had forgotten my dissapointment thanks to Jose with positive energy as cheerful!! ill consider to return again in future and hopefully next time should be more proffessional even i complained about toilettries as towels as been offered to move other room next day of my arrival but it did nt happened...that is really annoying!!

title: Awesome Location with Great Service!
text: I stayed here with my family for a NYC weekend getaway.  The hotel is in a great location that is close to theaters, Time Square and the Empire State Building.  There is a Subway station conveniently located right out side the hotel entrance.  The rooms and bathrooms are a good size for NYC.  Our room was very clean and comfortable.  The best part of our stay was the excellent customer service from the hotel staff.  Everyone was very friendly and accommodating.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Hotel buono in posizione ideale
text:
L'hotel molto commerciale ha il grande vantaggio di essere in un'ottima posizione, a due passi da Times square e con la metro di fianco all'ingresso. 
Pro: camera grande, come da nostra scelta, e molto pulita. 
Personale molto cordiale e disponibile.
Contro: abbiamo scelto la camera con vista ma le finestre era molto sporche all'esterno. Capiamo la difficoltà nel pulirle dall'esterno, ma così ci è stata tolta una bella vista dall'11 piano (vista però pagata)

title: Great Choice for a Weekend Trip to NYC
text: Stayed here for a weekend away with family. Wonderful location, central to much of what we wanted to do. Its also next to a subway station, so getting other places is very easy. The room was clean and modern. Bathroom was smaller, but I'm assuming typical of the city. Staff was very friendly, and always warmly greeted us when entering the hotel. The entrance was also very secure, with security present. The rooftop bar is a must! It has amazing views of the Empire State building. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Excelente em todos os aspectos!
text:
O hotel é excelente! Localização perfeita, ao lado do metrô com linhas que atendem plenamente, e de diversas lojas pra todos os gostos, além de restaurantes e farmácias (que vendem de tudo!)!!  Atendimento nota 10, tanto no check in, no check out e durante o tempo que lá ficamos. Pacotes de compras recebidos no hotel antes da nossa chegada e sem nenhum custo. Quartos amplos o suficiente para um casal e duas crianças, além de limpos e novos. E a acústica é muito boa, ainda que tenhamos que lidar com muita gente mal educada, que não apenas grita nos seus quartos, mas também no corredor...A relação custo x benefício é boa, especialmente quando se trata de
NYC, que tem o custo muito alto na hotelaria. Só não recomendo o serviço de translado que o hotel sugere, para o aeroporto, que é terceirizado, pois foi combinado um preço comigo e depois dito outro...então, pegue o taxi ou o uber, é mais prático!

title: Bel hôtel
text: Nous avons passé deux nuits dans cet hôtel qui était vraiment très propre, bien localisé et les gens y étaient vraiment très sympathique. Les chambres y sont bien. Il y a une terrasse/lounge sur le toit qui en vaut vraiment la peine, la vue est très belle.

title: GREAT! "Hotel-Staff-Location-Stay"
text: The hotel is well located. You are next to Macys, Empire State Building, few blocks away of Time Square and more sightseeing ... The room is good for a family of four (try to get a corner room for good view). The staff are very very nice, helpful and professional. If we come back to New York for sure we will stay again at Marriott Courtyard !

title: Excellent location
text: Loved the location, walking to Macy's took us maximum one minute, the whole shopping area is just there and food everywhere, Times Square about 5 minutes walk. Empire State Building also walking distance about 3 minutes walking. Highly recommended.

title: Tolle Lage, toller Ausblick
text: Zimmer im 16. Stock mit direktem Blick auf das Empire State. Zimmer im 16. Stock war sehr ordentlich und neu eingerichtet. Frühstücksraum und Lobby im ersten Stock etwas spartanisch, aber mit Kleinem Starbucks vor Ort in der Lobby. Sehr freundliches Personal, hilfsbereit. Hotel sauber und gepflegt. U-Bahnanschluss Herald Square.

text:

title: Ottima la posizione
text: L'hotel é nel suo complesso più che accettabile. Le camere sono un po' datate e non molto grandi, almeno per 3 persone. Ottima la posizione: vicinissima la metro, l'empire e Times square. Personale nella norma. Insomma hotel che non mi ha entusiasmato, riflette i pregi ed i difetti di una grande catena.

title: Good old Courtyard, but things have changed
text: Have stayed at Courtyards for years, and the new breakfast format is not appealing.  Stressful way to start the day, and some of the wait staff were downright snarky.  Nonetheless, I'm sticking with Marriott.

title: Excellent location
text:
Nice for business travellers and even those staying for a short while to go around NY and head off to the airport.
Rooms are not that big but quite comfy beds, but clean.
Staffs are just friendly as any Marriott Hotel.
There's a bar but was not able to check it as this hotel is so close to shops and dining areas. Quite close to Empire State from Herald square and from my bedroom window i can just see the Empire state at night.

title: New York Medical Trip with children
text: This hotel was very friendly from check in to check out. We were immediately greeted by a very courteous valet who helped us throughout our stay. Jose definitely made our stay less stressful by answering our questions and giving us directions. We frequently travel to children's hospitals and stay in hotels a lot. This hotel is very kid friendly. It is easily handicap accessible as well.They are also very sensitive to those with medical needs. The room was spacious and very tidy. I will definitely stay here again when my family visits the big apple.

title: Great hotel in the centre of all the action
text:
Stayed at this hotel back in April for our anniversary. Prior to arriving I called to request a package to make the occasion special. I was told there was no such packages, disappointed but decided to keep this hotel as it was on the centre of town.

It's located right at Herald Square, lots of people around at all hours so it's safe for solo travelers and those who want to explore the city by foot. The subway station as well.

The main lobby was confusing but found out it was located on the 2nd floor not on the main floor. The room was small but clean, bathroom was clean but the tile floor was cold as we went on a cold weekend and no heat ventilation in there.
You can hear the traffic noise outside from trucks making deliveries early in the morning, but it's expected if you stay in the city.
All the places we ate at were within 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel.
Overall had a pleasant stay and will definitely stay here again.
*I did a review specifically for the hotel and expressed my disappointment. The manager did apologize for being misinformed and promise to look into the matter.

title: Jose is a miracle worker and has the patience of Job
text: This was a family trip with my parents, my family and my brother's family with 8 adults/older kids and 1 toddler.  Jose coordinated and managed our local travel throughout the city and an out-of-town excursion.  He also mapped out a daily plan for us to see all the sites that we specified in the time allotted.  Jose was in constant contact with me and I could reach him as needed.  He went above and beyond to make our stay in NYC great especially dealing with my dad and his demands (that is where the patience came in).  Also, recommend going to the Monarch Rooftop lounge.  The view is spectacular and the staff was helpful and courteous.  The drinks are unique and good.

title: Good for the last year
text:
The attentive, friendly staff on the ground and lobby make this a good Courtyard. Herald square is loud on the low floors. Location convenient to Penn station, Macy's and 2 great steakhouses nearby.
A neat unaffiliated bar Monarch on the roof offers great views of the empire state building

title: Great  Location, Ok hotel
text:
First I must say that you can't beat the location of this hotel if you are a tourist. Subway is literally right outside the door, off/on tour buses are a block away as is the Empire State Building, lots of places to eat and shop are close. Location  = 5.

Now with respect to the hotel service, cleanliness, I'd say it was average - what you'd expect a hotel to be. Nothing over the top to wow you. Small issues prevent me from ranking it higher: sleeping guard when we arrived our first night,  (The staff  were professional) unclean elevator, certain items unavailable for the free breakfast, facial tissue box empty and not replaced. Service = 3

Overall score = 4

title: Michael is the bomb!!!!!!!
text: the hotel is a little small and the reservation staff on the phone is a little misguiding but the staff at the hotel is phenomenal!!! Michael the doorman is the NICEST person i have ever met! made my stay so much nicer. I'll stay here again just because hes so nice!!

title: New Year in New York
text:
A perfect hotel in the center of Manhattan. We stayed for a week, two grown-ups and two boys 14 & 12 years old. There where a few mistakes in the booking but they fixed it and gave us compensation. The Concierge Mike was very helpful when  planning theater tickets, helicopter, restaurants etc. 
The breakfast was served in the hotel lobby at Starbucks. You could pay extra to get breakfast included. The menue was like all other Starbucks.
We highly recommend this hotel because of location and price.

title: Fantastic room & service
text:
Arrived at 9am on a Friday, much earlier than check-in time. I was planning on checking my bags and coming back when a room was ready, but they were able to give me a room immediately. The concierge/doorman was amazing - very friendly and helpful, remembered my face as I came in and out of the hotel and checked in to see how my stay was going. The room was clean and modern looking, and the location is perfect - just a few steps from a number of subway lines, with food, shopping, and sight seeing just around the corner. Walking distance to penn station, even with my luggage.
The only cons were the price of a soda from the market (but this is NYC), and the only chair in the room was a desk chair which was a bit awkward and small.

title: Great service!
text:
Yes, the location is superb - practically at Macy's front door, & on the edge of the garment district. But the staff is what makes this more than just a spot to dump your bags! Everyone, from the bellmen who greet you at the door (& you're lucky if Michael & Jose are on that day!!!) to the front desk staff, to maintenance (to quickly clear a slow shower drain) & housekeeping, all are friendly, efficient, and helpful. 

My only complaint (please hear me management!) is that there were insufficient towel bars in the bathroom, and we were just a couple. For overnight, it was not a big problem, so I still rated 5 stars.  If we had been staying several nights, it would've been an more of an annoyance.

title: Bon emplacement et tres propre
text:
Sejour en fevrier, reservation d une chambre double skyline au 16e etage.
Chambre bien equipee, tres propre mais vue un peu decevante meme si c etait assez impressionnnat. Pas de vue sur Empire State tout proche....
Petit dejeuner decevant et assez cher mais, frigo et cafetiere dans la chambre donc, possibilite de s organiser.
Hotel securise a l entree 24h/24
Position en ville exceptionnelle pour tout faire a pieds, ou presque.
A quelques metres de la 5th avenue, proche de Time Square, de restaurants, du Madison.....
Personnel toujours present a la reception, acces libre a des ordinateurs et une imprimante, wifi gratuit.
Tres silencieux.
Eviter les distributeurs a l accueil en cas de petite faim, avec les taxes, c est hors de prix et vraiment pas bon (pizza congelee) !!!!
Bref, rapport qualite/ prix correct pour Manhattan mais, skyline pas utile a mon avis.

title: Excellent
text: Great Location. Near Macys and Victoria secret, easy walk to Empire state and down town times square , would stay here again. Great place a couple of doors up to eat a big smorgas board type place. Bar on roof top.

title: Wonderful hotel and awesome concierge!
text: We stayed at this hotel this past weekend for a family trip to New York. The hotel was in a great location just across from Herald Square and Macy's. The subway was literally steps from the hotel doors which was very convenient for getting around the city. The rooms were not large (which was to be expected in NYC), but were very clean and comfortable. But what really made this stay a 5 star for us was the service of Jose, the concierge. He was WONDERFUL! He took the time to tell us what sights to see in lower Manhattan and then even went down to the subway station with us to show us how to purchase Metro tickets and showed us which trains we would need to take. To us, that went above and beyond which we greatly appreciated! In addition, he also helped us with some breakfast and dinner recommendations (which were great!) and also got a car for us to return to the airport the day we left. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. Thanks again Jose!

title: 6 days stay near to Macy's
text:
Room was good...
Awesome Location...
But quality of Service is not good
No complimentary breakfast so had to run for breakfast everyday.
No creamer/Sugar provided for coffee as well
Did not get the room in proper time, had to wait for two hours to get the room.

title: Great location, clean hotel with friendly staff
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights - the location was excellent - walk out of the hotel and there is the metro. 
The Empire States Building(which is literally right there!)  is your view from the roof top bar - which is a must! Make great cocktails
Rooms were clean, wifi was fast and free.
Enjoyed the toiletries on offer - reminded me of a previous trip to Thailand.
With the windows closed - the noise of the streets below was fairly muted.
Friendly helpful staff - especially Michael!

title: Great location
text:
Will come back.
Mike is very helpful and salute to room cleaning service.
Good service at small cafe next to reception.
Quick check in process.
1 minute walk to Macys and H&M and found a fabric shop with lovely fabric selections at 35th Street between 8th Avenue & 7th Avenue, before Staples.

title: Weekend Trip to See a Broadway Show
text: The Courtyard Marriott at Herald square is right across from the Macy's. There is a subway station right next door. The staff could have been nicer and the getting up and down from the rooftop bar was a pain. Lots of people from the city go to the rooftop bar, so you have to wait for the elevator to take you up. Even if you are staying in the hotel, you have to wait. My other issue is that fact that I was given a room next to the ice machine. Also has a gold member, I was not offered any additional perks outside of late checkout. The bathroom was very small and there is very little to no counter space. The area is good for getting to all the attractions by train.

title: Living next to Macy's
text: Ideally located next to the largest Macy's in the world, the hotel is few steps from its main entrance. It is a small hotel with limited rooms but clean and well maintained. Like most New York hotels in Manhattan, the hotel is old. Doesn't offer complimentary or special rate for breakfast, nor has the best of services. However, the experience was pleasant, staff and security individuals at the main entrance were very friendly.

title: posizione eccezionale...
text:
l'hotel è molto curato, personale gentile e disponibile.
La colazione non è male per essere a New York dove in genere non viene neppure preparata...
non è dotato di reception a piano strada ma al primo piano... tutto ciò non comporta alcun disagio.
buon rapporto qualità prezzo sempre considerano la città in cui ci si trova!!!

title: Great location!
text: This hotel is in a wonderful location, one street up from the Empire State Building and across the street from Macy's. Rooms are a tad small but this should be expected when it comes to Manhattan hotel rooms. This hotel is excellent value for money, hotel staff are very helpful.

title: Wonderful Stay at the Courtyard Herald Square
text:
We had stayed on Times Square during our previous two visits to NYC and we wanted to try a location somewhat away from the huge crowds.  Right from the moment we arrived at the hotel we were made to feel welcome and our room was upgraded (I'm a Platinum Member) to a corner suite with a fabulous view.  The room was beautifully appointed and every single staff member we interacted with was exceptional. This hotel is located across the street from a Duane Reade pharmacy, near many restaurants and the Greeley Square food area and close to Koreatown.  Macy's is across the street and the subway is within steps of the entry.  

Special thanks to Michael, the bellman and concierge, for his kind service and for setting us up with a great ride back to the airport.  We definitely recommend this hotel without any hesitation and would stay here again during future visits.

title: Great location, great room
text: As soon as you walk into a room you know - and this one was great. Big enough, especially by New York standards and for the price it was a great size. No funky smells, no weird stains, the room was in great shape. The staff was friendly - and the location is the BEST. Walking distance to everything - we will definitely stay here again without hesitation.

title: Pros & Cons Summarized
text:
Hello,

I stayed at the hotel for 1 night. Here is a summary of my experience along with what I think are the pros and cons. 

I paid around 170 for 1 night. The hotel is located right next to empire state building, Macys and broadway. There is no parking facility. The closest garage charges you 65$ for 24 hrs. Check in - check out process is smooth and quick. Hotel staff is very polite and nice.

PROS
----------------------

1. Location is great if you just want to walk around in times square.
2. Rooms are relatively neat and tidy
3. Hotel staff was great to any requests
4. There is free basic wifi

CONS
----------------------

1. Value for money is bad. The rooms are extremely small
2. No breakfast included with the money. You can pay extra $$ for it. We did not have even water bottles in our room which was strange. We had to ask for brushes and paste.
3. Parking is bad, and the nearest parking garage (Icon Parking) has no discounts for this hotel but has for others in the area like hilton which is in the same price range
4. There is always a big line in the entrance with people waiting to go to the rooftop bar. its well managed by very strange to always see big lines

Overall I would rate it just average. With this kind of money there could be better options

title: Great location for NYC!!!!!
text: This hotel is the best hotel I have stayed in NYC much more welcoming than the Hudson . Good sized rooms and very clean concierge service excellent. Location could not be better next door to Macey's and loads of good bars and restaurants especially Korean.

title: AWESOME stay for girls weekend in NYC
text: The Courtyard Marriott at Herald Square made our girls trip to NYC fun and stress free. The customer service is great, better than any hotel I have ever stayed in anywhere in the US! We arrived early and they kept our bags for us while we explored the city. They offer discounted tickets to bus tours and other attractions you may want to visit. They give quality advice about which tours are worth your money and give the best service. Jose is a gentleman who works there as a concierge/ resource for guests. He is AMAZING! He took care of us with anything we needed. He even walked to into the Subway station (right outside the hotel by the way) helped us get a metro card and made sure we were getting on the correct train to get us where we were going. He always has a smiling face and is so helpful! He got us an suv to take us to the airport after our stay. Another side note, the Monarch is the rooftop bar at the hotel with a great view of the city and the Empire State Building. I can't say enough about this hotel. The rooms are great, the customer service is great and it's in an awesome location. I recommend this to anyone visiting NYC! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: my 50th birthday
text: my first trip to new york and wot can i say.The hotel is spotlessly clean, rooms immaculate.Less than 10 min walk to times square.Subway right outside hotel which is very convenient if u dont want to be stuck in traffic.Only 3 dollars sigle fare which is extremely good even if ur going downtown or uptown.The beds are very comfortable and the traffic noise didnt bother us.Michael the bellman was extremely helpful telling us the best way to get to places and arranged our transport to the airport.Never had time to try the rooftop bar as we were so tired when we came back we fell asleep right away.Next time i come to new york i will definately b staying here again,

title: NEW YORK HERALD SQUARE
text:
I was welcomed at the hotel upon arrival.  Reception is a few floors up and checking in was painless.  The room was spotless clean with a decent size TV, a coffee machine making fresh ground coffee.  Ample towels and toiletries.  A fridge and huge bed.  The Wi-Fi is the best I've every had in a hotel

I had a corner room overlooking Macy's.  New York is a noisy city and that cant be attributed to the hotel.  This hotel has a plus as its right next to the subway and just two blocks from the Empire State Building.

I wouldn't recommend breakfast at the hotel as its more of a (overpriced) coffee shop and there are plenty of eating places around.

title: Family Holiday
text:
What a fantastic location, right in the centre of Midtown on 6th, directly opposite Macy's (or Messy as we called it (not worth the hassle) and next door to the Empire State so get ahead of the queues (opens at 08:00). A convenience store and bank straight across the street and a Subway entrance outside the front door to take you up and down town (and you can buy a ticket at this subway (not all have the machines). 5-10 minutes to Times Square as Broadway cuts directly across the front of the hotel (this is where you will get the Bus Tours for both up and down town and the night Bus to Brooklyn) and same to Maddison Square Gardens. 
The hotel is clean, tidy and modern and not sprawling, everything is off the lift and you have access to computers in the lobby for general use and printing boarding passes. 
The staff are fantastic and a BIG SHOUT OUT to Michael the doorman.....great attitude, no hassle to do anything for you (book a cab, give direction, advice) a great resource to make your day easier......TOP MAN!
Only downside was the breakfast....Coffee was great but the actual breakfast not so and often options not available (strawberry's for example and with a fruit seller outside each day I'm sure it could be worked out).
Speak to Michael about going to the rooftop bar (not part of the hotel but the lifts are in the same lobby). wonderful views, great bar and very welcoming staff if only to let you have a look around.
All in all, recommended, everything you need on your doorstep.

title: Great location, but tiny.
text:
This hotel is located in a very central part of downtown NYC.  As others have observed, its right to a subway station and has a lot of useful shops etc all around.  There are Starbucks, McDs, Duane Reed etc. all within a few 100 meters of the location and Macy's and H&M right opposite.  Furthermore, Herald Square has a lot to do and on sunday we saw 6th avenue closed off for a street fair!!!  

The Bad:
The rooms are pretty small.  You can understand that when you see the building.  BUT.  The bathroom is the smallest that I have ever seen in any hotel.  The sink is TINY.  You end up making a mess in the bathroom as water splashes all over the place when you do basic things like washing your hands or face.  Its also got only basics (soap, shampoo, lotion), and its the Paul Mitchell stuff that takes forever to get off your hands.

The room has basic amenities...no tea but there is some coffee that isn't the greatest in the world.  Hotel is very stingy with regard to these things as we (family of 4) had only 2-3 sachets.  And while there are real glass tumblers, there are only paper cups for coffee.  Oh and breakfast was not included in our deal.  

Finally, our bus was leaving in the evening so I asked for a late checkout...and they gave me one whole extra hour...which was useless and as a result we checked out early and had to leave our luggage in the lobby while we went out.  Similar to other hotels but not what I expected from the Marriott, especially as I am a rewards club member.  

We barely interacted with the staff...other than the check in and check out (both quite painless and quick) we really didn't see anyone else, so cant really comment on their service.  But our rooms remained clean and neat so I guess they did there job well.  Front desk was well manned and the staff there was friendly and offered good advice.  

So all in all it wasn't a bad stay.  Perhaps my expectations were higher, but clearly not in the same category as other Marriotts that I have stayed at (including other Courtyards).  Location wise its a great place, but one should look around at other options in the area as it was certainly not a cheap stay.

title: Good location and service, small rooms
text: We liked the location of the hotel (literally above a subway station), within walking distance of main attractions (e.g. times square). The service was ok, not overly friendly, not bad. Room service was consistently forgetting to replenish the shower gel and shampoos and the ones we were given were minuscule, literally two drops of shampoo in a small bottle. Plenty of options to have breakfast near the hotel, no need to eat at the hotel's Starbucks (we did it only once in 3 nights). The price for a small room and tiny bathroom was moderate. We booked the city view double and we had an average view of some old roofs. What we disliked a lot was the countless number of homeless people in the area, although we didn't feel unsafe, we weren't comfortable. On weekends there's a big queue to go to a bar on the hotel's roof and it gets loud and crowded. For the remaining 3 nights we went to another Marriott (residence inn on 48th and Lexington) and we got a king studio and breakfast included for a rate that was only a fraction more.

title: Above and Beyond Customer Service
text: I had an overnight stay at this property in December. It's on Herald Square by the Macy's building and within walking distance to Rockefeller Center and the red line. What is memorable about my stay is the customer service I received. I had checked out of my room and left my luggage in storage while I did last minute sight-seeing. I returned to the hotel later than I expected and there was a long queue of people either checking in or checking out and the bellman was busy transporting luggages. I was getting worried that I would miss my transportation as I waited for someone to retrieve my luggage from storage. Fortunately for me, one of the front desk staff,  helped retrieve my luggage for me and I was able to make it on time for my ride home. Thank you! For this, I would return to stay here on my next visit.

title: Hotel mit geiler Rooftop-Bar
text:
Direkt gegenüber von Macy's am Herald Square gelegen.
Wir hatten ein Zimmer mit Kingsize und Cityview. Die Zimmer in dieser Kategorie sind etwas klein und für max. 2 Personen geeignet.
Vom Bett aus konnte man das Empire State sehen. (Zimmer mit Blick auf die 35. St).

U-Bahnstation direkt vor dem Haus. Zum Empire State sind es zu Fuß 5 Minuten, zum Madison S. Garden und zur Penn Station 10 min. und zum Times square max. 15 min.

Nach dem Check out kann man noch kostenlos sein Gepäck zur Aufbewahrung abgeben. 

Der Hammer ist die Rooftop-Bar mit Blick auf das Empire State.

title: Excelente opción para recorrer Manhattan
text: La ubicación y la comodidad de sus habitaciones convierten as este hotel en una excelente opción para recorrer Manhattan, a metros de una estación de metro, y a solo unas cuadras de lugares como bryantt park, times square, empire state building, etc.

title: Great hotel!
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights and the hotel was perfect for what it was! The staff were really nice and the room was good. Our room had a great view of the Empire State Building.

The only thing I found strange was walking into hotel you meet a queue of people wanting to get up to the rooftop bar. It had its own lift but people found it confusing and got into the hotel lifts where they can't actually access the bar from.

Overall good stay!

title: Amazing holiday
text: It's was our first visit to New York with our friends to celebrate his 50th birthday..This hotel is in ideal location in the centre Manhattan.. Stuff helpful and very friendly.. The hotel was spotlessly clean & so was our room, I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends &family.. Can't wait to comeback again 🇺🇸🗽😊

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Muy buena opción para alojarse en New York.  Frente a Macys, muy buena zona para hacer shopping.  Hay una estación de subte en la esquina.  El hotel está todo renovado, las habitaciones bastante espaciosas para lo que son habitualmente en NY. Recomendable

title: Friendly staff make this hotel special
text: I can't think of another big city hotel where the friendliness and competence of its staff made such ahuge difference in our experience. It turned a fine experience into a memorable one. The building itself is narrow and so the ground floor entrance is somewhat hidden and not particularly welcoming. But the lobby one floor up is well designed and has plenty of natural light. We had a corner room on the 8th floor, also with lots of natural light and a very comfortable bed. The  design of the room and bathroom was clever and subtle-- no ersatz colonial boring sameness. The design choices made the room larger and more inviting than many urban hotel rooms elsewhere. The bathroom is small, but comfortable and, again, well designed and spotless. The work-out room is on the 4th floor and is above average-- clean, excellent signage, all equipment working (which is, in my experience, highly unusual!)-- with the added bonus of a small outdoor patio where, if the weather were better, I would have gone to recover after working out. My only complaint is something the hotel can do nothing about-- sirens and other noise from Herald Square and 6th Avenue. I heard no noise from other rooms in any direction so the walls and doors are clearly thick, but Macy's was doing some kind of incredibly noisy Ninja Turtle promotion for a few hours on Saturday afternoon which made working (much less napping) in the room impossible, even with ear plugs. I can't say enough about the staff though-- from housekeeping to the front desk to the security guards on the ground floor.  Marriott should give them all bonuses because they made the experience for us. The cafe was O.K., but I would have loved advice as to where one could get a hot, sit down NYC  breakfast place nearby. One tip that I didn't discover until later-- Macy's has nice cafes and food choices, surprisingly.  Overall, a very good experience, truly made by the cheer and helpfulness of the hotel's employees. There was only one front desk employee who was a little sour, but her attitude was in the range of 'normal' for big hotels --  I might not have even noticed had it not been so different from everyone else's extraordinary helpfulness and energy. Well done!

title: Nice hotel
text: Hotel was convenient to Times Square and the Empire State building.  Rooms were decent size and clean.  They had the ability to valet my truck which was oversized with no issues.  Would stay there again if the area.

title: Central Location with great staff.
text: The rooms are good size and well equipped with comfortable beds and good soundproofing. We (6 adults) arrived early for check in after transfer from Bayonne Cruiseport and found the front desk staff extremely helpful and polite. They referred us to Jose (doorman) who stored our luggage and fixed us up with sightseeing vouchers and gave us his contact number if we needed any other services. He retained our luggage after checkout the following day until we left for the airport and was a major contributor to the  comfort of our stay and is a great asset to this hotel. The hotel is within easy walking distance of most amenities and I would happily return to this hotel for future visits to NYC.

title: Central Hotel
text:
This hotel is very central for all the tourist attractions. 10 minutes walk to Central Park, Times Square, around the corner from Empire State Building. Very fairly priced.
Hotel very clean,quiet and staff extremely friendly and only too willing to help. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we found a little cafe round the corner who had plenty of choice.
Would return to this hotel , a hidden gem.

title: Great location, decent hotel
text: Bathrooms are ok for NYC standards but a bit small for my standards. The location cannot be beat. Right near 34th Street metro stations and all the shopping. Easy access to uptown or downtown on several subway lines. The rooms are definitely spacious and the added bonus of having a laundry machine (quarters only) in the building definitely sold me on this place. The gym is very basic, a few treadmills and weights and 3 machines. But it was fairly empty during the weekend so not a big deal. The check-in/check-out was quick and easy and the staff seemed nice. If I'm on a budget then I'd definitely stay here again.

title: LOVED THIS HOTEL!
text: This hotel was great. Perfect location, huge room by NY standards, and friendly and accommodating staff. We also got upgraded when we arrived! Jose, who exceeded exceptions beyond a doubt, found laughter on a dreary day.

title: Great hotel, staff, location across from Macy's
text:
Nice and very clean.  Both Jose and MIchael are outstanding bellman/concierge.  Rooms are small but new and very clean.  Do not eat here-  there is Best Bagels a block away past Macy's and Andrews Coffee Shop as well.  Both are better for breakfast.
From here, so easy to get back to Lincoln Tunnel when time to drive home.
I would recommend staying here for proximity to Macy's, Lord and Taylor, and some other shops.  Cab ride to Soho and Village and mid-town.    New and nice.
Unfortunately we could not go to the Monarch bar on roof because of private parties.

title: Best hotel stay ever for  New York City!!!!
