text: Our Hotel stay was perfect. Great location across the street from Macys Subway was right outside the door. What made this stay special was Michael  handling our every need, from checking in to arranging drivers for us. Even texted me on his days off making sure we had everything we needed. Because of flooding in Houston,  we could not fly out on that Monday. Did not know this until we were already at airport and checked out of hotel. We could not fly out till the following day. Again Michael went above and beyond in what I would expect from someone. Also do not want to Forget Jose, He was a great help to us also. Because of Michael and Jose we will l be back, and hope to connect with Michael and Jose again

title: Fantastic apart from TV REMOTE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
text:
Great in all ways possible except for TV remote has no menu button so you have to scroll through every channel to find the one you  want! I would have thought  Marriott
would have spent more on this!
Also food overpriced compared to what you can get right outside the hotel
Staff fantastic helpful in every way possible

title: Not My 1st Choice
text:
This hotel has some good things going for it, and some not-so-good things going for it.

We felt these items were good:
- The Location.  Very convenient to the subway and Penn Station, as well as the rest of Midtown.
- The People.  Every employee we came into contact with at this hotel was very friendly and helpful.

We felt these items were, well, not-so-good:
- The Noise.  Unfortunately the noise coming up from the street was noticed all night long.  Yes, we understand Manhattan is a noisy place.  However, we've stayed in many a Midtown hotel and this one was by far the noisiest.  Perhaps a room on the back side of the hotel would be better.  Next time we'll book a different place we like, which is in a mid-block location.
- The Elevators.  Every time we needed to use the elevator, we had to wait.  And wait.  And wait.  Add to this that the lobby is not on the ground floor, when we needed to stop at the lobby, there was an additional wait for an elevator.
- The Decor.  We were told this hotel is only two years old.  Maybe it's a Courtyard thing.  The room was, shall we say, quite plain.  The bed was a bit soft.  We would have liked an easy chair in the room, like many other hotels have, and there was plenty of space for one.  Other than these things, the room was fine.  Just a bit blah.

To sum up, a bit noisy, a bit plain, a bit weird.  But not terrible.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Loved this hotel so much 1st time in nyc michael and jose so helpful if we ever get chance to go again wud definetly stay here wslking distance to everything spotless clean and around the corner from mcds 😄🗽👍

title: My Favorite NYC Hotel
text: This is my go to hotel when visiting NYC.  The location can't be beat.  Easy walk from Penn Station and Subway right outside.  The staff is outstanding, friendly and helpful.  A big plus is the Starbucks right in the lobby/reception area.  I have stayed here twice so far and will back for a third visit in May.  It was a bit more expensive this time of year, but to me absolutely worth the price.  Highly recommend!!

title: Great Stay
text: Awesome staff and great rooms . Location is right next to subway station and also centrally located . Staff was alway very friendly and helpful. Plenty of nearby restaurants and shopping. Rooms and common areas clean and updated. Will use hotel again on next stay.

title: Perfect Location
text: This was a great location to touring New York City! It's been recently renovated, so it's nice and updated!  Good location for shopping too! Right near Macys!  Nice little Irish pub nearby for a quick meal after a long day of touring!

title: Absolutely amazing stay!
text: Very impressed with this hotel!  The room was huge and clean and had an awesome view.  The staff was absolutely fantastic!  Every interaction was the perfect combination of friendly and professional.  The bellman assistant Michael arranged a car for us and was so helpful.  Best service I've ever received from a hotel!

title: Great location, 2 comfy beds, Marriott - quality service, reasonable prices
text:
This hotel has everything we needed for a visit to the City. The location is just 2 blocks from Penn Station (so arriving by train or from JFK is convenient without a taxi), and is just a few steps from the Herald Square subway entrance (D, R, F and other trains easily connect). We had a quiet room with 2 beds, refrigerator, coffee maker - all the amenities of a standard Marriott Courtyard hotel. Breakfast is available in the spacious lobby that is upstairs from the entrance level - so it is a calm place to plan your day in the big city. Dining/shopping/theater/meeting options are just a short walk away - the location is 35th St and 6th Ave, so, e.g., Korea Town is just 2 blocks south with restaurants, bakeries, shops. And the major locations are easily accessible for a nice long walk in the City or a short cab ride if you opt out of the subway: for example, Lincoln Center is 30 blocks north, the Village is 30 blocks south. And, when you come back to the hotel at night, the door next to the entrance leads to a great club that has an open air lounge with a spectacular view of the Empire State Building (pictured). Even though we were adjacent to this nightclub (and busy Herald Square) we heard no sounds in our room on the 8th floor of the hotel and slept like babies (or at least like babies who sleep through the night). The prices were reasonable for NYC - $229/night on a weekend night and $249 for weeknights - for a room with 2 beds at a
major hotel chain this was the best rate we found, particularly since we wanted the cancellation option (i.e., we could have prepaid and saved $30/night but didn't want to risk an unknown hotel), and we refused to pay a "resort" fee (additional $30/day at other hotels).
Staff at the hotel were great - we had one problem with a man at the front desk who failed to read notes in our reservation as to who would be checking into our room first (we arrived at different times the first day and he charged the room to my friend despite my already having used points and my credit card to pay), but he apologized the next day and worked with other staff to fix the problem. Everyone else was very friendly and a pleasure to meet. In summary, a great place to stay and highly recommended.

title: My go-to place for short trips to Manhattan
text:
I've reviewed before, but adding another to show consistency of service and value. Tucked away near Herald Square (you could easily walk by and not know it was a hotel - only just see the signs for the Monarch nightclub), this hotel is a great value for money, and a good experience overall. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are well-appointed and a decent size for Manhattan. I love the location (easy walk from Penn Station, right by Subway, right by Herald Square shopping). The rooms are always clean and well-stocked. Amenities are minimal (it's a Courtyard after all) and you're not going to be blown away with a huge amount of space or features - but it's clean, quiet and friendly. There's no real restaurant - just a small cafe type place serving sandwiches, breakfast foods and coffee/drinks. But I find that is okay for my needs as I'm usually away from the hotel for lunch and dinner (it's New York! food choices for all cuisines and budgets abound!)

Special thanks to Jose the bellman. He is fantastic. He goes out of his way to help out, and does so with a smile - and in multiple languages! He truly seems to love his job.

I'll be back next time I have business in NYC. :)

title: Short family trip
text: Great location! Subway (34th St) station is at the corner- literally just a few steps from the front door (I think it was the R-L-Q line??). Short walk to Empire State Bldg, Times Square, Madison Square Gardens.  Macy's flagship store is across the street with all the other shopping opportunities at Herald Square. Bryant Park is around the corner.  Rooms are good for NYC standards- (small bathrooms). All is clean and modern. Staff was helpful. Michael, the concierge, was extremely nice and helpful- thank you again!  NYC-style rooftop bar- not owned by the hotel?? so it doesn't feel like a hotel bar. There is a Chik-Fil-A, McDonald's and an Andrew's coffee shop close by for breakfast if you don't want to purchase from the hotel offerings. There is a small market/snack area- with a microwave.  If you need it, there is a Hertz rental car place a few blocks over. No issues with heat/air. Beds were comfy. It is NYC, but there was no noise either from outside, the hallways, or nearby elevators. One minor obstacle was there is basically one mirror (teen girls) in a small space.  Computers are available in the lobby to print boarding passes, etc. There is a space with tables/chairs for informal meetings or groups in the lobby. Free WiFi (yay!).

title: Clean room, great Location
text:
We spent spring break with our kids in NYC and thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.  As expected for NYC the room was small but very clean and efficient.  It’s pretty close to several attractions (20 mins to the American museum of natural history, 17 mins to times square, 5 mins to empire state building). Its right opposite the flagship Macys store and there’s a subway station right outside their entrance.

Additionally, Michael their concierge is so nice and helpful.  Thanks for a wonderful stay – we will be back so please maintain your standards

title: Great location
text:
Stayed here 4 nights with friends..on a shopping trip bonanza in NY!
Great location for shopping, plenty of shopping nearby and not far to walk most places. And if not walking  there is a subway entrance right next to the hotel entrance.
Check in was easy and no hassle, great staff overall. Had no problems the nights we stayed, and all requests was sorted fast.

Our room had 2 queen size beds, would have been nice we had larger beds, being 4 friends sharing a room. But the size of the room didnt allow for larger beds really. Room and bath was good overall, just got a bit crowded with 4 girls on a shopping vacation, but not sure we can blame the hotel for that problem :)
The view was ok, guess if you get a room even higher up ( we had 9th floor) you see more.

It was all clean and nice, did smell smoke in the hallway at night, not sure if someone was smoking in the rooms or what! But all in all we had a clean nice room and fresh towels every day. Im rather sure our room was not the easiest to keep tidy! Lots of stuff in there with the 4 of us.

Last day we left our bags in storage and booked a taxi for the airport! Not sure if it was the amount of luggage or our friendly faces, but when we came to pick up and leave, Jose the bellman,had arranged a limo for us to the airport! A great and fun way to end our travels to NY, leaving in style!
So all in all we had a great stay, location cant get much better, staff was helpful and smiling and for sure wouldnt mind staying there again.

title: Centralissimo
text: Questo hotel è veramente al posto giusto. Pochi passi sei alla penn station..al madison Square garden e se vi piace la frenesia di time square i passi saranno pochi di più!! Macy's vicinissimo e bar sul tetto spettacolare!!! Unico neo è che ci hanno cambiato la camera a l'ultimo ed era più piccola.

title: Great Location
text: We stayed here for a long weekend and loved the location.  It's within walking distance of great shopping, restaurants, and more importantly the NY and NJ train system.  Rooms are well appointed and quiet.  Highly recommend this hotel if you need to stay near the train system, Madison Square Garden, Macy's or other mid-town destinations.

title: Localização perfeita
text: O hotel tem na sua localização o ponto mais alto. No entanto, isso não basta para qualifica-lo. Os apartamentos são corretos com Wi-Fi grátis em todo o hotel. O café da manhã é  muito bom com preço correto. O atendimento é muito Cortez e atenciosíssimo. Não é um hotel de luxo mas é a minha primeira opção em NOVA YORK. O entorno do hotel e repleto de bares e restaurante de ótima qualidade e possui atrasões para todas as idades. Ideal para compras e grande opção de transporte.

title: Room under night club
text: I arrived early and my room wasn't ready, but I wasn't given or assigned to a room. Instead I came back later that evening around 8 or 9 p.m. and was told that the only room available for my room type was on the top floor which a happened to be under a night club. This was disappointing service for a Marriott Gold member so I received a nice hip-hop soundtrack until 4am on Friday night with bass banging overhead.

title: A total gem
text:
**Due to jet lag, I accidentally reviewed the wrong hotel**
Whoops a daisy!!

We stayed here for a long weekend for a 30th birthday celebration (and decided to celebrate it in NYC) but also decided to try another hotel.
This hotel was more than excellent value for money but it is practically smack-bang central, not too far from the famous/busy Times Square but a five minute walk from Madison Square Gardens, The Empire State Building and depending on your room can see Macy's just opposite.

The room was comfortable and clean, an added bonus of a fridge which is great compared to other hotels that we've stayed in, considering the location, I cannot complain about the noise as I heard nothing! Staff were friendly and very approachable. 

Although the small cafe on the lobby floor is only opened for a limited time was the only thing I can fault the hotel for!
There's also a very small shop 'The Market' that supplies the basics which is handy should you be caught out or can't be bothered to leave the hotel!

The rooftop bar (a bit expensive but in saying that it was a special birthday treat plus the wonderful views), I'd recommend the bar (open to anyone as the access to it is separate from the hotel so there's an extra sense of security).

The shower was massive which surprised me considering we've stayed in NY nearly four times and never had the luxury of space plus as well, the cleanliness was flawless! Hats off to the cleaning staff.

The decor is fresh and modern and there's free wifi! We loved our stay at the hotel, who even arranged a taxi to the airport (they don't do shuttles/transfers but this is stated on their website), should we be visiting the big apple, this hotel will be the first port of call!

title: qanto ao Hotel nada a reclamar. Era o que esperava.
text: A única queixa que tenho é simplesmente o fato de terem me cobrado o café da manhã, Após o mesmo me era apresentado um comprovante para assinar. Ao perguntar se aquilo era uma cobrança disseram-me que não. Tenho a DIZER QUE A MINHA RESERVA, N. 124013545026, DAVA DIREITO AO CAFÉ DA MANHÃ.Total cobrado: $ 141,39.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Stayed at the courtyard recently as went to New York to celebrate my 30th. I would say ignore all the bad reviews, as we have nothing bad to say. 
Soon as we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted well and then Michael came up to our room with chocolates and a card for my birthday, which was a really nice touch. 
The staff were very attentive and helped us with everything we required. Michael helped us with local places for breakfast and gave us loads of helpful advice. 
The only thing I would say is that the hotel should provide drinking water in the rooms, but no big deal as there is a small cafe on the 2nd floor, where you can buy this. 
I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in a central location as you are a 10 minutes walk away from times sq and across the road from Macys and the subway is really close to the hotel. The hotel also has amazing roof top bar, where you can go any day of the week to ave a drink.

title: Mediocre
text:
Based on the reviews and ratings I had high expectations for this hotel. The rooms are NY small, dimly lit with sad fluorescent lights. The bathrooms too are claustrophobic. The gym is fair. 
Rooms have computer safes.
The cafe on the second floor is nothing to savor but isn't too expensive if you're in a rush. 
The location is pretty good if you need to be in midtown, close to the Empire State Building and Penn station.  Lots of shopping but little charm. 
In summary, not a bad value for the money, but not a place I would look forward to spend more than a single night in.

title: Disappointed and disgusted.
text: Upon checking in things were great.  Front desk staff was great.  Location is decent one block from Broadway and a few blocks from the beginning of the festivities. When we returned to change for the evening there was throw up in front entrance outside at night that was there when we left.  Upon checkout out I waited 20 minutes for the bellhop. After the 20 minutes went by I asked the front desk  how long it would take to retrieve my luggage later on in the afternoon. I was referred back to the bellhop later he basically snapped/yelled his response that he would be back to pick up my luggage and was I next in line completely avoiding the question. The reason I asked the question was to determine whether or not I wanted to leave luggage or take it with me. After waiting another 10 minutes he came by then I was frustrated and it showed in my voice. His responses again in a loud tone was don't yell at me, I was not yelling and I used the same exact tone he used with me. I have never been talk to publicly by any employee like this I would never talk to any of my employees or customers like this. I will not recommend this hotel for any future visits.

title: Very average, not staying here again
text:
I booked this hotel based on my experience with Courtyard on the 40th. But this one was a bit let down. Small rooms, stuffy hallways, ting bathroom, very small beds, no space to put your luggage and an air-condition system from ancient days. It's sounds won't help you sleep well. Check-in service was ok, a bit cold, but ok. Concierge staff was the best, very attentive and helpful. Location wise, hotel checks all the boxes. Macy's is across the road and the Empire State Building is one block away. Plenty of eating places in the area and times square is 10-12 minutes walk away. One of hotel's entrances is connected with the underground station as well. 

In terms of value for money, you can get much better hotel in Manhattan. This won't be on my list anymore.

title: Kanonläge och väldigt bra service!
text:
Har precis kommit hem och hela familjen känner sig väldigt nöjda med vistelsen på The Courtyard.
Läget är fantastiskt och det är nära till det mesta. Jag vill särskilt lyfta fram den goda serviceandan hos de som arbetar på hotellet. Alla visar ren glädje och en sann vilja att hjälpa till och underlätta utifrån de frågor eller ev problem som dykt upp. Alla hälsar och önskar en trevlig dag, mycket proffsigt och trevligt bemötande.

Rummet på 15 våningen var fräscht och lagom stort för vår familj, allt som behövs fanns och wifi fungerade utmärkt.

Särskilt vill vi nämna Michael som alltid hälsar godmorgon och erbjuder sin hjälp oavsett vad det gäller, Jose som på samma sätt proffsigt och glatt fixar det du behöver samt vår städerska Esmeralda som såg till att rummet var fräscht varje dag.

title: Good Service!!!
text:
We stayed for just two nights but it was good stay - we were expecting a better view since we got the skyline view room but it wasn't bad either. 

Every one from the person that checked us in to the cleaners were really helpful and nice. Especially Jose, our doorman. He went out of his way with our bags, opening the car door for me and wishing us a good trip back home. 

We will def come back!

title: Very nice hotel, centrally located
text: We really enjoyed our stay here. There was one slight issue at check in but I felt it was handled quickly and to our satisfaction by the manager. The staff was all friendly and helpful but I have to give extra praise to Jose and Michael. Jose actually walked us down into the subway and explained how to buy our metrocard and what train to take. Above and beyond!! Michael was very helpful as well. Gave us good recommendations for dinner and was always quick to help us get a cab. We would stay here again.

title: Best service ever!!
text: When booking a room for an impromptu nights stay in the city, I spoke to Yelly at the front desk. She was very helpful, attentive and accommodating! She went above and beyond to ensure that we were comfortable & that we would have a great stay and we did. Thank you Yelly!

title: Идеально
text: Мы с подругой искали номер в НЙ, и по сути нам было неважно где остановиться, но когда мы начали искать, цены были просто безумные. И тут внезапно нам подвернулся номер в этом отеле, всего за 90 баксов за ночь ( плюс такс). Номер уютный, чистенький, приятное обслуживание и ребята на ресепшн. В день вылета мы даже оставили умных вещи, уже после того как выписались из номера. ( потом еще чемоданы донесли в общую кучу). На крыше здания отеля находится бар с крутецким видом на Эмпайр-Стейт-Билдинг. А расположение у отеля просто шикарное для тех, кто любит гулять пешком. Буквально через улице находится Торговый центр Macy's, Эмпайр-Стейт-Билдинг недалеко, а шаговой доступности куча ресторанов, кафе, книжных магазинов и прочих мест. Сам отель очень чистый и спокойный.

title: Great location, Terrific staff
text: Stayed here for one night to attend a wedding. I had reserved several rooms for myself and family members. When I reserved, they were all in my name. Changing them over to other family members names was handled professionally and correctly. I can't stress that enough. I've had nightmares before at other hotels where they just can't seem to get it right. Kudos to the staff here! Our room was clean and comfortable, especially the bed and pillows. They were super comfy. Two little things - the climate control system leaves the air extremely dry. Kept waking up to sip water. The other little thing was actually sort of funny - After first checking in, I went into the bathroom, closed the door and was greeted by a pair of khacki pants belonging to the last guest. All in all, a great stay in a great location.

title: Bastante Satisfeito!
text: Não foi minha primeira vez em NY mas com certeza foi a melhor estadia. O Courtyard Herald Square está muito bem localizado (saída de metrô para duas linhas a alguns passos da porta do Hotel, várias opções de lojas/alimentação nas redondezas); quartos espaçosos, novos e limpos, mas o que me chamou a atenção foi a cordialidade e atenção de TODOS os funcionários, sempre dispostos a ajudar e colocando-se a disposição para qualquer eventualidade. Com certeza essa cordialidade deixou nossa estada bem mais agradável!

title: Silencieux, confortable et très bien situé
text: J'ai choisi un hôtel Midtown pour un séjour avec des enfants en février. Premier bon point, c'est un hôtel incroyablement silencieux: aucun bruit venant des autres chambres pourtant nous sommes restés 8 nuits! La literie et les oreillers sont très confortables également car bien moelleux comme je les aime (les amateurs de literie très ferme seront certainement déçus!). Evidemment, le métro au pied de l'hôtel et la situation géographique sont des atouts majeurs: les 2 principales lignes de métro y passent et Times Square n'est qu'à quelques minutes à pied ! Idéal aussi pour le shopping ou aller faire un petit tour à L'Empire State le soir après manger. Le fait de pouvoir rentrer dans l'après-midi pour faire des temps de pause nous a permis de profiter au maximum de notre séjour. Finalement, nous avons fait plus de choses que lors d'un autre séjour où notre hébergement était moins central (un fois rentrés d'un journée épuisante, plus envie de ressortir pourtant tout ferme très tard!). Le personnel est également charmant, attentionné et discret, ce qui est très appréciable. Nous avons aussi profité de la wifi avec un très bon débit ainsi que des nombreuses chaînes télé. Bref, je recommande chaudement cette adresse (pas si chère que ça hors saison!) et j'y retournerai sans doute!

title: Valentines Weekend
text: In town for a surprise birthday party for my girlfriend that I helped plan...busy for 4 full days in freezing weather but all good.  Hotel rooms were small but okay; will never stay on a 'street side' as the horns, police cars/fire engines are busy doing their jobs, but soooo noises.  Had to use ear plugs to sleep but beds were comfortable. Location was away from Time Square.  The staff at the hotel were amazing - especially the bell guys at the front door; they hailed us cabs, told us which ones to take going which way...they were wonderful and so were the ladies at the front desk.  Took our wine to the lobby where we had plenty of room and didn't disturb anyone.  Good time in spite of freezing weather.

title: Nicer than i expected!
text: Pleasantly surprised by the great lobby, clean and modern.  Everything looked newly remodeled!  Even the room size was larger than expected.  Nice hot showers with great water pressure. My friend had the room next to us and had a shower instead of a tub/shower combo.  That would have been nicer in my opinion.

title: Excellent Stay at the Courtyard Herald Square!
text:
I don't often give a property a 5 rating. It always seems like there is always something the hotel could improve upon, but in this case the combination of service, value, location was really top-notch. 

It started even before our check-in experience by the greeting we got on the ground floor from the Security person and then from the Courtyard Concierge on duty, Mike, who guided us to the Lobby on the 2nd floor. 

I had used the Marriott app to request an early check-in, which is not something guaranteed by my Platinum status. Happily, we were offered our room 4 hours early, for which we were very appreciative due to the really cold temperatures outside. It felt great to warm up a bit before heading off to our Broadway matinee. We loved that the hotel was walking distance from Penn Station and close to so many subway lines. This weekend had been planned months in advance, so I was able to snag a rate of $159 a night for a 2-night stay. It was truly a bargain for that location and room.

The King bed room itself was clean, slightly more spacious than most hotel rooms in NYC (I am up here all the time for work so have stayed in about 20 different hotels in this exact vicinity.) We had an angled view of the Empire State Building (lit up in red on Valentine's Day!) The room included closet, mini fridge, large flat screen TV, desk with chair, and an easy chair. The bathroom had a huge (frosted glass) window that let in a ton of light and made it seem very large. We had plenty of towels, etc. The Wifi worked fine and was free.

Everyone at the hotel was friendly, helpful, and polite - especially our housekeeper Sherley.

Bottom line is I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to others. FYI.  I typically like to stay at a property where breakfast is included especially when traveling for business (where I have an expense account that I cannot exceed) and that is probably the only downside of a Courtyard vs. other Marriott properties. The lower end properties such as Fairfield Inn or Residence Inn have breakfast included, and at the higher end properties such as a full service Marriott or Renaissance, I get Concierge Lounge access due to my Platinum status. However, given the price I got for this room, buying breakfast was not an issue.

title: Great Location & friendly staff
text:
Seven days in this hotel and there was no low moment. I was on a Bleasure trip and so the location of this hotel served my needs very well. 

Staff are very friendly, exceptionally its MICHAEL who stands out. He ensures your needs are met, it is almost like he makes everything possible. 

The rooms are clean, only they are small if you travel with so much luggage like I did. 

Taxis, buses and trains are all easily accessible. It s a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Lots of restaurants around the hotel for your convenience. Macy's right on the same square with hotel. The fashion district is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, Madison Square Garden is close by. 

I will certainly go back on my next visit to NYC.

title: Great choice for manhattan business!
text: Stayed there multiple times in Oct - Jan 2016 timeframe.  Always got a clean room and the staff (esp. Yeilly at front desk) are super helpful!  The ither good part is that in some rooms you can watch the tv from your restroom (while using it :).

title: Wonderful Staff and Gorgous Roof Bar!!!
text: We stayed here in February 2016 and had a wonderful time! The staff was absolutely amazing, a table for 7 was found for us at Frankie's and Johnny's at the last minute. We spent several hours at the roof top bar visiting with family and friends. The bartender was great, I'd been craving a Key Lime Martini and several places had been unable to make one but the Rooftop bartender made a delicious one. The hotel had a Starbucks which had sufficient breakfast items that we didn't have to search for food on the way to Grand Central. The room was very clean and ultra modern for a reasonable city price. I will book here next time I stay in the city.

title: Above and beyond !!
text: I've been to NYC on business many times - this is the first time I felt special in a hotel.  Greeted immediately by Michael who explained he was there for whatever we needed. We (group of 4) consulted Michael quite often.  He was instrumental to getting us to the airport on time - planning a car, keeping our bags so we didn't have to drag them to our meeting.  The hotel room was very clean and new, slept great, great TV.  Loved the rooftop bar. We had business with Macy's so this was right across the street.  We will definitely return to this hotel.  A+++

title: Ok & good location
text:
I was only here a couple of evenings for business, staying alone. My room was tiny but it's Manhattan so what can you expect? It was rather beige  & a bit depressing, but not offensive. 2 people in it would struggle a bit though, I think. 

Location wise it was great & I had a view of Macy's & Herald Square, which was a definite bonus & I enjoyed watching the world go by. I didn't use it, but the lobby area with seating & PCs & a coffee bar (mornings only) seemed a great feature. I like to stay in different parts of Manhattan when I visit, so not sure I would return for that reason, but I'd consider it if I needed to be in this locations for any reason. 

Staff were friendly & helpful & they sorted out a plumbing issue I had very quickly. Overall, nothing special but certainly nothing wrong with it either.

title: Best location in Manhattan, Great Hotel and Impecable Customer Service!
text: The hotel was great, everything super clean and new, the location right next to Macy, Empire State and all the most important places in Manhattan.. The Staff i give them 10 Stars if I could they were the greatest ,always ready, willing and able to assist both my husband and I.  We love traveling to Manhattan and this is going to be our hotel to stay. Specially one of the guys, Michael he really knows how to treat a customer all of the staff from the checking in to the maid service. They were all there for us at any time of the day to answer our questions and getting directions.Love, Love, this Marriott - they know how to make the customer feel welcomed and special.  Thanks to all the guys ! you all rock!!!!! We will be back soon

title: Great weekend in NYC
text: My husband and I received theater tickets for Christmas and planned to make a weekend of it.  We found a great price for this hotel online were very happy with the location.  It was easy to get everywhere, we were able to take advantage of the great weather and walk.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating, especially the doorman, Jose.  He was great helping get our car taken care for the weekend and with holding our bags after we checked out of our room before leaving the city.  He was extremely friendly and helped start and end the trip on a high note.  We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay again.

title: Segurança a desejar
text: O hotel é bem localizado, atendentes simpáticos, porém esqueci alguns  pertences no cofre e soube que este teria sido aberto sem o procedimento de segurança adequado. Alguns pertences foram encontrados e cordialmente estão sendo despachados porém houve o desaparecimento de um objeto de valor. Ainda aguardo uma posição do hotel

title: Ótima estadia
text: Otima localização, bem em frente ao Herald Square. Uma estação de metrô logo embaixo do hotel, com acesso à maioria das linhas que utilizamos. Quando fomos, a fachada estava sendo renovada, então a vista de todos os quartos estava parcialmente bloqueada (o que chateou um pouco meu marido, já que estávamos bem perto do Empire State e poderíamos ver da janela do quarto...). Serviço excelente de todos os funcionários do hotel. Ponto fraco para a lanchonete do hotel, que quase não tinha opções (tentamos tomar café da manhã um dia e preferimos buscar um lugar mais aconchegante na rua). Escolham andares altos, porque o barulho é um pouco menor. E o bar do terraço é uma delícia (para quem conseguir ir em épocas de clima mais quente!)

title: Best yet in New York
text: This was my best hotel experience in New York so far. The location was much better for me tha Times Square and while I have never had a negative experience in New York , the staff here was exceptional. Micheal who greeted us was wonderful in taking over the car and bags and getting us settled. Another couple in my party was upgraded to a corner room because the room wasn't ready when we returned from an early dinner. Accommodations were comfortable and the bed and bedding excellent. I will stay there for sure on my next trip. Recommend highly!

title: Decent location, nice staff
text:
I was here on business and most of the hotels in the area were sold out so I ended up here. The location was nice, and I was able to walk almost all the places I needed to be which was great.
Check-in is not on the first floor, however security is. I appreciated feeling secure but then that made me wonder if I was in a bad area? I had no issues with anything like that but it made me feel safe and unsafe at the same time.
Check-in was speedy and friendly, and my room was upgraded to a  nice corner room. Unfortunately there was scaffolding outside so i didn't get the full view, but it was nice enough.

title: Simply amazing
text:
Stayed Here over the new year period, how fantastic!
The check in is done in minutes and the staff are simply the best.  Very helpfuk, great for directions etc and always happy to help.
The Rooms are spacious and well kept. The bed is huge and comfortable as could be.
Room service is quick to respond and the cleaners are very tentative and well on top of keeping the rooms very clean and tidy.
There is no doubt we will be returning to this hotel on our next trip to NYC.  The location is perfect, just across from Macys and the subway is literally just outside the entrance to the hotel.

title: Gold status not recognized
text:
I checked in via the app. Got there and asked if a corner room was available as I often do as gold members often get upgrades and are almost always recognized as a gold member upon arrival. NOT HERE!!!
Why attain a status when there are no perks??
Overall great staff, nice room, but would not stay here again. Go to the Essex house, worth the money or points.......

title: Great location in the center of Manhattan
text: My first choice for a business stay due to quality reception staff, accommodating specific room request, upbeat and practical room furnishings and lobby reception area conducive to casual meetings, computer access and fresh breakfast items at walk up counter

title: Holiday Tree Visit
text:
My husband and I had the  opportunity to stay  at this wonderful hotel in  December 2015. Since our first visit we've revisited this hotel  3 times again. We love this hotel. Upon arrival we are always greeted and welcome by friendly guest services. Jenifer and Brithany both are delightful to speak with. 
The location is REMARKABLE, our view was the Macy's Christmas windows displays. The rooms are spectacular and the bed OMG😔😔😔😔you get the best nights rest. We had a king size bed and man we slept well. 
There was No street  noise and we loved the quietness of the hotel. They also have an awesome lounge/ bar on the 17th floor which is very Cozy yet Chic. 
Overall this is a very beautiful hotel to stay at for comfort and for entertainment.

title: Very well located hotel. Shame about some of the service.
text:
We traveled to New York just before Christmas for business and leisure and can comfortably say that this hotel was perfectly located for Midtown access - Macy's is literally directly opposite, Empire State building is a block away and most other key shopping and tourist sites are within a 20 minute walk from the front door. If not, there is a subway station literally outside the front entrance to the building. 

The rooms are pleasant and of a good size for New York hotel rooms, however, I unfortunately had a number of encounters of pretty poor service / rudeness at this hotel. When calling ahead a week or so before to confirm the room, front desk couldn't seem any less interested in helping if they tried. Said they had no reservation under my name, without taking and dates of our stay or seeking to clarify the spelling of the name. It then took me several more calls to various people to find out that we did in fact have a booking. 

When at the hotel, on one of the days that we were there, we had popped back to the room for 10 minutes, which so happened to coincide with when house keeping came to clean the room. There was no 'Do Not Disturb' sign on the door, however, when we came back to the room later that evening, we found that housekeeping had not returned to the room or cleaned it. 

Finally, I had a situation where I needed to make a call to my bank and enquired with the room's phone operator (front desk) as to the cost of making an overseas call. I was told that they did not know the hotels rates, but that it would be a lot cheaper than using a foreign mobile phone to make the call. However, I subsequently found an invoice under the door the next morning for $40 in charges for a 3 minute call. To credit the hotel, they refunded the costs upon complaining regarding the same, however, if this had not been the case, the misinformation given would have been extremely costly. 

Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a budget stay in central Manhattan.

title: Incredible
text: Stayed here for one night last weekend and I couldn't have asked for a better hotel. Great location and staff is wonderful. Room was small, but what do you expect in NYC. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

title: Right Next to Macy's & Empire State Building
text:
We stayed here during December 2015 during Christmas time for 3 nights.

Location: It has an excellent location right next to Macy's and 5 minutes walk from penn station and empire state building making it very convenient and in a very happening place. We literally walked down to everywhere in mid town ( times square, 5th avenue saks, radio city hall, top of rocks: within 15 minutes or 0.6 miles )

Hotel: The hotel is relatively brand new ( 2012) and offers  nice views of Empire State Building and Macy's. Average hotel. Nothing Spectacular.

Rooms: Modern and Comfortable but with small rooms.We had excellent views of the empire state building.The bathrooms had standing showers. no bath tubs.

Service: I was very impressed with the service  considering that this is New York City and very busy time. While checking in, the service desk allotted us a high floor room immediately and we requested 2 rooms next to each other on high floor. They advised us that the 17 floor rooms have a bar on top..so not recommended for us with kids due to noise. This was very good advice and gave us 15th and 16th floor. I really appreciated this. Also while checking out, they gave us a late checkout ( 1pm ) even though the hotel was completely sold out.

Value for Money: Not worth the price. They charged us USD 318 on advance purchase. I guess it is due to the location that the prices are high for all Marriott's during this time of the year.

Would recommend based on the location.

title: Great location, nice place to stay!
text:
I accidentally reserved non-refundable room but hotel turned out fine, actually much better than expected. Room reserved was two double room w/ skyline view.  Our room on 14th floor had view down 6th Ave, no skyline and/or Herald Square view.  When I called front desk, told there are no double rooms w/ skyline/Herald Square views. Manager offered to reduce room price to city view rate which was decent thing to do. 

The best quality of this hotel is its central midtown location.  You are 10-minute walk to Southern end of Times Square, 6-minute walk to Bryant Park, 30-minute walks to Chelsea Market and Central Park. We were in town to attend game at Madison Square Garden which was 6-minute walk.  The subway is literally outside front door and taxis readily available to get up or downtown.      

This is a no frills 3-star hotel so no turn down, room service, pay movies, robes, wine glasses, good toiletries, etc.  However, the room was clean and quiet, beds very comfortable and TV quality good.  The hotel was built approx. 2 years ago so everything modern and in good shape.  We had a bathtub but I believe they’re only in double double rooms. Storage is limited – be tough for long stay. Apparently, there are laundry facilities which would help. I was w/ my 10-yr-old for quick 3-night stay so not a problem for us.  I saw inside a really small King standard room so note square footage prior to booking.  Housekeeping respected Do Not Disturb sign in mornings!  Security is big deal for me and for most part, someone was by elevators…but not all the time. I can imagine during warm months, line to get to rooftop bar (didn't go, no kids allowed) might be a real nuisance entering lobby but was not in dead of winter.   Our only issue involved in-room heat that kept changing from heat to a/c so we had to get extra blankets. 

I would absolutely stay here again - Marriott doing excellent job w/ their new, moderately-priced hotels.

title: Ottima Posizione - Colazione appena sufficiente
text:
La posizione dell'hotel e' sicuramente ottima: l'hotel e' situato a Herald Square, vicinissimo alla Broadway, alla 5th Avenue, all'Empire State Building (se sarete fortunati, lo vedrete dalla finestra della vostra camera!), a Times Square, al Madison Square Garden, al Flat Iron e a Bryant Park. Inoltre, la fermata dalla metro (linea Gialla e Arancione e fermata del PATH) e' proprio sotto l'hotel.

L'ingresso dell'hotel e' al primo piano. Entrando al piano terra, troverete una sorta di reception e il personale vi indirizzera' agli ascensori con i quali arriverete alla reception vera e propria e alle camere.

Note positive: personale cordiale e disponibile, computer iMac e stampante a disposizione degli ospiti, bevande e cibi confezionati acquistabili a tutte le ore vicino alla reception, pulizia camere e spazi comuni, wi-fi perfettamente funzionante ovunque, anche nelle stanze, bagno molto spazioso e doccia molto grande, cassaforte nelle camere.

Note negative: camera x 4 persone con due letti matrimoniali piuttosto piccola con armadio praticamente inesistente, frigobar vuoto, asciugAmani e bagnoschiuma contati.

La colazione merita un commento piu' dettagliato. Sicuramente non e' adatta a chi si aspetta una super colazione e buffet con cibo di ogni genere. Infatti, non c'era nessun buffet, ma un piccolo bar (Table 71), aperto solo negli orari della colazione, dove era possibile scegliere tra un numero ristretto di piatti prevalentemente dolci, gia' pronti o pre-confezionati, riscaldati al microonde. Alcuni di questi a volte non erano nemmeno disponibili (siamo riusciti a mangiare i waffles solo la prima mattina, per i restanti 4 giorni erano finiti).
Alcuni menu precludevano la scelta di alcune pietanze (ad es. un te caldo precludeva la scelta di un succo di frutta, un waffles precludeva la scelta di un croissant)
I membri della stessa stanza devono presentarsi tutti insieme e fare colazione nello stesso momento. 

La tariffa della nostra camera includeva pernottamento e prima colazione. Eravamo quindi "costretti" a farla in hotel avendo pagato.

In ogni caso, consiglierei questo hotel e ci ritornerei, magari senza fare la colazione, visti i costi e il servizio scadente.

title: Awesome Location
text: Not only is this hotel in an awesome location it is newly renovated and the rooms (or at least the king room we were in - 1613) was huge by NYC standards.  There were three of us and we had a ton of room to move around and be comfortable - the service was awesome - and who doesn't love being half way between Chinatown and Central Park so we always felt like it was easy to get to everything.

title: Nice experience
text:
The room wasn't large enough but fine and functional. Perfect climatization. Wonderful view of the Empire State Building. Very nice lounge.
Good breakfast granted by Starbucks quality but not wide choice.
Very kind personnel.

title: Macy's Parade trip
text:
We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott for the week of Thanksgiving with 2 adults and 2 older children.  The room was well organized and made good use of it's space.  The bathroom was well appointed.  The beds were fantastic as were the linens.  It was easy for us to relax in the room.

There is a very convenient subway stop outside the front of the hotel.  We also found the walk to Times Square easy for nights when we had show tickets.  The view from the Monarch (on the rooftop) is worth visiting.  We went the night before the parade & enjoyed watching all the activity below.

As for parade viewing, I can't imagine a better hotel.  We were on the 11th floor, but we felt like we were on the street level.  The hotel is not tall and if you are lucky enough to get a parade view room you are in for a treat.  We booked 8ish months in advance.  The window tilted slightly open so we could hear all the excitement below.  We briefly went down to the street and quickly realized how nice the view from our room was.  We had a great view, a clean bathroom to ourselves, live tv viewing, and a great spread of food!  I am already looking forward to taking this trip again and staying at this same hotel.

title: Great hotel, spacious room, and location.
text: This hotel is really nice, absent the strange "lobby" on 35th street.  The lobby of the hotel is actually one the second floor.  There is a very nice common area behind reception and a nice business center.  The breakfast coffee shop as Starbucks based and staff there were very friendly.  The room was large by NYC standards with a decent size bathroom with glass shower.  Clean, centrally located to Herald Square and subway and a short walk from most local sightseeing spots.  I really enjoyed my stay and experience at this hotel.

title: great location and service
text: stayed here this week.  Hotel manager, Colin, was able to upgrade our room to a corner view. great views of both macy's and 6th ave.  room was large enough for two, though had a fridge, but no microwave.  the only negative with the room was housekeeping, as the refrigerator had food from the prior guest still in it, and there were hair ties and trash under the bed - out of reach of the vacuum.  bellman and other staff were nice and made guests feel welcomed.  Location is great as walkable to almost everything.  next to subway station as well so no problems on such despite no taxi stand close by.  would stay here again.   would have given it the 5th star except for the housekeeping issues.

title: Great location
text: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days this month while on a family vacation to New York. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking around, across Macy's on 6 th avenue. Overall a nice hotel, clean, with very friendly staff (special thanks to Jose the bellman for his help!), the only negative point being the size of the room which was very small (king bed) although other members of our family with queen bed rooms had much more space. I would stay again at this hotel mostly due to its location.

title: Wonderful Christmas Stay
text: Stayed here week of Christmas and departed Christmas Eve.  Very clean, a step above the "Courtyard" brand. Great location, right across from Herald Square.  Easy to get to Macy's (to see Santa or the windows), walk to Madison Square Garden, Empire State building, Times Square or Broadway.  Subway located right outside the door.  Will definitely visit again!

title: Good Hotel in an Outstanding Location
text: My wife and I stayed at the Courtyard New York Manhattan/Herald Square on the evening of December 25, 2015 while visiting New York.  We normally stay at a Marriott, because I am a Marriott Rewards Gold member.  The registration desk is not located on the main level.  Rather, one must take an elevator to the third floor.  An employee at the main level politely instructs guests as they enter.  I used mobile checkin 2 hours before, and our room was available upon arrival at 3 PM.  Our checkin went very smoothly.  We were assigned Room 913, which is classified as a Larger Guest Room.  Our room was very clean, and it was furnished with a king bed, sofa, desk, mini refrigerator, and microwave oven.  Free wifi is also available, and the wifi speed is more than adequate to watch a streaming movie.  In addition, our room faced Herald Square, and we had a nice panoramic view of Macy's and its Christmas decorations.  My wife and I had no problems sleeping that night, as the bed was very comfortable, and the noise level was nonexistent.  Furthermore, the location of this hotel is ideal, because one is within easy walking distance of several key attractions in New York.  My wife and I visited Rockefeller Center Christmas night, and the Flower District the next day.  This hotel is midway between these 2 locations.  Our checkout went very smoothly, because I used mobile check out.  I would have rated this hotel 5 star, but our only minor complaint was the bathroom.  It was rather small.  Actually, I bumped my head on the glass over the sink when I bent over to wash my face. Outside of that, this is a great hotel my wife and I recommend to anyone visiting New York.

title: Great Hotel!
text: I recently stayed at this hotel with family. I really appreciate how helpful and attentive the staff was to us. The central location and proximity to Macy's was a plus for me. Rooms were a bit small, but very clean and comfortable. We had a car and the hotel did offer parking. However, we were told to call about 45 minutes to an hour prior to getting our car. A couple of times it took almost 2 hours to get the car. Other than the situation with getting our car, it was a great stay!

title: Отличное расположение
text: Отель понравился своим расположением. Рядом несколько станций метро, огромное колличество магазинов на любой вкус, множество кафе и ресторанов. Номера чистые, нормального размера. Хорошая уборка, быстрое заселение. Обязательно останавлюсь здесь снова.

title: Above average Courtyard - staff was outstanding
text:
This is a case of - people truly make the difference. It all started with the willingness of the sales manager to work with me when I needed 6 rooms for my team during the holiday season. Next we were greeted by Michael the concierge with amazing service. If you haven't experienced trying to park & unload on the cramped NY city streets - it can be stressful. But not when you have Michael helping you. The front desk staff & food service staff were all smiling and genuinely looked happy. 
The rooks were clean, bright and very comfortable. We were able to walk to all the great attractions. When it came time to leave - Michael sprang back into action - helping as he had done for the entire stay with anything and everything with a genuine passion. 
I have stayed over 100 nights just this past year in Marriott properties. I can say from experience the staff and in turn this courtyard is well above average. Nice job - thank you.

title: Great choice
text: The room was a good size - nice and clean. Had a great view. No issues with check in/out, and the staff were all very friendly. Hotel bar on the roof was busy during the weekend. No issues for us with noise from the bar, we were on a higher floor. Great choice for our NYC weekend!

title: Extremely Helpful Staff but the Rooms are Small
text: The staff at this hotel are wonderful and that is the reason that I rated the hotel a 4.  The front desk staff are very helpful.  Jose was wonderful with checking our bags and helping us find places to eat.  The rooms are very small but the staff is wonderful!!

title: Excellent stay
text:
We had a great stay at the courtyard. The staff was very friendly. We had a very late check in, close to midnight. The doorman was very helpful. We had a lot of luggage. 

The room was clean and quiet. The location was terrific. 

At the end of our stay Michael the doorman got our car out of valet quickly and packed our luggage quickly so we could be on our way home. Michael also gave us great directions to get out of the city the easiest way possible.  

We definitely will stay at the courtyard in Herald square again.

title: Central Location
text: Great central location near Herald Square close to shopping, Penn Station, major subways etc.  Almost walked by front door as it is not well marked.  Must take elevator to lobby. Didier was at front desk alone handling many phone calls as well as guests checking in and out. Overheard one caller who was very demanding and Didier remained calm and professional. Kudos to him.  I had requested a very early check-in and he was able to accommodate.  Room was decent size by Manhattan standards. At first I could hear guests next to me but put on fan to block it out.  Breakfast down the street at Andrew's was great.  Hope to return in the spring and check out rooftop.

title: Good hotel
text: The hotel was nice and clean (no bed bugs! :) ). The room was modern and quite large. Location was very good and service excellent. We could see Macy's and Empire State Building from our room. The hotel has a nice roof top bar with great views on the 6th avenue and Empire State Building.

title: Very reasonable prices for above average Courtyard
text:
Was pleasantly surprised at the low price for this midtown location. Beyond my expectations. Clean ,well maintained. Generous sized rooms with nice linens. Placed
between Empire State Bldg and Macy's with easy access to all the usual tourist spots.
Also a short walk from Penn Station and Bryant Park.
Terrific idea to have lobby area above ground level and accessed by elevator . Really nice lounge area by the front desk that has large windows with views and smaller cubby areas with TVs . Full service Starbucks in the same space. Housekeeping does a good job and all staff I encountered were personable and helpful. A small hotel with only 17 stories but I did not hear any street noise. Would love to visit this property in nice weather to take advantage of the roof top bar.

title: A Shining Star
text: After a disappointing stay at a Courtyard here in SoHo & VA Beach, this property exceeded my expectations. All staff members were friendly, courteous & welcoming. You experienced it the moment you arrived from Michael - the doorman. I watched him "in action" assisting early a.m. arrivals & arranging the most economical car service to area airports. At check-in, I was upgraded to an exec. king room, a bit larger than a standard-size NYC room, w/excellent street views of Macy's/HS. The room included a desk, frig, safe & sofabed. The rooftop bar - Monarch - was an unexpected bonus. Drinks are pricey, but an open-air deck (in season) w/floor-to-ceiling windows offers great 360 views. I would not hesitate to stay here again when I visit the "Big Apple."

title: More than a Courtyard...Doorman WOWS!
text:
Let me start by saying, I took this trip in October... but the Courtyard did such a great job that it requires a minute to stop and review.
This was better than a standard Courtyard, the staff really understands that they need to be just a bit more, no where is this more evident than with their doorman, Michael.
I have stayed in many a hotel and dealt with many a doorman...Michael went above and beyond, He made it feel like coming home at the end of a long day... and he was definitely a hero when it came to the challenges of transportation that my group presented.
I would make this my hotel of choice simply to interact with Michael again.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We traveled here for the NYC Marathon this past weekend.  It is in a great location!  The room was perfect for 2 and we were within walking distance of everything we wanted to do and see.  The shopping in the area is amazing and I loved how close it is to the Emipire State Building.  The staff made our stay delightful!  I will definitely stay here again!

title: Ótimo!!!
text: Me hospedei com marido e uma filha adolescente de 04 de setembro até 12 de setembro.Adorei o hotel. Bem localizado, limpo,equipe ótima, principalmente o pessoal da recepção. Amei o Lounge no Rooftop.Fiquei num quarto triplo King de Luxe com vista para a Herald Square, que é bem grande. O hotel foi uma das partes que contribuiu para o sucesso da minha viagem.

title: Great place for us.
text: Plenty of shopping, transportation, and eating nearby.  Our room on the 13th floor was very clean and large enough for the four of us.  Front desk service was fine and helpful.  Would definitely consider staying here again.

title: Weekend trip
text: The hotel was difficult to see from the street due to the netting but the taxi had no problems getting there, about 1 hr drive from JFK. The room had 2 queen beds and they were very conformable,not much space but we were only there for a few nights. Had all the amenities we needed. Fridge, hairdryer, etc.bathroom lacking in space but had a big walk in shower. Didn't try the restaurant but did meet Jose, the concierge who recommended a great American diner for typical New York breakfast (Andrews diner about a 5 minute walk away). He also planned a great itinerary for us taking in all the sights we said we wanted to see. The other staff, although not unpleasant could take some tips from his friendly manner.The location of the hotel was great, about 5 mins to times square and 10 mins to the empire state building. Few restaurants nearby but not really suited to our tastes. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a short break.

title: Wonderful place to stay!
text: I stayed here for one week in October 2015.  The staff is amazing, they really help you out.  From taking you to the subway to show you first hand how to purchase the correct ticket, and make sure you don't spend too much, to the friendly baristas serving you coffee this is an amazing and wonderful place to stay in the hustle and bustle of a busy city.  I highly recommend staying here if you are visiting New York City.

title: A Great Location and Comfortable Room
text: This was our first trip to New York City and we couldn't have picked a better location. The rooms are a reasonable size for NYC. Bed was comfortable, shower was large and warm. From our window we could see Macy's to the right and the Empire State Building to the left. There is a rooftop lounge (not owned by the hotel). Drinks are pricey but it is the best nighttime picture you will get of the ESB and it is a fun place to hang out for a bit. The subway is literally just outside the hotel but you may not need it all the time because you are so close you can walk to so much. Staff was accommodating. I had read reviews about noise from the street and the lounge upstairs, so I specifically requested a room on a mid-level floor. We were on 6 and never heard a thing from the lounge and the street noise stopped around the time we went to bed each evening. We were so tired each night from all of our walking, I don't think we would have noticed anyway. I would definitely stay here again and I'm pretty picky about travel plans.

title: bästa läget
text: Slitet och smutsig matta. Det lilla man kunde köpa till frukost var micrat. Vi åt frukost på Hotell  Graden in som ligger brevid. När till alla och det finns en takterass där man kan njuta av utsikten, dock dryg personal.

title: Friendly friendly friendly
text: This is one of most friendliest hotels I have ever stayed at... Everyone so nice and offered to help us out every time we ran into someone. Room clean and bathroom with awesome shower compared to other hotels I've stayed at. Very short walk to Macy's and easy to grab cab or use subway since station right outside hotel door. Ate at Andrew's for breakfast and O'Reillys for dinner- close to hotel and cheap! Stayed 6 days and no complaints.

title: Location is the selling point here
text:
This hotel is all about its location. Right on the Herald Square, most key spots we were interested in are close by. It doesn't look like hotel from the outside, it has a small entrance from the side street, and reception is on higher floor. During check-in there was no smile or kindness from the lady on duty (Melissa). Other staff we had contact with (Harvey, Didier) were nice and courteous. Walls are very thin, so you will hear every door slammed and sometimes even voices from other rooms. You can't complain about noise from the street, this is heart of New York. 
For this price breakfast should be included. WiFi connectivity is decent.
I would recommend it for short stay.

title: Great service from the very beginning!!
text:
We want to NYC to see the Billy Joel Concert and had a great time.

The hotel couldn't be more convenient to MSG and it seemed brand new.

One of the pleasant surprises was Michael the doorman.  Sounds crazy I know but he acted like our own personal concierge.     He knew exactly what to do, where to go and couldn't have made it any easier or more enjoyable.  It seemed anytime we needed something he was there.  On top of that,  the service he provided as the doorman was better than any five star hotel I have stayed in.

Great trip and great service!  Had a blast, just too quick!

title: Good location and friendly staff, but...
text:
I was looking for a place to stay in Manhattan while in town to see a show. I looked for a place close to mid-town with easy access to the highway. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. Overall, it was a good experience, but we had two unexpected issues. 

First, we called ahead to ask about the price of valet parking from the road, we were told the price, and were planning to use this feature. When we arrived, we were told by a security officer that there was no valet parking that day, so we had to drive around to find a lot (we had just passed one). Why did they not tell us about the lack of parking when we called?

The second issue came around 9:30am on Sunday when two members of the cleaning staff had a loud argument outside of our room. One was heard saying, "Be quiet, I have guests on this floor" (in a loud voice) and the reply from another member of the staff was, "I don't care." They didn't stop talking until we stuck our head out of the room to let them know they were disturbing us. All of the other staff we met were very courteous and checked us into the room quickly.

title: Good location and very nice staff
text:
This is in a good location, right opposite Macy's and very close to Empire State Building, restaurants and shops. Also close to a subway station. 

It was not easy to see from the stree, but luckily the taxi driver knew where it was, hidden under scaffolding. This covered the building on one side and was outside our bedroom window and the breakfast area. The ground floor entrance was not very welcoming but the lobby on the 1st floor was better. 

Our room was fine, not big but adequate withe a comfortable bed, big TV, fridge, desk and chairs. The bathroom was small but had a windowsill for storage of things and the shower was efficient and a decent size. Good number of towels and there were toiletries. Wifi was free and efficient.

The staff were all really friendly, nice and helpful. They all smiled a lot and seemed very happy in their work. They helped us with a map and finding places. When we left I had a bad nosebleed in the ground floor section and my husband was still upstairs collecting cases. I could not leave my luggage but the porter did all he could to help, finding me tissues etc.

Breakfast was in a modern lounge area and was a franchise of Starbucks (I think) and not particularly to our taste but OK.

We only stayed one night but we're pleased with the service.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text:
The rooms are quite small but certainly adequate and well cleaned. The beds are comfy and the hotel has good facilities for longer stay travellers such as a coin op laundry onsite. The Monarch Bar on the rooftop has brilliant views of the Empire State Building - definitely worth a visit.

The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is away from the madness of Times Square yet just one stop away on the subway which is right at the front door. It is also straight opposite the largest Macy's in NYC and close to many restaurants and bars. The Korean restaurants and Irish Pubs have got you covered. 

Last but not least the staff are super friendly, a big shout out to Mike and Jose as extra caring but everyone was very accommodating and looked after us superbly.

title: Nice hotel but some flaws
text:
I've stayed at this marriott property twice for business and I'm not impressed. It's location is a nice mid-town spot in terms of access and bars - but other than that it's not a very desirable location. The building has been shrouded in...well, a covering and scaffolding for months and yet their rates are full price.

Speaking of which, for the price I would expect a full-service marriott - but this is definitely a 3 to 3.5 star hotel. 

The rooms themselves are very nice. Comfortable, nicely sized for manhattan, and efficient for work and relaxation. The hotel "starbucks" isn't.....it's just a coffee bar with a small poorly used machine, undertrained staff, and pretty poor end result. The food served there is of low quality and high price.

I can't recommend this property and I'm a big fan of the marriott brand. I'll probably try it again in the spring, but in the meantime I'm switching to the JW Essex or one of the other main marriott properties in manhattan that have a similar room rate.

title: The Shroud
text: Looking forward to staying at this hotel.  Read lots of reviews on Tripadvisor which were all very positive.  When we got there we had planned to stay five nights....with a city view....not much to see with scaffolding and a shroud over the entire building.  Put a damper on the hotel and therefore quickly moved to another Marriott property - the Marriott Marquis on Time Square.  The staff at the courtyard were very friendly but the room was not what we had in mind.  Do not know how long the hotel will be covered in a shroud.

title: Great location
text: Great location, a great place to stay, very near to all the import places of interest. Staff were very helpful, friendly and efficient. The room was fine, clean and well equipped, fantastic shower. Pity there no real Resturant but breakfast was good if a little limited, coffee good and hot, just not keen on paper cups, but everywhere we went in Canada and US coffee/tea was nearly always served in paper cups. The concierge and porterage were fantastic,

title: Very good
text: Very good hotel and it needs a little bit to be excellent. In the middle of the city and close to everything and everywhere. I stayed only two nights. Did not enjoy the city so much as it was raining. A big hurricane was coming to the city :)

title: Muy bueno
text: Excelente ubicación las habitaciones amplias y limpias tiene en recepción un lugar para tomar café y comprar desde un adaptador para teléfonos hasta golosinas es un tótem normal pero súper bien ubicado muy buena atención de su maletero José es la segunda vez que me hospedo  lo recomiendo

title: 适合购物，对面是梅西百货
text: 位置相当好，对面就是梅西百货，楼下就是热闹的街区。要是楼层高的话，在房间就可以看到帝国大厦，隔了两个block的距离，走路5-10分钟。只是我们入住的时候，外立面在整修，全部是脚手架，什么都看不到。。。

title: Great stay
text: This was a great place to stay in NYC--subway right outside the front door and walking distance to Times Square  and theaters. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet although we could hear traffic below but that's expected in NYC. Had a wonderful dinner at Keen's located right around the corner.   Everyone was so nice & helpful.  Jose gave us great tips on things to see and the best way to get around. Had a change of plans on our flight home and Michael was right there to arrange transportation to the airport for us. We were so thankful to him.  Both of these guys were great!  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Location? Location.  Location!
text: Ok so this hotel isn't by Times Square or Central Park.  I've only been to New York a handful of times, so finding the right place has been a challenge.  You'll find great Central Park locales or Times Square locales or others, but for a tourist hoping to be near the action with the right price and ease of transport, this is a great option.  This hotel is great for visiting the WTC, Statue of Liberty, shopping off Avenida de las Americas which offers a giant H&M, Macy's, steps from the subway, tons of tourist junkie stores with IheartNYC stuff, etc.  We were put in room 1611 on the 16th floor.  It was a bit loud since there is a popular bar/lounge on the roof and the honking and sirens can also be heard until the wee hours of the night.  This is the downside in my opinion.  You know what you can expect from a Marriott.   The room had a nice setup and a great bed, but it's New York so it isn't extra spacious.  It was perfect for a good night's rest and centrally located to allow for access to Central Park, Battery Park, the Brooklyn bridge and shopping on 5th is only a couple of blocks away.

title: Decepcao
text: Hotel bem simples, abaixo de minha expectativa, a bancada do banheiro e minuscula bem como o frigobar que tambem nao gela nada... as fotos do site nao correspondem ao verdadeiro estado de conservacao da mobilia, tapetes...  contudo, o quarto e banheiro eram bem limpos e razoavelmente espacosos  e a cama bem confortavel, exceto os travesseiros que podiam ser melhores. Ocorreu um fato desagradavel em relacao a um objeto nosso ter sumido do quarto e, apesar de a camareira ter assumido que viu o referido objeto no quarto e que pode ter ido junto aos lencois na troca de roupas de cama, o hotel nao se responsabilizou pelo desaparecimento sob a alegacao que nao tinhamos como comprovar nossa reclamacao e ficamos no prejuizo, por sinal, nem tanto pelo lado financeiro e sim pelo sentimental, ja que se tratava de um presente que minha filha tinha ganhado vespera da viagem. O hotel nao tem cafe da manha e nao e muito grande, tornando tranquilo servico de elevador e corredores, exceto por um dia logo cedo, termos nos acordado apavorados com um alarme de incendio que disparou sem motivo, atrapalhando nosso sono. Enfim, nao atendeu minhas expectativas, exceto pela localizacao, apesar do incoveniente de uma boate que tem acesso, filas e muito movimento na porta do hotel. Nao voltarei a me hospedar nessa rede.

title: Amazing from start to end!
text:
I was so impressed with all the staff at this hotel. I was greeted with smiles and a helpful, can-do attitude from the moment I arrived. It started at the front desk, that went above and beyond to accommodate me. I wanted to take a moment to make special mention of Jose, the doorman. I had a lot going on the morning I was checking out. Jose took note of that right away and made sure to facilitate me with my exit from the hotel, into my car and to my final destination on time. I felt very well taken care of, he did his job with such care and consideration, not to mention a great attitude.
Thanks everyone at the Courtyard Marriott Herald Square, for being so AWESOME! 
And...Thanks Jose for being great at what you do! :)

title: Solides Hotel an hervorragender Lage
text:
Unser Aufenthalt im Courtyard New York Manhattan / Herald Square hat uns insgesamt gut gefallen. Die Lage ist perfekt, direkt neben der Subway Station (34 St - Herald Sq) und vis-a-vis des Macy's. 

Die Zimmer (wir hatten einen Standard Room mit zwei King-Size-Betten) sind für New Yorker Verhältnisse in Ordnung. Das Badezimmer ist zwar relativ klein, aber alles war tadellos sauber. Wi-Fi hat perfekt funktioniert.

Zu erwähnen ist die Dachterrasse im obersten Stock mit schöner Aussicht auf das Emire State Building. (Eigentlich hätte man dort, als Hotelgast, 20% Rabatt auf die Getränke, wobei man aber zwingend den beim Einchecken erhaltenen Gutschein mitnehmen muss - pro Zimmer erhält man offenbar nur einen für den gesamten Aufenthalt.)

Weniger gefallen hat uns der Hoteleingang. Dort ist lediglich ein Angestellter anwesend, bei dem man bspw. ein Taxi bestellen kann. Um in die eigentliche Lobby und die Reception zu gelangen, muss man den Lift benutzen. Die Lobby ist eher kühl gehalten. Es halten sich dort nicht viele Leute auf.

title: Highly recommend this hotel
text: I had an amazing stay here in August with the help of Mr.Corey Burton a front desk agent there his customer service skills were off the charts. I wish other hotel chains can take notes from that guy. Because of him I will be staying at at the Marriott hotel chain more often. When I come across amazing talent I have to give credit. The room was beautiful clean no issues great view of the city and I will definitely  come back again! Thanks again Corey for making my stay a memorable one!

title: Great stay
text: This hotel is in a great location with quick access to where ever you want to go (it also helps there is subway access right outside the hotel). The price was very reasonable. The rooms were very clean and everyone on staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent location; fair sized rooms
text:
While not a bargain this hotel's location made it worth while.  It is located next to the Empire State Building on the one side and Macy's on the other.  Yet the hotel is quiet (as long as you have a room not directly under the roof top lounge which is popular on the weekends).  The rooms are slightly larger than most Manhattan hotels with a modern bathroom with a window (frosted).  The place has been recently renovated so furniture and bed and carpets are still relatively fresh looking.  Unfortunately the hotel is currently clad in netting due to renovations, however, the view is largely unimpeded. 

The check in was excellent.  We arrived several hours prior to the 4:00 PM check in time.  The reception clerk ensured that while a smaller room was immediately available, since we would be staying for 5 nights, she would book us into the larger rooms.  This, however, would require us to wait.  No problem for us and much appreciated.  We checked our bags and went to town.

One peculiar issue did arise, however, upon our return.  When we returned at 6:00 PM it took over 20 minutes for our bags to arrive in our room.  Not good, especially when you've had a full day of travel and sight seeing.  I should mention that the front desk was not busy.  When we mentioned to "Michael" (the concierge) why it took so long to get our bags up to us and why the bags could not have been put in the room when the room became available, we received a somewhat flippant answer that we should have made this request at the front desk.  

OK, folks, there's you cue according to "Michael" - if you arrive early and your room is unavailable and you check your baggage, ask that your bags go to your room when your room becomes available.  

The other peculiarity was the absence of a second pouch of milk powder and sugar.  The room comes with a fridge (empty) and a coffee maker (one cup at a time) with two  paper cups but only one little packet of milk powder daily.  Strange.  How did they know that one us took their coffee black (however, the other would have preferred another little packet without having to go to the lobby).

Otherwise the hotel is quiet.  You hardly have the feel of a hotel since you go straight from the street level foyer to your floor - by passing the lobby.  The modern lobby is on the second floor and you can find the newspaper there.  The guards in the foyer are friendly, The reception clerks were welcoming and efficient.   The concierge was an ebullient fellow and, while a bit flippant, gave us a 20% discount coupon for the roof top bar, Monarch (which we unfortunately never had time to use).  There is free and efficient WiFi in the room, as well as nice soap and shampoo.  The bed is excellent.  And, finally there are some good Irish pubs right down the street with some excellent $5 beer/lunch combos (Playwright Irish Pub).

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Hotel muy bien situado cerca del Empire State y a pocos minutos del Flatiron, Bryant Park, la estación central y Times Square. Existe una parada de metro junto al hotel. Las habitaciones son tránquilas, cómodas y limpias. Wifi gratis. Ideal para visitar durante varios días New York.

title: Perfeita localização para compras
text: Localização excelente com metro na porta. Nos disponibilizaram o quarto antes do horário do check-in, receberam encomendas sem cobrança. Equipe muito prestativa e simpática. Quarto e banheiro com tamanho excelente e bem limpos. Em frente a Macys, com diversas opções de alimentação e um locker da amazon a um quarteirão. Região segura com movimento mas não tão caótico como a área da Times Square.

title: Friendly staff and good location
text: We stayed here during the first 4 days of our stay in New York, staff are nice friendly people. Although the hotel room is very small not enough space to move around specially with 3 kids but overall the hotel is clean and location is good just right across Macy's, Starbucks is just in another street with lots of restaurant around.

title: Great location; easy access; reasonable price
text: Have stayed here twice on business this summer (July and Sept).  Located 20 yards east on 35th from subway exit on NE corner of 35th Street and 6th Ave.  A block from Herald Square and Macy's.  So convenient.  Lobby is on 3rd floor. Courteous security at ground level entrance.  Large breakfast area and friendly staff, with reasonable prices for breakfast and for the stay itself.  Easy 10 minute walk up Broadway to Times Square.  Rooms clean and very good size for Manhattan. Good evening view out the window of Empire State Building.  You can't go wrong here, and will not be disappointed.

title: Great roof top bar
text:
I stayed here for 4 nights with my husband before going on to Boston, this is our 5th time in New York and we usually stay around midtown.
