The hotel was in a great location and within easy distance of the subway and main attractions, The hotel was clean the rooms were a decent size for New York and had everything we needed, we would have had a great view of Macys if it hadn't been for the scaffolding and netting outside our window due to building work. However there was no noise and the beds were extremely comfortable.The bathroom was bright, the lighting was very good and the shower had plenty of room, they also provided toiletries.
The roof top bar was amazing and must be one of the best location in the city it is up close to the Empire State building and can see Macys, the area is very comfortable and although the drinks are a tad pricey it is no more than can be expected for such an awesome location.
There are plenty of places for breakfast the best we found was Andrews coffee bar, don't bother with the Martinique it is overpriced and no where near as good as Andrews.
A must if you have the time is The Cloisters which is way uptown past 190th St well worth a visit and also a visit to Brooklyn Heights which is a great area to explore. I wouldn't bother with Coney Islands to say it has had its day is an understatement, way past its best and not worth the travelling time.

title: Excelente hotel
text:
El hotel es super bien ubicado al frente de Macys. Las habitaciones limpias. EL personal de la recepción muy atento. Quisiera destacar el excelente servicio que dan tanto José como Michael, quedé impresionada, siempre atentos a ayudarte en todo. 
Recomendando 100%, pero me pareció que las camas no eran Queen.

title: Great location in NYC and clean!!
text: It's walking distance from Penn Station which is great and right across the street from Macy's.  Great shopping. Walkable to the theatre district and Times Square. Also walkable to High Line Park. The room was very clean and that is important to me so I was thoroughly satisfied. If you have three people in a room with a king sized bed, then just keep on checking with the front desk to make sure there is a sofa bed in the room. The front desk will try their best to accommodate.

title: SSSSHHHH don't tell anyone how GREAT this hotel is!!
text:
My husband and I planned a trip 2 weeks ago. WE are SO happy with this hotel. EVERYONE was SO nice. Jon was VERY approachable when checking in and out. I didn't realize we would be  SO close to the Empire State building. We could see it from our window. This isn't a resort as I read that some reviews said the rooms were small. This was a nice size room, this is all you need when you are in NYC. Comfy & clean bed clean bathroom. AC worked well. I have been to a few other hotels in NYC and walked right out. NOT HERE. The hotel is RIGHT in the middle of Macy's/ Hearld Square. Perfect location for lots of subways.   The Monarch on the rooftop has a beautiful view of the city. And great snacks The only negative thing to say is the bartender was for no reason was rude to my husband and I. We asked for 2 different drinks she said no she couldn't make them and walked away. I stayed and waited for her to come back and had her make us something else, I was not going to let her upset us with her rudeness.  YOU will be happy with your stay if you book here!! We are already planning to come back in Feb. 2016!!!  
THANK YOU ALL AT MARRIOTT HERALD SQUARE!!

title: Great place
text:
Nice room very modern, hotel right near Empire State Building, which was a big bonus, breakfast area needs major improvement food not very good.
Front desk staff good but:

Jose made this stay enjoyable, he took care of us from the moment we arrived, gave us a suffers for a restaurant right down the street and he was spot on with the recommendation based on what we told him we were looking for.

Jose once again your the BOMB!

title: Great location
text: We stayed here for two nights - great location, brilliant rooftop bar. As with all marriotts the bed was comfortable and room was clean and a decent size. Especially for NYC. But don't use the valet parking - not only is it very expensive but it took forever to get our car back! Ridiculous - just park in the car park which is just before the hotel on 35th street

title: The kindest, generous, and most comfortable hotel! EEVVVEERRRRR
text:
First, let me start by stating, I am huge on customer service. It means the most to me when giving anyone by business. Sooo my flight landed in NYC at 5:30AM and check in was not until 4:00PM. To say the least I was panicked. I arrived at the hotel and greeted by Corey and Didire. I didn't even have to explain or beg for an early checkin they accommodated me right away. Thank god. Throughout my stay the staff here was extremely helpful. I have never been to NYC so I had no idea how to get around. One of the doorman, I think his name is (Jose) literally walked me down to the subway and gave me a full on tutorial of how to use the subway system and which train to use for my destination and return. If you stay, ask for him. He will help you get anywhere in the city. Then there was a guy on the fourth floor for house cleaning. Every morning he asked me if I needed anything additional or if I needed him to do anything. Who and where can you house keeping service that extends themselves so much?? Every morning going forward  the staff was so friendly and nice. Anything, I needed I would call down to Corey or Jesse and they would help me with directions, activities, info about the city, and whatever other needs suddenly came arise. I appreciate this kind of service because often at hotels you can hear the frustration in the staff's voice for becoming a nuisance. Not to mention, last minute we needed affordable and quick transportation to make our returning flight and Michael, one of the bell man helped arrange that just with a simple request. 

Additionally, the hotel is great. Its in a perfect location! You can literally walk across the street and access major shopping stores and the largest Macy's I have ever seen. There is a subway stop right outside the door of the hotel too. In addition, a couple nights a went upstairs to the rooftop bar for drinks. The view is AMAZING. You can see most of the city and it looks like the Empire Center directly in front of you. Be sure to ask Corey or Jesse for a coupon for discount on your drinks if you visit. Both are super nice and seem to remember every guest at the hotel. The hotel also has laundry, fitness center, business area for free computer and printing use (crazy cool), FREE WIFI (that works great by the way), and its meticulously clean. I love this place. It feels like your at home because any resource you need is accessible (refrigerator and microwave too for all your late night leftovers :) ).I will definitely be back to this hotel during my next NYC visit.

title: Strategico soprattutto
text:
È' strategico, vicino alla quinta av, vicino all'Empire, alla Broadway, a Times Square, alla metro, a metà strada per tutto. Insomma la posizione ci è' piaciuta, anche se la 35^ Strada soprattutto di sera e' zeppa di sacchi dell'immondizia con le relative esalazioni e insomma non è' uno splendore. In più la facciata dell'albergo è attualmente coperta da impalcature quindi arrivando penserete: ma dove sono arrivato?
Invece l'albergo e' molto comodo. Il piano terra serve solo per entrare in ascensore, infatti la security vi farà entrare superando la coda di giovani che va all'ultimo piano dove c'è' un locale di tendenza. 
Alla reception ci si va all'arrivo e alla partenza. Arriverete direttamente al piano con gli ascensori.
Le camere sono piuttosto piccole ma tutto sommato accoglienti.
Nel complesso tutti gli alberghi USA sembrano avere almeno una stella in più rispetto alle abitudini internazionali.
Il frigo c'è ma è vuoto. C'è' la cassaforte.
Il bagno è l'aspetto meno esaltante. Piccolo e da tre stelle (doccia nella vasca senza telefono e tutto un po' anni Ottanta).
Asciugamani contati come il bagnoschiuma.
Per il resto, pulizia senza problemi.
Neo di un certo peso e' il sistema di condizionamento: quando di accende sembra sia entrato un camion nella vostra stanza! Davvero fastidioso nella notte, quando si viene svegliati dalla riaccensione dei rumorosi motori. Meriterebbe un drastico ammodernamento.
WI-FI ottima.
Il voto è' quindi una media tra la comodità della location e gli aspetti non esaltanti detti sopra.

title: I love New York...and especially this Marriott!!
text: Booked this hotel because of its location to Penn station...and I'm so happy I did! Michael met me at the door and made me feel like I was home. The Monarch lounge on the rooftop is a great place to relax and enjoy a beautiful view of New York City.  Everyone couldn't have been nicer. My only regret is that it was a one night excursion...but I can't wait to go back!

title: Excellent hotel, loved it, loved it, loved it
text: Excellent location right near Macy's. VERY friendly staff - special mention to Michael who helped us with all 11 bags with a big smile and a lot of energy. Rooms were clean, smallish but hey this IS New York. Rooftop bar ahs very loud music and an amazing view of the Empire State Building. I was sorry we stayed for only one night and would definitely stay here again!

title: Moderno - simple - acogedor - ubicación
text:
El hotel es perfecto como centro de operaciones para recorrer NYC. Lejos la mejor ubicación, con Herald square cruzando la calle y estación de metro a una cuadra.
El hotel tiene una  ambientación moderna y minimalista, El personal fue muy amable en todo momento  y tanto el check in como el check out fueron muy expeditos. Está hecho para quienes valoramos el tiempo en este tipo de viajes.
Las habitaciones limpias y bien mantenidas. Suficientemente espaciosas para quien no pretende gastar mucho tiempo en el hotel.

title: Very good location
text: We've stayed multiple times in NY and this is our first time in the Herald Square area.  We loved the convenience of the subway.  The hotel was clean and I'd go back.  The rooftop bar had an amazing unobstructed view of the Empire State Building. Michael, the doorman, was outstanding.  He went above and beyond the call of duty to find a cab in rush hour to take us to the airport.  Apparently this is not an easy task from where we stayed, but he was able to convince a cab driver to do it.  Fantastic!

title: Отличное месторасположение
text:
Часто бываем в NYC, но именно этот отель запомнился наилучшим расположением и соотношением цены и качества.
Останавливались тут на несколько дней , остались довольны практически всем. 
Брали номер на троих, с огромной кроватью и раскладывающимся диваном. Хоть номер и небольшой, но нам места хватило. Тихо, несмотря на то, что это центр Манхеттена, чисто, уютно, всё необходимое присутствует в полном объёме. 
Эмпайр-Стейт-Билдинг находится в двух шагах, почти до всех основных достопримечательностей дойти пешком. Рядом есть метро.
В соседнем доме отличный китайский ресторан, очень вкусный и качественный. 
В двух минутах ходьбы огромный старинный универмаг Macy's, а самый большой бутик Victoria's Secret - рай для девушек, располагается ещё ближе, можно за минуту отнести покупки в отель)))))
Собираемся в январе 2016 снова остановиться в этом милом отеле.

title: First time visit to NYC
text: I chose the Courtyard at Herald Square because of the great reviews and easy access to all NYC landmarks. It is surrounded by great restaurants and the entire staff was amazing. We had a 4th floor room which had some street nose but nothing to keep you awake at night. We had a small patio and enjoyed the sounds of the DR parade during our last day.

title: 최상의 위치입니다
text:
위치가 너무 좋습니다. 매트로 코앞이고 연결된 노선 훌륭합니다.
청소, 위생 깔끔합니다.
대응 친절합니다.
런드리머신이 있어 세탁용이합니다.
조용합니다.
무료와이파이 빵빵합니다.
강추합니다!

title: Super !
text:
Nic dodac ... Naprawde Super Hotel - polecam!
Super obsluga , idealnie polozony .
Bylismy cala Rodzina i kazdy mial cos dla siebie . Duza pomoc Hotelu w Nowojorskich Atrakcjach .
Niedaleko kolo Dworca i Times Squer ..... Mozecie z 17 pietra tego Hotelu obserwowac NY .... Najlepiej Noca ;)))

title: Proche de tous
text: Nous avons passer un bon séjour dans cet hôtel. . Il est très bien placer proche de tout . Le métro juste en bas. Le personnel est agréable . Les chambres petites mais propres et confortables le ménage y est fait tous les jours. Le petit déjeuner cher nous avons préférer le prendre à l extérieur.  Le bruit de la rue en sourdine n'est pas au point de ne pas pouvoir dormir.

title: We loved our stay there!
text: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the Courtyard for 3 nights in July. We loved it for several reasons. First of all, the room as compared to New York City standards was quite spacious, which was a pleasant surprise. We had enough room to spread around. The room was elegantly appointed and modern and very clean. The beds were SUPER comfy and gave us a good night's sleep. Also, our room faced the Empire State Building so there were no complaints with the view! The bathroom wasn't huge but was clean and well appointed as well. We also really enjoyed the decor of the common areas...very sleek and modern. The location of the hotel was great too. Herald Square is bustling and full of energy, yet we did not hear street noise at all from our rooms. Many places of interest were in walking distance, particularly Times Square, and there was a subway entrance right on the corner making it easy to venture to other parts of the city. We loved having the large Macy's right across the street too! The only negative at all to the Courtyard that we could find was the breakfast. We did not find the food very tasty at all and it certainly wasn't cheap. But there are plenty of places to get a great breakfast at a reasonable price right within walking distance. In the end, I highly recommend the Courtyard Herald Square. I would be happy to stay there again!

title: Perfect stay!
text: First time in New York and this hotel made it an awesome first experience.  Michael the doorman was there for us every step of the way.  The rest of the staff from the check in desk staff to the porters to security were amazing!!  Everything was taken care of with extreme care and perfection. I will gladly stay at this location on my next visit. It made our first trip a wonderful experience!

title: Excellent Customer Service!!
text: Great place to stay! Came with two kids and Jon helped with an early checkin since my kids were exhausted and Michael Doorman was fantastic! He helped me with Empire State visit and car to airport. Michael made our visit so much easier for me traveling with kids. Probably one of the best customer service experiences of our two week trip. The ladies at the front were great also. Great customer service from everyone, pretty rare nowadays.

title: Weekend in NewYork
text: This hotel was just amazing. The room was clean, nice size. The bed was comfy. Liked the fact that there was a mini fridge on the room. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our doorman had a great sense of humor and it was fun to chat with him.

title: Courtyard/Herald Square Bungled My Reservation Horribly!!!
text:
Because I had a business trip planned in NYC for Monday, August 3rd through Tuesday, August 4th, I decided to use that trip as an opportunity to reward my oldest nephew with a trip to NYC. He worked hard to graduate from undergrad in three years and planned to start a dual grad/law school degree program. I initially made a reservation at The Carlton on Madison Avenue, but also reserved the Courtyard Marriott/Herald Square (CM/HS) to accommodate the budget of 7 other family and friends who wanted to see NYC. On Friday, July 31st, upon utilizing a link specifically for cancelling my Carlton hotel reservation, I accidentally deleted my CM/HS reservation. I immediately called CM/HS and, after 20+ minutes, spoke for 37 minutes with a rep who assured me that I was not only able to reserve the two rooms with double beds from August 2nd through August 4th (2 nights) at a rate of $235/night, but I was able to have breakfast included. I thanked her (and God) profusely. 

Although I still hadn't received a hotel confirmation 10 minutes later, I felt one would be forthcoming, per my past experience with many hotel reservations. What I received instead was an email on Saturday, August 1st stating that I could check in for August 2nd, with a check out on August 3rd (1 night) with two rooms, both with one king beds each. I'd already purchased Amtrak tickets for a return trip on August 4th; so, no way had I planned on leaving on the 3rd. In any case, staff on the phone was rude and dismissive, refusing to be accountable or remorseful for the error and the impact it was having on me and those who were traveling with me. Although the in-person hotel staff wasn't rude, they were equally dismissive, refusing to acknowledge or address the hotel's error. It was not only humiliating, but it was stressful. I would have accepted it if the rep was unable to meet my request when I spoke with her on Friday. After all, I deleted the first reservation. But, I was told (not just given the impression) my reservation and all I had specified had been secured. So, I didn't bother to immediately race to secure other lodging. Going forward, I (as will the four adults in my party who travel for business and leisure frequently) plan to boycott Marriott. Even if for business, which I travel for about once a month, I will pay the difference (in lodging and transportation) to lodge somewhere else.

title: Great Location!
text: Great Staff!!  Everyone was super helpful and friendly, especially Michael and Jose.  It was our first time to New York and we will definitely be back.  Clean rooms.  Great Location - Macy's right across the street, Empire State Building just a couple of blocks away, subway entrance was right out the front door!

title: Good place to stay for many reasons
text:
1) Really helpful front desk staff
2) Good location
3) Fun rooftop bar w/ a great view of the Empire State Building (not a Marriott bar)
4) Updated room, and the typical room is a good size by NY standards

The only obvious place they can improve is in the bathroom accoutrements - the towels are thin and very rough, and the toilet paper and tissues are also!

title: Super séjour !
text: Lits confortables, chambre propre, wi-fi dans la chambre, bon service et personnel courtois, rooftop Lounge avec vue sur l'empire state building mais les drinks sont tres dispendieuses ! Bel emplacement a environ 4-5 minutes de marche çe Time square !

title: Top notch service - great staff and meeting facility
text: I used the lobby and office space at the Courtyard Marriott for some meetings. The lobby is very cool and offers many different configurations so you can comfortably work or meet up with people. But the #1 thing about this hotel is their staff. True dedication to customer service. The people working the door and at check-in are very friendly. I want to give a special thanks to Rich in Loss Prevention. When the magnetic lock on the office door malfunctioned, he guarded my belongings as if they were Jack Sparrow's treasure! A huge thanks to Rich and to everybody at the Courtyard Marriott Herald Square!

title: Calidad-precio y comodidad
text: Este hotel es sencillo, práctico, limpio y funcional. No esperes grandes lujos, ni servicios de un 5*. Es perfecto para los que, como yo, pasan poco tiempo en el hotel y el tiempo que pasan desean descansar. Sin duda la situación es magnifica, cerca de todo a un paseo.

title: Nice hotel and great service!
text:
Hotellet har bra läge och ligger några minuter från Time square, Empire state building och massa andra sevärdheter.

Utanför finns en butik där man kan handla det mesta som mat, researtiklar, smink, hud och kroppsvård om det skulle krisa. Dock är det rätt dyrt där!!
För övrigt så är hotellet väldigt fräscht och receptionen är bemannad hela tiden.

Vi som var där rekommenderar verkligen det här hotellet.

title: Great Weekend Stay for Broadway Play
text: What a great hotel. Michael, the doorman, is excellent and makes a great first impression. Hotel is clean and nicely decorated.  King room is not huge but a good size. And the location is terrific. Very walkable to Times Square and the theatre district.  Great rooftop bar not affiliated with the hotel but very convenient.  Would definitely stay again.

title: Ideale locatie
text: Mooie locatie dichtbij metro, treinstation,... Kamers zelf zijn iets aan de kleine kant, en het ontbijt is een pak beperkter dan andere Marriots maar om de hoek heb je meer dan mogelijkheden genoeg. Service en begroeting is wel van zeer goede kwaliteit (wat je mag verwachten voor een dergelijke prijs)

title: Decepcionante
text: Realmente a localizacao e excelente o atendimento desde a recpecao, não tem um cafe da manha, o que existe e uma loja de cafe que tem em todos os lugares dos Estados Unidos, na entrada tem uma boate antes a noite e impraticável

title: Great City, Fantastic Hotel, Ideal Location, very Friendly Staff
text:
I am not one for writing reviews, so this is a first for me. I started planning this family trip to New York over 9 months ago. I must have spent hours upon hours looking at various hotels in New York and reading countless reviews. Deciding where to stay was always going to be the conclusive factor in a successful trip to New York. After many sleepless nights I decided to book the Courtyard Marriot Herald Sqaure. So on the 5th July 2015 we set off with some trepidation on our first trip to New York. Any worries regarding the Courtyard Marriot were soon dispersed the moment we were  greeted by Kenny at the front door. Always cheerful and always willing to help in any way he could. Passing on vital information to New York first timers. If the Courtyard Marriot was as good as their first point of contact then we had struck it lucky. We had no need to worry. Reception staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were very clean, ideal for our stay They were kept clean by a hardworking group of housekeeping staf, always eader to assist. It's  little things like that your remember. The hotel is in the ideal location for sightseeing, shopping, Broadway, Central Park. Ground Zero is a must, Central Park was fantastic and the Jersey Boys on Broadway just topped it off. As I said at the beginning I don't normally write reviews but the Courtyard Marriot deserved it. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and its staff.From the first point of contact to checking out on our last day, eveyone 
at the Courtyard Marriot could not do enough for us. As for the city that never seen sleeps Thank you for a wonderful holiday.

title: Dream hotel in NY
text:
My comments will be a couple of sentences;
Amazing location (5min to Times Square by walking)
Clean and fresh rooms
10 steps to Herald Sq subway
Starbucks at reception (love it..!!)
If I would go to NY again, I will stay there, no doubt..

title: Great central location in Manhattan
text: I've stayed at several Marriott properties in Manhattan, but the Herald Square location may be my favorite.  Subway for many lines are right outside the door.  All staff were professional, friendly, and helpful.  Rooms were actually a little larger than standard NYC rooms that I have stayed in.  It is a Courtyard, so not a lot of frills, but when you are only there to sleep and get ready for the day of sightseeing, it is perfect.  We stayed on the 15th Floor and had no problems with waiting for the elevator.  Street noise was minimal.

title: Amazing place
text: So glad we booked this hotel. Staff were friendly, rooms were spacious (for New York), clean and blocked out a lot of street noise. There is a small empty fridge in the room which is great for storing a few small groceries. The area is great for shopping; Macy's is just across the road. There is a subway station a few meters from the hotel which is extremely useful. The only thing I didn't like was the coffee machine in the room. The coffee was terrible. There were no facilities to make tea. A small kettle would've been much better.

title: Nice service !!
text:
“Excellence in abundance”
 

The hotel staff are excellent, Ask for Alexander from  Engineering ,michael,geraldine concierge amongst some of the most knowledgable I have come across in my stays in  hotels.

I wmailed ahead to say my partner and I would be celebrating a special occasion. I couldn't have imagined staying anywhere else and the hotel laid on a lovely gift for us too.

Service within the hotel was exemplary. Rooms were to a high standard both in cleanliness and decor.

All the usual things you'd expect from a courtyard  hotel. Will definately be staying here if we are ever lucky enough to visit NY thanks again Alexander for you for awesome job.

title: Hotel guest
text: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  Rooms were spacious and very nice.  Staff was very accomodating, Michael was very friendly and helpful, he made sure all our wishes were met with a smile.  He obviously enjoys his job. Thanks!

title: Wonderful for our handicapped nephew traveling with us
text: All of the staff was pleasant, courteous and helpful, especially Michael, the doorman, was exceptional.  The handicap amenities were tastefully thought out.  The room was very clean.  Housekeeping was called for extra linens and responded within minutes, fantastic!  All in all a very pleasant stay.

title: Great centrally located hotel!
text:
Love, love this hotel.  This is our hotel of choice every time.   It's very centrally located with a subway right outside the door.   Lots of shopping all around the hotel, too. 
Everyone from the doorman, to the lobby staff to housekeeping were so friendly and helpful.  

Our room was really big compared to most rooms I've stayed in in NYC.  We had a corner room with 4 windows and a great view!  The room was big enough for a desk, couch, chair...very spacious.  Not sure if all the rooms are this large but both rooms we've had there have been the same.  

It was a little loud since our room was facing 6th avenue but it didn't bother us at all.  We were so tired by bedtime that we fell sound asleep.  

Great hotel!!

title: Хороший отель
text: Стандартный номер, как водится в этих отелях, небольшой, но зато чистый, не изношенный, сантехника хорошая, постельное бельё качественное. Лобби на втором этаже, там же Старбакс и балкон, где можно завтракая наблюдать за жизнью Нью-Йорка. Рядом находится крупнейший в НЙ универмаг сети Macy’s.

title: Best Hotel in NYC!
text: I can't say enough about this hotel. It is by far the best I've stayed in, in NYC!!! Location is great, rooms are well appointed and SPACIOUS! which is a rarity in the city....clean comfortable and well cared for. But in addition to all those wonderful qualities the staff in this hotel outshines any hotel I've ever stayed in worldwide!  Everyone has a genuine smile on their faces and can't do enough to make your stay perfect!!!. A few names that I remember and want to point out to management are Corey at the front desk, Angel in maintenance and Michael who seems to be everywhere taking care of anything you need!  Must go up to the Monarch on the roof for great drinks and views NYC style....I WILL BE BACK!

title: Comfortable, clean and spacious
text:
My room was very comfortable, clean and spacious. It appeared to be recently renovated. Bathroom was spotless including the white grout. The bed and bedding were very comfortable. 

The staff were very helpful and friendly. It's at the .corner of Herald Square so a busy area. Highly recommended.

title: Elegante y Cómodo
text:
La atención fue muy buena cuando ingresamos al hotel, nos ayudaron con las maletas y siempre fueron atentos con el servicio que brindaban. En la parte superior hay un bar que es muy bueno, los días viernes parecen ser los más recurrentes para las personas de NY, hay música latina pero también música de allá. 
Lo único que no me gustó fue que cuando fuimos a pagar la cuenta la señorita que nos atendía se molestó porque no entendíamos que se paguen tantos impuestos y además nos estaban cobrando valet parking que no habíamos adquirido. Después de esto, es un hotel recomendable para poder relajarse y estar cómodo.

title: Excellent Staff attention
text:
Having stayed in different Marriott Hotels of different countries and cities, our review is directed to the outstanding attention of bellman Kenny and security Jessie. 
I was on vacations with my pregnant wife and my mother as these 2 gentleman were brilliant. Their attention was just exceptional. Well done Courtyard Marriott of Herald Square, Staff like this is just great.

title: Hotel Muito Bom!
text: Excelente localização, ótimo atendimento, quarto com bom tamanho, confortável e linda vista para o Empire State, banheiro bom e tudo limpo! Adorei e na minha próxima visita à NY, certamente ficarei lá!

title: BRILLIANT HOTEL & LOCATION - EXCELLENT STAFF
text: I booked this hotel purely on TripAdvisor reviews wanting a good quality hotel in busy location but away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. We LOVED this hotel and can't recommend it enough. We had room 711 which overlooked Macys and Herald Square plus views to the Empire state it was walking distance to Times Square, Fifth Ave, Rockefeller Centre, Broadway hadvlots of cafes, shops, subway & bus on the corner. Facilities include free wifi,  laundry, business centre and incredibly comfy beds. Our trip was for our daughters 21st and special mention must go to a lovely young lady on reception named Yeilly who organised a card and chocolates in our room on arrival our daughter qas thrilled. Also Jon on reception very warm and professional & ever efficient Kenny and Jose on the door. This hotel really cares about their guests its obvious in the customer service of the staff. If you are going to New York I urge you to stay at the Marriott Courtyard for its location, service and quality. WE WILL BE BACK!!!

title: Perfeito, não podia ser melhor
text: Muito bom hotel, limpeza, estrutura e acomodações, METRO na porta, de la se vai para toda Manhatam. excelente, recomendadissimo, o quarto enorme e bem decorado, janelas frontais e laterais deixam o visual maravilhoso

title: NYC Go To Hotel
text: Having stayed in many NYC hotels this was my second stay here after the opening a few years ago. It is by far the most conveniently placed location to hop on any subway to get anywhere you could possibly go. Rooms comfortable, staff attentive and acknowledge Gold Elite status. Love Starbucks on site, Macy's across the street and new outdoor food court right in Herald Square. It's my definite go to NYC city place already reserved for this year's annual trip.

title: Christmas Visit
text:
we stayed here for the Christmas period. Our corner room overlooked Macy's department store and up Broadway on the other side. The room was far better and comfortable that our previous New York hotels. Breakfast can do with a revamp as we found it to be a bit pricey by comparison with restaurants in the area. 
I certainly will stay there again as the location is ideally suited to access the major sights

title: Excelente!
text:
Esse hotel foi um achado! Na época pagamento 400 reais a diária e ele está numa localização que eu considero perfeita para quem quer conhecer NY! Uma quadro do Empire State Building, pra ir na Macy's é só atravessa a rua! Starbucks, Victoria Secrets, GAP, Forever 21, tudo bem pertinho e uma estação de Metrô do lado! O hotel é novo então tudo era limpinho e aconchegante, além de ter Wifi em todos os locais dele (até na rua pegava hehe). Vale a pena e se eu puder fico novamente!
Não deixem que conhecer o bar que fica no rooftop, vista maravilhosaaaaaaaa do Empire State Building!

title: One word - Michael!!!
text: This is the first time I have been to this Marriott property.  I have stayed at the other two Courtards in Manhattan (Midtown East and Times Square).  The service at this hotel was outstanding.  Michael works at the door during normal business hours.  Even though the Courtyard does not have a concierge, he might as well be.  He knew all the places to go in the area and recommended a nice Irish pub within a block of the hotel.  He definitely made my experience better!

title: So close to everything
text: We took the train in to the city to Penn station.  It was an easy 15 minute walk to the hotel.  It's easy to walk to restaurants.  There is a subway stop at the corner, we took the subway to Battery Park this morning.  Tonight, we have tickets for a show on Times Square and it will be a 15 minute walk.  We grabbed a Starbucks coffee to start the day and sat outside in Herald Square, right by the hotel.  It is so easy to get to everything from here.  There are 3 hotels in a  row, with the Hilton garden and a Hamton Inn

title: Great Stay in NYC!
text: My husband and I stayed here for a quick weekend getaway.  This was our first trip to the city and the hotel was really easy to find.  The location was fantastic and a walk up to Central Park and back took us past almost everything on our list of things we wanted to see.  Room was very nice (large for what I expected in NYC).  Great stay!

title: Great customer service
text: My first time staying at this NYC Courtyard was a great experience. The room was a decent size for New York. All the staff are very friendly and helpful, especially Michael the doorman, who did everything from get me into the car service arranged by the hotel  to making change. Good location for both walking to local attractions or catching the subway.

title: Efficient classy hotel near attractions
text: My daughter and I spent two nights at this Marriott, in town for a Billly  Joel concert at Madison Square Garden. A twenty minute walk from where our bus dropped us, it was still doable and less hearty could always take a cab. We were greeted right at the door by a clerk that told us how to check in and got the elevator for us. Check in was a breeze and although three hours early they had a room for us so we could freshen up and leave our things. The front desk clerk was friendly and efficient. Our room was a king bed with skyline views on the 14th floor. Skyline was a bit of a stretch but we heeded other reviews and stayed away from the top floors and reported club music. Our room was spotless and the space was efficient...fridge, TV and free internet were all in working order . Not much drawer space so those spending an extended stay will be living out of their suitcases. The room was quiet, bed comfortable and bathroom spotless. The tacky picture of a pigeon studying the skyline was the only jolt to my senses. You can walk to all things from here, we did Central Park, Madison Square Garden, and Times Square. These are longer walks so if you aren't up to a great deal of exercise take a taxi. With the traffic it is much better and quicker to just do it yourself.

title: Everything you would expect.
text:
We spent a long weekend in NYC in June 2015. Everyone we encountered on the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is secure without making you feel like a criminal coming and going. Great location in the middle of the middle of everything.
We  had a larger king city view which was indeed a bit larger than the normal Manhattan room. We looked over Herald Square with Macy's beckoning.
No complaints and a reasonable price.

title: Perfect location and pleasant staff
text: Whether a tourist or business traveler, this is nice hotel at a terrific location in midtown.  Very safe too as the doorman and concierge triage all foot traffic before taking the elevator to lobby and rooms.   The best shopping in NYC is on 34th and you are centrally located next to it all.  The rooms are nice size for a NYC hotel, and the lobby is bright and open, with an outdoor terrace area.  Didn't get to experience the rooftop bar as there seemed to be a line or private party every night.  Not much for breakfast options but the staff was nice, and there's a million places close by anyway.  Free wifi a huge plus.  Michael the doorman was very cordial and knowledgable about the area, and can arrange a decent fixed rate for a car to any airport.  Recommend to all travelers.

title: Great Service!
text: Jose the bellman was instrumental in our stay in New York.  He went over and above to ensure our stay was great.  He even walked us to the subway, took us down and showed us how to use the Metrocards!!!  He was FABULOUS!!!!  The rooms were very clean, and the other staff were very helpful as well.  It was a great stay!!  Would stay again!

title: Comfy, convenient and right at the center of NYC
text: Where else can you stay in NYC where next door is the largest store in the world, excellent Korean restaurant, Empire State building, Subway, Train station and 10 minutes walking distance to Time Square.  The hotel lobby is on the 3 or 4th floor and the room occupies the higher floors of the building.  Quiet and clean and comfy is what i describe my hotel room. Even though it is small, I do not complain since it is squeaky clean and the amenities are plenty.  If you want to catch a train to Newark Airport, this hotel is within walking distance to Amtrak station.  The subway station around the corner is without doubt the best feature of this Courtyard.  I'll come back again and again.

title: Great Hotel in Mid Town
text: This is a great hotel.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The size of the room... while smaller than most hotels across the US was larger than I expected from a NYC hotel.  The carpets are clean... bedding is clean.... well appointed room.  You will have access to computers and a printer in the lobby at no additional fee.... its a great hotel.  The roof top lounge is operated by another company but is quite the scene.  Great views of midtown.   I would recommend this location and do plan on staying here again when in NYC.

title: Wonderful location-Great staff
text: Met my  family in New York.What a great location.Right across the street from Macy's and H and M.The Staff was great.We arrived early in AM from the West Coast and Jon in the lobby(second floor) found us a room and anything else we needed.The service was fabulous on the 1st floor with everyone including Michael.When we needed a cab at 4:30 AM he made sure it was there.You have to go to the rooftop;the Empire State Building is lit up and right in front of you!Make sure you bring your camera;we took some amazing  pictures.We walked all over,up to Central Park.It was a wonderful trip and will be back.

title: Amazing Place, Amazing View!
text: Located right across the street from Macy's, with a subway station at the front door, this location is ideal!  The room was very well appointed and up to date, including an unusual abundance of electric plugs!  I found the staff to be the friendliest I have ever encountered in NYC.  The view from the rooftop bar and our room was exquisite as we were here during Memorial Day and watched the Empire State Building and Macy's clothed in red, white and blue.  I will definitely stay here again!

title: Lower floors can be loud from street noise.
text: Walking distance to Penn station. The room was nice, clean, and a good size. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Right next to the subway. We had a very enjoyable time and would return again if we're staying around Herald Square.

title: Small Rooms for family and lousy breakfast
text: Stayed for 3 nights from 31st May with family. Room sizes are very small and the breakfast is lousy. They serve pre-cooked breakfast and restrictions apply which is not mentioned while booking. Staff however is very helpful and always smiling. That's a big savior and a star for them. Not worth the price especially if you are with family and booking 2 Queen beds.

title: Great Location to explore the city
text:
I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago whilst visiting NYC, (27th May - 31st May) and found it to be in a great location (which was my primary reason for staying here).  As well being very close to a lot of tourist areas it is also right next to a large subway station so it was easy to travel anywhere.

The hotel itself is clean and modern designed, the room we stayed in was very pleasant with nice decor and a view of the Empire State Building.  The staff were very kind and helpful, particularly the doorman, I think his name was Michael, he was a great help when we first arrived in the city who explained all the hotel and surrounding area.

The hotel lobby also has access to the Monarch Rooftop bar which we also frequented when we were staying there which was also a cool place to visit for a late drink.

There was free wi-fi in the room which worked brilliantly, the only downside was maybe the small selection of food for breakfast which was also not free, I felt the hotel was a little pricey for not including and breakfast however we did enjoy our stay.

title: A Great Experience
text: We stayed here for 5 days and had a fabulous time.  The staff was kind, engaging and very helpful.  The room was perfect, very clean and comfortable.  The location was great too.  We had considered staying in Times Square but was glad we didn't as it was not as noisy and crazy as Times Square.  Loved having Macy's across the street to pick up things we needed, like a jacket and getting a watch fixed.

title: Beautiful property - great location - great value
text:
I stayed at this hotel for a bachelor party right after the opened and again for a wedding a few months ago.

This property (like all Courtyard's) is a great value - this hotel has a clean and open lobby.  The rooms are comfortable (but not huge).  

The gym is large and is well stocked - and it even has a patio to get sun (not my thing - but some people might like that).

The staff is great - really nice people that are willing to help on the drop of a dime.

title: Perfect stay!
text:
Positives: Location - shopping area!! (Macy's across the street). Subway - 20 steps from the hotel entrance & you are at the subway! Plenty of lines to choose from. 
Easy walk to Penn station & Times Square. Close to Broadway theaters & plenty of shops in 34th street (Vic Secret, Gap, Mango, Aldo, Banana Republic, Sephora etc)
Food - turn right out the entrance & right into 6th ave to find Pax whole foods for cheap fresh food. The hotel does offer breakfast for purchase at a restaurant on lobby level (above street level) but it is more expensive than eating out. Pancakes in the hotel are $9.95; at Pax $5.95. Oatmeal cheaper too plus far bigger selection.
There was a small market in lobby where snacks, ice-cream, toiletries etc could be purchased. They even had a limited selection of frozen meals & a microwave so you could heat up something to eat.
Staff- are wonderful!!! All so friendly & helpful! Thank you to all.
Monarch - roof top bar at entrance to hotel not cheap but this is New York! Wonderful trendy place to grab a cocktail & watch the sunset. The Empire State Building is right behind you. Very pretty at night.
Free wifi (3 devices only)
Laundry room if you need to do some.
Rooms - our 2 x queen room was a good size but I did notice other rooms weren't as large. Some will have Empire views or Herald Square (&  Macy's). Our city view room looked north along 6th ave. A small window could be opened for air or to gauge the outside temperature before venturing out. Air conditioner than we could turn off or adjust temp.
Amenities - Hanging space; plenty of bench space (desk); window that allowed natural light; all amenities like safe, ironing board etc. Lovely Paul Mitchell shampoo/conditioner & body lotion. Coffee machine in room.
Clean!!
 

Negatives: only 1 power point at bedside table & not large enough for overseas adapter. If trying to use phone while in room & charging we had to use the wall power points & sit at foot of bed.
Bathroom - small with no place for toiletries bag. On the plus side, they did have a narrow shelf running the width of the room to store small items on.
Food - no room service or restaurant for lunch or evening meal.

The positives far outweigh the limited negatives of this fresh, modern, clean hotel. Would not hesitate to check for rates if ever back in NY. If the price was comparable to hotels of similar quality & location this would be my first choice. Even if just because the staff were so lovely!! Thanks Kenny (I hope that's right!) & Michael....others too but names escape me...sorry! :-) 

Note: This hotel is 71 West 35th street. Don't confuse it with the Marriott on West 37th. It didn't come up on my first search.

title: Doorman Michael
text: I came to NYC for a work trip. On our last day, we had to leave our luggage so we wouldn't have to drag it all over the city. When we came back to the hotel, Michael greeted us immediately. He was very attentive, offered a black car, but was accommodating when we preferred a cab. He offered to get our bags and hail a cab while we ran to the restroom. When we came down, everything was waiting for us, he put the bags in for us, and we just hopped in and went. One of the friendliest doormen I've encountered in all the years I've been coming to NYC! He is definitely an asset to this Courtyard.

title: Muy buena opción y cerca de todo!!
text:
Me pareció un buen hotel, cómodo y limpio, sobretodo muy bien ubicado.
se encuentra en la esquina de la 6ta Av. y la calle 35, a una cuadra de Macy's y saliendo del hotel se encuentra una estación del metro que conecta con el Uptown y Downtown de Manhattan. también está a una cuadra del Empire State.
Sin embargo tiene algunos pequeños problemas, mi habitación era bastante chica, para ser una standard, y se escuchaba el ruido del desagüe en las noches, quizás si hubiera viajado solo no sería tanto problema pero como fui con mi esposa lo sentí más chico.
El hotel no ofrece desayuno de cortesía, pero cerca hay varios sitios recomendables para ello, como Pret a manger en la 5ta. Ave. con comida sana y económica.
De todas maneras me pareció por la ubicación y comodidad que es bien recomendable.

title: Michael the Doorman
text:
I normally do not take the time to write reviews (I guess I should) but in this case it wasn't an option. My daughter and I stayed at this hotel Thursday, 5/28-Friday, 5/29. Michael the Doorman was exceptional. From the moment we arrived, he helped with our car and brought us to the lobby, to the moment we were leaving the next day, helping with our valet. I did not only witness this generous behavior to my daughter and myself but while waiting for our car I witnessed his interaction with everyone. From the other guests to people simply walking along the street. All interactions were so welcoming and kind.  This isn't my first encounter with Michael the Doorman. I also stayed at this location back in October and Michael was there then as well. He is unforgettable!
Thank you!
Donna Dupre

title: Great concierge, rooftop bar
text:
Good location, rooms were small (NYC after all) and the concierge guys were friendly and had a few tips. Whilst I was in the elevator they managed to get a table at an exclusive restaurant for another guest by making a call.

Rooftop bar also an added bonus (although there is a better one around the corner at the Archer Hotel)

The negative: breakfast area in the lobby, Claimed to be a Starbucks but I think Starbucks should think twice about putting its name on it. Breakfast was appalling and cost a fortune. Ripped off.

title: Visiting New York
text:
Spent five days at this hotel.
Excellent location for travelling around with the subway at the front entrance. Just a few blocks from Times Square and many of the traditionally sought attractions. 
Room was clean and well air conditioned, coffee maker and fridge in room
Staff were excellent, friendly and very helpful.
Only disappointing aspect was the constant bass "thumping" coming from the rooftop 18th floor lounge "Monarch"  early evening and lasts until the early hours on weekends 0400 It is accessed from the first elevator inside the hotel entrance. Recommend you get a room a few floors lower than 17 if noise is a problem otherwise no problems with this hotel.
Monarch lounge is a great place to visit, open rooftop lounge little tight for space and seating with fantastic views of the Empire State Building great for sunset and night pictures.

title: Visiting NYC!
text: The hotel staff were so welcoming! One employee in particular named Michael welcomed us at the door and went above and beyond with helping us with our bags, directions and just overall made us feel very at home. He never failed to put a smile on our face each day! The hotel was very clean and conveniently located to everything, without being right in the craziness of the town! We really enjoyed our stay and would 100% return here in the future!

title: Excellent location, great hotel for travelling NYC
text:
Reached this hotel not-intentionally through priceline, while looking for a place for 2 nights in NYC after a business trip.
The hotel is perfectly located on 35th street and 6th Ave. right above a subway stairs, just near Macy's, Victoria Secret, H&M  and Desigual on Herald Sqr. (and a bit further DSW).
Staff is totally friendly and helpful, and rooms are wide enough, quiet, and well air-conditioned from the inside (Manhattan was hot and air condition did well).

Elevators are a bit slow and crowded to take you from the street to Lobby and then up

title: Great location
text: My parents stayed here recently to visit me and had a positive experience. They had a hard time adjusting to New York City night noises but thought the hotel was better than expected. The doorman team is very helpful, especially Michael, who went above and beyond to help us get are car out of valet when the parking lot team was understaffed. Would recommend.

title: Beautiful rooms in a fantastic location in NYC!
text: This Courtyard was either recently renovated or brand new.  We were upgraded to a corner room which had amazing view of Macy's and Herald Square out 2 windows and views up 6th Avenue to Central Park out of the other windows.  The room was very comfortable and even though we were on the 6th floor, the street noise wasn't too bad at night (you just have to expect this in Manhattan).  The staff was very welcoming every time we encountered them.  Herald Square is just out the front door and so is the subway which can take you anywhere.  Great shopping all within walking distance.  We arrived by train at Penn Station and this was only 2 blocks away as well.  I would stay in this hotel again when back in NYC for business or pleasure!

title: Perfect location, nice rooms, excellent customer service.
text: This hotel is everything I have come to expect from Marriott properties.  Reasonable prices, friendly service, clean spacious rooms, and excellent location for business and as a base for sightseeing make this one of my new favorite places to stay in Midtown.

title: Just exactlly what we wanted
text: We were in NY for one day to catch a Bermuda Cruise. The Courtyard was Very clean and modern.  Our room was on the 13th floor and very quiet and nice.  Not a big room but fine for us.  Very modern bath and shower and comfortable bed.  Elevators offered good service.  Check in was fast.  We got there a little early and main desk stored our luggage and brought it to the room later.  Right across the street from Macys. and only a few step from Herald square subway entrance.  They offer a small breakfast  bar with fair prices.  The door man and all help was very friendly.  We will stay here again when in NY.  Highly recommended.

title: Great Experence
text: My Wife and several friends stayed 4 nights and were very pleased with the service, rooms and all the extras from Jose and Mike, the two Doormen.  They were very knowledgeable and fun to work with.  We'll be back !!

title: Employees are outstanding!!!
text: We stayed at this hotel on Friday, May 1st and Saturday, May 2nd prior to taking a cruise from New York.  I must say that the hotel was fabulous.  However, the employees we encountered were even better.  The two employees names that I would like to mention are Michael Doorman and Jose (don’t recall last name).  Both were extremely friendly and helpful in giving us directions and ideas as to what sites to see.  There were eight people in our group under the names of Hamilton, Cockrell, Douglas and Bell.  All agreed that the accommodations were one of the best, if not the best, that we’ve ever experienced because of the employees.  Thank you very much.

title: サンクスギビングパレード
text:
サンクスギビングのパレードを部屋から見たい、という方にはお勧めです。
部屋からバッチリ見られます。
北側の、低層階が良いと思います。

ホテルの入り口が若干わかりにくいかも。
35th側から入り、フロントは2階になります。
フロントはおしゃれなアメリカ人って感じで、いい意味でビジネスライク。
部屋は日本のビジネスホテル、シャワールームと洗面台が狭くて、使いやすいとは言いがたいけれど、メーシーズは目の前、周辺にレストランもデリもたくさんあるし、どこに行くにも便利です。
エレベーターがなかなか来なくて不便を感じたので、私のように身軽な大人ばかりで泊まる、ちょっとせっかちな方は、階段を使える低層階をリクエストされると良いかと思います。

title: Outstanding stay in the heart of Manhattan
text:
I was in town for business, and decided to go with the Courtyard Marriott based on both the reviews and the location. Just two blocks from the Empire State Building, and still within walking distance of Times Square, you really can't ask for a better location. This was the best of both worlds, having a huge variety of places to eat and shop at, but still being away from the even larger Times Square/Theater District crowds.

The hotel is only a few years old, and it shows, as everything is brand new. The rooms are of decent size, and are ultra modern - with large walk-in showers. The best feature of the room for me was the central AC, though, especially when it's 80+ and humid outside. As far as reviews about it being noisy near the elevators, I was on the 14th floor DIRECTLY next to the elevators and didn't hear a single sound from them throughout my stay.

The staff were extremely pleasant, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again the next time I visit the city. This is an easy 5-stars for me.

title: Good all round hotel.
text:
Well located close to Times Square and the Empire State Building. Easy access to subway for further destinations. 
Clean and comfortable hotel. Valet parking. Friendly staff. Nice lounge / restaurant areas. Not overly fancy but everything you need.
Would stay here again.

title: Great location, good hotel
text: The hotel is a few blocks (easy walk) from Penn Station and there's a subway station right on the corner.  Nice places to eat close by.  Not the cheapest hotel in the city, but the location is perfect for my needs (museums, theaters).  This was my second stay and both times they were helpful in letting me check in early (about 11 AM).  The rooms are clean and pleasant, the staff helpful.  Coffee shop on the premises for breakfast.  Only drawback this time was a shower with controls you couldn't adjust without getting wet.  When I booked this time, they remembered (computer assisted?) that I'd stayed last year.  I'll stay again.  I found the wifi pretty good (contrary to one review I've seen), but I was there over a weekend both times I've stayed.

title: Nota 10!
text: Hotel excelente, perto da Macy´s e com metrô a dez passos  da entrada do hotel. O quarto é bem confortável e tem um espaço bom se levando em conta os hotéis de Manhattan. Frigobar no quarto e wi-fi grátis.O hotel recebe encomendas sem custo. O staff é muito prestativo e sempre disposto a ajudar. O hotel estimula a reutilização das toalhas visando a economia de água. Ponto para hotel.

title: Not meant for business
text:
If you are here for work and need to work then this is not for you.
The internet is like the AOL dial up.
Wow it takes a min to refresh online email.
Otherwise centrally located with business and shopping nearby.

title: Excelente servicio, ubicación y comodidades
text:
Nos quedamos 8 noches de marzo 2015 en el Courtyard Marriott de Herald Square, y fue una experiencia fantástica de principio a fin. Las instalaciones son nuevas y están en excelente estado. La decoración es moderna y agradable y las habitaciones sumamente cómodas.
El staff del hotel fue de lo más amable, particularmente Michael el portero (doorman) quien nos atendió siempre con una sonrisa, ayudó con reservas y hasta nos dio una mano con algunos paquetes de Amazon.
La ubicación en el centro de Manhattan y con una boca de Metro en la esquina es inmejorable.
Sin dudas un lugar para volver.

title: Fantastic Hotel for a Short stay
text:
Questo albergo è situato in una posizione eccellente !! E' molto centrale, vicinissimo all'Empire e con la stazione metro di Herald Square proprio adiacente...l'ideale per un breve soggiorno nella City !! L'ingresso è un po' insolito in quanto la Hall si trova al primo piano ed entrando c'è una postazione della sicurezza con il personale che ti indirizza agli ascensori.
Ogni luogo d'interesse è facilmente raggiungibile a piedi e/o con metro !
Il personale è stato molto gentile ed accogliente facendoci sentire al centro dei loro interessi :) In particolare Kenny Bellman e Michael si sono rivelati molto attenti e sempre pronti nel dare indicazioni ed aiutare a risolvere i nostri quesiti al meglio. Ci tornerei volentieri !

title: Bien, mais .........
text:
Nous revenons d'un séjour d'une semaine à NY et nous avons logé dans cet hotel. Voici un petit résumé de mes ressentis : 
-l'hotel : simple, bien placé, à 2 pas de l'ESB, métro juste en bas de l'hotel, times square à 10 min à pied. Cependant, il s'agit d'un quartier tres touristique et commercial, donc si vous cherchez des petits restos et bars pour le soir, allez à Chelsea !! Il y a cependant au 18eme étage un rooftop avec une tres belle vue sur l'ESB, à ne pas rater. 
-le personnel : très agréable, nous avons été très bien accueillis par Mikael.
-les chambres : côté hygiene il n'y à rien à dire, c'est niquel. Par contre elles sont petites et très bruyantes (bruit de la rue, klaxons, sirènes d'ambulances ... Boules quies obligées ! New york quoi!). Les matelas sont un peu trop mous à mon goût, mais c'est un avis personnel. Il manque cependant des "services" qui devraient être obligatoires dans un 4 étoiles, comme par exemple des bouteilles d'eau, des peignoirs, chaussons .... Ce sont des choses qui manquent. 
-le petit déjeuner : il n'y a pas bcp de choix (pas de buffet), c'est pas mauvais mais cher, prenez plutôt votre petit dej en face sur le square, ils vendent des gaufres liégoises, et parfois il y a un marché avec des fruits frais à vendre. 
-services : il y a un service de voiture pour se rendre à l'aéroport que je vous conseille fortement, ca coute 65$, moins cher qu'un taxi normal. 

En conclusion, le personnel a rendu le séjour très agréable (les américains sont en général très accueillants, contrairement aux français!). Nous passions toute la journée dehors, donc pour dormir l'hotel est vraiment tres correct. Cependant, si je reviens à NY, j'irai plutot à Chelsea, quartier plus "hype bobo", et où tous les restos et bars se trouvent !

title: Five Days in Manhattan
text: We visit New York at least once a year, and sometimes we are there twice a year.  This was the first time we had stayed at this property.  I am a Marriott Reward member and usually stay at their properties.  All the staff was friendly.  We were enthusiastically greeted by Michael at the front entry.  He took us up to the Lobby and still remembered us on our last day as he helped us get a taxi for the airport. The attendant cleaning our room was also very nice and welcoming when she would see us leaving our room for the day. The room was a nice, corner location, but only on the 7th floor.  So, the traffic noise was a little bothersome.  I know that's hard to avoid in New York, but as a Gold Member, I was expecting a higher floor.  We would stay here again.

title: Helpful Staff
text: The hotel was in a great location. There were many of stores around and I didn't have to go far to shop and the subway station was a few feet away. However, the room is small and with a double bed, it can get kind of crowded. Michael, the doorman, provided excellent service. Chatted with us until our car came and helped us with our luggage. He was very helpful and his positive attitude made our stay enjoyable.

title: Localização perfeita!
text: O hotel é muito bom, com quartos limpos e amplos. passei apenas 1 noite, mas com certeza ao voltar a NY tentarei me hospedar de novo nele. Além do ótimo atendimento, a localização não podia ser melhor, em frente a Macys, Victorias Secrets, na esquina da 34th e uma estação de metrô na porta. Ocorreu um incidente com o alarme de incêndio durante a madrugada, mas nada que estragasse a estadia.

title: Drew
text: I normally do not expect a high level of hospitality and friendliness when staying in NYC.   The staff at this Marriott could have been transplanted or could alternatively train at the finest Ritz Carlton property.  You simply can not fake the genuine passion they have for customer experience.  In particular,  Michael the doorman was graciously helpful and welcoming along with many other staff members we encountered.   Thanks for making this trip pleasant and memorable.   I will certainly prioritize for future stays.

title: Average Hotel - Great Location
text:
Overnighted here on a Friday at the end of a business trip to do a bit of shopping.

My requirement was a central hotel, close to Times Square where I could make the most of the 24 hours or so I had in Manhattan. I chose the Marriot based on price which at €180 for the night was as good as I could get at short notice. 

The hotel is literally around the corner from Macys and Penn Station. Took me about 10 minutes to walk there from Grand Central. Its well served by the subway stations close by so opens up the shops on 5th avenue and the world trade centre very easily. ITs a location you pay for but you really cannot fault.

The room I had was very small, as a double room its hard to imagine 2 people in it but it was clean with wifi, tv etc and did the trick for a single traveller on a one night stay. 

In common with some NYC hotels, the building is not exclusive to the Marriot. Reception is reached via passing by a security desk on the ground floor and taking a lift to the second or third floor. The bedrooms are further up. Its not exactly a 4 star welcome.

I didn't dine in the hotel and used it purely as a base. I was due to check out at 12 but rang and asked for a late check out and was given until 1. Better than nothing!  

I left my bags at reception upon check out and continued on my trip. The bell hop gave me a hard sell on a limo to the airport which I later availed of. $65 including tips and tolls was probably about what you'd expect to pay in a yellow cab to JFK. The porter took my bags to the car and waited with me chatting until pick up, you can't fault the service in the place.

All in all a great location, very cramped but good facilities and very accommodating staff make this hotel ideal for a (very) short trip - I'm just not sure I'd stay longer than 2 nights in it.

title: Great Service! Great Staff!
text: One staff went above and beyond: Michael, the doorman made our stay delightful and was always available for us. We really enjoyed our stay at this property. The location is great as well! We will be back for sure...

title: The Doorman Michael!
text: This place is a great place to stay and Michael the Doorman was so helpful to us! We had six kids total and he came in handy with great advice of how to get to places! Jose was also great! Clean rooms and great location!

title: Book this hotel
text:
There are enough reviews about the rooms in the hotel so i won't go on but get a high one floor 13-15 is great

never a wait for lift or at reception they are very efficient, friendly and professional here.

best things......

Starbucks to sit in or take out every morning 6am-12pm from the lovely ladies in the lobby restaurant.

rooftop bar has amazing jaw dropping views of Empire State lit up at night, a really nice chilled DJ and amazing cocktails.

concierge are the most amazing guys overly helpfull and really look after you, calling cabs giving recommendations and so friendly.

title: Staying in NY on Biz and Pleasure
text:
Stayed at this Courtyard after many years of staying either in Financial District or on Times Sq and was very pleasantly surprised.  Michael, the Doorman, met me the first day and made sure I had everything I needed the entire trip.  When my wife joined me Michael helped her get situated as well.
The staff was great throughout.
The room was larger than I expected and serviced perfectly each day.
Bathroom was a bit smaller than I had hoped but the shower was great with excellent pressure.
If there is any complaint, it's the TV.  I don't like the way the TV is on a wall off to the side, making viewing from bed difficult.  The remote does not work well and it makes it frustrating to change channels or change the volume.
I will be back to this hotel.

title: Decent rooms, convenient location
text:
Conveniently located for the subway and one block from Penn Station, right next to Macy's and close to the Empire State Building, this is a good hotel, with comfortable rooms. 

Most of the rooms don't have a view of any consequence.

Plenty of restaurants around and about and a small "market" in reception make food options easy.

Small gym and smaller sun deck, guest laundry and really good roof bar.

title: Rich Loss Prevention Kenny bellman
text: Kenny was an exceptionally skillful bellman .We had a better experience at the hotel because of his top notch customer service. Rich was also professional and pleasant. He went out of his way to help us during our 4 night stay. The team worked together to assist guests.

title: Great Stay!
text:
We stayed here for 8 days, me, my wife and two kids, and the location was very good.
You are close to everything, and the subway is near by.
The beds are the best beds I have ever slept in!! fantastic! (what brand is it?)
Staff was very nice, and Mike was very, very helpful when we needed to get to the airport,  arranging the luggage and a ride out to the airport. (thank you Mike.)
I recommend this 100%!

title: Met expectation
text: Courtyard is a decent no-frill option for staying in midtown Manhattan. Walk to many attractions or evening outings. The room is decent size by Manhattan standard. Some may consider small. Everything is functioning well. If you stayed at other Courtyards, you may recognize familiar design and btahroom amenities. This location appears to have been recently renovated. When the price is right, we will be back again.

title: Excellent Hotel, Midtown Manhattan
text: Clean, nice beds, good bathrooms (small rooms, but who's staying in the room?).  Macy's across the street, subway right outside the door, very convenient for a tourist.  Easy walk to Broadway area, or Park Avenue.

title: Hotel was excellent and staff was very friendly!! Better experience than we expected!!
text: Hotel was a lot nicer than we expected. Friends that visited NYC told us to expect a small hotel room. Our room was A LOT nicer and bigger than expected. Jesse was the security guard and was always smiling and friendly. He was very helpful and checking on us when arriving and leaving. Jose was the best doorman we have ever had. He was always attentive and responsive to all of our needs. We said we were going to leave and try to find the Hop On/Hop Off place and he gave us the closest and cheapest place; we ended up having a great time. We stayed for 8 days and both of their attitudes were always great and friendly. No complaints for Jose, Jesse and the hotel!

title: Great stay at Hersld Square
text: Our family of 2 adults, 1 senior and 2 kids really enjoyed our stay for 6 nights. Close to everything we had planned to visit. Really friendly and helpful staff. In particular a Doorman Michael who was very kind and considerate to us and everyone else he met that we saw. Many thanks Darren & family

title: Perfekt läge och bra standard
text:
Bodde här under 5 nätter, 2 vuxna och 2 ungdomar på 15 resp. 13 år.
Bokade mest med tanke på läget eftersom shopping stod högst på önskelistan.
Rummen var bra med väldigt sköna sängar. Badrummet också det bra.
Med tanke på att det låg mitt i "smeten" så tycker jag nog att det var ganska bra med ytor.
Personalen var så där amerikanskt trevliga dvs. hälsar och frågar hur man mår utan att mena alltför mkt. Dock inget som var värre här än någon annanstans.
Om jag åker hit så skulle jag definitivt tänka mig att kunna bo här igen.
Hotellet har en härlig bar på takterrasen med grymt bra utsikt över Empire State Building.
Så åk upp på kvällen så har ni en väldigt bra chans att få bra bilder på.
Ganska så tyst för att ligga där det ligger. Visst hör man trafiken ibland men inte något som man störs av.

title: Great service! Great location!
text:
My wife, eight year old daughter, and I stayed at this hotel at the very end of March and first of April. The service by the doormen, especially Jose, Mike, and Andrew, and the security man Jesse, cannot be beat. I used to work for Disney and I know what excellent service looks and feels like to a guest. These guys went above and beyond to help me make this the best trip possible for my family. I had been to New York a few times before. This was the first time for my wife and daughter and it was wonderful!!

The room was nice. The location cannot be beat. Across Herald Square from Macy's, with a subway stop right outside the hotel, the Empire State building down the street, Metro buses very close, and Times Square/fifth ave/Central park all within walking distance, this cannot be better for us. We will be back!

The help of Jose, Mike, Andrew, and Jesse make planning in New York very easy.

title: Awesome location, Awesome Hotel, Awesome Doorman !!
text:
Visited this hotel after long and painstaking hours on tripadvisor looking at all the reviews. This hotel was one which rated excellent and it's no surprise why.
This hotel is in a great location opposite Macy's within easy walking of the Empire State Building, MSG, Times Sq, Penn Station etc. Loads of shops nearby, Victoria Secrets, Urban Outfitters, Footlocker, AEO, Forever21 to name but a few.

Hotel room is cleaned daily, bathroom spot on. We had a room on 8th floor which wasn't noisy, 2 double beds which are the norm for NYC, four of us in the room which was big enough. My son and daughter are adults (just) and the room was more than adequate. 

Lots of places to eat nearby, breakfast bagals round the corner from PAX were delicious along with best bagals and coffee a stroll along the road. We ate at The Counter near TSq for burgers, Planet Hollywood TSq, Applebees TSq, Andrews Cofee shop not far away. All well worth a visit with no disappointments. One of the best was The Keg Room on 36th st just behind the hotel. Good quality hearty meals with excellent surroundings. 

Last but by no means least was Michael the doorman. Helpful, friendly, nothing too much trouble and even sorted our ride back to JFK. Opened the lift when we were cold and tired after a long day shopping, what a gent. He added to the whole experience and is an absolute gem! 

I wouldn't say this normally but from our experience this is a great hotel in a great location and you won't be disappointed if you stayed here.

title: Excellent Staff
text: I usually don't have the time to write reviews but after my second stay at this hotel,I just had too. I'm going to start by saying this hotel is a wonderful choice if you want to be in the heart of everything. Great location and a comfortable place to lay your head at night. The highlight for me though, was the amazing service from the staff. Michael was very hospitable and kind. In particular there is Jose. He was so kind, friendly and helpful. I can't say thank you enough for his hospitality. Keep up the great work guys. I look forward to my next trip to New York and your wonderful hotel. Thank you!

title: Super friendly and helpful staff. Doorman Michael and guard Jesse made it extra special.
text: Loved our stay here. All of the staff were really friendly and helpful. The doorman, Michael and guard, Jesse made it extra special. Their warm welcome and friendly smiles always made us feel like we were coming home. They asked questions and really listened to what we were looking for in our experiences and made perfect recommendations. Jesse helped us with directions to our destinations and navigating the subway system. Michael set us up with reservations for restaurants, cabs, whatever we needed. Doorman extraordinaire! Thank you for a first class stay.

title: Wonderful Stay, Great Location, Very Friendly and Helpful Staff!
text: My family and I visited NYC for the first time from April 4 through April 6. I wasn't sure which hotel to choose and I now I am so glad that I chose the Courtyard Marriott - Herald Square. The location is great! Very short walking distance to shopping, Times Square, the Empire State building and many places to eat. Our room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. Melissa (front desk) warmly greeted us when we arrived.  She was very helpful with directions and information regarding the hotel. She even provided us with a map which we used throughout our stay. Jessie (hotel entrance) greeted us with the most wonderful smile and offered very helpful tips to us for travelling throughout the city which we greatly appreciated.  We were very impressed because the staff, (front door, front desk and housekeeping) were genuinely friendly and helpful.  I have recommended this hotel to others and I will stay at this hotel during my next trip to NYC!

title: Pros and Cons
text:
I was at this hotel in March 2015, with my wife and teenage daughter.

Pros
1. A 1 minute walk to Macy's
2. A 1 minute walk to Broadway Ave.
3. A 1 minute walk to the Subway.
4. A 10 minute walk to Times Square.
5. A 10 minute walk to the Empire State Building.
6. Clean room.
7. Very comfortable beds
8. Attentive staff.
9. Many restaurants nearby.
10. Security in the lobby.

Cons
1. A 1 minute walk to Macy's. 
2. Check-in staff did not provide any info on nearby attractions.
3. Breakfast is not included.
4. Surroundings are a bit seedy with drunks leaving nearby bars late at night... so you need to keep an eye out.

title: Great stay for our family, great location, very friendly staff.
text: We found the staff at the Courtyard Herald Sqr all to be so friendly and courteous. The room was clean with a view of the city, modern decor and the size you'd expect for NYC. We especially loved the Bistro staff who remembered our coffee drink orders each morning and were very friendly. My only complaint and this would be with hotels in general,  why do you have to charge so much for market goods?  My daughter purchased a bag of chex mix thinking they were $3 and they were $10.  That is ridiculous and I just don't see why you have to mark the price up that high.  Other than that our stay was very nice and the location of the hotel was perfect, just a few blocks from many popular sites, right on the metro line as well.  Bryant park is gorgeous, just a few blocks up.

title: Localização nota 10
text: A localização, 35th Street esquina com 6th Avenue, é sensacional e o ponto forte. Estação de metrô (34th Street/Herald Square) praticamente na porta, Starbucks do outro lado da avenida, Macy's a poucos passos, lojas da 34th Street, High Line, 5th Avenue e Empire State bem pertinho. Ficamos em um quarto com duas camas de casal no oitavo andar com vista para a 6th Avenue. O quarto é muito bom, limpeza diária, com armário e cabides para pendurar os casacos, tábua de passar roupa, ferro, secador de cabelo, TV, frigobar e mesa. O banheiro tem banheira e chuveiro. Chegamos algumas horas antes do check-in, que lá é feito às 16h, mas como não tinha quarto disponível deixamos a mala no hotel (não há cobrança pelo serviço). Os ponto negativo foi a exigência do pagamento de uma taxa, tipo um seguro. No momento da reserva, isso não nos foi informado. Eu e minha mãe tivemos que entregar US$ 300 como garantia. O dinheiro foi devolvido no check-out, mas não gostei de ser surpreendida com a taxa não informada. Ficamos 11 dias e o alarme de incêndio tocou duas vezes. Na última, de madrugada, um dos frequentadores de uma festa no rooftop apertou o alarme, mas não havia fogo algum. Os funcionários da portaria são educados e solícitos.

title: Genial. Recomendado!
text: La ubicación es inmejorable, la atención buena. Todo muy limpio, y nuevo. Comunicaciones por metro excelentes. Las habitaciones son completas. A agradecer el trato personal por parte del hotel. Una gran experiencia.

title: Situación inmejorable
text: Nuestras estancia para 7 días fue espectacular, tienes todo lo que necesitas a tu alcance, parada de metro en la misma puerta del hotel, también tienes a pocos pasos las principales atracciones como pueden ser el Empire State o Timesquare. Dormimos a pierna suelta gracias a su gigantesca cama y añadir también que la habitación es espaciosa. Señalar especialmente la limpieza del hotel y en concreto de la habitación, todo genial, es muy probable que repitamos estancia en este hotel.😉

title: Nice Room with View of the ESB
text:
We stayed here on Thanksgiving Eve and had a corner room that provided a view of the Empire State Building and Herald Sq.

The room was great... until the marching bands started warming up for the parade at about 3:30AM. Should have gone to bed MUCH earlier!! lol

Still, the room was clean and comfortable, and we will definitely stay again. Maybe just not in T'giving Eve!!

title: Ótimo, metro na porta.
text: Localização ótima, esquina da 6ª com a 35, muito limpo, atendimento muito bom, quarto com frigobar o que ajuda muito, metro herald Square na calçada do hotel. Macys em frente, perto do Madison Square Garden .

title: Great Location & Staff
text:
This is the best Courtyard we've ever stayed at. Modern, staff very friendly, great location in midtown Manhattan close to the Empire State building, Times Square, Macy's, and many restaurants. Corey, at the front desk, got us a nice corner room(1311) with a view of the Empire State building and lots of windows to see the busy New York life. Jessie, from security, helped us out with our many questions.
 Be prepared for very high food prices at the local restaurants and very busy streets. We took a carriage ride through Central Park and it was outstanding

title: The best location and staff
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 8 nights for my first visit to the US. I did not know how convenient the location was until I got here. Right by Times Square and Broadway. You can walk rather than spending a lot of money on taxi.

The rooms are pretty and big, with everything you need. Good bed, tv, bathroom and a fridge. The traffic is not a problem. 

The employees are the most helpful and service-minded people I've ever met. Whatever you ask they help immediately. In the door you will find the happiest and most friendly person on the planet - JESSE - he made my trip. With his recommandations we went places that we would never had found any other way. Like the worlds best pizza. 

I love this city and will definitley choose this hotel next time.

title: Perfect location, great staff, nice rooms.
text:
We were originally put into a room for disabled guests on the 4th floor - the room was spacious but we had requested a higher storey room when booking and felt uncomfortable taking a disabled room that we didn't need; the staff found us a room on the 16th floor quickly and without fuss.
