The room was a good size, great views of the Empire State Building and Macy's, with a comfortable bed and TV/fridge/safe/iron/hairdryer.

Location was perfect; a Subway station just outside the door with access to B, D, F, M, N, Q & R trains, with Penn Station one block away for the 1, 2 & 3.

Times Square was a 15 minute walk away, Central Park about 30, same for West Village/The High Line. Amazing!

Breakfast was a little expensive from the lobby so I went out to the Starbucks opposite for tea each morning - bagels from Best Bagel & Coffee are two blocks away and incredible.

The free wifi wasn't super-fast but functional - we watched a couple of shows on Netflix while we were there. Room was tidied and cleaned nicely.

Noise from the Monarch Bar was minimal - it might be a problem if you're on the 17th floor but we barely noticed it. The bar was great to visit too (happy hour from 4-6pm) though slightly annoying to have to go down the to the street and get a lift back up to the 18th floor!

The doormen were friendly, saying hello each morning and we had a good chat with Jesse as we waited for our taxi to leave.

We'll definitely be staying again.

title: Great Location and Staff
text: The room was clean and pleasant, perfect for a short stay.  The hotel staff were all very courteous.  The Doorman, Jose, was very helpful.  We appreciated how they held our bags after we checked out so we could continue to enjoy the city after check-out and before departing that evening.  I would definately stay there again.

title: Great Location and Helpful Staff
text: This hotel is close to Penn Station and right near Macys. Jose the Doorman is especially friendly and helpful! Our room was a good size and the staff gave us great restaurant suggestions! We will definitely stay here again!

title: Perfectamente ubicado !!!
text: Un hotel con inmejorable ubicación.Esta a un par de cuadras de Time Square,frente a Macys y en la puerta, se encuentran las líneas de metro  que pueden llevarte a los más interesantes atractivos turísticos de la ciudad.las habitaciones son pequeñas ,pero el baño es adecuado.buena limpieza general de habitaciones y espacios comunes y muy buena atención de su personal.el último día tuve un problema con el shutle al aeropuerto ,y un botones se encargó  de solucionarlo. Recomendado 100% para parejas o matrimonios..!

title: Convenience
text: The location is wonderful. Very convenient to Penn Station, subway, Times Square. There are lots of good restaurants close by. The room was quiet and comfortable. Friendly, helpful staff. I look forward to staying there in the future.

title: Muito bom. Recomendo.
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, com estação do metro na porta. Limpo, quarto de bom tamanho e pessoal muito atencioso. Apenas não estava incluído na reserva o café da manhã mas na região existem várias opções. Recomendo.

title: Staff Staff Staff
text:
I just came back from a week end get away in NY at this hotel.

Everything was fine from the beginning to the end.

My main reason for this five star review is the staff. From the Valet Parking to the Check Out, everything was fine, more than fine. In the last 30 years or so, i've been in over 25 hotels in Manhattan. The staff for this one was simply the best.

Staff with genuine smiles.

Staff who cares.

Staff that is fast.

It was the fastest check in i ever had. Very efficient. Everything time i walked by the lobby, never a line up. Usually, there are two reasons for this.

The hôtel is empty which it was not the case.

Or service is fast and fine and people don't have to come back following an issue. Bingo

I strongly recommend the hotel.

Other reasons:

It's new and well maintained

Perfect location. Empire State building, Macy's, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, 10 min walk from Theater district.......I can go for a long time.

Business center

Fast elevators, no long waiting.

The room (in my case 1301) was Standard New York size, but very functional. Space to but your luggage, safe and a fridge.

But not least, a dream Bathroom, great plumbing, huge shower.

My room was close to the elevators, but nerver heard Ting Ting...Slept like a baby

Window actually open if you need fresh air (fresh as it can be in NYC of course, it's not the Catskills :-) )

Very nice bed.

I will go back and bring other people.

title: Meet Michael
text: Fantastic location, good price, good size room. Highlight of this property is the evening concierge named Michael. He is genuinely the highlight of this place. If I owned a hotel in New York, I would hire him in a heart beat. Great place to stay in New York for the overall price & location.

title: Good location, nice staff but...
text:
Do not book transportation by the hotel. Because you pay more than what you're expected. Flat rate 65 US dollar and we were told that this included everything. We were going to pay 5 USD anyway but the taxi driver claimed us at least 10 US dollars. 

We only pay for good service depending on how well someone perform the service and it should not be a standard as it was in this case.

title: Fabulous Place With Even Better Staff!
text: We loved staying here!  All staff were very helpful and courteous!  Michael the doorman went way above the call of duty in helping us out and ensuring we had a great vacation!  We were able to switch from the 17th to the 15th floor after the roof-top lounge was too loud for us to sleep on the first night. We will stay again for our next NYC trip!

title: Idéalement bien placé dans Manhattan
text: Nous avons passé une semaine à NY. Cet hôtel est idéalement bien placé dans Manhattan. Proche de tout, métro au pied de l'hôtel, à côté de Broadway, situé juste derrière l'Empire Sttae Building que l'on voyait de notre fenêtre! La 5ème avenue est au bout de la rue. Le personnel est très agréable. Un rooftop sympa dans l’hôtel voisin. Juste un petit bémol pour ceux qui comme nous aiment les petits déjeuner sous forme de buffet, ce n'est pas le cas. Nous avions trouvé une parade, allions déjeuner dans l'hôtel à côté! Je recommande cet hôtel à tous ceux qui souhaitent passer du temps à NY

title: Pleasant stay, great location
text: For the money, this was a great location in Manhattan. Not too far of a walk to Times Square without having to pay the higher rates to be closer. The view from the room wasn't the greatest although it was suggested that the view was a good one. To be honest I don't know what the the views were from other rooms so ours might've indeed been a good one. We could see a brick wall and the Macy's if you looked to the right. Check in was smooth and the employees friendly. No problems with water as another guest experienced around the same time. The valet was very nice and gave us some great information. Not far from the garment district and Mood Designer Fabrics.  Unfortunately we didn't make it to the rooftop bar but wish we had at least checked it out.

title: Great stay
text: Fantastic hotel and a great location to stay overnight with a skyline view of the city. Was really impressed with the bar on the roof top, where you can overlook the Empire State Building while having a champagne. Also, there's a nice and cosy Irish pub just right in the neighbourhood where you can hang out in the night and have some food. Room service is not available in the hotel, I'm afraid.

title: Bad experience with the water; only warm and slow
text: Room is average condition. Problem with water pressure that the shower was very slow.  The water was only warm.  They are unable to fix it over the weekend. They are trying to replace the part on Monday. Staff is helpful.  I am a platinum member of Marriott.  This is the worse experience that I ever had .

title: Recomendadísimo
text:
La ubicación del hotel es privilegiada. Tienes el metro en la puerta (lineas N,R,Q,W) y en la calle de al lado (la 7 con la 34) las líneas 1,2 y 3 (junto con el Madison Square Garden y la estación de Pennsylvania). Situado delante mismo de Macy's y a 10 minutos andando (o incluso menos) de Times Square, y a 2 minutos del Empire State. El personal es muy amable y correcto. La limpieza en zonas comunes y en la habitación excelente. Las camas son grandes y muy cómodas. Armario un poco justo para una semana y 2 personas. Tamaño de la habitación correcta. Nosotros no desayunábamos en el hotel (dentro tienes servicio de cafetería Starbucks pero la variedad es justa). En la zona tienes varios markets con servicios de desayuno,comida y cenas para llevar o tomar en el mismo recinto y a buen precio. Hotel totalemente recomendable por precio, calidad y ubicación. PD: un punto a su favor que les doy, es que compré unas entradas para un concierto en la ciudad y la única posibilidad era un envío a domicilio dentro de USA. Yo puse la dirección del hotel y les envié un correo para avisarles. Cuando les llegaron las entradas, me contestaron el email y en cuanto hice el check in me entregaron las entradas. 

 Para una semana hay que calcular alrededor de unos 200€ más al precio de la reserva, por motivo de tasas e impuestos varios de la ciudad y/o hotel.

title: Large room, great location, friendly staff
text: I stayed here for a long weekend with friends and wanted to be near both Penn Station and Macy's. Penn Station was in walking distance which was an easier trek than taking the subway in spite of the fact that it's only a couple of stops. Like many urban hotels, you have to get to the lobby from the street via an elevator and then you obtain your key and go on to your room. I didn't spend much time in the hotel so not sure about any of the amenities other than the gym (which had plenty of equipment for a hotel gym in the city as well as a decent size so you didn't feel like you were literally on top of other gym goers).The really pleasant surprise was the room size. I worked from the room and it was very spacious for one person and would have been more than sufficient for two people.The room also seemed recently renovated and the shower was good. I'd definitely recommend it and the price point was ~$115/night which made the stay even sweeter. The only challenge I had was with my neighbors who were a bit "over zealous" at night. I called downstairs to complain and it seems that a phone call from the front desk was enough to cool their ardor!

title: Incredible Service
text: The hotel staff was incredible. John at the door might be the friendliest person in New York. The location was perfect to travel around the city. The subway was steps away and the view was beautiful. I highly recommend this hotel

title: Excelente localização optimo quarto
text: Ficamos neste hotel em Fevereiro, durante um dos períodos mais frios e o quarto esteve sempre a uma temperatura agradável. O nosso quarto era tinha uma cama King size bastante confortável, e ainda assim tinha espaço suficiente para as nossas 3 malas. O staff é extremamente prestável. Possui um lugar onde guardar as malas, caso seja necessário. Também existe uma Starbucks dentro do hotel, pelo que se pode tomar lá o pequeno almoço. A localização é fantástica: fica em frente à Macys, dá par air a pé ao Empire State ou Bryant park. O metro é mesmo À porta e é uma das estações com mais linhas pelo que permite acesso directo a boa parte da cidade. Penn station também é muito perto tal como  o acesso ao PATH caso se queira ir até New Jersey.

title: Birthday Stay 2/19 - 2/22
text: I had the best stay at this hotel! I chose this hotel based solely on reviews & they were spot on! We arrived after 9pm and we were greeted by a very friendly face. Room was very nice, clean & quite spacious compared to other NYC hotels. Rich the security guy was fantastic! He greeted us as we arrived & left..we had to ask him if he ever went home!! He recommended dinner & breakfast spots for us and even gave a coupon for dinner! Next we met Jose! Man what a nice guy he is! He found us directions, maps and anything else we needed!! Melissa at the front desk was so kind! She even searched for places my husband could play the lottery! Everyone and I do mean everyone (Miguel, Micheal downstairs and Mike at check-in desk) all were so friendly & helpful! Felt like home.. I would definitely recommend this hotel as I will be back there myself very soon!

title: Chrismas in New York
text: If you want a great location, clean hotel, and a great staff. Please look into this Courtyard, and tell Michael the doorman that my family said thanks for all his help. I only stayed there for one night and 6 days I stayed at the JW in Central Park , and I found this Hotel to be much better.

title: Excellent Service
text:
I'm staying at the hotel on my business trip for 20 days.

Been a long stay, I can mention that all employees are very kind and ready to assist you.
I specially thanks Richie who help me call an ambulance and assuring everything was OK in my room when i got food poisoned by the shop next to the hotel. Also Jesse and Michael are always happy to help with a great smile.

The only thing I would prefer to be better is the internet, since I need a good connection to work, 
apart form this.

Definitely this is the hotel for your stay!!

title: Great service!
text: Everyone was helpful and exceptionally friendly!!! The hotel is very clean & comfortable and in a fantastic location. Michael the doorman warmly welcomes at every opportunity and goes to great lengths to meet every need!!!

title: Great hotel
text: Excellent hotel and  great staff. Rooms are modern and well appointed. Restaurant is open plan and very pleasant with a bar and great food. Excellent helpful staff with a special mention for Jon and Miguel. Great location just on Herald square although city noise can be a little loud - but that's NYC!

title: Great Thanksgiving Day Parade Watching and Guest Services
text:
Everyone should see the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade in person and this is a great home base for watching.  We stayed in room 910  (911 was the corner room) and had a perfect view up 6th avenue and a great big window for watching the parade - the window opened a notch so we could hear the bands and the hoopla. Next time, I'll ask for 7th floor to look the balloons square in the face for a different perspective - 9th floor was a bit over their heads - but gave great perspective of the whole parade coming at us and all of the people lining the route.

Room was "cozy" for 4 people - they are definitely doubles not queens - but we made it work. There is a cupboard - no closet - but it and the area under the wall hung desk and the hanging vanity in the bath room were enough storage area for a 4 day stay with 2 twenty-somethings who brought their entire wardrobe. Room was very clean and quiet.

As bad weather was forecast for Thanksgiving Eve, we pushed our stay up a day to arrive Tuesday night and the hotel was very accommodating. They put us directly into the parade view room we had booked several months in advance, so we didn't have to make a move. Tuesday night cost $179 compared to the $999 rate for the 3 night minimum Thanksgiving stay (before taxes and fees of course). Some hotels would have stuck us for the higher rate for the additional night - Marriott didn't. Was it worth the money? You bet!  The parade came directly at us just before it turned the corner a block south to Macy's.

I was a bit apprehensive about our arrival late on a weeknight - and there is no real place to pull in and unload the car - they have a marked loading zone on the street. When we pulled in at about 11pm, the hotel staff was waiting for us and quickly unloaded the car and the valet wisked the car away and they kept it until we left on Saturday - for a fee of course :)  We were in our room, unpacked and zonked out by midnight. 

The area around Macy's gets understandably crazy the day before the parade. They close 6th avenue and get to work swinging all the street lights to the side and out of the way of the parade. We walked or used cabs to get around, but driving would have been more a hassle than usual. There are several fun restaurants within a block - pricey Keen's steakhouse and Bryant Park Grill are right around the corner, but so are StellaTrattoria in Macy's and my personal favorite Playwright Irish Restaurant and Pub on 35th street. There is a handy Duane Reede and a few nice deli's for snacks.

The hotel provided a handout with advice on handling the event. Main points - the hotel does not have a special viewing area (but you can spend an extra few $100 to view from the 3rd floor lobby with brunch - otherwise this area is closed and blocked off from guests during the parade - more about this later). There is a delay re-entering the hotel after the parade because there are so many people coming and going. Bands practice across the street by macy's overnight - if you're a light sleeper - you'll hear them! If you're a fan, you'll enjoy them :)  Spoiler alert - Macy's actually films many performances starting at daylight in from of the store to insert with "live coverage" of the parade on tv  - but don't count on watching - they block the area off pretty well to lookers on.

After the parade, you are landlocked. 6th Avenue is closed until about 6pm so they can restore all the street lights. Cabs going down 7th are already full and 7th is gridlocked. Cabs going up 8th are already full. Face it - you're stuck. Our solution was to walk down to Playwright's and enjoy their Thanksgiving special - it was amazing - a full traditional Thanksgiving spread for $35 a person - including the pumpkin pie. Or you could order off the menu - one of our girls had a steak and it was as big as the plate and perfectly cooked. We lingered a long time and the staff made us welcome and kept filling refills long after the bill was paid and tip rendered.

Hotel staffers Michael and Nicholas seemed to be everywhere, all the time. I don't think they sleep. But they were wonderful hosts and always ready to offer ideas or help and very accommodating to requests they could fulfill. Keep in mind, every single soul in the hotel wants to be front and center for the parade - so there are limits to what can be done to accommodate some requests. Some people who didn't plan ahead were particularly surprised and offended that they couldn't use the lobby during the parade. You'll find that EVERYPLACE that has a parade view is making the most of the $ return on that view for this day. Don't expect a free ride unless you watch on the street. The hotel's hiring strategy must be very special because we never encountered a sour face and they all seemed to be loaded with holiday cheer!

So what are some other strategies if you don't want to make yourself cozy in a parade view room to watch the parade?  Get an interior room (much cheaper!!!!!!!!!!) and sign up for the lobby parade/brunch special - lots of room to spread out in the lobby (out of control kids alert) and there are doors to the outside "porch" that runs along the side street with a parade view - but you'll have to stand to see it out there. If the brunch special doesn't show on the website - call and ask for a reservation. Or combine an interior room with brunch at Stella's in Macy's - it's on the 2nd floor in Macy's - has its own elevator at the corner of Herald Square and a wall of windows looking out to 6th Avenue and the parade. Be prepared for some jostling in the beginning, but the parade is 3 hours long - reserve your energy at your table having the wonderful brunch and you can score a front row spot by the middle of the parade.  Again - you'll probably be standing but you'll have a reserved table to go back to and eat and this is a great, warm, view. OR reserve an interior room and head down to the street to watch the parade.  It is not nearly as crowded at 36th street as it is up by Central Park and gee, its the same parade. Be prepared to take a thermos of hot chocolate (warmed in the lobby microwave) and bundle up for the full frontal parade experience.  With 3 hours to watch - you can slip back to your room to warm up and watch a bit on tv before returning to the street.

If you're used to The Doubletree Times Square amenities, you'll see a contrast. There is no room service and although you can get a snack and coffee at the counter in the lobby - the hours are really limited. The few times we found ourselves there at lunch or breakfast (other than Thanksgiving), we made a deli run and had a "picnic" spread in the lobby - comfy chairs and plenty of space to spread out and visit with friends.  The twenty somethings visited the rooftop bar, The Monarch, one evening and it was empty - so empty that their waitress sat down with them for a while. Great views, astronomical prices, but worth a visit. For my money, I'd rather go back to Playwright's a have a soda and snack and watch sports on the gazillion flat screen tvs behind the bar. If only I could have had a leftover turkey sandwich with some dressing and cranberry sauce on the side, but I didn't have the nerve to ask.

All in all, I think this was a perfect spot for the parade, worth the extra $, a bargain compared to some of the Columbus Circle hotels, great proximity and view of parade, clean and comfy room, wonderfully accommodating staff, and once Macy's opens Thanksgiving evening, you can slip across the street and do your Black Friday shopping if that's your thing.

title: Great Service at Courtyard - Manhattan/Herald Square
text:
Newly remodeled hotel in a busy part of town...very clean, excellent view and plenty of action on street below. 
Outstanding service from Michael the Doorman...he is there to greet you, help you with bags, get the elevator, park your car or bring up your dry cleaning or help you with directions!

title: Michael our doorman made it all happen.
text:
We arrived Christmas Day and had a wonderful time.  Michael was friendly and very helpful.  He made it all happen for us.  The hotel staff was great.  A staff that smiles and offers to help before one has to ask makes a huge difference.  The rooms are clean and the gym is awesome.  It was really nice to walk straight out to shop in the morning!!!
We will stay here again.

title: 紐約曼哈頓35街住宿
text:
很方便的住宿地點35街，櫃台在樓上。房間不多，
房間內就可看見梅西百貨在對面，也可以看到帝國大厦，
離地鐵或帝國大廈都很近，下次到紐約還是會入住。

title: Location is everything
text:
Hotel location is very convenient for tourism, subway is next to the entrance, Macy is almost in front of. A Mac is turning the corner. 
However you need to take an elevator to go tho the lobby in 2nd floor, and rooms are very very small for the price. 
Luggage was very well handled after check-out. Hotel allowed us to store the luggage until late afternoon.

title: Posizione eccezionale
text:
L'hotel affaccia su Herald Square, piazza dove c'è il famosissimo negozio di abbigliamento Macy. Sotto l'hotel troviamo sia la fermata della metropolitana (linea gialla e arancione) sia la fermata del Path (ottimo treno per raggiungere Wtc ed Hoboken). Anche a piedi si possono raggiungere parecchi punti di interesse in meno di 10 minuti. (Empire state building, Flatiron, grand central station, public library, madison square garden, 34 th, Time square,ecc)
Le camere sono moderne e pulitissime. L'unica pecca è solo l'armadio, troppo piccolo per 4 persone.
Valida anche la colazione anche se solo dolce. Buono il caffè che servono perchè è Sturbucks. Il prezzo un filo più alto della media ma ne vale la pena. Consigliato

title: Great Place to Stay for New Year's Eve
text: This Courtyard is a mere seven blocks from Times Square.  As such, we were within walking distance for the New Year's Eve celebration in Times Square.  We were able to arrive early in the afternoon on December 31st, park the car in their garage ($65), walk to lunch, and then enjoy New Year's Eve in the bowtie (the area in Times Square where the celebration occurs).  The rooms at the hotel were very clean.  There is really no view of anything, but that was okay, for the hotel was far less expensive than others.  It is a newer hotel, so everything is nice.  Finally, there was a subway station right at the hotel's front door, so we could have taken it if we so desired.

title: Posizione da 10..!!!
text:
Appena ritornato dal mio soggiorno newyorkese questo albergo ha molte note positive...
Posizione perfetta per raggiungere qualsiasi metà 
Pulizia e ordine estremo 
Cordialità di tutto il personale estremo 
Per chi si aspetta colazioni super non è il genere 
Unica pecca forse nelle camere con due letti doppi pochi armadi per riporre vestiti dei 4 ospitanti 
CONSIGLIATO...!!!!!

title: Hotel novo, excelente localização
text:
Localização excelente, muito próximo a Times Square e ao lado da estação de metro Herald Square. É possível fazer muitas coisas a pé do hotel - Empire State, 5a Avenida e Rockfeller.
Em frente a gigante Macy´s e próximo a varias lojas interessantes.
O hotel é novo, o que não é tão comum se tratando de EUA. 
Quarto muito bom, espaçoso e confortável.

title: Da tenere in considerazione
text:
Albergo pulito, grande gentilezza dello staff e posizione strategica. 
Sei nel cuore di Manhattan ed in poco tempo raggiungi a piede tuti i luoghi di interesse. Metrò appena fuori l'albergo, sturbucks difronte e Macy's sulla piazza....
Cosa fondamentale albergo silenzioso.
Da tornarci!!!

title: Um achado em NY
text:
Estou encantada com esse hotel. Um verdadeiro achado em NYC. E olha que já visitei a cidade 6 vezes!
A localização é perfeita! Metrô na porta do hotel, Macy's em frente, Victoria's Secret ao lado, ótimas opções de restaurante ao redor. 
Quartos com bom tamanho (o que é raro!)
Esperava que o box do banheiro não fosse com cortina (odeio), mas ok. Bons amenities. Secador de cabelo potente e bom. Várias toalhas de boa qualidade.
A limpeza nota 10. 
Fiquei num quarto para 4 pessoas. Camas muito confortáveis e limpas, apesar de pequenas (equivalem a uma cama de casal pequena). 
No quarto há um pequeno armário (tem pouquíssimo espaço para guardar roupas) e cofre. Fornecem tábua e ferro de passar roupas (amei!). Tem um rádio relógio com dockstation para iphone e há uma máquina de café e frigobar (vazio)
Tem uma Starbucks dentro do hotel em que se pode comprar itens pro café da manhã (caro, porém gostoso e com várias opções)  e um pequeno mercadinho para outros itens.
O funcionário Michael foi muito atencioso e simpático. O pessoal do atendimento e da segurança também.
Pedi quarto com vista para o Empire State building, mas não puderam atender o meu pedido. Também pedi early e late check out, mas como o hotel estava lotado, também não puderam atender ao meu pedido. Mas nada disso diminui a qualidade do hotel.
Como chegamos muito cedo, guardaram nossas bagagens sem qualquer cobrança adicional. Também receberam encomendas minhas sem qualquer cobrança. 
O Wi-Fi é GRATUITO! (o que também é raro)
Oferecem diversos computadores para o uso dos hóspedes, além de uma específico para imprimir vouchers e tickets aéreos.
Com certeza voltarei a me hospedar nesse hotel. DEMAIS!

title: Perfect Stay
text:
We spent a few days before Christmas (2014) at this property, shopping, eating out, and going to shows.  One of the best stays we've had as a family in the City! The hotel is relatively new so the facility is clean and welcoming.  All of the staff were friendly, helpful and went out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable.  The Bellmen/Doormen (Mike and Cat) went above and beyond every day to make it a fun experience for all.
The Hotel location is great.  Right by all of the shopping.  Walk out the front door and you can walk right down to the subway.  Walk up a couple of blocks and you're at Times Square, or Rockefeller Plaza.  Go the other direction and you're at the Empire state building and many other great attractions.  

only issue we had during this trip was the hotel did get us a car service to the airport that was supposed to be $51.00 to LGA and they charged us $73.00 - so just make sure if you get a car service you check before you pay.  
We will definitely be back to this hotel when we visit the city.

title: Location! Location! Location!
text:
This hotel is perfectly situated. We travelled from Upstate NY via Amtrak and got down at Penn station. This hotel is 2 blocks from it - a couple bags on wheels and stroller were no problem for the short walk. Walkable distance to Times Square, access to subway right across the street, tons of shopping including the flagship Macy's - couldn't ask more.

Being Manhattan, rooms are slightly small but packed with everything you'd need. Very impressed by the amenities in the room. 

Very friendly staff.

title: Excellent property
text: Visiting NYC after Christmas, we scored with room availability at the Courtyard.  Convenient access to subways, Starbucks, and MSG made this a great location for our needs. We received a complimentary upgrade to a corner king room with a sleeper sofa (no roller beds and we had our 7yo who needed a spot to sleep).  The housekeeping staff was great, making the sleeper sofa for us (unusual at most hotels these days).  Well appointed room and a large bathroom by NYC standards. Planning to stay again for family and business travel in the future.

title: Great position
text:
I spent a week during Xmas time with my family. The staff was very helpful helping us changing the room from a king to a double queen as with a girl of 2 years it was quite larger!No extra fee was requested.
The room was very quiet and clean. Minifridge is available on room and in the lobby there is a microwave you can use. Also a variety of drinks and snacks are available (to charge  extra on the room) if you need!
Undergroung station is just round the corner to the hotel entrance. Also an underground accessible with stroller is nearby, very helpful!, Macy is just in front of the holel, just need to cross the street!!
If I have to find any negative spot I can say the breakfast: you have a little sturbucks in the lobby but as we had breakfast included we can only get dark cofee or orange juice and choose between muffin, waffles or pancakes...I just expect a little bit more from a 4 stars hotel...but really, it was the only little "negative spot"
I suggest the hotel to everybody: families, couples, friend...!

title: Great experience
text: Very impressed by location and by the service provided, especially by the bellmen/doormen Cat and Michelangelo. Outstanding, intuitive service by both of these gentlemen.  Hotel is in the middle of tremendous attractions, especially in midst of the holidays. We'll be back next year.

title: Great Location
text: We had a great time at the courtyard. My daughter and I visited for a few days to shop, eat and see a show. We were pleased with the staff. Miguel and Michael, The Doorman were friendly and seemed to really enjoy their work. We will be back again

title: Excelente localização e custo/benefício
text: Localização perfeita, perto de tudo e com vista maravilhosa para o Empire State Building! O staff é super atencioso, sempre simpático e disposto a ajudar. O hotel é novo e os quartos confortáveis. A limpeza é muito boa. Volto com certeza!!!

title: Sehr gutes Hotel in bester Lage
text: Insgesamt lässt sich nichts aussetzen. Die Lage ist bestens - gegenüber von Macy's am Herald Square (somit 5 Gehminuten zum Times Square, 3 Minuten zum EMpire State Building, 2 Gehminuten zur Fifth Avenue, 10 Gehminuten zum Rockefeller Center). Eine U-Bahnstation liegt direkt vor dem Hoteleingang, Penn Station ist in 5 Gehminuten zu erreichen. Die Zimmer sind für New Yorker Verhältnisse sehr groß. Schicke und neue Inneneinrichtung. Die Lobby befindet sich im ersten Obergeschoss, die Zimmer liegen auf den Etagen 4-17. Gute Schallisolierung, leise Klimaanlage. Sehr gute Zimmerausstattung. Freundliches Personal, sehr schnelle Fahrstühle. Rooftop-Bar auf dem Dach des Hotels mit tollem Blick aufs EMpire State Building. Im Vergleich zu anderen Hotels ist das Cortyard Marriott Herald Square für seine Lage und seine Ausstattung gelativ günstig, wobei die Hotelpreise in New York ja bekanntermaßen ohnehin exorbitant sind. Insgesamt eine Top-Empfehlung, sicher aber kein Luxushotel (das erwartet man bei dem Preis aber auch nicht).

title: AMAZING BUT....HMM!!
text: Its been long years I moved off NYC to AZ as im a marriott member so I found this brand new hotel which I tried to contact manager by email but WOW!! I got reply from Director mr Lewis so gentleman as understanding regarding my doubts about room view because im picky I must say fair is fair ha ha!! Okay I got a beautiful view corner room with macys view as empire state bldg; its just in center city which easy access to everywhere so I was happy and had fun hmm I also struggled to handle my big luggages when I was leaving hotel, I was stopped by 1 old doorman who told me for tips;I dont know his name as there were 3 doormans 2 speaking english older and young as 3rd is billingual called Jose (jose also help on breakfast) who knows EDUCATION because i arrived with my elderly mom so Jose greeted us and we gave him tip LATER!! Unlike the older doorman who said tip at that same moment even I was with 4 big luggages and making sure my elderly mom dont carry due her bones hmm how rude!! PATIENCE IS A VIRTUE!! right? 1 star less for that older doorman service who think im not coming back and hurrying for tip?! Of course im coming back but I'll avoid that doorman!! I rather have doorman Jose or anyone...trust is earned not given!! anyway thanks Mr Lewis and doorman Jose as also the receptionists hotel!! Im happy and looking forward for my return!!

title: Outstanding employee
text:
This hotel has the best location for all one wants to see but far more is the men and women that work there. One stood above the rest Catalino he went far above the call to duty to make our stay wonderful and the best part is it was genuine he really care about our stay and did everything he could to see it went well...Thank you to Catalino.
The hotel is across from Macy's and just down from time square. It is also a short walk up 6th to Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center. you are never shopping at at Macy's, Manhattan mall, Bryant Park, Hell kitchen flee Market and the Theater District flee Mark style shops... 
 Plus as to Eat you have everything you need by this location.
I have stayed at other places but from now on it will be here..
 For Members of the Grand Lodge Of Free & Accepted Masons it is a short walk to Grand Lodge on  6th and 23rd. Would be a good location to stay for Grand Lodge in May

title: Heart of NYC
text:
Nice hotel, close to Macy's , Rockefeller Center, Radio City, subway station right across the street.
Michael as everyone has said is GREAT, WHAT AN ASSET TO THE HOTEL!  Our room 712 was BIG, others in our party had smaller sized rooms. So ask for a larger room, they were the same price. Only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 stars was you could hear street traffic all night long! Which I'm sure is typical for NYC.

title: My Son's First Trip to the Big Apple was Perfect!
text:
We emerged from Penn Station to a biblical downpour; scurried two blocks to our hotel and were immediately put at ease by Mike at the Front Desk. He was able to give us an early-arrival room--and upgraded us at no cost. (Perhaps thanks to my modest Marriott Rewards points or because I mentioned I was bringing my son to NYC for his experience of New York. Either way, he was a true professional and a really nice guy.) Our room was a corner, executive suite overlooking Macy's and Herald Square to the west/south and the Empire State Building to the south/east. Folks like me don't get rooms like this! The amenities in the lobby and our room were all-new and beautiful. The corridors to rooms felt like a quintessential New York hotel--not cookie-cutter hotels found off interstate exits.
As we were blow-drying our raincoats the Korean Day parade struck up the band right below our windows. Welcome to New York! We walked our feet off for 36 hours, saw everything from 125th St to Ellis Island, and each time we came and went from the hotel, the doorman, Michael, was there to greet us and ensure we were all set with our vacation needs. Michael is the kind of New Yorker everyone hopes to meet. Kind, helpful, and friendly. We felt safe and welcome, and that they appreciated our business. I hope Marriott knows what a great impression these men are creating for their hotel. We WILL stay in this hotel again next time we're in NYC. Perfect location. Perfect staff.

title: Treated Like Royalty
text: This hotel is such a perfect little gem perfectly located.  Perfect rooms.  Perfect amenities.  And perfect, perfect service.  The clerk at the front desk was kind, quick and efficient.  The cleaning staff clearly took pride in their work.  The security staff was attentive and we must give a special shout-out to the doorman, Michael and the bellhop, Catalino.  All this fussing over a group of middle aged ladies made us swoon!!!   With such good service, we are sure to return.  The location is right next to Macy's.  Our room had a spectacular view of the Empire State Building (which is right around the corner).  There is a wonderful roof-top lounge and the view is amazing.  We thought we'd be slick and take a quick way up to the lounge via the stairs but we set off an alarm by doing so (sorry and embarrassed!!!).  Don't be like us - take the elevator!!  Seriously, we wish our stay was longer.  Perfect, perfect, perfect!!!

title: What a great hotel!
text: We had a very nice stay. We were only in town for a couple days, but the hotel was very central to everything we wanted to go see! Michael the doorman should get a raise! We was so helpful and was so friendly, and an all around genuine person. I would come back to this hotel just to talk with him again! My experience here has very lovely, and I would love to come back!

title: Fabulous staff, rooms and location!
text:
Stayed 4 nights here with my teenage son in a double double city view room. The room was a very decent size, spotlesly cleaned every day, beds incredibly comfortable - those pillows are the best! - and the view was brilliant. Straight down sixth avenue. Totally lucked out because we were looking directly onto the Macy's Thanksgiving day parade. Actually don't think you could get a bad view at this property though, if you book a city view room. 
It's in a great location. Subway station entrance on the footpath next to the hotel. Subway is very easy to use. Walking distance to Empire State Building, Macy's obviously, Penn Station, Times Square, Bryant Park (ice-skating), and two of the main stops for the hop-on hop-off buses (they all use pretty much the same stops).
The best thing about this hotel though, is the staff. In our experience, they were without exception, all incredibly helpful and friendly. Even in the chaos of the Thanksgiving day holiday they went out of their way to smile and help everyone coming and going. Special mention to the security guard on the ground floor - didn't get his name sorry, but he was on every night we were there (Sun 23rd-Thur 27th), and smiled and asked how our day had been and was there anything we needed, every time we walked in or out of the hotel. Just makes such a difference when you're in a foreign city. Thank you!

title: Thanksgiving Day Parade
text: If you want a great hotel to see the Thanksgiving Day Parade this is the place to stay. I did a lot of research and wanted to find a reasonable hotel ($300/night) to stay at near or in the Parade route. So I decided to go with the Courtyard Herald square. I considered booking a room with a view of the parade so I wouldn't have to take my 2 year old son down to the street for a view. However, I couldn't justify paying the $800 a night charge for the a view. So I went with the regular room and decided to brave the crowd. When we got to our room I was very surprised to see that we had a clear view of 6th avenue exactly where the parade comes down. We were on a upper floor, but we couldn't ask for a better view in my opinion. This worked out perfectly for us, we watched the Parade live and didn't have to leave the warmth of our room. I'm not sure if this is a hidden secret, but if it is I am very happy we found it. I definitely recommend this hotel, on Thanksgiving or any other day of the year. Thank you Courtyard by Marriott Herald Square New York for the great experience, I hope to see you again in the future.

title: A Good, Practical Choice
text: I've stayed here twice recently while in NYC on family business.  I'm a platinum Marriott member and have stayed at several other Marriotts in the city.  This is my new favorite.  The rooms and public spaces, while not luxurious, are very clean, well-maintained, and comfortable.  Staff are generally very helpful and friendly, although the warmth of the welcome at the front desk can vary.  On the whole, though, excellent value for the money.  The cost is reasonable and  the location convenient.  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Surprised rooftop loungue
text: This Courtyard feels different from the others around New York. This has more character with a nice rooftop longue if you plan on going out. Good use of space with the business center and the rooms are spacious enough. Ray the overnight security was helpful and friendly. We will be returning.

title: Wonderful Experience!
text: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during a seminar I was in New York for. Saturday night I stayed on an upper level and it was close to the rooftop bar. I heard loud music and called down to the front desk. Geraldine answered and I told her I couldn't sleep with this base because I'm a light sleeper. She did everything in her power to accommodate me and I was able to get the sleep I needed in complete quite every night and enjoyed my stay completely! I will definitely be staying here in the future!

title: Great location!
text: Our first trip to New York and we seem to have hit on a little gem.We did our homework before we left home and everything ran like clockwork.After landing at Newark airport we caught the Airtrain to Newark Liberty station then the NJ Transit to Penn station New York,it must have only took 30 minutes,all for $12.50 each.About an 8 minute walk to our hotel and "Voila"we're here.Dont be afraid of dragging cases through the streets,you will not be the only ones doing it,just keep walking single file.We arrived about 2.00pm but our room was available.It was a reasonable size and had evidently been recently refurbished(room 1009),it had fantastic walk in shower,small basin and an abundance of bath towels.A big screen TV and a cracking view of the Empire State Building,what more do you want,well maybe it's a good nights sleep.That was my only negative,nothing wrong with the bed,just the incessant traffic noise,24 hours,sirens car horns etc but hey,we're in New York,you're going to be out throughout the day and for 3 or 4 nights just put up with it because the hotel is in a great location for walking to some of the major sights with the added bonus of the subway to take you uptown or downtown virtually on the hotels doorstep.You will not be disappointed should you decide on this hotel.I would like to add we had our breakfasts at Jimmys American Grill just around the corner in 6th ave.Double egg,ham,bacon,potatoes,toast and endless cups of coffee,about $26/$27 for two people..

title: Much better than you can expect
text:
We stayed here 2 nights after one night in neighbouring Hyatt Place.
Courtyard is like from another galaxy! Light, stylish, comfortable, clean, fresh odour! Rooms are spaciuos, with a lot of free space. We asked and get a corner room facing Herald Square and Macy's - The largest Department Store on Earth as they say. King size bed was very comfortable, pillows and linings are fresh and clean as if you are at home.
Location is excellent - 10 steps to subway, 100 steps to Macy's, 2 Irish pubs are in 30 steps and a lot of other dining options are here.
An excellent option for stay in NYC on business or vacations.

title: New York jewel
text:
I have travelled to New York on business countless times stayed in many hotels.
This represents excellent value for money the rooms are clean and spacious and the staff very helpful .
The rooftop cocktail bar is an added bonus.the location could not be more central for eating shopping as well as business.
Recommended and I have just re booked for my next visit.

title: New Hotel, Nice Rooms, Good Location
text: We had none of the problems with our room that some noted, and honestly, some of these reviews make me question whether they aren't placed by other nearby hotels.  Our king bed room was very large compared to places I've stayed in Manhattan before.  Plenty of room on all sides of the bed, as well as a sitting chair, desk chair, and stool.  And we had plenty of shelf space in the bathroom - more than enough for two adults and a child.  The price, though high compared to roadside hotels, was lower than comparable places in mid-town Manhattan ($266 including the various taxes).  The location was great for tourists - across the street from Macy's, one block from the Empire State, and a 10 minute walk to Times Square.  It was about a 15 minute walk from/to our bus on the west side of Penn Station/MSG.  Service was friendly.  Only piece of advice is that there are plenty of places to get a good breakfast at a cheaper price throughout the neighborhood.

title: Great location for Midtown Meeting!
text: Great location and a subway stop right out the front door. The Monarch bar was nice as well. Michael the doorman was super helpful! I would recommend getting an interior room away from the street if at all possible...just a bit noisy.

title: Nice hotel, convenient location
text: We stayed overnight at this hotel during a bus trip to NYC.  We arrived super early (7:30 am) on a Saturday and they were able to get us into our room!  We were absolutely thrilled, because check in isn't supposed to be until 3pm.  The inside of the hotel is very modern.  The rooms were nicely furnished and had all of the necessary amenities.  The location of this hotel is very convenient to everything.  The staff was very helpful and accommodated all of our needs.  I will definitely stay here again and also recommend to friends.

title: Nice hotel, but small
text: This hotel was a nice one, but everything was really small and tight in the room. Although it was really close to Herald Square, it was just a little too far away from the other New York City attractions, making it a little bit of a hike to get to a number of downtown attractions easily. It is located near a subway stop however, making it easy to get to other parts of the city. The staff was very helpful.

title: not bad, not bad
text: i rate this hotel between a 3 and a 4. it is oddly configured: you enter at street level where all there is is a security desk. so you have to take an elevator to the lobby. there's attractive and useful public space on this floor -- various sitting areas, new large-screen pc's, an ample dining area and the typical courtyard "bistro". the check in desk staff were friendly and helpful. my room (upgraded to a king "suite") was, er, unusual. it appears that the hotel was renovated recently with modern electronics and bathroom fixtures. but if room 1213 is a suite i'd hate to see a regular room because it was very small and the bathroom was TINY ... ok for me since i was alone but had i been with my wife there would have been seriously inadequate shelf and counter space. that was a minus as was the noisy heating/air conditioning fan. i have encountered many courtyard "bistros" that are inadequately and/or unprofessionally staffed. in this case the lady working the bistro was nice enough but would have benefitted from additional training. the hotel's location is outstanding -- diagonally across the avenue from macy's and easy walking distance to penn station, madison square garden, keen's chop house and times square.

title: Inmejorable ubicación
text: El hotel está ubicado en un lugar ideal para hacer compras o salir de noche, casi en la puerta hay una entrada al metro con las conexiones necesarias para recorrer todo Manhattan, además está a 5 cuadras de Times Square aunque la zona es un poco más tranquila. El Starbucks en el hotel es muy cómodo para desayunar y el bar del roof top vale la pena una noche para ver el Empire State iluminado. El resto de los servicios es correcto, las habitaciones son chicas pero para lo que se usa es suficiente, tienen cafetera (aunque hay que reclamar para que repongan café), caja de seguridad, camas cómodas y un baño estándar.

title: Hotel dengan lokasi sangat amat strategis..
text:
Ini kali pertama saya menginap di hotel di New York. Saya ternyata memilih hotel yang tepat, karena lokasinya yang sangat amat strategis, dekat dari tempat-tempat seperti Macy's, Urban Outfitters, Korean Town, dan stasiun Subway. 

Berjalan kaki lebih lama sedikit, sudah sampai Madison Square Garden, Korean Town, dan juga Grand Central Terminal. 

Memang kalau di New York, harga hotel itu sangat mahal & ukuran kamarnya lebih kecil ketimbang kota-kota lain di Amerika. Namun karena lokasinya sangat bagus, jadi harganya sebanding.

title: Excelente
text: Hotel novo, funcionários bem educados, perto de tudo! Simplesmente adorei. Dá pra ir a pé pra Times Square, 5ª avenida, Rockfeller center e de varias linhas do metro, e, dependendo do andar, tem vista para o Empire. Muito bom! Os funcionários são educados e prestativos, a limpeza do hotel é ótima e tem um starbucks dentro. Vale apena.

title: Great hotel in a perfect central location
text: I choose this hotel for its location, free wifi and hotel chain reputation. I can't comment on the food or gym. We bought food from the local deli's that are located everywhere. Starbucks on every corner.  Room was very comfortable. I travelled with my brother, but with 2 double beds and enough space, sharing a room here wasn't an issue. Large comfy pillows and bed linen, hairdryer, iron. We were offered a choice of room, we chose a high room (1506), great view of the Empire State Building. Roof top bar, it was busy with a private party the night we decided to have a cocktail, but it looked perfect.  Flatiron, Grand Central Terminal, Chrysler Building, Rockefellar Centre, Times Sq are all within walking distance. Macy's & herald Sq subway literally on the doorstep. Huge thanks go to Michael, the doorman, nothing was too much trouble, lots of advice, car booked for us back to Newark airport (discounted price), service always with a smile.

title: The manager Nicholas and the attendant Catalino.
text:
After my stay for the NYC marathon the valet took almost 2 hours to bring my car to the hotel. The attendant as well as the manager made this negative situation positive.  
I was impressed with how responsive Catalino was to 
the situation.  He got the manager involved and made sure I was aware that everything was being done to resolve the issue. I appreciated the 1on1 interaction from the manager.

title: Great stay, great service, "Meh" breakfast
text:
All-around great hotel for a short stay. Great service, very clean, nice modern look and surprisingly not loud at all, even if it's centered really close to the heart of Midtown. Really good service from Michael; a genuinely nice and helpful guy. Though the pros are strong, I cannot give the hotel a perfect score due to the lackluster breakfast. The food was alright, nothing wrong with it, but it was imported from the nearest Starbucks, therefore the stock runs out quickly, and you'll be stuck eating an oatmeal for breakfast everyday. From a 4-star hotel you maybe also expect them to propose to send postcards, or at least sell stamps, but not here, I guess. 
The rest kind of makes up for it, especially the location; you won't be too far away from Times Square and other interesting attraction.

title: Excellent location and service!
text: We had a great experience at the Courtyard Marriott, mostly due to Michael the doorman. In the hustle and bustle of NYC he made dropping off and picking up our car a breeze, hauled all of our luggage for us, and was such a great "host"! This guy belongs at the Ritz or Plaza, he made our stay!

title: Very good hotel, lousy neighborhood
text: very good hotel. The lobby on the second floor is very large with lots of seating, a marketplace, and a grab & go eatery. The hotel appears to be relatively new. The rooms are very modern with a great modern bathroom. I am not thrilled with the area since the only great place I'd Macy' s flagship store otherwise lots of bead, trimming and souvenir stores.

title: Excellent stay and service.
text:
Great location, clean hotel, staff were very friendly and extremely helpful.  This was our first time visiting Ney York and they were a great help making our visit as seamless as possible.   

Michael Doorman, the concierge helped us with all of our car/airline details.  He did everything for us, it was great!

Great overall experience!

title: Very good service
text:
Location is very good, subway station next door, across Macy's, 2 blocks from Empire State Building
Excellent service
Special mention to the bell boys Michael and Jose, who were very helpful and kind during our stay!

title: Hyvä hotelli
text:
Hyvin hoidettu siisti hotelli, melko hintava, erinomainen sijainti. Kohtelias ja ystävällinen henkilökunta. Macy`s kadun toisella puolella, melkein vastapäätä. Empire State Building
viereisessä korttelissa. Lähellä myös pieni market, josta voi hakea aamiaistarpeet jos hotellin hintaan ei sitä kuulu.

title: Nice place and service was excellent
text:
It was refreshing in New York to have such kind and professional and accommodating service professionals.  When checked out we were able to leave our luggage and walk New York for the day and retrieve it later that even to catch the train at no charge.
Two particular standouts in the service department where Jose the Bellman who we dealt with several times. Always a smile, always friendly and once with Micheal the doorman. He too was accommodating, helpful and friendly. I would stay there just to have staff like this on hand.

Kevin
Minneapolis

title: Excellent Hotel and Service
text: I stayed at this Marriott with my two daughter for a mini vacation.  The staff is the friendliest, most accommodating that I have encountered during my travels. We arrived in the morning before check-in, they secured our bags so we could enjoy the day.  The doorman Michael was there to greet us everyday, asked if we needed anything, and arranged for our transportation when it was time to leave.  (Awesome black Escalade that cost the same as the yellow cab). He is a wealth of information and will provide information on tourist activities and the best times to visit to avoid lines. He also recommended some amazing restaurants. The room was very clean and when we passed housekeepers in the hallway they always asked if we needed anything.  Great location for catching the trains too, right outside the door on the corner.  Walking distance to Penn Station, Times Square, the garment district, and  the Empire State Building, I will definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone who is traveling to NYC.

title: Great Location
text: Stayed here for 4 nights with 3 friends, hotel is in a great location for walking to the popular tourist attractions just across road from largest Macy's store, Times Square & Empire State being under 10 min walk away & Rockefeller under 15 mins away. We got one room with 2 double beds for the 4 of us to stay in. Beds where very comfy & plenty big for two people to comfortably sleep in, room size was just enough for the storage of 4 big cases & 4 small ones & still be able to walk around. Good size shower in bathroom ( no bath) & both room & bathroom where spotlessly clean. Reception staff where friendly, helpful & efficient and the 2 concierge guys where excellent. We dealt mainly with Michael who was extremely friendly, very helpful & gave us plenty of useful advice & hints and I think his name was Andrew was also very friendly & was very helpful in getting us around especially in arranging transport back to the airport. Although there are cheaper hotels around New York if you have a little extra cash this one is worth spending that little bit more on especially if only staying for a few days & want to cram as much in as possible.

title: great time in New York
text:
this hotel is the best for transportation!!!! we have the subway in the corner at 12 steps from the hotel. yellow, blue and orange routes! that was the best. The rooms are ok, the price I think is expensive, but more for the location, because you are 2 or 3 blocks for every important place in NY, like time square, central park, museums, famous buildings. The breakfast are not the best, but you have a lot!!! restaurants around the hotel. The service is great, all is clean. The cleaning service was perfect!,  Miguel in front desk, excellent! Cat the door man in the first floor, he always know the best places, really nice person, always for our service! thanks cat! 
If we go back to NY this hotel will be our option number 1.

title: Location, cleanliness, quiet
text: We picked this hotel on previous reviews, also location and the good price for being so central.  Loved being in the middle of all the tourist spots but without being right in Times Square which is less than 10 mins walk away and I found too hectic.  From the minute you arrive to the first floor lobby which has a lovely spacious lounge with a morning opening coffee bar, you feel quite chilled despite looking straight onto Macys and the busy streets below.  The room for a family of 4 was reasonable and although not much space in the shower room the cubicle was very large and everything was modern and clean.  No fancy frills just simple good quality accommodation.  Also Penn station is just 5 minutes walk along the side of Macys

title: Great Location AND Service
text: I just spent the weekend at this hotel with my boyfriend to celebrate my birthday and we couldn't be happier! We will definitely stay at the Marriot next time we are back in NYC. The location was perhaps the best part but the service was exceptional as well. The rooms were clean, spacious and well-kept. The staff, especially Catalino, made sure that our stay was comfortable and fun. He was one of the best parts of our stay, honestly. The Monarch lounge was especially great as well! Overall great and very memorable trip!

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: Wasnt sure what to expect due to location of this mid-price hotel. It was wonderful! We were greeted at the 35th St entrance by doorman Cat who gave us so much info about the area & hotel. Later in the day Michael (doorman) helped us find a great bbq place & arranged for car service back to the Airport. They were both very accommodating. The room was small but modern with a nice big shower. Street noise was as expected, but not overwhelming. The Front Desk staff, Jennifer & Mike were great too! The location is a 30 second walk from Macys!  We normally stay in Soho but will def return here for the great location & comfort for our Xmas shopping.

title: PERTO DE TUDO E LONGE DO TUMULTO
text:
Sou detalhista e não consegui achar nada no hotel que me fizesse criticá-lo negativamente. A localização é muito boa (em frente à Macy's e bem próximo ao Empire State Building), o hotel é muito limpo, o quarto é confortável e os funcionários são muito simpáticos.

Sem dúvida me hospedaria novamente neste hotel quando o valor das diárias for convidativo.

title: Хороший отель
text:
Расположение
Очень удачное расположение. Пешком можно добраться до основных достопримечательностей. Рядом – Empire State Building. На крыше отеля есть бар с открытой террасой, откуда можно сделать очень хорошие снимки высотки. Также рядом есть Macy’s, недалеко Таймс Сквер. Рядом куча ресторанов, баров, кафе. Отель расположен прямо в сердце корейского квартала, можно отведать корейской кухни практически «не отходя от кассы». В прошлом году, кстати, корейских ресторанов здесь было куда как меньше. Видимо, очень большой спрос сейчас на них. Описывать удачное расположение можно долго, лучше самому открыть карту и посмотреть

Номера и Сервис
После отеля в Вегасе – номер был унылым и маленьким. Но это и понятно. На второй день мы к нему уже привыкли, и в принципе номер был уже ничего, «с пивом потянет». В нем есть холодильник, кофеварка, микроволновка, телевизор. Бесплатный, устойчивый WiFi. В принципе в лобби есть бизнес-центр с 3 компьютерами и принтером, можно посидеть там.

Сервис неплохой. Но есть одно но: я уже выше упомянул, что на крыше здания есть бар. В Пт и Сб в баре были вечеринки, соответственно, часов с 22.00 и до 04.00 играла громкая музыка. Нас об этом предупредили только при регистрации. Если бы мы знали об этом на этапе бронирования номера, то вряд ли бы вообще выбрали эту гостиницу. Заказали номер с Skyline View, но то, что нам дали, очень мало напоминало такой номер. У нас был выбор между комнатой на 13 и 17 этажах. На 13 этаже номер был у лифта и весь шум от бара шел прямо в номер. Спать там было бы невозможно. Поэтому сдали ключи от этого номера и поехали на 17 этаж. Тут (кстати, 17 этаж был последним, над ним как раз был бар) было на удивление тихо. Он находился далеко от лифтовой шахты и звук не доходил до нашего угла. Там и остались. Вылетали мы вечером, а выехать надо было до обеда. Можно оставить бесплатно багаж в Storage Room, чем мы и воспользовались и еще походили по Нью-Йорку. Посыльный оказался бывшим соотечественником, мы с ним поболтали, он позаботился о нашем багаже.

Питание
Завтрак не включен в стоимость. Но он предлагается в отеле. Немного дороговат (комплекс «сэндвич/омлет-кофе» будет стоить порядка 15-17$), но утром в ресторанчиках вокруг ничего подходящего для завтрака в пределах 15-20$ нет, поэтому либо есть тут, либо можно спуститься на буфетный завтрак в соседний Hilton Garden Inn, либо купить все в магазине и есть в номере. По стоимости буфет вышел около 20$/нос, но там очень большой выбор и ешь сколько и чего хочешь. Мы предпочли переплатить, но позавтракать очень хорошо и очень плотно.

title: The Most Centrally Located Marriott Property in the City!
text: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel with my friend for a girlfriends weekend away in the city.  Great hotel, wonderful staff, and fantastic location.  Main subway right at corner, nice clean rooms, decent size (especially for a Manhattan hotel!), great beds and wonderful shower!  Best of all, Monarch rooftop lounge (separate entity from hotel) is right there..........had a great time and was able to just go straight to room after a night of dancing!  You must stay here!

title: Wonderful service
text: I stayed here for a week for work and every time I walked in, Michael was extremely accommodating. From getting the elevator to asking how my day was, michael made it happen. He always made himself available and was always pleasant. Catalino stored my luggage like a true professional. I needed extra care taken w my bags and he not only delivered, he did it happily and gave me a coupon for a local pub. I can't thank Michael and catalino enough! Great experience!!!

title: Amazing Location
text:
Location was fantastic, just a minute from Macy's, Empire State Building, about 10 min walk to Time Square. Subway is right about 40 steps from hotel doors. Just perfect place if you looking to walk around and enjoy New York atmosphere. Room is large for Manhattan location, our view was fantastic from the  top floor, one side Macy's other Empire State Building. 
The room size is large for NY, very clean and housekeeping does very good job. Something about hotel staff, housekeeping was very pleasant and Michael as everyone else mentioned is just fantastic, if you need anything just ask him. We scheduled taxi with other person in am and it cost us about $55.00 to go about 1.80 mile, while catching taxi on way back was just $14.50. we were  not very happy about that part, considering it was regular Toyota car, not town car which we asked for. But overall nice stay.

title: Fantastic location!
text: This hotel puts you right in the heart of things. Spent 5 nights - it was clean, the room had plenty of space for three people doing lots of shopping, and while there was a bit of street noise, we loved it. Of course, the higher your floor, the less noise you'll hear. Michael the doorman was fantastic - I challenge anyone to stump him with a question! The other doorman Jose is super friendly and helpful, and both of them were available any time we needed them. Will absolutely be staying there again!!!

title: Great Get-Away Location
text:
We attended the Eagles Concert at MSG and decided to treat ourselves top an overnight stay in the city.  The location was fantastic!  Upon arrival, we walked to Rockefeller Center, grabbed lunch, visited the Paley TV anbd Film museum (a great way to ride out a rain storm), walked back, changed for the concert and walekd to MSG.  Following the concert (which was fantastic!) we walked back to the hotel, found a bar two doors up and had a late-night dinner.  

The room was nice, with a great view of Herald Square.  I want that room on Thanksgiving morning, it would be ideal to view the parade!  

We loved the ability to walk everywhere and not wirry about hailing a cab.  This may be our new go-to hotel for over night stays!

title: Clean, Quiet, Location, Location, Location
text: Spent three nights touring NYC from this hotel.  Perfect location, centrally located but off the craziness of Times Square.  Didn't receive an upgrade for being Marriott Gold Elite, but the room we had was sufficient.   Room was quiet, elevators readily available as this isn't a big property.  There is a roof top bar and the line for that gets in the way of easy access in during the late evening hours.  Wasn't bothered by the noise though.  No late check out available, again a benefit usually afforded to Gold Elite.  This was a decent hotel, as others noted doorman was excellent, front desk staff so so.   No problem with cab service, was able to flag ourselves outside the entrance when the doorman was indoors with other guests.

title: Great Stay In An Excellent Location
text: Had an excellent 3 night stay.  Great location next to a subway stop, short walk to Times Square and lots of good restaurants nearby.  Had a great corner room with a view of Macy's.  The workout room was small, but had good cardio and was never crowded.  The proximity to Penn Station was great for coming/going from Newark airport and meetings I had in NJ during my stay.  Will come back again.

title: Nice hotel, reasonably priced
text: Great view of Empire State Building from roof. Fair sized room for NYC. Bed was comfortable. Service great. Doorman extremely helpful. Nice that there is a refrigerator in the room. The one problem with this hotel is that they don't have any coffee available after 11:30, I find that very strange.

title: Good and Bad
text: We stayed twice at this hotel as few weeks ago : for two nights then for one night later in the same week. When we arrived direct from our cruise ship, it wsa only 10:00 a.m. but the staff were really friendly and helpful and we were able to go straight to our room. It was on the 7th floor and was a large room with a view towards the Empire State Building as we had requested. We didn't spend much time in the room but found it spacious, quiet and comfortable and the constant free internet connection was a real bonus after the price and slowness of the cruise-ship wifi.  Our second room was much smaller – I'd go so far as to call it pokey and was a huge disappointment. It was on floor 5 and right on the corner so certainly noisier but it certainly didn't affect our sleep. The staff were helpful throughout our stay and we were particularly grateful that they were able to look after our luggage both when we spent two days away from the hotel and also on the day we left.   We'd particularly mention the doormen  - sorry can't remember their names - but they were all really really friendly and helpful and a credit to the hotel.

title: Excelente localização, hotel novo e limpo...
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, novo e limpo. Perto de tudo, Macy's na frente, 6 quadras da Times, entre a 5th e a Broadway e vista colada com o Empire State, tudo que tem de bom para comer é perto. Ficamos 5 noites em NY e as diárias para setembro não são as mais baixas para visitar NY, então dividimos o quarto com mais um casal e acabou ficando bom para todo mundo, para quem não se importa é uma boa solução. Quarto limpo todos os dias e funcionários bem prestativos, com certeza quando voltarmos será nossa 1 opção.

title: Great !
text: We just had family visiting from California and they wanted to stay in NYC overnight.   We chose your property because of location and other reviews.    It did not disappoint!   Mike the doorman was excellent - what a great first impression he gives !  So helpful and friendly.   Thank you for a wonderful stay for our family.   We will definitely use your hotel again !

title: Great hotel
text: The hotel was great. Wonderful location. Close to 5th Avenue & Times Square, Empire State Bldg.   Clean rooms and nice comfortable beds.  The best part was the doorman, Michael.  He was the best.  He helped us whenever we needed assistance whether it was giving us directions somewhere or arranging for our ride to another hotel for the next part of our trip.  5 Stars for Michael!!

title: Boa localização. Não é um 5 estrelas.
text:
Estive em finais de Setembro de 2014 no Courtyard New York Manhattan / Herald Square, com mulher e duas filhas de 20 e 23 anos num quarto reservado através do Hotels.com. O Hotel é central e bem localizado (perto de uma estação de metropolitano). 
Defeitos: Quarto pequeno para 4 pessoas (será que as camas eram single ou double beds?).
Muito perto da porta do Hotel estava sempre cheio de sacos do lixo a partir do meio da tarde. 
Tivemos que mudar de quarto pois o inicial fazia barulhos estranhos rapidamente verificado pelo responsável pela manutenção.
Virtudes: Boa localização. Funcionários simpáticos, excepto os que serviam o pequeno almoço. Pequeno almoço razoável tendo em conta o preço. Quartos limpos e modernos, apesar de pequenos. Boa localização e ao mesmo tempo sem grande barulho do transito (estivemos em quartos no 14º e 12º andar). Check-out rápido e eficiente.

title: Ótima localização, excelente hotel
text:
Hotel excelente,novo, quartos amplos bem decorados, com vista para o Empire States e para a praça Herald.
Limpeza diária e camareiras eficientes e atenciosas.
Os funcionários eram gentis e sempre prestativos para indicar os trajetos de Metrô, há uma estação ao lado do hotel. Chegamos  antes do horário de entrada e fomos imediatamente hospedados. O café da manhã não está incluso na diária, porém é o melhor das redondezas.
Voltarei a me hospedar neste hotel e recomendarei  aos meus amigos.

title: Great location / great staff
text: The location of this hotel is extremely convenient for anyone looking for a midtown adventure.  I've stayed in New York many times, and this hotel has the nicest doorman (Michael).  Everyone who works there helps to make your stay feel like it's a home away from home.

title: Great weekend
text: Loved the service and location.  Michael working the door is especially entertaining and acommodating. The roof bar is a real treat for nightlide fun. Keep this place top on your list. It is also very close to subway

title: excelente hotel
text: Nos hospedamos en el hotel en agosto de este año y tuvimos un trato excelente por parte del personal sin contar con el confort que ofrecen las habitaciones, las camas muy cómodas y hay wifi gratis en la hab y en todo el hotel. La ubicación es muy buena (en frente de macys) y a 1 cuadra de la 5ta av.

title: Growing pains
text:
This recently renovated Courtyard is ideally located in Herald Square (across the street from the flag ship Macy's department store, a few blocks away from Penn Station, and Grand Central Station, and walking distance to several subway stops). Mike the doorman does his best to be outgoing, cheerful and helpful. The hotel also has rooftop club, Monarch. When I returned to the hotel after an evening out I was greeted by the club bouncer and by hotel security. Note: if you plan to visit the Monarch, adhere to the dress code or you will not be admitted. 

The hotel is experiencing growing pains. I felt as if my legs were being bitten as I sat at the desk in the room assigned to me.  I called the front desk and was eventually moved to another room. Management asked me to file a report about the room, which I did.  I soon learned that the rooms smoke alarm system is finely tuned to pick up ANY smoke or steam (this is non-smoking property). I opened the door after taking a hot shower and triggered the smoke alarm. I called the front desk within minutes a member of the maintenance team appeared and inquired about what happened. The fire department was also alerted and came to the hotel to reset the alarm.  I found out that the complaint about the 'biting' sensation and the smoke alarm trigger happen from time to time. I was disappointed to see long dark brown hair on the inside of the bathroom door (not my hair). Hopefully management can resolve these matters soon. 

I tried the hotel because of an offer from Amex. I can't enthusiastically recommend this hotel to others when there are other hotels a few blocks away that have matters addressed are at the same price point or lower ( Hilton Garden Inn at 51st and 8th, for example).

title: Excelente Hotel
text:
Excelente Hotel , a pesar que al ingresar tuvimos un inconveniente , este fue solucionado de inmediato y automáticamente nos gratificaron con algunos beneficios . Destacamos la atención recibida por el gerente del hotel Sr. L. L. , el personal de recepción y la cordialidad y amabilidad del personal de la cafetería (Sra Nidia y acompañante) .
El hotel esta impecable en sus instalaciones y ubicado en una de las mejores esquinas de la zona, Herald square a metros de Times Square o del Empíre State...... Mejor imposible !!!
Nuevamente destacamos la cordialidad , gentileza y amabilidad del personal de este excelente Hotel. Saludos W. L.

title: Ottima posizione per visitare Manhattan
text:
Abbiamo trovato questo albergo in offerta a un prezzo molto ragionevole per la posizione centrale e il livello ($ 143 a notte) e sono rimasto molto soddisfatto del rapporto qualità/prezzo.
La posizione è ottima per visitare la città, nei pressi ci sono vari buoni ristoranti, la posizione tutto sommato tranquilla anche se con pochi passi si è nel cuore di Manhattan.
Highlight della visita: Il concierge ci ha trovato una limo per tornare all'aeroporto allo stesso prezzo di un normale taxi.

title: Mrs
text: The room was clean and comfortable, we got an early (very) check in that was wonderful street an all night flight. Michael the door man was wonderful and a very pleasant all around! All the staff was wonderful actually. Great trip.

title: Very enjoyable stay
text:
My sister, my daughter and I stayed 6 nights in Sept 2014.  We arrived weary after a red-eye flight from Los Angeles and the front desk let us check-in early (before 8 am) which was absolutely amazing of them.  Got some sleep and stepped out to find a subway station conveniently located right outside the front door of the hotel.  Herald Square is a lively little corner, yes noisy, even on the 12th floor, but we are city dwellers and didn't lose any sleep.  I did not hear noise from other guests coming through the walls of our room at all, not even a peep.  
Lobby is nice and inviting, lots of seating, tables, booths, computers, and a cafe.  Rooftop bar was great when I was able to catch them at off-hours and not packed with huge parties of people with 'reserved' signs on every table--the view up there of the Empire State Bldg is worth the elevator ride alone.    
Super clean rooms; attentive and courteous housekeeping.  Very comfy beds and pillows, just wish they had been queen-size instead of full but I realize space is limited.  All linens were fresh and sparkling white throughout our entire visit.  Excellent a/c that cooled off the room in a flash, thankfully, I think we were there during their hottest week of the year.  
It's been said before, I'll repeat it:  Michael the Doorman is the man!  Truly, he is at your service.  Always welcoming, sweet, helpful, personable and fun.  Not walking or taking the subway?  Michael will drop everything and get you a cab. 
Seesya later Michael!  Thanks for being a memorable part of our great vacation.

title: Great location
text:
If you have ever visited New York, you know that it's hard to get room rates under $400 at a decently clean hotel.    We found this at the Herald Square Courtyard.   Our rate was $377 a night in late August - and even cheaper than that if we didn't need a room with 2 beds.   Just a few yards in from 6th Avenue on 35th.   The only thing that is a little confusing is that the front door isn't really well marked.   I imagine that many people miss it the first time.   The other thing is that you go into the lobby it's the lobby to the building - not the hotel.   So you have to go up one floor to get to the hotel lobby.   It just not inherently obvious - especially if the doorman has stepped away.

The room was clean and quiet.   We were on the 15th floor with a city view.   Typical small room - as is usual case in the city.   A frig in the room was convenient (not a mini-bar).    The hotel does have a small restaurant.   We did not try the restaurant.   I know the breakfast was just a light breakfast buffet.   We opted to just grab a banana on the street and focus on a good lunch.   

If you aren't looking for a place with all the bells and whistles, this is a good hotel.   The location can't be beat.

title: Great location and laundry service!
text:
Me and my bestie stayed here for a week of shopping and sightseeing.. We had a great twin room on the 8th floor, very impressed with the room space as it's so hard to find a hotel room in NYC that can comfortably hold two people and shopping without tripping over each other! Tiny bathroom though with no bath and not the best shower but was super clean. 
Room view wasn't that great but I guess the higher you go the better the view! 
Staff where friendly and helpful they even had there own laundry room, which was brilliant in 93 degree heat and we came home with a suitcase of clean washing a bonus.

The hotel is in a great location opposite Macy's and within walking distance of lots of tourist hotspots and great shopping! You may struggle to find a decent restaurant in the area that's not a tourist trap. It's better to head towards Greenwich village a few stops away on the metro (direst line) 

My top tip would be to befriend the lovely concierge guy Michael he is a great source of information and he has a whole black book of top tips! 

Point to note is there's only a very small cafe for breakfast mainly coffee and muffins perfect for a quick bit before heading out but not to give you lots of substance which is needed to hit all the shops. 

Overall, I would highly recommend the hotel and of course New York

title: Excellent Location and comfortable rooms
text: My best friend and I took a girl trip to NYC and stayed here. It was in a PERFECT location - close enough to virtually everything you want to see and do in walking distance.
